name: Atlas AS7-D
details: The Atlas is the king of the battlefield, capable of bringing a dizzying array of weapons to bear on targets at any range. It is also noteworthy for normally mounting the maximum amount of armor possible. Few opponents can survive even brief contact with this monster. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Achileus [FL]
details: The Achileus was jointly designed by scientists from the Free Worlds League and Word of Blake with the goal of creating a light battle armor suit that could be mass produced. Inspired by the Federated Commonwealth's ultimately flawed Infiltrator Mk. I, the research team used the Blakist Tornado PA(L) as the basis for the new suit while seeking to overcome some of its defects. The resulting Achileus manages to add armoring, weaponry and integrated jump jets while still maintaining its stealth aspects. Quirk: Ambusher Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.886 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Adder A
details:
For a mech of just 35 tons this little turtle sports a lot of long range fire support in the form of FORTY LRM tubes, which can scare away even much much larger enemies. For close range, self-defense or a last effort push if the ammo bins are empty, the ADR-A carries 2 Small Pulse Lasers and the standard Flamer. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder B
details:
Every time the Adder-B is spotted you can't stop wondering how the clans fit all that firepower on a tiny 35 ton chassis. With an extremely accurate Large Pulse Laser this mid to long range configuration softens up the armor of an enemy to finish it at medium range with its powerful LB-X AC/5, backed up by a pair of ERMLs. Never underestimate the power of an ADR-B, it might be a mistake you can't recover from. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder C
details:
As a slightly lighter armed long range bombardment variant, the Adder-C 'only' sports two LRM-15 launchers as the main armament...but also has an additional launcher for NARC Homing Beacons. You can't hide anywhere if you have one of those stuck on your hull. For CQC and as a non ammo-dependent backup weapon, a single Medium Pulse Laser can absolutely ruin the day for ambushers who think the LRM support mech might be an easy kill. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder D
details:
Sticking to the general theme for this rather slow 35 tonner, the Adder-D fields a mid to long range setup in form of an ER Large Laser and an Ultra Autocannon/5. The ADR-D will try to keep its distance and open up components from a safe distance before it moves in to finish the job with a set of Streak SRM2s. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder E
details:
The E configuration has two ATM-9 launchers which can fire ammunition specialized for long, medium, and short ranges. For close combat, the 'Mech has an additional four Micro Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder E2
details:
The E2 configuration of the Adder mounts a Large Pulse Laser in each arm and a Flamer in the center torso. All the weapon are synchronized through an advanced targeting computer. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder F
details:
The G configuration is focused on medium range engagements with its two Streak SRM-6 and four ER Medium Laser. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder G
details:
Codenamed Puma by Inner Sphere forces who first engaged it, the Adder is a light Clan OmniMech that serves as a direct or an indirect fire-support unit in most of its configurations. The Primary configuration has a basic but powerful arsenal of two ER PPCs which are linked to an advanced Targeting Computer, allowing the Primary configuration of the Adder to strike at long range with deadly accuracy. It also sports a flamer. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder H
details:
The only true brawling configuration of the Adder, the Adder H has two highly destructive Heavy Large Lasers as its primary weapons backed up only by the fixed Flamer. To help dissipate the 'Mech's heat, it has six additional double heat sinks. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder Prime
details:
Codenamed Puma by Inner Sphere forces who first engaged it, the Adder is a light Clan OmniMech that serves as a direct or an indirect fire-support unit in most of its configurations. The Primary configuration has a basic but powerful arsenal of two ER PPCs which are linked to an advanced Targeting Computer, allowing the Primary configuration of the Adder to strike at long range with deadly accuracy. It also sports a flamer. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder S
details:
The Adder-S is a is a scout configuration mounting a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers in each arm and sixteen Machine Guns to exploit any holes opened up in armor by the pulse lasers. The Adder-S also includes an Active Probe and ECM Suite to aid in detection and evasion. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder TC
details:
A variant designed for hunting infantry and vehicles, the Adder TC was created specifically for Tukayyid. Diamond Shark politics limited the variant to a single unit, which fought and died on Tukayyid, covering the retreat of Alpha and Gamma galaxies. Powered by a 210-rated XL Engine and built with a combination of Ferro-Fibrous and Endo Steel, the Adder TC has 16 tons of pod space. 10 Machine Guns and a Small Pulse Laser make up the Anti Infantry weapons, while a Large Pulse Laser gives the TC some range. A Targeting Computer, Active Probe and an AMS fill out the remaining pod space. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Adder W
details:
A loadout mainly fielded by the Wolf's Dragoons. Two ER Large Lasers are the main damage dealers, while a C3 slave computer and a basic ECM suite provides some extra performance. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ajax AJX-A2
details: A prototype LAM, the Ajax was a next generation Star League design. Following relatively successful initial trials, the Amaris Civil War rendered the design extinct, with production and testing ceasing due to the war. Designed to be easy to maintain, the Ajax uses pod mounted weapons similar to the modular weapons designed for the Mercury scout 'Mech. Though able to switch modes faster than standard LAM designs, particularly heavy loadouts still hinder the Ajax's speed and versatility. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Ajax AJX-A2H
details: A prototype LAM, the Ajax was a next generation Star League design. Following relatively successful initial trials, the Amaris Civil War rendered the design extinct, with production and testing ceasing due to the war. Designed to be easy to maintain, the Ajax uses pod mounted weapons similar to the modular weapons designed for the Mercury scout 'Mech. details: A prototype LAM, the Ajax was a next generation Star League design. Though able to switch modes faster than standard LAM designs, particularly heavy loadouts still hinder the Ajax's speed and versatility. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Albatross ALB-3U
details:
The Albatross was designed by the Free Worlds League in 3053 with an eye toward a possible future conflict with the then advancing Clans. The 'Mech is built using a Hermes 380 XL Engine to minimize weight and maximize free tonnage for its weapon loadout. The Albatross also uses a variety of weapons in an attempt to make the 'Mech effective at any range. The 'Mech has average mobility with a maximum speed of 64.8 km/h and also makes use of double heat sinks for their greater heat dissipation capability. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Álfar AL-A1
details: The Álfar AL-A1 fielded an impressive amount of firepower for its size. A PPC mounted on its right arm was the main weapon. Three medium lasers, two on the left arm and one in the head, plus a SRM-6 missile rack with 1 ton of ammo, all in the left shoulder, provided ample backup and close-range punch. Fifteen heat sinks provided good battlefield endurance. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Álfar AL-D1 'Dökkálfar'
details: Nicknamed "baby Warhammer", this less common Dark Elf variant replaced all lasers and the SRM with a second PPC to provide a cheap fire support option at the cost of short-range capability and heat endurance. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Ambassador MBSDR-I
details: The original variant of the Ambassador was fully unarmed, but as the StarLeague started fracturing some basic defensive firepower was adding in the form of a single Small Laser. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Anvil ANV-3M
details: Debuting in 3055, the Anvil is an FWL Mech designed to work with the light Hammer fire support Mech. A heavy brawler, the Anvil is a 60-ton mech with a 300-rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel chassis. The Anvil ANV-3M is armed with a pair of Large Pulse Lasers and a pair of Medium Lasers. A Guardian ECM Suite distorts enemy sensors. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Anvil ANV-5M
details: Debuting in 3055, the Anvil is an FWL Mech designed to work with the light Hammer fire support Mech. A heavy brawler, the Anvil is a 60-ton mech with a 300-rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel chassis. The Anvil ANV-5M is armed with a pair of ER Large Lasers and 4 Medium Lasers. A Guardian ECM Suite distorts enemy sensors. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Anvil ANV-6M
details: Debuting in 3055, the Anvil is an FWL Mech designed to work with the light Hammer fire support Mech. A heavy brawler, the Anvil is a 60-ton mech with a 300-rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel chassis. The Anvil ANV-6M is armed with a pair of Large Pulse Lasers, a Medium Laser and a TAG. A Guardian ECM Suite distorts enemy sensors. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Anvil ANV-8M
details:
Debuting in 3055, the Anvil is an FWL Mech designed to work with the light Hammer fire support Mech. A heavy brawler, the Anvil is a 60-ton mech with a 240-rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel chassis. The Anvil ANV-8M is armed with an Arrow IV and an ER Large Laser. A pair of ER Medium Lasers round out the armament, while MASC and Guardian ECM enhance the Mechs speed and defensive capabilities. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

name: Apollon APN-1J
details: The APN-1J is armed with two medium lasers and a machine gun, which is a surprising amount of weapons for 15-ton BattleMech considering it also sports 3 tons of standard armor. The drawback is the 90 rated engine core which leads to a - for ultralights - slow movement across the battlefield. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Arcas 1
details:
For long range combat, the Arcas carries a ER Large Laser in each arm. When the Arcas' opponent closes, it can bring three Streak SRM-4s and a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers to bear. These accurate weapons help the second-line warrior once an enemy gets close. Fifteen double heat sinks help keep the 'Mech cool. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Arcas 2
details:
This variant is used primarily when far from supply lines. It removes the missiles and ER Large Lasers for a pair of ER PPCs and additional double heat sinks. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Arctic Cheetah A
details:
The most popular variant in Clan Steel Viper adds a Small Pulse Laser and a pair of Streak SRM-6s to the Flamer. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Arctic Cheetah B
details:
Appealing to patient warriors, the bravo configuration uses an LB 2-X AC, a Medium Pulse Laser, and an ER Medium Laser. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Arctic Cheetah C
details:
This variant excels in urban combat and scouting thanks to its Active Probe. This hunter-killer makes use of four ER Medium Lasers and a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers in addition to the standard Flamer. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Arctic Cheetah D
details:
A capable long-range missile boat, configuration D mounts a pair of LRM-10s in each arm with a Medium Pulse Laser and a Flamer mounted in the Left Torso. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Arctic Cheetah Prime
details:
A sleek, mobile, and versatile design, the Clan Arctic Cheetah was long suspected to be one of the first OmniMechs produced by the Clans. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Arctic Cheetah X
details:
A special configuration of the Arctic Cheetah used for batchall, the ritualistic combat challenge between Clan warriors. Two Heavy Medium Lasers and two SRM-6 launchers are the main damage dealers, but a pair of Micro Pulse Lasers and a Flamer gives better close combat capabilities. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Arctic Fox AF1
details:
The Arctic Fox is a light OmniMech reverse engineered by the Kell Hounds from the Clan Uller OmniMech with assistance in the final stages from Clan Wolf-in-Exile. The resulting OmniMech is a powerful light 'Mech that has a top speed of 97.2 km/h that is provided by a GM 180 XL engine, shaving off valuable weight from the Arctic Fox's base chassis while also making the 'Mech vulnerable to becoming a combat kill through the loss of one of its side torsos. The Arctic Fox has ten double heat sinks which are generally enough to handle the 'Mech's heat load, with the ability to add more if needed. To protect itself from enemy fire, the Arctic Fox has six tons of Royal-7 armor. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.94

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Arctic Fox AF1A
details:
The Arctic Fox is a light OmniMech reverse engineered by the Kell Hounds from the Clan Uller OmniMech with assistance in the final stages from Clan Wolf-in-Exile. Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Arctic Wolf 2
details:
This variant replaces the SRM-4s and two SRM-6s with an Alpha Series large pulse laser. This gives the 'Mech some long-range capability and provides it with a punch weapon, as well as increased accuracy and a reduction on ammunition dependency. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Atlas AS7-8D
details: One of several variants that attempt to modernize the weaponry of the AS7-D. The AS7-8D replaces the AC/20 with a Gauss Rifle, adds Artemis IV support to the LRM launcher and upgrade to Medium Pulse Lasers over the standard ones. Further, the SRM is replaced with a Streak SRM and both a Guardian ECM Suiote and a Beagle Active Probe were added. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS7-8K
details: An upgrade of the original -D, this variant uses an Endo Steel chassis to fit more Lasers and add Artemis IV FCS to the missile launchers. The Autocannon is also switch to a more accurate Gauss Rifle. The downside of all the energy weapons is the fact the 'Mech overheats very easily, event after the switch to Double Heat Sinks. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS7-A
details: The Atlas A is the first try to be the king of the battlefield, capable of bringing a dizzying array of weapons to bear on targets at any range. It is also noteworthy for normally mounting the maximum amount of armor possible. Few opponents can survive even brief contact with this monster. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Atlas AS7-C
details: A Combine modification of the K model introduced in 3050, the C model carried a C3 Slave unit into combat. This was achieved by removing one of the Medium Pulse Lasers from the K model. The extra free ton was used to add another heat sink to the design. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas C
details: The Atlas C is the result of the first rudimentary refit protocol created for the Atlas C, which upgraded the weapons, and was later commonly implemented on captured Inner Sphere Atlases during Operation Revival Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Atlas C 2
details: After the success of the initial conversion protocol of the Atlas C, the C-2 is a more thorough upgrade that replaces the LRMs with an additional ER PPC and the rest of the weapons with superior clan versions. The C-2 protocol is the most common conversion to be implemented on Atlases and Atlas IIs in Clan space. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

name: Atlas C 3
details: A more uncommon clan conversion than the C 2, the Atlas C 3 removes some of the original weapon systems to fit a giant Arrow IV artillery system in the left torso. In the right torso a Gauss Rifle is mounted, and each arm also carries a ER Large Laser. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

name: Atlas AS7-CM
details: Another modification of the K model of the Atlas introduced in 3050, the CM Atlas was designed to carry a C3 Master Computer into battle. In order to do this one of the ER Large Lasers was removed and in its place a C3 Master computer was installed, allowing it to coordinate a C3 lance. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS7-D(C)
details: A Clan-tech retrofit of the AS7-D Atlas, the Atlas C replaced the older autocannon and missile launchers with a Clan standard Ultra AC/20, Swarm LRM compatible LRM-20, and Streak SRM-6 launchers; but the Inner Sphere Medium Lasers remained unchanged. Lighter Clan components allowed the Atlas C to carry 3 tons of autocannon ammunition. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS7-D-CE
details: The Atlas AS7-D-CE replaces the AC/20 from the standard model with the newly developed LB 20-X autocannon, and the LRM and SRM launchers with improved versions. To lower weight of the new technology even makes it possible to add two more heat sinks and more ammunition. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Atlas AS7-D-DC
details: Built in 2776, this Atlas variant is the largest 'Mech equipped with a Command Console. To free up the weight required to fit this device, the AS7-D-DC removes one ton of LRM ammunition and the paired rear firing lasers. Effective at Close and Long Range Fire Support. Recommended for use by Experienced Tactical Commanders. Extremely Rare and largely Extinct. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas II AS7-D-HT
details: Known as the 'Atlas II,' the D-HT model carries more Energy weaponry and usually a lighter, more flexible Autocannon. It still has unbelievable protection and the same crushing Melee ability as other Atlas models. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

name: Atlas AS7-DRR
details: The AS7-DRR is a refit of the AS7-D, replacing the AC/20 with a Gauss Rifle, allowing the addition of two more Medium Lasers and Artemis IV Support for the launchers. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS7-K
details: A Combine upgrade of the Atlas that used rediscovered Star League technology, the K model was built with a Vlar 300 XL Engine. Carrying a Shigunga LRM-20 with two tons of ammo in the left torso the 'Mech was rearmed for long range combat with an Imperator Dragon's Fire Gauss Rifle in place of the autocannon, with two tons of gauss rounds carried in the right arm, backed up by a pair of Victory Nickel Alloy ER Large Lasers split between both arms. This armament allowed the AS7-K to keep an enemy at range, though the continued use of twenty single heat sinks caused swift heat buildup if both lasers are fired repeatedly. For close range defense, the K model carried two Victory Heartbeat Medium Pulse Lasers and a Yori Flyswatter Anti-Missile System in the left arm. To round off the AS7-K's defense, CASE was added to the side torsos to protect against an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS7-K-DC
details: The AS7-K-DC is a command version of the AS7-K. To be able to fit the command console, a ton of LRM ammo and one medium pulse laser was removed. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS7-KH
details: A partial clan refit used by some of the high-end mercenary outfits, based of their gathered loot. A few have also been stolen by Pirates or gone missing under suspicious circumstances. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS7-LL
details: A Large Laser refit of the AS7-D, reducing the LRM launcher to 15 tubes and the Autocannon to an AC/10 to be able to fit a Large Laser in each arm. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Atlas AS7-MCA
details: A mercenary refit of the Atlas, mounting a Gauss Rifle, the stock LRM-20 launcher and two ER Large Lasers. Two Medium Pulse Lasers provide close fire support. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS7-MCJ
details: The Atlas AS7-MCJ is similar to the -MCA, but drops a ton of armor and uses an endo steel chassis to fit three Jump Jets. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS7-MCW
details:
Another refit of the AS7-D similar to the -MCA and MCJ, this variant replaces the Large Lasers with two ER PPCs. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Atlas AS7-RS
details: A Succession Wars era attempt at recreating the Atlas II's loadout, the AS7-RS downgrades the AutoCannon, LRMs and SRMs while trading out the Medium Lasers for a pair of arm mounted Large Lasers. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Atlas AS7-S
details: A very basic FedCom upgrade of the standard Atlas introduced in 3050, the S model removed five heat sinks from the design, upgrading the rest to Double Heat Sinks. The weight savings are used to add two rear firing Coventry T4H Streak SRM-2 launchers, giving the Atlas increased protection in its rear arc of fire. After the civil war production of this model ceased, although garrison forces in both sundered states continued to use them, with AFFS units using Precision Ammunition for the autocannon and LAAF units making use of specialized LRM munitions captured from the Free Worlds League. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS7-S2
details: The S2 Atlas was a major upgrade of the design by the Lyran Alliance coming out of the Hesperus II facility in 3061. The 'Mech was built with a Light Fusion Engine and carried an Artemis IV Fire Control System enhanced LRM-15 launcher and two ER large lasers as its primary long range weapons. For close combat, the 'Mech was armed with a Heavy Gauss Rifle. The S2 mounted a Guardian ECM Suite in place of the AMS to protect against enemy electronic warfare equipment. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas AS9-K
details: An late Clan Invasion era variant created as an attempt to counter certain Clan 'Mechs. Each side torso carries a Gauss Rifle and both arms an ER Large Laser. A chest mounted LRM-10 provides some indirect fire capabilities. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas II AS7-D-H
details: First fielded in 2765, the Atlas II was designed by the Hegemony Research and Development Department, Weapons Division of the original Star League to maintain the technological edge over the other Great Houses. It was exclusively for the SLDF's Royal Regiments. In 2785, when General Aleksandr Kerensky put out his call for loyal forces to join him in his Exodus, every Atlas II pilot responded and left with him. The Atlas II is armed with an array of weaponry, including an LB-X Autocannon/10, a pair of ER Large Lasers, and a 20-tube Long Range Missile Launcher for long range attacks. For close range combat, the 'Mech is equipped with a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a Holly Six Pack. In addition, the 'Mech has been given CASEfor both sides of the torso in order to keep an ammunition cook-off from consuming the 'Mech. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Atlas II AS7-D-H2
details: This variant of the Atlas II exchanges both ER Large Lasers and its LB 10-X for a Kinslaughter ER PPC and a Gauss Rifle while removing only one double heat sink Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Avatar AV1-O
details:
The first of the Inner Sphere OmniMechs to be conceptualized and one of the last to reach production by the Draconis Combine, the Avatar's design is based on captured Vulture OmniMechs. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Avatar AV1-OA
details:
Focused on close combat, the A configuration carries an ER Large Laser as its only long range weapon. Mounting a pair of SRM-6 launchers, an Autocannon/20 and the two Medium Lasers mounted on the base chassis, the Avatar A is a fearsome opponent with devastating close range punch. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Avatar AV1-OB
details:
A fire support variant, the B configuration carries two LRM-15 racks and two LRM-10 racks. These are all mated to an Artemis IV Fire Control System. The only short range weaponry on the B configuration consists wholly of the two Medium Lasers mounted on the base chassis. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Avatar AV1-OC
details:
As a command configuration, the C configuration carries a C3 Master Computer into battle. The C configuration attempts to keep enemies at arms length with a PPC and Ultra Autocannon/5 supported by a pair of LRM-10 launchers. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Avatar AV1-OD
details:
The D configuration is intended to act as a sniper. The primary weapon is a Light Gauss Rifle. For close to medium range combat, the Avatar D has two MRM-20 launchers and a pair of ER Medium Lasers in addition to the two hard-wired Medium Lasers. Finally, the D Configuration has a C3 Slave unit that allows it to work in C3 lances. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Avatar AV1-OG
details:
A dedicated 'Mech killer, the Avatar G carries a Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammunition in each arm. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Avatar AV1-OR
details:
A field upgrade developed in the midst of Operation Bulldog, this configuration utilized captured Clan Smoke Jaguar weapons to help bolster the SLDF forces in later waves. Mounting a mix of Combine and Clan-tech, this config carries an MRM-40 supported by a Clan Gauss Rifle, ER Large Laser and Streak SRM-4. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Awesome AWS-8Q
details:
A 'Mech that truly lives up to its name! The Awesome 8Q mounts a frightening trio of PPCs that can destroy, knock down, or debilitate any target in no time. It's ungainly, but it can shrug off huge amounts of incoming fire. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Awesome AWS-8R
details:
The AWS-8R replaces the more expensive PPCs with a Large Laser and paired LRM-15s. While this variant can still dish out a similar amount of damage, it suffers from its dependency on a limited supply of ammunition. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Awesome AWS-8T
details:
The Awesome 8T is a superb fire support 'Mech, though its heavy armor is a bit wasted in that role. It can still put up a good fight at medium ranges, and it can crush smaller units outright with Melee attacks. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Awesome AWS-8V
details:
Seeking to address the issues with the 8R model, the AWS-8V is a blend of the 8R and 8Q. This allows a pilot to provide indirect fire support, while still being a potent combatant with its PPC and Large Laser. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Awesome AWS-9M
details:
The 9M is an upgrade of the Awesome that uses Star League technologies. The 'Mech is built around a 320 Hermes XL Fusion engine, giving the 'Mech a top speed of 64.8 km/h. The heat sinks were upgraded to double heat sinks to allow this variant to be rearmed with three Fusigon Longtooth ER PPCs. The ER PPCs are backed up by two Hovertec Streak SRM-2s, split between the left arm and center torso and fed by one ton of reloads in the left leg, a Magna 400P Medium Pulse Laser also in the center torso, and a Diverse Optics Type 10 Small Pulse Laser in place of the head-mounted small laser. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Awesome AWS-9Q
details:
A basic upgrade to the original 8Q introduced in 3057, the heat sinks are upgraded to double heat sinks and are reduced to nineteen. The saved weight is used to add a fourth PPC to the 'Mech as well as a Guardian ECM Suite. Although there was some criticism for using basic PPCs and not upgrading to ER models, the 9Q proved itself during Operation Guerrero to be quite devastating. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Bandersnatch BNDR-01A
details:
The Bandersnatch, named after the monster in Lewis Carroll's 'Wonderland' series, is the brainchild of Felifious Bander and is built around the concept of an affordable and effective BattleMech for sale to mercenary units. The Bandersnatch shares most of its components with the Marauder, making the 'Mech cheaper and easier to repair. The Bandersnatch uses double heat sinks for superior heat dissipation capabilities, allowing a heavier weapons payload. Further, the Bandersnatch carries a respectable eleven tons of armor. While not the maximum amount of armor that the chassis can handle, the 'Mech is still well protected. The primary armaments are for long to medium range combat, a trio of Holly LRM-5 missile launchers and a pair of Armstrong Class-B ClusterGuns LB-X Autocannon/10s that fire both solid and cluster rounds. In the event that an enemy does close to short ranges, the 'Mech carries six Magna Mk II Medium Lasers, two of which are rear mounted, giving it good close range protection. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Bane 1
details:
The Bane is a BattleMech that is based upon a Star League prototype that was never put into production. Tagged the Kraken by Inner Sphere forces who opposed it, the Bane was first built in 2827. It was originally a significant part of many Clan toumans, but was gradually relegated to second-line status following the introduction of the OmniMech. As such, it is still critical to many defensive units. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Bane 2
details:
Designed for medium and short range combat, the Bane 2 trades out the Ultra Autocannon/2s for four Ultra Autocannon/10s. Fourteen tons of ammunition allow the Bane 2 to stay in the fight for a long time. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Bane 3
details:
Designed for fire support, the Bane 3 is a radical rework of the Bane. Eight LRM-15 provide the bulk of the designs fire, with sixteen tons of ammunition supplying the launchers. A Streak SRM-4 provides limited close support. Nineteen double heat sinks are up to the task of keeping the design cool. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Bane (LRM)
details:
An unusual variant of the Bane acting as a missile boat rather the usual long range direct attack weapons. A total of eight LRM-15 launchers can fire 120 missiles in each volley, enough to penetrate even the most powerful AMS defenses. Four Machine Guns acts as close range defense against any infantry or squads trying to engage the 'Mech directly. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Bane (SRM)
details:
An unusual variant of the Bane acting as a close range missile boat rather the usual long range direct attack weapons. A total of twelve SRM-6 launchers can fire 72 SRM missiles in each volley, a formidable attack that is able to cripple all but the most heavily armored 'Mechs. Four Heavy Machine Guns acts as close range defense against any infantry or squads trying to engage the 'Mech directly. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Banshee BNC-1DM
details:
A heavily re-designed and improved variant, the -1DM is based on an Endo Steel skeleton and powered by a 380 XL engine, but trades battlefield longevity for an expanded weapons loadout and a brand new Targeting Computer. The primary guns are a pair of ER PPC and a RAC-5. Finally, the -1DM carries an LRM-10 Long Range Missile rack supplied with a single ton of ammo. Protecting the 'Mech is a full sixteen and a half tons of standard armor, and sixteen Double Heat Sinks helps cool it all down. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Banshee BNC-1E
details: The original design first produced in 2445, this Banshee variant carries the PPC, Autocannon/5, and Small Laser of the later 3E, as well as a pair of Medium Lasers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

name: Banshee BNC-3E
details: The Banshee 3E was originally designed for close combat, with better speed than most other assault 'Mechs. While it has heavy armor and powerful Melee attack capability, its firepower is severely lacking and it can still be flanked by lighter units. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: Banshee BNC-3EA
details: Exclusive to Noisiel and serving as one of the 'Queens' in the Noisiel Summer Games' famed 'BattleChess' matches, the low technology BNC-3EA trades the standard BNC-3E's PPC for a Large Laser, saving weight to add a single rear-facing Small Laser to each side torso and forward facing Medium Laser in the center torso. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: Banshee BNC-3ER
details: A battlefield refit of the -3E, the -3ER replaces the PPC and head-mounted small laser with eight Medium Lasers mounted in the Right Torso. The 'Mech also carries a C3 slave computer and CASE for the AC/5 ammunition. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

name: Banshee BNC-3M
details: The Banshee 3M mounts respectable weaponry with better-than-average speed and armor. This comes at the cost of very poor heat management. It's good at hunting lighter units, especially if it can close to Melee range. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: Banshee BNC-3MC
details: The Banshee 3MC was a special design of the Magistracy of Canopus. It replaced the autocannon with a bigger one. To make room for it, most of the original heatsinks had to go. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: Banshee BNC-3Q
details: The Banshee 3Q variant lacks the long distance capabilities of its predecessor, replacing its AC/10 and PPC with an AC/20 and enough ammo to last in a sustained fight. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: Banshee BNC-3S
details:
A very recent variant, the 3S downgrades the engine size making the Banshee slower, but more than makes up for this by more than doubling its firepower. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Banshee BNC-3SR
details:
A refit for the -3S, replacing two of the Medium Lasers with an Armored Cowl and C3 slave unit for better battlefield performance. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Banshee BNC-4S
details: An attempted upgrade of the -3S that never was produced beyond a very low number initial run, making this variant quite rare to see. Amongst 'Mech collectors the -4S is almost seen as a white whale, many have attempted to acquire one from not-so-legal sources only to be disappointed to find it a false refit instead of an actual production unit. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

name: Banshee BNC-5-GD
details:
Based on a heavily modified -5S, this custom refit replaces the Lasers with an ER PPC and two medium Pulse Lasers, and the SRM-6 launcher with a Streak counterpart. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Banshee BNC-5S
details:
An upgrade of the 3S variant using Star League technology, the 5S replaces the engine with an XL Engine and uses double heat sinks to save weight, restoring its top speed to 64.8 km/h. The 'Mech is armed for long range combat with a Poland Main Model A Gauss Rifle and two Defiance 1001 ER PPCs. For close ranges, the 'Mech has a TharHes Maxi SRM-6, four Defiance B3M Medium Lasers, and two Defiance B3S Small Lasers, and is also equipped with an Angst Clear Channel 3 comsys. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Barghest BGS-1T
details: The -1T carries two ER Large Lasers that allow the Barghest to hit a target at up to five hundred and seventy meters. For medium to close range combat, the 'Mech carries a powerful LB-X Autocannon/20 that is capable of firing both standard ammunition and cluster rounds that act like 'Mech-sized shotgun shells. The 'Mech's simplicity is also a weakness, as the Barghest has only the two ER Large Lasers if the autocannon falls silent from a lack of ammunition or a jam. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Barghest BGS-2T
details: The 2T removes the weapons of the 1T model and replaces them with a single ER PPC and an Ultra Autocannon/20. The ultra autocannon is capable of firing at twice the rate as a standard autocannon, giving the 2T an incredible amount of short range firepower. The Barghest has also gained an additional ton of armor protection, making the 'Mech even harder to take down on the battlefield. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Battle Cobra A
details:
The Battle Cobra makes use of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous technologies, but uses a standard Fusion Engine for increased durability. The A variant excels at close range with a variety of smaller pulse lasers. It wields four Medium Pulse Lasers and six Small Pulse Lasers. This armament forces unarmored infantry to be especially wary. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Battle Cobra B
details:
The Battle Cobra makes use of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous technologies, but uses a standard Fusion Engine for increased durability. This B loadout is popular with the Clan Blood Spirit warriors who use a Battle Cobra. It mounts twin ER PPCs and Small Pulse Lasers. However, it lacks additional heat sinks to cope with the heat generated by the cannons. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Battle Cobra F
details:
The Battle Cobra makes use of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous technologies, but uses a standard Fusion Engine for increased durability. A mid-range Jump Jet equipped brawler, the F config mounts an Ultra AC/5 and single ton of reloads in its right arm supported by a trio of ER Medium Lasers in its left. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Battle Cobra H
details:
The Battle Cobra makes use of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous technologies, but uses a standard Fusion Engine for increased durability. Instead of the pulse lasers common to the other variants, the H configuration mounts a pair each of ER Large Lasers and Heavy Medium Lasers. Four additional double heat sinks help to keep heat levels manageable. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Battle Cobra Prime
details:
The Battle Cobra makes use of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous technologies, but uses a standard Fusion Engine for increased durability. The primary configuration uses a pair of Large Pulse Lasers and Small Pulse Lasers. With these, it is capable of highly accurate fire that is effective against armored and unarmored targets alike. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Battle Hawk BH-K305
details: The Battle Hawk was originally designed and built at a time when Defiance Industries felt threatened by the large amount of equipment being produced by, and imported from, the Free Worlds League. It was built to prove that Defiance Industries was still an industry leader in BattleMechs. This came from a 'Mech that, while slow for its weight class, is a force to be reckoned with on the modern battlefield. The Battle Hawk has a top speed of 86.4 km/h, which puts it on par with 'Mechs fifteen to twenty tons heavier than itself, but it also carries a powerful arsenal for its size. Its five and a half tons of armor give it good protection for a light 'Mech. Additionally, to make the Battle Hawk more maneuverable on the battlefield, it can jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: BattleAxe BKX-1X
details:
The first native Battlemech to be built by the FedSuns, the 70 ton Battleaxe debuted in 2459. Based off of the technology used in the Mackie, the Battleaxe would be constantly updated with new technology, before being retired after the Reunification War when newer designs such as the Hammerhands and Warhammer entered service. The Battleaxe BKX-1X is the original prototype model. Built around a 255-rated Fusion Core, the BKX-1X is armed with a pair of Large Lasers and a pair of LRM-5’s. An SRM-6 and a pair of Machine Guns give the Mech some close range firepower. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.88

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: BattleAxe BKX-7K
details:
The first native Battlemech to be built by the FedSuns, the 70 ton Battleaxe debuted in 2459. Based off of the technology used in the Mackie, the Battleaxe would be constantly updated with new technology, before being retired after the Reunification War when newer designs such as the Hammerhands and Warhammer entered service. The Battleaxe BKX-7K is the mass production model. Built around a 280-rated Fusion Core, the BKX-7K is armed with a pair of PPC’s and a pair of LRM-5’s. An SRM-6 provides some close range firepower. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: BattleAxe BKX-7NC
details:
The first native Battlemech to be built by the FedSuns, the 70 ton Battleaxe debuted in 2459. Based off of the technology used in the Mackie, the Battleaxe would be constantly updated with new technology, before being retired after the Reunification War when newer designs such as the Hammerhands and Warhammer entered service. The Battleaxe BKX-7KNC is the mass production model. Built around a 280-rated Fusion Core, the BKX-7KNC is armed with a pair of PPC’s and 4 LRM-5’s. An SRM-6 provides some close range firepower. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: BattleMaster BLR-1C
details: This command version of the BattleMaster mounts a Command Console and is equipped with 20 Heat Sinks. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: BattleMaster BLR-1C2
details: A Starleague Royals version of the BLR-1C, exchanging the Command Console for a Dual Cockpit, removing the Machine Guns in favor of an Anti-Missile System and upgrading the PPC to an Extended Range version. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

name: BattleMaster BLR-1CX
details: A upgrade Battlemaster 1DC Command refit, carrying advanced Technologies and Hardened Armor to stay in the fight as long as possible. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-1D
details: More of a refit than a production variant, the SRM-6 and two Medium Lasers are removed so that six Heat Sinks and an extra ton of armor could be added. Making the BLR-1D a formidable opponent. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: BattleMaster BLR-1G
details: Versatile and powerful, the BattleMaster 1G is one of the best known BattleMechs in existence. Normally mounting a varied array of Energy weapons, the BattleMaster can engage enemies at any range and packs a powerful punch. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: BattleMaster BLR-1Gb
details: The 1Gb was an upgraded BattleMaster that was used by the Terran Hegemony-based SLDF Royal units. Introduced in 2760 it was built on an Endo Steel chassis and used double heat sinks. It only retained the forward-facing medium lasers to which was added a pair of ER PPCs, one in each arm, and a Large Pulse Laser in the center torso. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-1Gbc
details: A variant of the 1Gb introduced in 2763, this model dropped three heat sinks to incorporate a Command Console. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-1Gc
details: A much less radical upgrade of the 1G, the 1Gc upgraded the heat sinks to double strength models and removed the machine guns to make room for a command console. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: BattleMaster BLR-1Gd
details: Produced by the Federated Suns during the Star League era, this variant drops the machine guns and ammunition while all the forward firing medium lasers are replaced by Medium Pulse Lasers. Sixteen double heat sinks keep the 'Mech cool. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-1G-DC
details: Command Console refit built in 2855 - The BattleMaster was one of the Federated Suns' preferred 'Mechs to install Command Consoles. Standard refits usually installed the Command Console on the BLR-1G, removing one heat sink and both rear-mounted Medium Lasers. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-1GR
details: The BLR-1GR is an attempt to restore old disused or damage BattleMaster chassis using surplus parts. Mainly found in the less controlled parts of the Periphery, the variant does pack an unexpected amount of weapons and even a C3 slave unit. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-1GT
details: Originating as the heavily customized and personal 'Mech of General Gregor Tucker, the 1GT become a rare but favoured favourite of the Free Rasalhague Republic's elite MechWarriors. The weapons layout has been reworked almost from scratch, moving the medium Lasers to the arms and two PPC in the side torsos. A single SRM-4 launcher in the center torso can provide some unexpected close range damage. The 'Mech further utilizes both Ferro-Fibrous armor and an XL Engine, allowing increased armor and a total of 18 double heat sinks. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-1HD
details: The BLR-1HD is named after First Prince Hanse Davion, and created as a thank you for funding the successful development project of the Medium Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-1J
details: A heavily upgraded version of the BLR-1G, using a downgraded engine size to allow the addition of both Jump Jets and an extra PPC. The variant is even able to increase the armor to a total of 16.5 tons, the chassis practical limit. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: BattleMaster BLR-1K
details: A Mercenary conversion of the BattleMaster, using mostly Clan grade equipment. The weapons loadout consists of six ER Medium Lasers, one ER PPC and one Streak SRM-6 launcher. A C3 Slave provides increased combat capabilities. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

name: BattleMaster BLR-1M
details: This melee-focused BattleMaster mounts arm-mounted large laser in place of the PPC, adding a small laser beside the classic twin medium lasers in each side torso along with a left shoulder–mounted SRM-4, the saved weight allowing it to carry an assault claymore in its left hand. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: BattleMaster BLR-1P
details: This version of the BattleMaster comes with Angel ECM and a Bloodhound Active Probe. A single machine gun is located in each arm, with an additional large laser mounted in the right arm, the right torso contains the electronic warfare equipment along with two medium lasers, and two medium lasers along with a SRM-4 sit in the left torso. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-1S
details: A new variant produced for the Lyran Commonwealth by Red Devil industries which changes its mission profile to be more of a support 'Mech, removing its PPC and SRM-6 and replacing them with an LRM-15, LRM-5 and a pair of SRM-2s. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: BattleMaster BLR-2C
details: Dating back from 2925, this designated command vehicle sported a Command Console and a Beagle Active Probe wired into the targeting system. Instead of the machine guns it carries an anti-missile system installed in the left arm; the rearward firing lasers are retained. Like with the BLR-1C, House Kurita received at least one BLR-2C from ComStar in full working condition and used it to good effect in the War of 3039. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-2C2
details: An variant of the BLR-2C used by the SLDF Royal Divisions. The design replaces the Command Console with the smaller Dual Cockpit, using the saved weight to add two Small Lasers and extra external armoring. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

name: BattleMaster BLR-3C
details: A command version of the Battle Master, mounting a Dual Cockpit allowing the battlefield Commander to focus on commanding. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-3M
details: The 3M was a basic upgrade of the BattleMaster utilizing Star League technology. Introduced by Earthwerks Incorporated for the Free Worlds League in 3049, the 'Mech replaces the standard heat sinks with double heat sinks, upgrades its primary weapon to a Fusigon Longtooth ER PPC and removes one of the machine guns to add CASE to the design to protect itself in the event of an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-3M-DC
details: A command variant of the BLR-3M that removes two medium lasers and one double heat sink to fit a Cockpit Command Console. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-3NC (C)
details: The BattleMaster 3NC (C) is a strange clan rebuild of the chassis. Although the design lowers the chassis tonnage to only 75 ton, using all Clan technology weapons allows the 'Mech to mount an impressive all energy loadout. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-3S
details: Another upgrade of the BattleMaster using lost technology from the Star League, the 3S was introduced in 3050 by Red Devil Industries for the Federated Commonwealth. Still using standard heat sinks it actually removes a half-ton of armor along with the PPC and one of the machine guns, although it still retains the SRM-6. These changes along with the inclusion of an 340 XL engine make room for a LRM-20 launcher as its primary weapon backed up by six Medium Pulse Lasers for fighting close in, with two of the lasers being rear facing. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-3W (C)
details: The -3W is a full Clan conversion of the Battlemaster that sometimes can be spotted on the battlefield for Clan forces close the Inner Sphere. Mounting an impressive combined loadout of two ER PPC, a Large Pulse Laser, four Medium Pulse Lasers and three ER Medium Lasers - all of the Clan variety - means it can deliver a lot of damage if not dealt with, but it does suffer from heat management limiting factors like many other Clan designs. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

name: BattleMaster BLR-5R
details: The 5R is a modernization of the more classic BattleMasters. Besides the LB 10-X autocannon mounted in the right arm as the main weapon, the variant replaces all of the Medium Lasers with Pulse variants and the PPC with an ER Large Laser. Four jump jets makes the -5M one of the few models that can jump. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-IID
details: No real information exists on who created the design of this variant and why the unusual name. One theory is that it's a dig at the Clans use of IIC variants, attempting to one-up them. The 'Mech itself caries a combination of Pulse Lasers and ER PPC, combined with a single SRM-6 launcher with an attached Artemis IV Fire Control System. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: BattleMaster BLR-TD
details: By replacing the BattleMaster's 350 fusion engine with a 255 engine, the BLR-TD is slightly slower but allow for 14 more tons of weapons. A second PPC was added as well as the additional heat sink kits to fire it. To compensate for the slower speed, Jump Jets where placed in the Legs and Center Torso. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: BattleMaster IIC
details: A Clan IIC variant, created from the Battlemasters the SLDF took with them during the exodus from the Inner Sphere - but upsized to 90 ton. To fit the two ER PPC, six ER Medium Lasers and two Streak SRM-6 launchers the variant uses an Endo Steel chassis and an XL engine. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

name: Bellerophon BEL-1X
details:
Debuting soon after the Mackie, the Bellerophon was Defiance Industries attempt at creating their own Battlemech. Basing the prototype on an earlier generation Mackie prototype, the project would prove to be fundamentally flawed. While 20% faster than the Mackie, the Bellerophon BEL-1X only mounted 60% of the armor carried by the Mackie. Even worse, the Mech suffered from balance issues stemming from the early generation gyroscope and the concentration of firepower on the right of the Mech. Despite an attempt to market the Mech to the Terran Hegemony, the project was eventually abandoned and the fate of the original prototypes is unknown. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.86

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Upper

name: Beowulf BEO-12
details: The primary weapon on the Beowulf is a highly accurate large pulse laser, supported by two ER medium lasers. To make it easier for the 'Mech to hunt down its targets, the Beowulf also mounts a Beagle active probe, and a TAG target designator allows the 'Mech to designate targets for artillery attacks. To save weight on the 'Mech and still allow for high speeds, the Beowulf is powered by a 270 XL engine that weighs half as much as a standard fusion engine. It also mounts MASC, enhancing its top speed of 129.6 km/h to allow it to keep up with most light 'Mechs. To traverse rough terrain, the Beowulf has six jump jets that allow it to jump up to 180 meters. For protection from enemy fire, the Beowulf carries eight and a half tons of ferro-fibrous armor. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Berserker BRZ-A3
details: Designed to engage in close range brawls, the 100 ton Berserker debuted in 3056. A 400-rated XL Engine paired with MASC allows the BRZ-A3 to outrun almost any other heavy or assault grade Mech. An ER PPC and a pair of Large Pulse Lasers make up the Mech’s ranged armament while a colossal 10 ton Hatchet is lethal at close range. AMS and Guardian ECM keep the Mech safe as it closes in, while a head mounted Flamer adds to the Mechs intimidation factor. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Berserker BRZ-B3
details: Designed to engage in close range brawls, the 100 ton Berserker debuted in 3056. A 400-rated XL Engine paired with MASC allows the BRZ-B3 to outrun almost any other heavy or assault grade Mech. An ER PPC and a pair of LRM-10’s make up the Mech’s ranged armament while a colossal 10 ton Hatchet is lethal at close range. AMS and Guardian ECM keep the Mech safe as it closes in, while a head mounted Flamer adds to the Mechs intimidation factor. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Bishamon BSN-3K
details: Engineers had clearly intended for the BSN-3K to engage its enemies at short to medium ranges. The primary weapon on the 'Mech is a MRM-20 launcher, backed up by a pair of ER Medium Lasers and two highly accurate Medium Pulse Lasers. While the 'Mech is vulnerable to long-range attacks, when engaged in close quarters the Bishamon is an extremely dangerous 'Mech to face. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Bishamon BSN-4K
details: The 4K variant of the Bishamon is intended to command a C3 lance. In order to accomplish this, the 'Mech has had the MRM-20 launcher downgraded to an MRM-10 launcher, and replaces its two ER medium lasers with two ER small lasers. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Black Hawk-KU BHKU-O
details:
The Black Hawk-KU is an Inner Sphere version of the Clan Black Hawk OmniMech. In order to make it possible to copy the Black Hawk, the Black Hawk-KU is built ten tons heavier than its Clan counterpart. The Black Hawk-KU is built on a sixty ton chassis and is powered by a Vlar 300 XL Engine which propels it to a top speed of 86.4 km/h. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Hawk-KU BHKU-OR
details:
Formerly known as the Bulldog variant, this configuration is a field upgrade developed in the midst of Operation Bulldog. It utilized captured Clan Smoke Jaguar weapons to help bolster the SLDF forces in later waves. A mix of arm-mounted short and long range weapons, this configuration mounts two Clan-tech ER Large Lasers mounted in the right, with two Clan Streak SRM-6 launchers in the left. Carrying a ton of reloads of each Streak Missile Launcher, a C3 Slave unit allows further enhances its abilities. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Hawk-KU BHKU-OX
details:
This variant carries seven medium lasers in each arm and a C3 Slave next to the cockpit. To keep the BHKU-OX cool, it carries an experimental Coolant Pod in the left and right torsos. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Lanner A
details:
The Black Lanner A is configured for electronic warfare and scouting. It uses an Active Probe to find hidden units, an ECM Suite to counteract enemy electronics, and a TAG spotting laser to designate targets for homing artillery. Offensively, it can call upon an ER PPC and a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Lanner B
details:
This dedicated fire-support model uses a pair of LRM-20s, though they can only call upon three tons of ammunition. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Lanner C
details:
The C is a close-support variant that mounts six ER Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-6. It also uses three additional double heat sinks to help combat heat levels. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Lanner D
details:
This close-range brawler mounts pairs of Medium Pulse Lasers, SRM-6s, ER Small Lasers, Flamers, and four Machine Guns. This configuration is devastating to conventional infantry and a serious threat to combat vehicles. An Active Probe ensures that it is rarely surprised. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Lanner F2
details:
The Black Lanner's F2 loadout is currently only used with the Jade Falcon Clan. It is a general-purpose design, intended to take on recon patrols and disrupt supply lines on an intermittent basis. The choice of weapons suggests a need to minimize the burden on the Jade Falcon support and technical training pipelines. Unfortunately, while it is capable of many routine assignments, the F2 will do none of them well. It is presumed the Jade Falcons will exercise caution, fielding this configuration only when they are sure there are no massed formations of Battlemechs in the target area. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Lanner G2
details:
The ability to close quickly on large, slow-moving Assault 'Mechs, combined with the potential to kill such foes with a single headshot, makes it abundantly clear the Black Lanner G2 configuration is intended for brutal sledgehammer operations. Deployed in pure Stars, the G2 can quickly gain the upper hand and go on to dominate the battlefield, moving about at will. Jade Falcon Commanders who make proper use of this threat can force an opponent into defensive strategies which will ultimately lead to defeat. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Lanner H
details:
The H configuration mounts four additional double heat sinks to combat the heat that the heavy large laser and pair of medium pulse lasers build; it also has an ECM suite. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Lanner Prime
details:
The primary configuration of the Black Lanner is effective at all ranges. At long range, it can make use of an ER Large Laser and LRM-10. When it closes in, it can attack with a pair of ER Medium Lasers and an SRM-6 that can exploit holes in its opponent's armor. An ECM Suite protects it from many forms of electronics. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Lanner S
details:
The S loadout is a hunter-killer designed primarily to take out enemy support 'Mechs. It can easily deal with enemy recon patrols, rapidly bypass front lines and bring the fight to softer targets in the rear or close in quickly on large, slow-moving ‘missile boats’ and artillery support vehicles - all depending on the current needs. Seventy-two percent of the weapons systems are energy-based, giving the Lanner S respectable battlefield endurance. This, combined with its impressive mobility, translates to chaos and carnage when it reaches the back field Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Black Python 2
details: The Black Python is similar in many ways to the Warhammer and Marauder BattleMechs. Though it is faster than those heavies, it has a similar weapons load-out with comparable damage, albeit with much more accurate damage potential. In order to achieve this, this expensive second-line 'Mech avails itself of all weight saving technologies that were at the disposal of the Clans, including an XL Engine, Endo Steel frame, and eleven tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

details: The Black Python is similar in many ways to the Warhammer and Marauder BattleMechs. name: Black Python 5
details: This variant was introduced by Clan Steel Viper. It replaces the traditional weaponry with a pair of ER PPCs, a Gauss rifle, and two Machine Guns. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

name: Black Python Prime
details: The Black Python is similar in many ways to the Warhammer and Marauder BattleMechs. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

name: Black Watch BKW-7R
details:
The 7R carries a Light Gauss Rifle as its primary weapon, allowing the 'mech to engage an enemy at up to seven hundred and fifty meters. This is backed up by an Ultra Autocannon/10 that can fire at twice the rate of a standard autocannon. For medium to short ranges, the Black Watch has a MRM-40 launcher. The Black Watch has received some criticism due to its heavy reliance on ammunition based weapons. To make the most of them, the Black Watch carries a C3 slave unit to allow it to share targeting data with friendly units through a C3 network. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Blackjack BJ-0
details:
Blackjack 0s are Primitive downgrades of the BJ-1, replacing both AC's with Medium Rifles, and maximizing armor as best as it can. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.81

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Blackjack BJ-1
details:
Blackjack 1s are solid, well-rounded 'Mechs for their tonnage. They typically mount Jump Jets, which give them an extra edge by repositioning quickly to keep a direct line of fire for their Autocannons. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Blackjack BJ-1B
details:
Blackjack 1s are solid, well-rounded 'Mechs for their tonnage. The 1B is a typical example of a battlefield refit, swapping the autocannons and arm-mounted medium lasers for two LRM-15 launchers and three tons of reloads between them. In addition, two jumpjets and one ton of armor were removed. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Blackjack BJ-1DB
details:
A recent Federated Suns variant, the BJ-1DB replaces the AutoCannon with Large Lasers. In order to assist with the added heat, it also drops some armor and the torso mounted lasers to make room for more Heat Sinks. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Blackjack BJ-1DC
details:
Sacrificing the Jump Jets, the BJ-1DC adds a Small Laser in each side torso and a Heat Sink to help ease the extra burden. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Blackjack BJ-1X
details:
This early Blackjack prototype started along a completely different path for the 'Mech. Focusing on close in weapons, the BJ-1X has four Flamers and four Medium Lasers. The BJ-1X also focused more on speed than jump maneuverability, increasing the engine size while removing the Jump Jets. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Blackjack BJ-2
details:
The BJ-2 was introduced in 3052 by the Federated Suns as the new production model of the Blackjack, based on earlier experimental designs. It upgrades the 'Mech with two Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Lasers in place of the autocannons and removes the medium lasers for four Hovertec Streak SRM-2 launchers, two each in the left and right sides of the torso. One ton of ammo for the launchers is kept in the left torso while the standard heat sinks were upgraded to double heat sinks. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Blackjack BJ2-O
details:
An upgrade of the Blackjack BattleMech, the Blackjack OmniMech is a powerful and adaptable medium weight workhorse. Much like the Firestarter OmniMech, the genesis of the omni-Blackjack stems from the Combine's technology exchange program during the initial Clan Invasion with Ceres Metals Industries ' St. Ives Compact branch offering Luthien Armor Works specifications and licenses to manufacturer the ill-regarded Blackjack. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni
