name: Blackjack BJ-3
details:
In the 3030s, the St. Ives Compact experimented with recovered technology on some of their Blackjacks. One prototype that showed great promise replace the autocannon and one heat sink with a pair of Ceres Arms Smasher PPCs. Three of the remaining heat sinks were replaced with experimental “freezer” double efficiency units. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Blackjack BJ-3T
details:
The Blackjack 3T replaces the standard AC/2s with Large Laser, providing greater punch at the cost of some Heat and carries a large collection of Machine guns and 2 Small Lasers. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Blackjack BJ-G
details:
The Blackjack G, unlike the average variant, carries twin Ultra AC/10s. This variant also features an advanced targeting computer, an ultra-light gyro, and a supercharger. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Black Knight BL-6b-KNT
details: The Black Knight 6B was the harder-hitting, cooler-running Star League ancestor to the standard BL-6-KNT we have today. It did everything the 6 does, but better. Mostly thanks to its Double Heat Sinks. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: Black Knight BL-6-KNT
details: The Black Knight 6-KNT is a dedicated Energy weapon platform. It can shell out hellish damage with its beams and shrug off a lot of damage. Just make sure to keep its heat in check. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Black Knight BL-6-KNT-K
details: The Black Knight BL-6-KNT-K is a full conversion of the classic Black Knight to use Clan technology. Originally designed and ordered by Kell's Hounds, it can lately also sometimes be seen with other mercenary forces. The full energy weapons loadout combines an ER PPC with a Large Pulse Laser and an ER Large Laser as the main damage dealers, four ER Medium Lasers are available as secondary firepower. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

name: Black Knight BL-7b-KNT
details: The Black Knight 7B is a refit made for and sold to Mercenary Commanders deeply in favour with the Federated Commonwealth, sporting advanced Technologies and Prototype X-Pulse Laser. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

name: Black Knight BL-7-KNT
details: The Black Knight 7-KNT is a dedicated Energy weapon platform. It can shell out hellish damage with its beams and shrug off a lot of damage... just gotta make sure to keep its heat in check. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Black Knight BL-7-KNT-L
details: A Free Worlds League variant, the BL-7-KNT-L replaces the rarer PPC with a 3rd Large Laser and 2 additional Heat Sinks. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Black Knight BL-7-KNT-P
details: Introduced in 3040, this variant retains the side torso–mounted large lasers and right arm medium laser, replacing the PPC with another large laser and upgrading the head-mounted small laser to another medium. The weight saved allows the BL-7-KNT-P to carry a heavy longsword in its left arm. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Black Knight BL-7W-KNT
details: An updated version of the classic BL-7-KNT using modern Ferro-Fibrous armor and double heat sinks. The saved weight allows the 'Mech to mount an Beagle Active Probe and considerably more armor. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Black Knight BL-8W-KNT
details: The BL-8W-KNT is a further enhancement of the 7W, replacing its active probe with two more double heat sinks to address the subpar cooling. The design is otherwise the same. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Black Knight BL-9-KNT
details: A Clan Buster upgrade, the Black Knight BL-9-KNT was developed specifically for Tukayyid. Powered by a 300-rated XL Engine with DHS, the BL-9-KNT is armed with a Hatchet and an ER PPC. A pair of Large Lasers support the ER PPC at range, while 4 Medium Pulse Lasers and a Large Pulse Laser are devastating at close range. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

name: Blitzkrieg BTZ-3F
details:
Taking its name from a term meaning 'Lightning War' the Blitzkrieg completely lives up to the name. The Blitzkrieg is built on a lightweight Coventry BTZ-VII Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a Magna 350 XL engine that weighs half as much as a standard fusion engine while giving the 'Mech a top speed of 118.8 km/h. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Ballistics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Bloedhond BLH-6D
details: The Bloedhond BLH-6D carries several lasers, utilizing its high speed and small size to repeatedly flank and hit an enemy in less protected locations. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Bloedhond BLH-7D
details: The Bloedhond BLH-7D replaces the medium pulse laser of the 6D with two standard medium lasers. Otherwise the 'Mech configuration is the same as -6D. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Blood Asp A
details:
Introduced at the turn of the century, the Blood Asp was created by the Star Adders in anticipation of the Clans' return to the Inner Sphere. The A configuration is built for assault. It uses an advanced Targeting Computer to guide a pair of ER PPCs and two Heavy Large Lasers. Even with a total of 25 heat sinks this configuration struggles to stay cool when all weapons are used. The configuration also features enough jump jets to leap ninety meters at a time and incorporates an ECM Suite to protect itself. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Blood Asp B
details:
Introduced at the turn of the century, the Blood Asp was created by the Star Adders in anticipation of the Clans' return to the Inner Sphere. The B configuration is a fire-support design that uses a Gauss Rifle and a pair of LRM-20s with Artemis IV Fire Control System. In case an enemy unit gets close, it mounts four Medium Pulse Lasers and an ECM Suite. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Blood Asp C
details:
Introduced at the turn of the century, the Blood Asp was created by the Star Adders in anticipation of the Clans' return to the Inner Sphere. The C configuration uses a pair of Ultra Autocannon/10s and an LB 20-X AC for close-range duels, which its dearth of ammunition further reinforces. It mounts a lone ER Large Laser for long-range support. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Blood Asp D
details:
Introduced at the turn of the century, the Blood Asp was created by the Star Adders in anticipation of the Clans' return to the Inner Sphere. The D configuration is similar to the primary, though it is more geared to long-range support. It uses a Gauss Rifle, two ER Large Lasers, and three Ultra Autocannon/2s. A pair of Heavy Medium Lasers provide additional punch at shorter ranges. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Blood Asp Prime
details:
Introduced at the turn of the century, the Blood Asp was created by the Star Adders in anticipation of the Clans' return to the Inner Sphere. In its Prime configuration, the Blood Asp's primary weapons are a pair of Gauss Rifles. These are backed up by four Heavy Medium Lasers, a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers, and a Streak SRM-6 for close-range work. To aid in heat dissipation, the primary configuration incorporates four additional heat sinks. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Blood Ferret A
details:
The Alpha loadout has a single weapon, an ER PPC mounted in the left arm. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Blood Ferret B
details:
The B configuration of the Blood Ferret mounts three ATM-3 launchers. A single ER Small Laser in the center torso works as backup firepower. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Blood Ferret C
details:
The C configuration is all energy based; two ER Medium Lasers in each Side Torso together with two ER Small Lasers in each arm. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Blood Ferret Prime
details:
The primary configuration of the Blood Ferret combines three Streak SRM-2 launchers with a single Small Pulse Laser and a TAG. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Blood Kite 1
details:
The Blood Kite does not use advanced electronic targeting systems or expensive weaponry. For long range, it mounts a trio of ER Large Lasers and three LRM-15 launchers. The missile launchers each contain enough ammunition for protracted engagements, though the twenty-one double heat sinks preclude continuous fire of all six weapons. At short range, three SRM-4 launchers give the 'Mech the ability to score critical damage against exposed components. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Bombard BMB-010
details:
The original Bombard mounted a pair of massive Autocannon/20s in place of the Thunderbolt launchers as well as standard Medium Lasers instead of the MBM-013's ER lasers. This version was also equipped with experimental War of 3039-vintage double heat sinks, less bulky than standard double heat sinks, but which utilized corrosive coolant. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Bombardier BMB-10D
details: The 10D variant of the Bombardier is a refit performed by Earthwerks Incorporated during the Succession Wars as many advanced components became lostech; while Wakazashi were content not to manufacture any more Bombardiers, the company was prepared to license Earthwerks to produce parts for existing 'Mechs, resulting in the 10D refit. While the Delphinius and Arrowlight launchers were swapped out for low-tech Doombud and Hovertech models, the AMS system was completely replaced with a Machine Gun. Perhaps the biggest difference was the replacement of VOX 325 XL engine with the smaller Magna 260, giving the design a top speed of 64.8 km/h and cruising speed of 43 km/h. In addition, the CASE that protected the vulnerable ammunition stores has been removed from the design, while the armor protection itself has not changed. As a part of the refit performed by Earthwerks in their Calloway VI plant the communications system was replaced with the Neil 5000 system and the targeting and tracking system was replaced with the RCA Instatrac Mark XII system. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Bombardier BMB-12D
details: Continuing the trend toward specialized BattleMechs, the Bombardier was proposed to the Star League in 2735 by Wakazashi Enterprises as an "artillery 'Mech." The concept behind the design was to make a BattleMech that could replace less-mobile artillery vehicles, which might fall behind in an advance or be destroyed by counter-battery fire. It would be well-protected with twelve and a half tons of armor and use specialized missile racks which could carry diverse types of advanced missiles. Over years of testing and field exercises the Bombardier proved itself extremely effective at fulfilling the long-range fire support role, easily surpassing its vehicular counterparts and even inspiring talks of disbanding the SLDF's artillery arm once enough Bombardiers were operational. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Bombardier BMB-12D-EC
details: An early clan Mech dating from the days of Operation Klondike, the Bombardier BMB-12D-EC was an upgrade of the BMB-12D that replaced the weapons with Early Clan variants. It would be discontinued and forgotten as modern clan spec weapons entered production. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Bowman 1
details:
The Bowman utilizes an XL engine to maintain its rapid pace, as well an Endo Steel internal structure to save weight. An ECM Suite protects it from some forms of electronic warfare, while twelve and a half tons of armor protect it from weapons fire. The primary armament on the Bowman is a Class 16 Arrow IV Artillery launcher. Enough ammunition is included to allow for various types to be utilized. Though the original design incorporated two artillery pieces, the modern version accedes to modern demands by utilizing a LRM-20, though it has a limited amount of ammunition. Three ER Medium Lasers are meant for anti-vehicle use, while two Anti-Personnel Pods on each leg keep conventional infantry at bay. Fourteen double heat sinks keep heat levels down for the most part. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Bowman 2
details:
This variant abandons any hope of the Bowman being an ArtilleryMech. The remaining artillery is replaced with a second LRM-20 launcher, three additional tons of ammunition, and an ER Large Laser. More heat sinks are added to keep the heat in check. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Bowman 4
details:
This is the original Bowman configuration introduced in 2923, carrying a pair of Arrow IV missile artillery systems. Its only other defense are a pair of A-Pods in each leg. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Brigand LDT-1
details: The Brigand is a BattleMech that is surrounded by a sea of controversy as it is the first 'Mech to be produced by a pirate band. Manufactured by a company named Vengeance Incorporated, which is run by the pirates of the Haven Star Cluster and 'Lady Death' Trevaline, the Brigand represents an unprecedented threat because in spite of the fact that it is built by pirates, it uses advanced construction techniques and weapons. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Buccaneer BCN-3R
details: Designed primarily for short range combat, the Buccaneer carries a single ER large laser to give it some striking capability at long ranges. With the elevation of physical combat to an art in the Inner Sphere, the Buccaneer's most fearsome weapon is its four ton hatchet, supported at medium to close ranges by four medium lasers, a highly accurate medium pulse laser, and a SRM-6 with an Artemis IV guidance system for increased missile accuracy. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Bushwacker BSW-S2
details:
The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. The Bushwacker's unique design caused problems with the engine shielding, the side-effects of which manifested themselves as various gremlins in the 'Mech's on board electronics on the prototypes fielded. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Bushwacker BSW-X1
details:
The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. The Bushwacker's unique design caused problems with the engine shielding, the side-effects of which manifested themselves as various gremlins in the 'Mech's on board electronics on the prototypes fielded. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Bushwacker BSW-X2
details:
The Bushwacker was originally a failed BattleMech designed to have a smaller forward profile to make the 'Mech a harder target to hit. The Bushwacker's unique design caused problems with the engine shielding, the side-effects of which manifested themselves as various gremlins in the 'Mech's on board electronics on the prototypes fielded. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Caesar CES-3KH
details: A Kell Hounds refit, the -3KH carries all Clan weapons. The mercenary outfit kept most of the 'Mech the same, but did manage to squeeze in a C3 Slave unit in the head. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Caesar CES-3R
details: The -3R was built to do as much damage to an enemy at as great a stand-off range as possible. The 'Mech therefore carries primarily long-ranged armament. To save weight it also uses an 280-rated XL engine and sixteen double heat sinks, allowing the 'Mech to carry as many weapons and as much armor as possible. The primary long-ranged weapon on the Caesar is a Gauss rifle, supplied with two tons of reloads. This is backed up at long ranges by an ER PPC, which can do two-thirds of the damage of the Gauss rifle but is not dependent on limited ammunition. For close-range engagements, the Caesar carries four Medium Pulse Lasers, allowing it to put up a crippling defense against any enemies that can get close to the 'Mech. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Canis 1
details:
The energy weapons on the Canis are four arm-mounted Series 7Ja ER Large Lasers. While these pack a powerful, long-range punch, they often overload the design's sixteen double heat sinks. For medium-range support, the Canis utilizes a pair of torso-mounted Type 9 Ultra Autocannon/10s, though it only carries enough ammunition for approximately a minute and a half of sustained firing. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Cataphract CTF-0X
details:
We call the Cataphract a "FrankenMech" because it's got a little bit of everything stitched together on it. The 0X model was a limited prototype that contained hardwired Electronics Warfare Equipment but never received full Line production. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Cataphract CTF-1X
details:
We call the Cataphract a "FrankenMech" because it's got a little bit of everything stitched together on it. The 1X model works well at medium-long to closer range, with good armor and weaponry. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Cataphract CTF-2X
details:
The 2X replaces the PPC with a heavy laser, while the arm-mounted medium lasers are removed in favor of a SRM-4. This reduction in heat load also allows for the removal of 2 heat sinks and adding armor in their stead. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Cataphract CTF-3D
details:
The longest ranged weapon carried by the CTF-3D Cataphract is a General Motors Nova-5 Ultra AC-5 in its right arm, boasting a rate of fire twice that of a standard autocannon. This is backed up by a Mydron Excel LB-X Autocannon/10 in its right torso, capable of firing both solid and cluster rounds. It is a more popular weapon than the Ultra AC-5, especially for use in an anti-conventional and anti-aircraft role without the possibility of jamming. Finally, the 'Mech has four Intek Medium Lasers for close range defense, one in each arm firing forward and two in its torso covering the rear. With only two tons of ammo for the LB-X 10 and one ton for the Ultra, if it runs dry the Cataphract must fall back to be reloaded before continuing the fight. Eleven tons of armor combined with CASE allowed the Cataphract to easily absorb damage. Sixteen heat sinks keep it cool while four HildCo Model 12 jump jets gave it a jumping distance of one hundred and twenty meters. Room for these improvements was made by using a GM 280 XL Engine. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Cataphract CTF-3L
details:
Produced by the Capellans based on stolen Davion designs, the 3L is an upgraded version of the Cataphract that follows more in line with the prototype 1X model. It is propelled by an XL Engine with MASC instead of jump jets allowing it to reach speeds of 86.4 km/h in short bursts. While it is also armed with an LB-X Autocannon/10 as its primary weapon this is instead matched with a Ceres Arms Warrior ER PPC for powerful striking capabilities at long range. Other differences include the use of four Medium Pulse Lasers and double heat sinks in place of the standard models. This design was produced by the Confederation at Grand Base following the ascension of Chancellor Romano Liao. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Cataphract CTF-4X
details:
The CTF-4X is the latest variant of this prototype 'Mech. The 4X downgrades the Engine, making for a slower ride, but adds more long range firepower with two Autocannon 5s, a Large Laser and LRM5. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Catapult CPLT-A1
details:
The Catapult A1 was designed as a true support role model. The CPLT-A1 removes all 4 Medium Lasers in favor of additional LRM ammunition and armor. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Catapult CPLT-C1
details:
Ah, the Catapult C1. Just like its namesake, it's good at lobbing large numbers of missiles over terrain without fear of return fire. Surprisingly, it's also not too shabby at closer ranges in a pinch. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Catapult CPLT-C1b
details:
The Royal Catapult, the -C1b was designed to fill the same role as the normal -C1 but better. Thanks to Ferro-Fibrous armor it sports better protection, and thanks to double heat sinks it can jump and fire all day long without problems. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Catapult CPLT-C3
details:
The C3 variant takes the 'Mech's long range fire support to a new level by removing both of the LRM-15 launchers and replacing them with an Arrow IV artillery system, allowing the Catapult to stay a safe distance from the battlefield. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Catapult CPLT-C4
details:
The CPLT-C4 is an explosive addition to any outfit's arsenal. Trading out the stock LRM-15s, Medium Lasers and extra Heat Sinks for LRM-20s and Small Lasers - along with 2 extra tons of ammo, the C4 gives the Catapult impressive long range firepower. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Catapult CPLT-C4C
details:
An upgrade of the C4 model. The standard fusion engine is replaced with an extralight engine. With the extra freed tonnage, a large laser and Beagle Active Probe can be mounted. The two Small Lasers are replaced with a single pulse version. The heat sinks are upgraded to double strength models. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Catapult CPLT-C5
details:
An upgrade of the C3 model, this variant first appeared during the St. Ives Conflict. It retains the Arrow IV artillery system, but its chassis has been upgraded to Endo Steel and its heat sinks to improved versions. This allows the C5 to increase its armor coverage to twelve and a half tons, upgrade its lasers to ER Medium Lasers, and quadruple the amount of ammo carried with protection provided by CASE. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Catapult CPLT-K2
details:
The Catapult K2 is an outside-the-box redesign that trades the indirect-fire capability for heavier direct-fire PPCs. It doesn't usually mount Jump Jets, though, so it can be a bit more restricted in its use. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Catapult CPLT-K2K
details:
An upgrade of the K2 Catapult, the K2K model changes the engine to an extralight model. The twin PPCs also have been upgraded to ER PPCs. The 'Mech carries two ER Medium Lasers for close range firepower. To handle the added heat from the upgrades, the 'Mech uses 20 double heat sinks. Finally, the K2K model carries thirteen and a half tons of armor. . Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Catapult CPLT-K3
details:
Though this design never reached full production, it was prototyped during the War of 3039. It upgrades the PPCs of the K2 to ER PPCs. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Catapult CPLT-K5
details:
Another Kuritan variant, the -K5 goes back to its roots by carrying two MRM-30 launchers as its primary weapon. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: CattleMaster CTL-3R2 'Hunter'
details: The CattleMaster was created at the turn of the thirty-first century as an IndustrialMech to handle large herd animals. The concept for the Rancher 'Mech dates back to the twenty-fourth century. The 'Mech is noted for its durability and flexible Internal Combustion Engine. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.71

name: CattleMaster CTL-3R3
details: The CattleMaster was created at the turn of the thirty-first century as an IndustrialMech to handle large herd animals. The concept for the Rancher 'Mech dates back to the twenty-fourth century. The 'Mech is noted for its durability and flexible Internal Combustion Engine. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.71

name: CattleMaster CTL-X 'Bessie'
details: The CattleMaster was created at the turn of the thirty-first century as an IndustrialMech to handle large herd animals. Being fed up by local Troublemakers and Pirates trying to steal his livestock, one farmer went and upgraded his Cattlemaster. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.71

name: Cavalier [FL]
details: The Cavalier is a battle armor suit built in response to sagging morale in the Armed Forces of the Federated Commonwealth, due in large part to the secession of the Lyran state from the Federated Commonwealth. Although originally heavily based on the Inner Sphere Standard, the redesign turned out to be more than cosmetic: the redistribution of armor plating had increased leg protection at the expense of upper body protection. While there were some misgivings, in the final analysis it was discovered these alterations also gave superior dexterity to the trooper compared to that of the Standard. Reluctantly the officers in charge agreed that the benefits outweighed the drawbacks and approved mass production of the suit, which started in June of that same year. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Celerity CLR-02-X-D
details: While not mounting any defensive weaponry, the Celerity CLR-02-X-D's head is equipped with a Drone Remote Control System and carries a C3i module. The fact the 'Mech has no MechWarrior piloting it is a good thing given the Celerity's single ton of armor and the fragile nature of its XXL engine and XL gyro, even a single skid following a misstep would almost cripple the design let alone combat fire on the battlefield. The standard design carries no weapon, but this version has been altered to mount a single Small Laser. Quirk: Quad Mech (Squad) Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Centaur 1
details: One of the best first generation ProtoMechs, the Centaur combines high speed, decent armor, and a varied weapons mix. These features make it a flexible combatant, able to keep up with scout 'Mechs while supporting them. The SRM and LRM missile launchers provide much of the striking power of the Centaur, backed up ER Micro Laser. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Centurion CN3-A
details:
A primitive downgrade of the Centurion-9A commonly found among LowTech States and Bandits. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.82

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN9-A
details:
A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-A models are able to engage at any range, but their damage curve increases as they approach a target. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN9-A2
details:
A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-A2 models come with a UAC/10 and usually carry Hotloaded LRMs. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN9-AH
details:
A somewhat radical departure from the stock Centurion, the CN9-AH Variant trades out the stock AC/10 and Medium Lasers for a single AC/20. While this amounts to the same degree of firepower, it has the benefit of concentrating the damage to a single location. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN9-AL
details:
The AL variant of the Centurion tends to trade the larger burst damage of an Autocannon for more Energy weaponry and heavier armor. ALs can take an incredible amount of damage for their size but still pack a good punch. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN9-B1
details:
A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-B1 models are able to engage at extreme range thanks to a Light Gauss Rifle and stay in the field with their AMS and Medium Shield. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN9-D
details:
The D variant of the Centurion, introduced in 3049, is the first of many upgrades using Star League technology. The chassis was re-engineered to use Endo Steel construction techniques. Next the power plant was changed from the standard engine to an GM 300 extralight engine, increasing its maximum speed to 97.2 km/h. Finally, the weapons were upgraded. The Autocannon/10 was swapped for a Mydron Excel LB-X Autocannon/10 and an Artemis IV fire control system was added to the LRM launcher. The two medium lasers were retained. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN9-D3
details:
The CN9-D3 variant introduced in 3052 is identical to the CN9-D Centurion with one exceptional difference. The D3 uses Triple Strength Myomer to increase its top speed up to 118.8 km/h while it is running hot. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN9-D3D
details:
The D3D variant of this 'Mech is a potent long-range sniper, first built in 3060. It uses the same chassis and engine combination as the D3 variant but uses MASC to augment its movement to give it a maximum speed of 129.6 km/h. The primary weapon on the D3D is a Light Gauss Rifle. For added long range assistance, the 'Mech carries an LRM-10 launcher and for close range combat it carries an ER Medium Laser. This is all protected with eight tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN9-H
details:
The first purely Marian mech to come from hegemony Factories. It keeps costs down with both primitive armor and engine but counteracts this with a massive alpha from it's 5 Rocket Launchers. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.82

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN10-B
details:
A heavier 55-ton version of the venerable Centurion, the CN10-B was built in 3057 and uses an Endo Steel chassis to save weight on the design while retaining the CN9-A's original ground speed through the use of a 220-rated standard fusion engine. Much like the CN9-D, the 10-B carries an LB-X Autocannon/10 as its primary weapon with an LRM-10 launcher with an Artemis IV fire control system, but these are backed up by a medium laser and a medium pulse laser. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN10-J
details:
A heavier 55-ton version of the venerable Centurion, the CN10-J was built in 3057 and uses an Endo Steel chassis to save weight on the design while retaining the CN9-A's original ground speed through the use of a 220-rated standard fusion engine. Much like the CN9-D, the 10-J carries an LB-X Autocannon/10 as its primary weapon with an LRM-10 launcher with an Artemis IV fire control system, but these are backed up by a Medium Laser and a Medium Pulse Laser. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Centurion CN10-W
details:
A heavier 55-ton version of the venerable Centurion, the CN10-W was built in 3057 and uses an Endo Steel chassis to save weight on the design while retaining the CN9-A's original ground speed through the use of a 220-rated XL engine. Much like the CN9-D, the 10-W carries an LB-X Autocannon/10 as its primary weapon with an LRM-10 launcher with an Artemis IV fire control system, but these are backed up by a PPC. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Cerberus MR-5M
details:
The primary weapons on the MR-5M are a pair of Gauss rifles, each of which is capable of taking one ton of armor off of an enemy at long range. In the event that an enemy does move into short range, the Cerberus is ready for them because it carries four Medium Pulse Lasers and two rear-mounted Machine Guns. Additionally, for increased defense against missile attacks, the Cerberus carries an anti-missile system. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Cerberus MR-V2
details:
The primary weapons on the Cerberus are a pair of Grizzard Model 200 Gauss rifles, each of which is capable of taking one ton of armor off of an enemy at long range. In the event that an enemy does move into short range, the Cerberus is ready for them because it carries four Blankenburg Medium Pulse Lasers and two rear-mounted Sperry Browning Machine Guns. Additionally, for increased defense against missile attacks, the Cerberus carries a McArthur anti-missile system. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Cestus CTS-6X
details: The Cestus 6X was produced for the SLDF in 2603. Considered a failure due to abysmal heat sinking on an energy-exclusive loadout, the Cestus design would eventually see an overhaul into the 6Y, albeit half a century later. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Cestus CTS-6Y
details: Designed for the SLDF in 2766, the Cestus production was plagued with delays and setbacks. The 6Y is considered a design correction over the original 6X, which ran notoriously hot, by replacing some of the energy weapons with ballistics. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Cestus CTS-6Y-EC
details: A Clan-tech retrofit performed by Clan Fire Mandrill. While the original loadout remains identical to the base Cestus 6Y, the 6Y-EC benefits from the early fruits of Clan weapons research. Despite proving to be a success, the redesigned Cestus was overshadowed by further advancements in Clan technology and by 3020 was all but forgotten. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Cestus CTS-6Z
details: Created for the Federated Commonwealth during the Clan Invasion, the 6Z variant of the Cestus returns to the original energy-exclusive loadout of the BattleMech, this time with better cooling. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Chameleon CLN-5C
details: The 5C is a weird one, no official creator exists in the records of the design but the 'Mech was produced at several factories at one point of time. A slight rebuild of the classic TRC-4B, the variant does not introduce any major changes except moving the internals around. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Chameleon CLN-7V
details: The Chameleon was designed to help a new MechWarrior master the skills of maneuvering and heat management, with a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping distance of one hundred and eighty meters. The 'Mech also had an almost all energy weapons loadout, but cooled only by ten standard heat sinks. This paucity of freezers forces MechWarriors to concentrate on the 'Mech's heat levels. In some instances, the Chameleon had been forced into combat situations, notably during the Dragoon Civil War. Production of the Chameleon halted briefly in 3052 when Defiance Industries decided to switch its production to the Nightsky, but was quickly resumed when J.B. BattleMechs Incorporated purchased the rights to the design. J.B. BattleMechs also introduced two battle-worthy variants of the Chameleon. The Chameleon is a training 'Mech, intended to simulate a variety of opponents by mounting a wide variety of weapon systems. A Chameleon is a medium 'Mech, but it doesn't always look like one. It can be fitted out with extra plates to modify its appearance, and carries special electronics to falsify its signature; these special abilities let it look and scan as something other than what it is, hence the machine's name. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Chameleon TRC-4C
details: A Clan refurbished version of the TRC-4B, replacing its internals with Clan versions but keeping all weapon systems from the original 'Mech. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Champion CHP-1N
details:
Where the CHP-2N is the downgraded Succession Wars variant of the Champion, the -1N is the fully powered Star League variant and is the original one the designers introduced. The high speed for a mech its size remains as does the somewhat anemic armor, the main benefit the mech gets from Star League technology is found in the weaponry: a LB-10X Autocannon, a SRM-6 with an Artemis IV system, and a pair each of Medium and Small Lasers. Otherwise, the -1N is much the same as the -2N and performs the same in many ways. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Champion CHP-1N2
details:
During the Star League when the Champion-1N was in full production, there was a frequent pilot modification that turned into a production variant. This mech, the -1N2, is exactly the same as the -1N with the exception of the heat sinks, which have been upgraded to doubles. In all other respects, the -1N2 is the same as the -1N. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Champion CHP-1Nb
details:
A variant reserved for SLDF Royal units, this Champion was introduced in 2751 and replaces all the standard weaponry with a Gauss Rifle and ER PPC. It also uses double heat sinks. This gave the -1Nb an extremely long range weapon profile and a serious punch while also solving its heat issues. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Champion CHP-2N
details:
The Champion debuted in 2602 as a generalist combat 'Mech with a focus on heavy reconnaissance and fast strike capabilities. While definitely faster and more maneuverable than other heavy 'Mechs, it was criticized by many for being too large, underarmed and underarmored. The armament on the Champion is considered by many to be feeble for its size, especially after losing its advanced technology from the Star League. Carrying an AC/10, a SRM-6, and a pair each of Medium and Small Lasers, the Champion is woefully underarmed for its size. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Champion CHP-3N
details:
One of the so-called "Clanbuster" variants developed in 3052 by ComStar in the lead-up to the Battle of Tukayyid, this variant is a major upgrade that replaces the standard fusion engine with a lighter but more vulnerable 300-rated ExtraLight engine, the heat sinks have been upgraded to double heat sinks and two Large Lasers, surplus from the Clanbuster upgrade of the Wyvern, have been added to the 'Mech's unoccupied arms. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Champion CHP-3P
details:
The 3P is the newest variant of the Champion, introduced in 3061. The 'Mech's arsenal has been completely upgraded to modern standards with the complete removal of all of its weapons. In their place this version of the Champion carries four ER Medium Lasers, one in each arm. An Ultra Autocannon/10 replaces the LB-X Autocannon and the SRM-6 has been replaced by an improved Narc Missile Beacon. In addition, the ExtraLight engine used in the 3N has been retained and an improved C3 computer was added to allow the Champion to work as part of a 6-unit C3 network. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Champion CHP-C
details:
An upgraded Champion with Clantech, the Champion C is simply an updated Champion 1N2. Built in 2867 it uses an XL engine with the weight saved going into the addition of 5 jump jets that enable the 'Mech to jump up to 150 meters at a time. The medium lasers were upgraded to Medium Pulse Lasers and a pair of ER Medium Lasers were added. The small lasers are also upgraded to Small Pulse Lasers. The rest of the weaponry is upgraded to Clan standards and the remaining tonnage went to additional armor. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Charger CGR-C
details:
An upgrade of the 3K, the Charger CGR-C was modified to carry a C3 Slave unit that allowed it to share targeting data with other 'Mechs in its unit. In order to add the slave unit, a medium pulse laser had to be removed from the design. The left over mass went towards extra ammunition for the LRM launcher. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Charger CGR-1A1
details:
The Charger is seen as an example of abject failure in BattleMech design. Wells Technologies originally wanted to produce an ultra-heavy scout 'Mech for the Star League Defense Force that was not only fast but could survive contact with the enemy. This was done by building the Charger on an 80-ton frame, making it the heaviest scout 'Mech in existence, and powering it with a massive LTV 400 fusion engine that took up almost sixty percent of the Charger's mass. With a top speed which allowed it to outrun most other 'Mechs the Charger was then given ten tons of Durallex Heavy armor, enough to survive repeated hits from a Class 20 Autocannon. However these features left very little room for offensive capability, an intentional deficiency on the part of the design team as they saw any task other than gathering data a distraction. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Charger CGR-1A1R
details:
A simple refit of the -1A1, replacing three of the Small Lasers and some of the armor for a Medium Laser and a C3 slave unit. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Charger CGR-1A2
details:
An attempt to make the early Charger models more successful by downgrading the 400 engine to a 320 core. The freed up weight allows both considerably more armor as a much different weapons mix of weapons - a Large Laser, a PPC and three Medium Lasers. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Charger CGR-1A5
details:
The 1A5 variant of the Charger was one of the first variants of the Charger made to take it from the role of scout to assault 'Mech. A Capellan modification to the CGR-1Ls they received as part of the Kapteyn Accords, the engine was downgraded to a 320 version, which reduced the maximum speed of the 'Mech to 64.8 km/h, and four of the small lasers were removed. In their place was a Tomodzuru Autocannon/20 as its primary weapon, two Bical SRM-6 launchers and an Argra 3L Medium Laser, while the 'Mech's armor was increased by five tons. This made the CGR-1A5 extremely dangerous at close ranges and gave it a speed comparable to most 'Mechs in the heavy weight class, while carrying armor on par with other eighty-ton 'Mechs. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Charger CGR-1A9
details:
A Combine-LAW attempt to make the Charger more effective at long ranges, the 1A9 used a reduced 320-rated engine, lowering its top speed to 64.8 km/h, and its arsenal was overhauled. All of the smaller lasers (except for the head mounted one) were replaced with medium lasers and a single LRM-20 launcher was mounted in the right torso, with two tons of reloads carried in the left torso. To make up for the lost mobility, four jump jets were also installed, two in each leg, to allow the Charger to jump up to one hundred and twenty meters. This variant was fielded in time to surprise the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns during the War of 3039, but in years since the design fell into the hands of the Outworlds Alliance thanks to a legal snafu which gave Ravenna Electronics a production license. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Charger CGR-1L
details:
An export model sold to the Capellan Confederation as part of the Kapteyn Accords, the CGR-1L was a simple modification of the Charger in an attempt to make it more effective following their disastrous use on Chara in 3023. In place of four and a half tons of armor and all five Small Lasers, the 1L mounts a Large Laser in its right arm and two medium lasers in either side torso. While more prone to overheating and less protected - mounting armor comparable to that of a traditional scout 'Mech - it was better capable of defending itself against other scout 'Mechs, and at the time that was good enough for the desperate warriors of the Capellan Confederation Armed Forces. Since then, the CGR-1L has remained in Capellan service as a training 'Mech and, according to rumor, punishment assignment for dissident soldiers. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Charger CGR-1P5
details:
A melee-focused variation of the CGR-1A5 model introduced in 3028, the 1P5 retains the lasers and SRM racks but downgrades the AC/20 for an much smaller AC/5 to free up the weight for an assault Battle Axe carried in the right arm. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Charger CGR-3K
details:
Draconis Combine's 3K was an upgrade of the 1A9 that used an uprated XL engine to raise the Charger's top speed back to 86.4 km/h. The head-mounted small laser was removed, the medium lasers were swapped out for Medium Pulse Lasers, and the LRM-20 launcher was mated with an Artemis IV fire control system to improve accuracy. The addition of a fifth jump jet mounted in the rear torso gave the 'Mech a jumping distance of up to one hundred and fifty meters. This variant was confirmed to have been deployed on An Ting in the War of 3039 and may have been what Davion forces initially dubbed the Charger II; however, descriptions of the Charger II suggest that it was more likely a LRM-equipped variant of the Hatamoto-Chi (presumably the -Kaze). Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Charger CGR-9ZJ
details:
A very unusual total refit of the Charger, it's origins uncertain but likely some blackshop in the periphery as it is only used by pirates and other unsavory groups. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Charger CGR-SB 'Challenger'
details:
This radical modification looks to turn the Charger into a traditional assault 'Mech by reducing the 'Mechs speed to 54 km/h, which allows the use of a smaller engine (incidentally, the commonplace Pitban 240 reactor). The 'Mech is armored with fifteen and a half tons of armor and is armed with four Large Lasers, one in each arm and side torso, and a Medium Laser in its head; twenty-eight heat sinks kept the 'Mech cool. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Cicada CDA-2A
details:
Introduced in 2740, the 40 ton Cicada was developed as a competitor to the Locust. Slightly better armed and just as fast, the Cicada’s heavier armor and better melee capabilities enable it to function as an effective Light Mech hunter and scout. Powered by a 320-rated Fusion Core, the Cicada 2A is armed with a pair of Medium Lasers and a Small Laser. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Cicada CDA-2B
details:

Powered by a 320-rated Fusion Core, the Cicada 2B is armed with a pair of Medium Lasers and a Flamer. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1

name: Cicada CDA-2G
details:
The 2G is a Clan conversion of the Cicada, although its purpose is unknown it does allow the 'Mech to perform better and fit more advanced electronic warfare components. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Cicada CDA-2P
details:
A typical Periphery raider, the Cicada 2P is fast and hard hitting but lacks endurance and cannot survive long once it has delivered it's payload. 4 RL-20's make up the bulk of the mechs firepower, capable of threatening even an Assault mech if used correctly. The secondary weapons are a pair of medium chem lasers with a ton of ammo between them. Achieving almost identical speeds to its Inner Sphere counterparts, the 2P is designed as a heavy scout and head hunter with a nasty alpha strike capable of shredding most opponents regardless of the target. Designed to be easy to maintain and even easier to replace, the 2P is built with parts that can be salvaged from most battlefields or brought in any number of back street bazaars or disreputable arms markets. Indeed, most new 2P’s are often repurposed wrecks hauled off the battlefield and rebuilt as quickly as possible. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1

name: Clint CLNT-1-2R
details:
The Clint was primarily designed as a cheap recon unit, with the capabilities of a well-armed, low-end medium weight 'Mech, and in this regard it served well. With a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping capability of one hundred and eighty meters, the Clint can easily keep up with other recon elements and maneuver through mountainous or urban terrain. The 1-2R Clint was the original prototype variant that carried an Armstrong Buster Autocannon/10 with a single Medium Laser as a secondary weapon and no jump jets. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Clint CLNT-2-2R
details:
The Clint was primarily designed as a cheap recon unit, with the capabilities of a well-armed, low-end medium weight 'Mech, and in this regard it served well. With a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping capability of one hundred and eighty meters, the Clint can easily keep up with other recon elements and maneuver through mountainous or urban terrain. The 2-2R Clint is an even more cheap refit of the original variant, equipping primitive, cheaper weaponry, that periphery states can afford. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.8

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Clint CLNT-2-3T
details:
The Clint was primarily designed as a cheap recon unit, with the capabilities of a well-armed, low-end medium weight 'Mech, and in this regard it served well. With a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping capability of one hundred and eighty meters, the Clint can easily keep up with other recon elements and maneuver through mountainous or urban terrain. The Clint 2-3T equipped with one Autocannon/5 with one ton of ammunition. As secondary weapons, the Clint carries two Martell Medium Lasers. This well-balanced mix of weapons when combined with the Clint's above-average maneuverability for its size make the Clint a highly effective multi-role BattleMech. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1

details:
