name: Clint CLNT-2-3U
details:
The Clint was primarily designed as a cheap recon unit, with the capabilities of a well-armed, low-end medium weight 'Mech, and in this regard it served well. With a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping capability of one hundred and eighty meters, the Clint can easily keep up with other recon elements and maneuver through mountainous or urban terrain. The Clint 2-3U is a Capellan field upgrade of the Clint that strips all of the armaments from the chassis and replaces them with more potent and enduring weaponry, the most radical of which is the primary weapon. The AC/5 has been replaced with an ER PPC while both the Medium Lasers were replaced with Medium Pulse Lasers; as a result, it runs much hotter than the original. The 3U also packs double heat sinks in place of single models and is more deadly in combat. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Clint CLNT-2-4T
details:
The Clint was primarily designed as a cheap recon unit, with the capabilities of a well-armed, low-end medium weight 'Mech, and in this regard it served well. With a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping capability of one hundred and eighty meters, the Clint can easily keep up with other recon elements and maneuver through mountainous or urban terrain. This variant of the Clint carries two Autocannon/2s in place of the single AC/5, giving it one of the longest ranges possible on such a small chassis. It also bears a single Medium Laser as a secondary weapon. Like the 1-2R variant, the 2-4T also has no jumping capability. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Clint CLNT-2-GD
details:
A full conversion of the standard Clint to Clan tech, used by the famous elite mercenary unit the Gray Death Legion. By using both Ferro-Fibrous armor and an Endo-Steel chassis the design manages to fit an Ultra AC/5 and three ER Medium Lasers, making the 40 ton 'Mech capable to deliver an unexpectedly heavy strike. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Clint CLNT-3-3TR
details:
A mercenary refit of the Clint CLNT-3-3T using acquired clan tech. Mounting an Ultra AC/5 and three ER Medium Lasers, made possibly by use of both Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo Steel structure, making it considerably better armed than its base variant. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Clint IIC 1
details:
When General Aleksandr Kerensky led most of the Star League Defense Force into exile in 2784, they brought prototypes of the Clint BattleMech with them. After the annihilation of Clan Wolverine, Clan Snow Raven revisited these prototypes and was able to begin mass-production of the 'Mech in 2830 and introduced 2842. They ensured that it kept up with advances in Clan technology, eventually becoming the design that is now known as the Clint IIC. This speedy medium 'Mech is armed with a Type KOV LB-10X Autocannon and a pair of Series 2d ER Medium Lasers. This makes the Clint IIC an effective light 'Mech killer. It is capable of ranging far beyond supply lines thanks to its four tons of ammunition, though it only uses ten standard heat sinks and seven tons of standard armor. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Colossus CL-P3
details:
The original Colossus design, introduced in 3053, carried a standard AC/20, and a Large Pulse Laser teamed with a Medium Pulse Laser in each arm. Like the updated version, this prototype could jump 90 meters. The armor protection remained the same, but it carried three Coolant Pods in the right and left torsos instead of the shields that would later appear on the CLS-4S. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Commando COM-1A
details: The original Commando used prototype equipment that was similarly primitive to those found in the first BattleMech, the Mackie. This version was completely replaced by its successor. First constructed in 2463, the 'Mech was equipped with only an Odin Large Laser mounted in its right arm. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.76

name: Commando COM-1B
details: The Large Laser mounted by most 1B models is nothing to sniff at, but it lacks the close-up impact of the SRMs it replaces. Best to keep these units at range for flanking and spotting. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-1C
details: The Commando 1C is a recent variant that attempts to make a long range direct fire support unit, by removing the missiles and replacing them with a single AC/2 in the right arm. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-1D
details: The predecessor to the 2D, the Commando 1D was meant to give the MechWarrior a little more long range punch with a Large Laser. at the cost of some of its armor. While the 2D is superior in most aspects, there are still a number of this older design still in service today. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-2A
details: The 2A is an unofficial refit of the 2D, adding one and a half ton of armor and switching from single to double heat sinks. The SRM-6 launcher is converted to a hand-mounted SRM-4, and the Medium Laser moved to a side torso. The 'Mech also adds protection against internal ammunition explosions in form of a C.A.S.E. system. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-2D
details: With all those SRMs, the COM-2D is like a small, highly mobile shotgun that can take down 'Mechs twice its size or bigger. You've gotta be careful with it, though, because it's not meant to take much of a beating. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-2Dr
details: A refit of the 2D chassis removing all the missiles and instead adds three more Medium Lasers and six Small Lasers, along with an extra ton of armor. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-2DS 'Freeman'
details: In 3055 the Taurian Concordat's Vandenburg Mechanized Industries produced limited runs of this factory refit of the Commando COM-2D using stealth and sensor packages imported from the Cappelan Confederation. While the result was an effective scout, with respectable ambush capabilities, the expense compared to the base model, and the difficulties of multinational production, kept it from widespread adoption. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Commando COM-2I
details: The Commando 2I features modified SRMs with an Inferno payload. This pirate favorite is notorious for its ability to harass and disable, while also packing a punch with its two RL-10s. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-2J
details: A battlefield refit of the 2D, the 2J mounts 6 jump jets and replaces the SRM-6 with a SRM-4 launcher. The 'Mech further uses double heat sinks to support the increased heat build up from the jump jets. To be able to carry the weight of the jump jets, the 2J uses an XL engine core and Ferro-Fibrous armor. This does however mean that an extra ton of armor and a C.A.S.E. system can be added. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Commando COM-2P
details: Another common refit of the COM-2D is the 2P, which adds a Large Laser at the cost of only keeping a downgraded SRM-2 launcher. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-2W
details: Five tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, an XL engine, double heat sinks, C.A.S.E. system and an extra Medium laser makes the 2W quite a refit of the 2D. To make it even more interesting the SRM-6 has been replaced by a Streak SRM-4 launcher. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Commando COM-3A
details: A very recent variant, the 3A mounts a pair of SRM-6 racks and supplements its close in firepower with a Flamer. It is an excellent quick strike 'Mech, but suffers in drawn out fights due to a limited supply of ammunition for the SRMs. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-3H
details: A strange variant of the Commando that is focused more on durability than most other variants, the 3H only mounts a single Large Laser. Instead, it carries a full 2 extra tons of armor and an extra heat sink. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-3H2
details: The 3H2 mounts a Large Laser and a Small Laser, protected by 5.5 tons of armor. This makes it more durable than a 2D, allowing it to remain scouting for a longer time on the battlefield. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-5S
details: The COM-5S was introduced in 3050 and was the first Commando to feature Star League technology. Its new Cyclops MultiTasker 10 Targeting System links an Artemis IV Fire Control System to the Coventry 90 mm SRM-6, which replaces the Shannon Six-Shooter, and exchanges the SRM-4 with a Coventry T4H Streak SRM-2 launcher. Additionally, the chassis has been upgraded with Endo Steel, the armor has been upgraded to Ferro-Fibrous, and CASE has been added to protect the ammunition. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-7A
details: The best armored of the of the -7 series, the -7A still manages to fit a total of 200 C.A.S.E. protected SRM missiles for its two SRM-4 launchers. A single Medium Laser in the Left Arm is the only other weapon of the variant. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-7J
details: Similar to the -7A in weapons loadout with two SRM-4 launchers and a Medium Laser, the -7J mounts five jump jets instead of the extra armor and ammunition of the -7A. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-7W
details: The -7W reaches for longevity with extra ammo and a Streak SRM-2 launcher. Task Force Serpent used these variants to great effect on Huntress, prompting Coventry Metal Works to dedicate factory space to producing official re-creations. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Commando COM-7X
details: A 4th Succession war variant that saw limited production, the 7X variant exchanges the SRM-4 for an additional 2 medium lasers but is otherwise identical to the standard Commando. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-7Y
details: The COM-7Y swaps the -2D's SRM-4 for two more medium lasers and another ton of armor in an attempt to improve the Commando's longevity on the battlefield. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-7Y2 'Blazing Inferno'
details: The -7Y2 is more than just a sub-variant of the -7Y, it has become so famous and beloved it earned its own nickname of the 'Blazing Inferno'. It sacrifices the SRM launchers, but instead adds 6 small lasers. The only downside of the variant is its quite bad cooling capabilities considering all its weapons. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-7Z
details: The recovery of Cellular Ammunition Storage Equipment technology saw the emergence of a new more durable variant of the Commando, the -7Z. To fit the C.A.S.E. system the variant drops one of the -7Y's Medium Lasers, but also adds a bit more armor. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando COM-7Z2
details: A sub-variant of the -7Z, the Commando COM-7Z2 downgrades the two Medium Lasers to Small Lasers to be able to fit a Beagle Active Probe. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Commando COM-9D
details: Built on an Endo Steel chassis, the 9D combines a 200 XL engine with 5 tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, two Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-6 launcher. A ton of streak ammunition and an Beagle Active Probe finishes the design. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Commando COM-9DA
details: A refresh of the 9D, the 9DA replaces the Medium Lasers with Small Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Commando COM-R2D2
details: The Commando R2D2, except for having a very strange designation, is a pretty standard looking refit of the 2D replacing the Medium Laser with a C3 slave unit. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Commando IIC
details:
During the Amaris Civil War, several Lyran MechWarriors joined the SLDF in defiance of their government's policy of neutrality. With this came the coup that the Star League Defense Force had attempted to pull off for decades: the acquisition of the Lyran Commando. Long considered one of the better scout 'Mechs in the Inner Sphere, at least one of these Commandos accompanied Kerensky into exile and several of them appeared in the forces assigned to Operation Klondike. As newer weapons and 'Mechs made their way into the Clan arsenal, these Commandos began to show their age, so Clan Goliath Scorpion began a program to upgrade theirs. Dubbed the Commando IIC, this upgrade used newer technologies to outperform its venerable cousin. With the proliferation of OmniMechs, most Commando IICs were relegated to second line status, though the Scorpions still continue to outfit some of their pirate hunters with these 'Mechs. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Conjurer 1
details: The Conjurer is a fast, inexpensive medium BattleMech that excels at medium to short range. As befitting its status as a second-line 'Mech, the Conjurer uses a standard engine, though it is constructed on an Endo Steel chassis and uses eight and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Its jump jets enable it to leap up to 180 meters at a time. Armed with a Large Pulse Laser, the Conjurer can fall back on paired ER Medium Lasers and Streak SRM-2s for closer range combat. Ten double heat sinks are able to keep heat under control. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Conjurer 7
details: Designed as a successor to the Wolverine, the Conjurer is a 50-ton Mech seen in Clan Second Line formations. Powered by a 300-rated Fusion Core, the Conjurer CJR-7 mounts 6 Jump jets. A Large Pulse Laser and 2 LRM-5’s form the bulk of the CJR-7’s weapons, with a pair of ER Medium Lasers for close combat. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Copperhead CPR-HD-002
details: First produced in late fall of 3054, the Copperhead is a finely honed arena 'Mech. The design rose to fame when Silver Dragons Stables MechWarrior Brendon Frazer piloted his Copperhead, the Silver Snake, into the Solaris Top Twenty prior to his untimely death. The Silver Dragons commissioned Solaris Arms to develop a new exclusive variant to try and repeat the feat, but the new model's expensive experimental weaponry forced them to allow sales to other interested parties. The Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery snapped up a number of the original CPR-HD-002 models. While not increasing the original model's meager four and half tons of armor coverage, Solaris Arms chose to replace the original Durallex plating with ArcShield Reflective Armor to enhance its endurance against the large volume of energy weapons carried by Arena 'Mechs. Already a relatively speedy design, the addition of a Supercharger enhanced its ground speed. Its extremely short jumping distance was neither improved nor removed; instead it was retained to expand a pilot's options in tight terrain. An extra Double Heat Sink, bringing the total to thirteen, is still not enough to keep up with the increased heat produced by the CPR-HD-003's advanced laser weaponry. Allowing the designers to squeeze in the new systems, a cramped Small Cockpit is used, which is less of a liability in the short duration arena battles than on an actual battlefield. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Corona [STD]
details: The Corona is a battle armor design that was created by Clan Star Adder following the Trials to determine which Clans would take part in Operation REVIVAL. The idea was to build the battlesuit around a weapon that could threaten 'Mechs from a distance. The mass necessary to mount such a heavy weapon resulted in a twenty percent armor decrease and the removal of the jump pack, despite a fifty percent overall increase in mass. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.935 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can not swarm.

name: Corsair COR-5R
details:
While Corsair is supposedly a generic Periphery term referring to heavy and assault class FrankenMechs cobbled together out of desperation as the Succession War era dragged on, with no specific weight or base chassis, the most successful of these are ninety-five ton brutes modeled in a generally similar style, usually marked with a COR designation. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

name: Corsair COR-5T
details: While Corsair is supposedly a generic Periphery term referring to heavy and assault class FrankenMechs cobbled together out of desperation as the Succession War era dragged on, with no specific weight or base chassis, the most successful of these are ninety-five ton brutes modeled in a generally similar style, usually marked with a COR designation. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: Corsair COR-6R
details:
While Corsair is supposedly a generic Periphery term referring to heavy and assault class FrankenMechs cobbled together out of desperation as the Succession War era dragged on, with no specific weight or base chassis, the most successful of these are ninety-five ton brutes modeled in a generally similar style, usually marked with a COR designation. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

name: Corsair COR-7A
details:
While Corsair is supposedly a generic Periphery term referring to heavy and assault class FrankenMechs cobbled together out of desperation as the Succession War era dragged on, with no specific weight or base chassis, the most successful of these are ninety-five ton brutes modeled in a generally similar style, usually marked with a COR designation. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Corsair COR-7R
details:
While Corsair is supposedly a generic Periphery term referring to heavy and assault class FrankenMechs cobbled together out of desperation as the Succession War era dragged on, with no specific weight or base chassis, the most successful of these are ninety-five ton brutes modeled in a generally similar style, usually marked with a COR designation. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Corsair COR-S7 'Grace
details:
At its core this is still a typical Periphery FrankenMech, but it received a lot of care from 'Her' owner, named after a infamous Terran Pirate Queen, does this specific design sport a Thumper Artillery Piece and munitions from the Barrymore Munitions manufacturers, granting superior Tactical Flexibility. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Corvis 1
details:
The Corvis 1 is built on a Model MH-24 endo steel chassis, protected by seven tons of ferro-fibrous armor; a good thing since it is so slow. This low speed is due to the 160-rated fusion engine that powers the 'Mech. Thankfully this low speed is augmented by four jump jets, giving the Corvis a jump range of 120 meters. The main gun of the Corvis is its UAC/10, backed up by a pair of medium pulse lasers. These guns enable the Corvis to operate effectively in medium to short ranges. Between the generous supply of autocannon ammunition and 10 double heat sinks that keep the 'Mech chilled, the Corvis can operate without resupply for a respectable amount of time. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Cossack C-SK1
details: The Cossack is named after the mercenary unit Khorsakov's Cossacks in honor of their faithful service to the St Ives Compact. The Cossack is a practice in compromise. Originally requested as the fastest 'Mech that Ceres Metals Industries could produce, the emphasis of the design changed throughout its development to a slow moving, heavily armored light 'Mech. The final design that was accepted became the current incarnation of the Cossack. The Cossack is built on a Taijian Series X Endo Steel chassis to save weight. More weight was cut from the design by using a lightweight Hermes 120 XL engine that gives the 'Mech a top speed of 97.2 km/h. Six Pitban LFT-65 jump jets allow the Cossack to jump up to hundred and eighty meters, allowing the 'Mech to easily handle most rough terrain. For protection, the Cossack has three tons of armor and has ten heat sinks to handle the heat produced by the weapons payload carried by the 'Mech. Overall, the compromise that created the Cossack has turned it into a light trooper 'Mech that works well as part of a team but alone excels at no one role. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Cougar A
details:
With a focus on indirect fire support, the COU-A fields a pair of Artemis IV guided LRM-20s. If the pilot finds itself in a position with direct line of sight he or she can also rely on a pair of ERML's and a single backup Small Pulse Laser. In total this makes for a lot of firepower in a very small package. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Cougar B
details:
The Cougar-B is a classic clan direct fire support / sniper build. Dual ERPPCs and a backup ERML make for a formidable punch. With a set of six additional Double Heatsinks the COU-B runs reasonably cool and is able to keep its barrage up for quite a while. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Cougar C
details:
A mix of long and medium range weaponry is what makes the Cougar-C variant quite unique. A Gauss Rifle is an absolutely scary main weapon system for a mech of just 35 tons and even the backup weapons are more than enough to strike fear in its enemies heart: 5 ERML will allow the COU-C to stay active and dangerous even after the ammo for the Gauss is depleted. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Cougar D
details:
Conceptualized to be a sniper with a good near field defense the Cougar-D variant relies on a single ERLL and an Ultra Autocannon/10 for long range and dual SRM4 launchers for close range fire. The COU-D might not be quick, but if he closes in after ripping the armor open, these Short Range Missiles have great finishing potential. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Cougar H
details:
This configuration was introduced during the 3060s. It was equipped with four Jump Jets and an ECM suite. This variant is armed with an Ultra Autocannon/5 and a trio of Heavy Medium Lasers for when any opponent tries to close range. It also has three additional double heat sinks to deal with heat the trio of heavy lasers produce. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Cougar HR 'Huntress'
details:
The Huntress configuration of the Cougar is a rare sight, designed to be a scout hunter and Heavy Hitter is most of its capability shifted to advanced electronics and the ability to detect and effectively kill even stealthed units in a single devastating Blow. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Cougar MCA
details:
The primary configuration in the MC custom line of Cougars, based on an upgraded 210 XL engine instead of the stock 175 XL. The MCA's purpose is long rage attacks, carrying a LRM-15 and a Large Pulse Laser. For defensive purposes it mounts an Anti Missile System and to deal with infantry attacks the MCA also mounts a Flamer. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Cougar MCJ
details:
Another configuration in the MC custom line of Cougars, based on an upgraded 210 XL engine instead of the stock 175 XL. The addition of six jump jets makes the MCJ one of the most mobile configurations of the Cougar, at the cost of only being able to mount a single LRM-15 launcher and a Large Pulse Laser for combat, with a chest mounted Flamer for defensive purposes. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Cougar MCW
details:
Another configuration in the MC custom line of Cougars, based on an upgraded 210 XL engine instead of the stock 175 XL. Mounting four LRM-5 launchers and double Large Pulse Lasers, the damage profile is higher than expected. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Cougar Prime
details:
Khan Marthe Pryde decided to upgrade the 'Mechs her Clan fielded. Rather than waste precious resources designing a new OmniMech from the ground up, she instructed her scientists to improve upon existing designs. The design the scientists chose to modify was the Adder. Though the two 'Mechs are visually similar and share the same weight, the Cougar is slower and better armed. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Coyotl A
details:
The Coyotl has the honor of being the first OmniMech. Developed by Clan Coyote with some help from Clan Sea Fox, the Coyotl was first fielded in 2854. By using an XL Engine and Endo Steel chassis, the scientists were able to create a medium 'Mech that could carry a great deal of equipment. In addition, the high ground speed of the Coyotl allowed it to rush from one area of a battlefield to another, providing support for its teammates. The A configuration was introduced during a conflict against Clan Cloud Cobra. Seven Jump Jets gave the Coyotl A much greater maneuverability, while the long range weapons were traded for a Large Pulse Laser, Small Pulse Laser, and an additional Streak SRM-4 launcher. This version also dropped the Medium Pulse Laser of the original. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Coyotl B
details:
The Coyotl has the honor of being the first OmniMech. Developed by Clan Coyote with some help from Clan Sea Fox, the Coyotl was first fielded in 2854. By using an XL Engine and Endo Steel chassis, the scientists were able to create a medium 'Mech that could carry a great deal of equipment. In addition, the high ground speed of the Coyotl allowed it to rush from one area of a battlefield to another, providing support for its teammates. The B configuration uses an Ultra AC/10 in the right arm as its main firepower, supported by an ER Medium Laser and SRM-6 launcher. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Coyotl Prime
details:
The Coyotl has the honor of being the first OmniMech. Developed by Clan Coyote with some help from Clan Sea Fox, the Coyotl was first fielded in 2854. By using an XL Engine and Endo Steel chassis, the scientists were able to create a medium 'Mech that could carry a great deal of equipment. In addition, the high ground speed of the Coyotl allowed it to rush from one area of a battlefield to another, providing support for its teammates. The primary version of the Coyotl used an ER PPC and LRM-10 as the primary long range weapons, while a Medium Pulse Laser and Streak SRM-4 provided short range firepower. Originally the engineers thought they would build each variant around the PPC, but this proved to be too limiting, particularly with the high heat it caused. The missile systems were added to provide firepower at a lower heat cost. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Crockett CRK-5003-0
details:
A Star League era training mech, the Crockett was introduced in 2735. An 85-ton mech with a mix of weapon types alongside double heat sinks, the Crockett would go on to see frontline service as a command mech and assault mech. The CRK-5003-0 is a downgrade resulting from the Succession War’s decline in technology and features a 255-rated engine alongside a trio of Jump Jets. A pair of Large Lasers and an AC/10 form the bulk of the mechs weapons, with paired SRM-6's Lasers and Small Lasers surprising opponents at close range. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Crockett CRK-5003-1
details:
A Star League era training mech, the Crockett was introduced in 2735. An 85-ton mech with a mix of weapon types alongside double heat sinks, the Crockett would go on to see frontline service as a command mech and assault mech. The CRK-5003-1 is the original SLDF training model and features a 255-rated engine alongside a trio of Jump Jets. A pair of ER Large Lasers and an LB-10X form the bulk of the mechs weapons, while a pair of SRM-6's and Small Lasers surprise enemies closing in. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Crockett CRK-5003-1b
details:
A Star League era training mech, the Crockett was introduced in 2735. An 85-ton mech with a mix of weapon types alongside double heat sinks, the Crockett would go on to see frontline service as a command mech and assault mech. The CRK-5003-1b is an upgrade model used by the SLDF Royal regiments and features a 255-rated engine alongside an Endo Steel skeleton and a trio of Jump Jets. A pair of ER Large Lasers and a Gauss Rifle form the bulk of the mechs weapons, with 2 Medium Lasers and 4 Medium Pulses surprise opponents at close range. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Cronus CNS-3M
details: The Cronus was designed by Angus Gilmour to be a cost-effective 'Mech for use by mercenaries and small Periphery units using scrapped military equipment. After retiring from service with the Free Worlds League Military in the 3rd Succession War, Gilmour and many ex-technicians he recruited began working for the family business, Gilmour MilTech, on his home planet Talitha. While Gilmour MilTech would spend much of its time rebuilding/restoring wrecked equipment, technicians with free time constructed small numbers of the Cronus. An inexpensive, hand-built design, the Cronus combines design aspects of many different 55-ton BattleMechs seen on the modern battlefield. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Cronus CNS-5M
details: The Cronus was designed by Angus Gilmour to be a cost-effective 'Mech for use by mercenaries and small Periphery units using scrapped military equipment. After retiring from service with the Free Worlds League Military in the 3rd Succession War, Gilmour and many ex-technicians he recruited began working for the family business, Gilmour MilTech, on his home planet Talitha. While Gilmour MilTech would spend much of its time rebuilding/restoring wrecked equipment, technicians with free time constructed small numbers of the Cronus. An inexpensive, hand-built design, the Cronus combines design aspects of many different 55-ton BattleMechs seen on the modern battlefield. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Crossbow CRS-6B
details:
Considered to be a middleweight machine compared to the heavier Mackies and Ymirs already in circulation, the Crossbow was built to be a fast missile support unit. As was the case with the Coventry Defense Conglomerate, Arcturan Arms’ engineers initially failed to make their prototype Crossbow live up to expectations, but as the techniques for producing BattleMechs grew more refined, the Crossbow received an upgrade worthy of its original concept. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

details:
Considered to be a middleweight machine compared to the heavier Mackies and Ymirs already in circulation, the Crossbow was built to be a fast missile support unit. name: Crossbow A
details:
Developed during the Golden Century by Clan Steel Viper as an early second-generation OmniMech, the Crossbow is a relatively cheap OmniMech. The Crossbow was Clan Steel Viper's first attempt to crash-start their OmniMech manufacturing capability, and was initiated in part by a small cadre of captured Clan Snow Raven scientist caste. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

details:

name: Crosscut ED-X2M
details: The Crosscut is a popular type of LoggerMech, praised for operating efficiency in woodlands and dominating commercial forestry. The X2M is a militarized crosscut on the cheap, with only minor modifications to the base industrial model. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.72

name: Crosscut ED-X4X
details: The Crosscut is a popular type of LoggerMech, praised for operating efficiency in woodlands and dominating commercial forestry. The X4X is the dual-chainsaw version (not to be confused with the dual-saw version, which is different). It's particularly popular in forestry with dense tree coverage. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.72

name: Crusader CRD-1R
details: Introduced in 2596, this variant was originally produced for the SLDF during the Reunification War. It upgraded the heat sinks to double heat sinks and utilized an Endo Steel internal structure to save mass. All of the ammunition is located in the side torsos and protected by CASE. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Crusader CRD-2R
details: This lostech variant was used by the SLDF's Royal units. It used double heat sinks and utilized an Endo Steel internal structure to save mass. This enabled the addition of Artemis IV Fire Control Systems to the LRM launchers. The SRMs were replaced with four Hawk Streak SRM-2s. All of the ammunition was moved to the side torsos and protected by CASE. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Crusader CRD-3D
details: The 3D variant of the Crusader is a simple modification to make the 'Mech's heat load more manageable. Introduced in 2756 and used mostly by House Davion, the two SRM-6 launchers were replaced with two SRM-4 launchers and the machine guns were removed so that the number of heat sinks could be increased by four. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Crusader CRD-3K
details: A variant of the Crusader concentrating on lessening its heat burden, the 3K was introduced by the Draconis Combine in 2765. It downsized the LRM launchers to LRM-10 models and removed the machine guns to make room for an additional six heat sinks. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Crusader CRD-3L
details: The 3L variant of the Crusader takes concepts from both the 3D and the 3K models to save weight with a twist. Built for the Capellan Confederation starting in 2753, the 'Mech has removed the LRM-15 and SRM-6 launchers and replaced them with two LRM-10 launchers and two SRM-4 launchers. This frees up room for two additional heat sinks as well as the inclusion of four GM Jetstar jump jets, two each in either side torso, giving it a jumping distance of one hundred and twenty meters. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Crusader CRD-3R
details: The Crusader was initially designed as a close combat BattleMech for the Star League Defense Force, but soon proved itself to be a very adaptable, multi-role design. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Crusader CRD-3RR
details: A refit of the -3R that replaces the Machine Guns with a C3 slave unit and CASE protection to improve battlefield performance against other Mechs and Vehicles. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Crusader CRD-3R-WDR
details: Custom refit of the Crusader CRD-3R used by the mercenary band Wolf's Dragoons. The main features are the replacement of all the weapons with Clan tech versions and the use of a Clan XL engine core, combined with four JumpJets and an Artemis IV system. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Crusader CRD-3-WDR
details: One of several custom designs used by the famous mercenary company Wolf's Dragoons. Based off the -3R but heavily improved with Clan tech, the design uses a 360 XL Clan Engine core to be able to fit better weapons, a C3 slave unit, jumpjets and better cooling. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Crusader CRD-4BR
details: A Star League-tech retrofit of the classic CRD-3R developed by Bander BattleMechs for the mercenary market in 3054, the 4BR switches to double heat sinks and replaces the SRM-6 launchers with a pair of Streak SRM-2s. The weight saved allows an extra ton of LRM reloads for each launcher to be carried, protected by the addition of CASE in each torso. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Crusader CRD-4D
details: The 4D variant of the Crusader was a common field modification kit, utilizing Star League technology recovered from the Helm Memory Core, used by both Davion and Liao forces starting in 3049. This variant has had the medium lasers and the SRM-6 launchers removed and in their place has two Streak SRM-2 launchers and two Medium Pulse Lasers mounted. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Crusader CRD-4Db
details: The -4Db was an initial alternative upgrade route from the -3R before -4D design was fully finished. However, due the use of Artemis IV FCS, Streak SRM-4s rather than Streak SRM-2s and Endo Steel structure made the design far too expensive for the intended market. Only a few units were ever produced. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Crusader CRD-4K
details: A field modification kit based on the 3K variant and introduced for Kuritan forces in 3049, the 4K removes two heat sinks and replaces the two medium lasers of the 3K with Magna 400P medium pulse models. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Crusader CRD-4L
details: A Capellan Confederation specific variant, similar to the CRD-4D except for a slightly different paintjob. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Crusader CRD-5M
details: The 5M was the official production-model upgraded variant of the Crusader for the Free Worlds League, introduced in 3049 and using recovered Star League technology. Though using the same Crucis-B chassis as before the 'Mech was powered by a Hermes 260 XL Engine and carried thirteen double heat sinks to vent its heat more efficiently. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Crusader CRD-5S
details: A production-model upgrade of the Crusader utilizing Star League equipment, the 5S was built by TharHes industries on Tharkad for FedCom forces starting in 3049. It varies little from the 3R model, instead removing the machine guns to make room for double heat sinks, CASE to protect the missile reloads, and the addition of a Flamer in the right arm. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Crusader CRD-6T
details: A Kallon variant with a top speed of 86 km/h thanks to an XL engine. Each arm carries six medium lasers and the leg mounted weapons are a flamer in each hip mount. Seventeen double heat sinks struggle to keep things cool, but twelve and a half tons of armor protect the 'Mech. A C3 slave unit is mounted in the head, allowing this Crusader to share targeting data. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Cudgel CDG-1B
details: The Cudgel 1B was the first of a handful of BattleMechs designed off of the Charger chassis by Solarian manufacturer Innovative Design Concepts. By mounting all weaponry in the torsos, IDC found that MechWarriors were able to make melee strikes without sacrificing any firepower. Quirk: Melee Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Cyclone CYC-A1
details:
The original flagship model, the Cyclone A1 began mass-manufacture in 2631 and proved to be the most expensive variant until the 3060s. Sporting a Magna 210XL Fusion engine, the Cyclone A1 can reach and maintain speeds up to 118km/h. Sold as a Scout Mech, the A1 features both a Guardian ECM Suite and a Beagle Active Probe which leaves just enough space for its light weapons payload consisting of a pair of Longfire V LRM 5s in the arms and a pair of Magna Mk II Medium Lasers in the side torsos. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Cyclone CYC-A3
details:
A downgrade of the original A1 variant, the Cyclone A3 was produced throughout the Amaris Civil War and all four Succession Wars. Replacing the 210XL Fusion engine with an ultra-reliable Magna 150 Fusion engine made the A3 cost half as much as the A1 variant. While the A3 retains the Magna MkII Medium Lasers and Longfire V LRM 5s, the ECM Suite and Active Probe are replaced by a pair of Sperry Browning Machine Guns and a Zippo Flamer. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Cyclone CYC-A3P
details: The Cyclone A3P refit became popular in the late 2960s and became the primary variant produced, under license, by Luthien Armor Works in the Draconis Combine until the design was retired in the 3060s. The A3P retains the Magna 150 Fusion engine and Magna Mk II Medium lasers of the A3 but replaces the remainder of the weapons payload for a Magna Hellstar PPC and an extra heat sink. The Luthien production runs of the A3P variant were the first Cyclones to feature lower arm and hand actuators. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Cyclone CYC-B2
details: After the discovery of the Helm Memory Core and the development of several additional key technologies, Magna Metals Inc. revisited the Cyclone design in 3058. The B2 variant features an Endo-Steel chassis paired with a 180L Fusion Engine to make room for a pair of experimental Hellcat Class 5 Thunderbolt 5 launchers with a ton of ammunition each and a pair of Magna Mk VI ER Medium Lasers. Further differences from the previous A3 variant come in the form of Double Heat Sinks, lower arm and hand actuators, and the reintroduction of the Guardian ECM Suite. The Cyclone B2 found only a tepid response from military buyers as the Thunderbolt missiles are susceptible to being rendered ineffectual by Anti-Missile Systems. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Cyclone CYC-C1
details: After the lack-luster reaction to the Cyclone B2 in most markets, Magna Metals Inc., in collaboration with Hollis Incorporated, developed the C1 variant. The Cyclone C1 is built around the same Magna 210XL engine of the A1 variant. Using the same Endo-Steel chassis of the B2, the C1 replaces the weapons payload of the B2 with a Magna Firestar ER PPC, a pair of Magna Mk VI ER Medium Lasers, a Guardian ECM Suite, and an additional Double Heat Sink. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Daboku DCMS-MX90-D
details:
Equipped with 4 Imperator Smoothie AC/2s, 2 Holly LRM-10 Launchers and 2 Large Lasers this 'Mech was nothing more than a laughingstock when it was first released. It served as the basis for the more successful Mauler Quirk: Accurate Weapon - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Daedalus DAD-3C
details:
The original Daedalus carried a large pulse laser, machine gun, small laser, SRM-6, and a pair of SRM-4 missile launchers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Daikyu DAI-01
details: The DAI-01 is built around long-range firepower. The primary weapon the 'Mech carries is a ER PPC backed up by a pair of Ultra autocannon/5s. This combination of weapons gives the Daikyu a devastating long-range punch. The 'Mech also carries a LRM-5 launcher, giving it limited indirect fire support capabilities. For close combat, the Daikyu carries a single medium laser. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Daikyu DAI-02
details: A variant made to address concerns of a lack of short-range firepower, the 02 variant was built soon after Operation Bulldog. The 'Mech carries a pair of Streak SRM-6 launchers in place of the two Ultra autocannon/5s. Additionally, for close combat, the 02 variant of the Daikyu has two ER medium lasers. It is also outfitted with a C3 slave unit to share targeting information with other friendly units. It also has the addition of jump jets, giving it a jumping capacity of 150 meters. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Daimyo DMO-1K
details:
The Daimyo is named for the title used for warlords from the medieval Japanese empire. The 'Mech, first produced in 3053, attempts to live up to the heritage of its name admirably. It is armed primarily for long range combat but can hold its own if the situation warrants it. The Daimyo's maximum speed of 86.4 km/h and its Nissan 200 fusion engine make the Daimyo a rugged 'Mech that can survive an amazing amount of damage, while bringing the fight to the enemy. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Daimyo DMO-2K
details:
The Daimyo is named for the title used for warlords from the medieval Japanese empire. The 'Mech, first produced in 3053, attempts to live up to the heritage of its name admirably. details:

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Dart DRT-3S
details: The Dart was built when the Federated Commonwealth was looking for BattleMechs that were not ammunition dependent. The 'Mech was built with an all energy weapon arsenal on an extremely high-speed chassis. The 'Mech is capable of speeds of up to 151 km/h and is armored with three and a half tons of armor. The 'Mech, while lightly armed, is an exceptional recon 'Mech and also works well in a guerrilla force where its use of energy weapons allows it to operate independently. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Dart DRT-4S
details: The Dart was built when the Federated Commonwealth was looking for BattleMechs that were not ammunition dependent. The 'Mech was built with an all energy weapon arsenal on an extremely high-speed chassis. The 'Mech is capable of speeds of up to 151 km/h and is armored with three and a half tons of armor. The 'Mech, while lightly armed, is an exceptional recon 'Mech and also works well in a guerrilla force where its use of energy weapons allows it to operate independently. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Dart DRT-6S
details: The Dart was built when the Federated Commonwealth was looking for BattleMechs that were not ammunition dependent. The 'Mech was built with an all energy weapon arsenal on an extremely high-speed chassis. The 'Mech is capable of speeds of up to 151 km/h and is armored with three and a half tons of armor. The 'Mech, while lightly armed, is an exceptional recon 'Mech and also works well in a guerrilla force where its use of energy weapons allows it to operate independently. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Dervish DV-1S
details:
The original version of the Dervish that was produced in 2520 was not up to the same standards as contemporary Terran Hegemony designs. The use of comparatively "primitive" parts resulted in a heavier cockpit, engine, and less efficient armor. Consequently, the 1S had a top speed of 64 km/h and could only jump ninety meters. While the missile launchers were the same as the 6M, it did not have that version's lasers. 1S variants continued to exist in militias, but were raided for parts during the Succession Wars. It was not intended for front line use, but for Militia units. Though there were few, if any, remaining by the end of the 2990s, they once again began to be produced on low-tech worlds during the Jihad due to that conflict's disruption of supply lines. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.83

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Dervish DV-6M
details:
The Dervish carries as its main weapons two Federated 10-Shot LRM launchers. These missile launchers give the Dervish the long-range capability needed to provide fire support to friendly units and are safely embedded in the torso as opposed to the exposed launchers on other 'Mechs. A ton of ammunition per launcher provides sufficient endurance for any but the most prolonged battles. For close combat, the Dervish carries two Federated 2-Shot SRM launchers and two ChisComp 39 Medium Lasers. The SRM launchers are completely self-contained within the forearms, allowing them to be aimed quickly, and fed by a ton of ammunition each. The lasers are placed just above the launchers and ensure the 'Mech is still capable of fighting should it run out of missiles. The Dervish is capable of jumping 150 meters and is protected by seven and a half tons of armor. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Dervish DV-6Md
details:
This Star League era variant uses an XL Engine, twelve single heat sinks, and upgrades the LRM-10s to LRM-15s. Three tons of ammunition are in a CASE protected torso bin. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Dervish DV-6MRU
details:
The DV-6MRU - or Minor Resilience Upgrade - was an upgrade program provided for a while for the original DV-6M, replacing one of the Medium Lasers with a C3 slave unit and C.A.S.E. protection for the ammunition. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Dervish DV-7D
details:
The 7D Dervish is a 3047 upgrade of the design using Star League technology. The 'Mech is built with an Endo Steel chassis and also uses eight tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor with CASE for protection against ammunition explosions. With the saved weight, the SRM-2s have been upgraded to Federated SuperStreak SRMs and the 'Mech uses double heat sinks. This variant was first produced by Achernar BattleMechs on New Avalon. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Dervish DV-7P
details:
The 7P is a Medium Range Missile Boat, carrying an MRM-20 and MRM-10 in each arm, supported by a Medium Laser in each arm and side torso. Such a heavy loadout while retaining the Dervish's usual seven and half tons of armor and five jump jets is made possible with an 275-rated extralight engine and Endo Steel frame. The 7P is fitted with ten double heat sinks and carries a combined four tons of MRM reloads. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Dervish DV-7S
details:
The 7S is in practice a 6M with one of the medium lasers exchanged for two small ones and some relocation of the 'Mechs components and weapons. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Dervish IIC
details:
The Dervish IIC-0, a 55-ton Clan refit of the Star-League-era Dervish, was first seen in 3058 along the Smoke Jaguar front bordering the Draconis Combine. It has similar movement and jump capabilities to the original Dervish, but carries significantly more firepower. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Devastator DVS-1D
details:
A Star League era mech designed to correct the flaws of the original Titan, the Devastator was rediscovered by the FedSuns in 3023. Powered by a 300-rated engine, the Devastator DVS-1D carries a pair of AC/10’s, with 2 Large Lasers and 4 Medium Lasers as secondary weapons. 18 tons of armor and 15 heat sinks round out the design. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Devastator DVS-2
details:
A Star League era mech designed to correct the flaws of the original Titan, the Devastator was rediscovered by the FedSuns in 3023. Powered by a 300-rated XL engine, the Devastator DVS-2 carries a pair of Gauss Rifles, with 2 PPC’s and 4 Medium Lasers as secondary weapons. 18.5 tons of armor and 14 DHS round out the design. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Devastator DVS-2-EC
details:
Several Devastators were hand-built by Clan technicians for Operation Klondike. These used Improved Gauss Rifles and carried two more tons of Gauss ammunition (four tons total). Later Clan Wolverine would overhaul the weapons completely, leaving the Improved Gauss Rifles in place (adding CASE to the arms for protection), but trading the PPCs for Enhanced ER PPCs and the medium lasers for ER medium lasers. To handle the massive heat load, twenty Clan-spec double heat sinks were installed. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Devastator DVS-3
details:
A Star League era mech designed to correct the flaws of the original Titan, the Devastator was rediscovered by the FedSuns in 3023. Powered by a 300-rated XL engine, the Devastator DVS-3S carries a pair of Gauss Rifles and 2 PPC’s. A Medium laser and a Small Laser round out the Mechs weapons. 18.5 tons of armor and 14 DHS round out the design. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Devil TZ-1
details: A Snow Raven variation on the original Howler chassis, the 30 ton Devil entered service in 2911. Gaining 10 tons over it’s predecessor, it is powered by a 300-rated XL Engine; enabling it to accelerate to higher speeds then the Baboon. A combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo Steel provide the free weight for an ER PPC and a Targeting Computer. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Dire Wolf A
details:
The Dire Wolf is one of the OmniMechs that became feared throughout the Inner Sphere during the initial Clan Invasion and rightly so. The Dire Wolf weighs in at an impressive one hundred tons and has a relatively slow cruising speed of 54 km/h provided by a 300 XL engine. Its speed and armor protection matches that of an Atlas, but it has superior potential firepower with fifty and a half tons of free pod space for weapons and equipment. It is these traits which saw the 'Mech christened Daishi (pseudo-Japanese for 'Great Death') by the criminal underbelly of the Draconis Combine, a name that would be proven grimly accurate time and time again. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf B
details:
The Dire Wolf is one of the OmniMechs that became feared throughout the Inner Sphere during the initial Clan Invasion and rightly so. The Dire Wolf weighs in at an impressive one hundred tons and has a relatively slow cruising speed of 54 km/h provided by a 300 XL engine. Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf C2
details:
The C2 configuration of the Dire Wolf brings a combination of energy and ballistic weapons. Two Ultra AC/2, two LBX AC/2 and three Large Pulse Lasers are the main damage dealers, while two Medium Pulse Lasers and an ER Small Laser can provide extra defensive capabilities if needed. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf D2
details:
The OmniMech configuration designated D2 for the Dire Wolf carries on of the scariest weapons on the battlefield, an Ultra AC/20. But even if the large autocannon misses, the loadout still has two ER PPC, one Large Pulse Laser, four ER Medium Lasers and two Medium Pulse Lasers as followup damage. The largest drawback of the D2 is the fact that even with 24 Double heat sinks, the cooling is seldom enough for repeated full alpha strikes. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf E2
details:
The E2 loadout is all energy-based except for its two AMS. Two Large Pulse Lasers and six Medium ones provide a scary amount of damage potential when paired with the advanced targeting computer mounted in the left torso. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf F2
details:
The Dire Wolf F2 is configured for close quarters combat with its six Stream SRM-6 and 6 Medium Pulse Lasers. The loadout still manages to fit two ER Large Laser to use while closing to closer range, and a leg mounted A-Pod provides defense against infantry attacks. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf F3
details:
The Dire Wolf F3 configuration is presently used mostly with front line regiments and a few reserves. Most other Clans are restricting their 'rookie-resistant' designs to reserve units only. However, Clan Diamond Shark seems determined to correct their past conservative strategy by swinging wildly in the opposite direction, dropping the new design right on the front lines. Some rumours claim this is due to the clan lacking the resources to conduct a full field test of the Dire Wolf F2 before committing it to combat. Only time will tell. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf F/C
details:
Part of the Dire Wolf Forward program, the F/C loadout replaces the one-shot SRM from the standard C configuration with a Streak SRM-4. To free the weight capacity for this change, one heat sink had to be removed. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf F/C2
details:
The second configuration of the Dire Wolf Forward program, the F/C2 replaces the SRM launcher with a NARC Launcher. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf H
details:
A simple direct fire configuration of the Dire Wolf, the H configuration carries a pair of Gauss Rifles as its primary long range weaponry. These are backed up by two Heavy Large Lasers for medium to short ranges. Finally, for short range combat, the H configuration has a Medium Pulse Laser and a Flamer. All of this configuration's weapons are linked to a Targeting Computer, increasing their accuracy. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf Prime
details:
The Dire Wolf is one of the OmniMechs that became feared throughout the Inner Sphere during the initial Clan Invasion and rightly so. The Dire Wolf weighs in at an impressive one hundred tons and has a relatively slow cruising speed of 54 km/h provided by a 300 XL engine. Its speed and armor protection matches that of an Atlas, but it has superior potential firepower with fifty and a half tons of free pod space for weapons and equipment. It is these traits which saw the 'Mech christened Daishi (pseudo-Japanese for 'Great Death') by the criminal underbelly of the Draconis Combine, a name that would be proven grimly accurate time and time again. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf S
details:
The S configuration is intended for the close confines of urban and jungle warfare. The S configurations primary weapon is a massive LB-X Autocannon/20 which is capable of disabling most light and medium 'Mechs in a single blast. This is backed up by a single Large Pulse Laser to provide some long range firepower should the Dire Wolf S be caught in the open. Additional short range firepower is provided by five Medium Pulse Lasers and two Streak SRM-4 launchers. Two Anti-Personnel Pods and two Machine Guns provide exceptional anti-infantry capabilities. The S configuration has added mobility with three jump jets allowing it to jump up to ninety meters. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf W
details:
This Wolf's Dragoons variant is effective at both long and short range. For long range, it uses a Gauss Rifle, an ER Large Laser, and an LRM-20. At close range, an Ultra Autocannon/20, ER Small Laser, and a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers provide devastating firepower. Twenty double heat sinks allow the design to almost continually fire all of its weapons. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf W2
details:
So far Dire Wolf W2 has only been seen in use inside Crusader Clan Wolf and only in the hands of a few bloodnamed warriors. Speculation surrounds this variant and its deployment, and so far it seems the Widowmaker program has only limited support inside the Clan itself. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf WDR
details:
A custom loadout for the Dire Wolf used by the Wolf's Dragoons, the infamous mercenary outfit. A Gauss Rifle and two ER PPC provides pinpoint long range damage, while two Medium Pulse Lasers add extra firepower at closer ranges. A single ER Small Laser and two AMS provides considerable defensive strength, and a C3 Slave unit makes sure the unit is constantly sharing its targeting information. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf X
details:
This variant carries a Targeting Computer to guide the fire of a Large Pulse Laser, Heavy Medium Laser, twin ER Micro Lasers, an Ultra AC/10 and the solid shot of an LB 5-X autocannon. To provide missile support, the Daishi X carries an ATM 6 with a ton of each ammunition type, a head mounted Streak SRM-2, and an SRM-4 and LRM-15. The SRM-4 and LRM-15 are each equipped with an Artemis IV FCS. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dire Wolf X 'Batchall'
details:
A loadout of the Dire Wolf normally only used for Batchalls between clans. A large combination of weapons allows for handling of most situations that can arise, but without providing the resilience for extended engagements. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Dragon DRG-1C
details:
The DRG-1C uses an AC/2 instead of the more standard AC/5. This allows it to have extreme reach across the battlefield, but at a reduced damage rate. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Dragon DRG-1N
details:
The Dragon 1N is a beefy machine that can take a serious beating but tends to be a bit light on weaponry. It moves fast for a heavy 'Mech, though, which makes it well suited to closing for Melee attacks against slower targets. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Dragon DRG-1R
details:
The Dragon 1R is a beefy machine that can take a serious beating, mounting twin Inferno SRMs to complement its CQC capabilities. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Dragon DRG-5N
details:
The 5N variant of the Dragon was used as a bridge between it and the Grand Dragon. This field upgrade, which utilizes formerly lost technology, upgrades its normal autocannon to an Ultra Autocannon/5, which is capable of firing at twice the rate of a standard model. Additionally, the rear facing Medium Laser has been removed from the 'Mech. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Dragon Fire DGR-3F
details:
A 28th century design that first saw production in 3058, the Dragon Fire is a 75-ton mech designed for brawling. The DRG-3F is armed with a Gauss Rifle and an LB-10X, with a Large Laser and a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers as secondary weapons. A 300-rated XL Engine and an Endo Steel Skeleton provide the weight need for the heavy payload, while CASE and Guardian ECM add to the designs survivability. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Dragon Fire DGR-4F
details:
A 28th century design that first saw production in 3058, the Dragon Fire is a 75-ton mech designed for brawling. The DRG-4F is armed with a Gauss Rifle and an LB-10X, with an ER Large Laser and a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers as secondary weapons. A 300-rated XL Engine and an Endo Steel Skeleton provide the weight need for the heavy payload, while CASE and Guardian ECM add to the designs survivability. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Dragoon AEM-01
details:
The Dragoon AEM-01 is armed with only a few, but powerful, weapons in the 'Mech's arms. The main damage is provided by a pair of LB 10-X Autocannons with a long-reaching ER PPC as backup. Powered by a 280-rated XL Fusion Engines, the 'Mech is able to achieve a modest pace of 64 km/h. Its defenses include a Guardian ECM Suite, while its hull is protected by 11.5 tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Dragoon AEM-02
details:
Designed as a short-ranged fighter, the -02 is armed with a single ER PPC, the remaining weapons space is filled by five medium lasers, a small pulse laser, and an AC/20. At the price of dropping its jump jets, the 'Mech's engine has been upgraded to an XL 350 to allow the 'Mech to close in quicker than the original model. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Dragoon AEM-03
details:
Designed as a long-range fire support unit, the Dragoon -03 retains the same engine specifications of the Dragoon -01 model. Its principal weaponry includes 3 Artemis IV FCS-guided 15-tubed LRM Launchers with 2 tons of CASE-protected ammunition. Backup weapons include a single medium laser, with a duo of medium and small pulse lasers for close-in defense. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Dragoon AEM-04
details:
Based on a weapon-stripped -01 model, -04's long-ranged weapons come in the form of a single Gauss rifle and an ER PPC. Its short-ranged weapons include four SRM 4s and a pair of Medium Lasers. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Drift Shag 1
details: The first Ice Hellion mech to be built entirely of Clan tech, the 35 ton Drift Shag entered production in the early Golden Age. A conversion of the older Falcon BattleMech, the Drift Shag is built around a 210-rated XL Engine and armed with an ER Large Laser. A quartet of ER Small Lasers and a Medium Pulse Laser support the ER Large at close range. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Duan Gung D9-G9
details: The Duan Gung D9-G9's primary weapon is a LRM-10 launcher, which allows the 'Mech to hit targets at up to 630 meters, while also giving the Duan Gung indirect fire support capabilities. For close-range engagements, the 'Mech has two medium lasers. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Eagle EGL-1M
details:
Produced in 3058 by Curtiss Militech, the Eagle is an effort to create a balanced mix of speed and firepower on a 25-ton chassis. The 1M sports an ER large laser and an ER small laser, along with an anti-missile system. Five jump jets allow it to maintain decent mobility, but its overland speed is lacking compared to similarly weighted BattleMechs. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Eagle EGL-2M
details:
Produced in 3058 by Curtiss Militech, the Eagle is an effort to create a balanced mix of speed and firepower on a 25-ton chassis. The 2M sports an ER large laser and an ER medium laser, along with a TAG laser designator to spot for its lancemates. Five jump jets allow it to maintain decent mobility, but its overland speed is lacking compared to similarly weighted BattleMechs. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

details:
Once fielded in great numbers by the Smoke Jaguars, the Ebon Jaguar has proliferated to many of Kerensky's Clans, though some, like the Wolves, Jade Falcons and Coyotes, continue to field Hellbringers instead. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Eisenfaust EFT-4J
details:
This Eisenfaust model was the original prototype developed in 2515. Though several were produced, Defiance Industries only used them to test weapons and equipment configurations for the EFT-7X. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

name: Elemental [FL]
details: The standard against which all battle armor is measured, the Elemental battle armor was first introduced in 2868 by Clan Wolf in a Trial of Possession against the Nova Cats. It was a marvel of Clan engineering that allowed a small group of operators to take down large 'Mechs and survive the encounter. While it is possible for a normal-sized human to use the battle armor, this design is tailored for the Clans' giant Elemental warriors and only they can bring out its fullest potential. Quirk: Standard Parts Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Elemental (Headhunter)
details: This variant was created by Clan Wolf in 3050 to carry out decapitation strikes against Inner Sphere command personnel during the Clan Invasion. It removes the missile launcher to include an additional Power Pack, Heat and Improved Sensors, a Remote Sensor Dispenser, and a pair of extra Fuel Tanks for its jump jets, while mounting a fixed anti-personnel Machine Gun in addition to the anti-personnel weapon mount. Quirk: Standard Parts Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Emperor EMP-1A
details:
The Emperor is one of the earliest assault BattleMechs, dating back to 2502. The Emperor also bears the distinction of being the first 90+ ton BattleMech to mount jump jets (the famed Highlander began production in 2592). Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.94

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Emperor EMP-5A
details:
This version of the Emperor was a model introduced in the Age of War. It carried an Autocannon/5 in each arm instead of the LB10-Xs that were used in later versions. It also carried sixteen single heat sinks. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Emperor EMP-5B
details:
Developed by Cappellan Engineers just before the Clan Invasion, this Emperor is a retrofit of the standard 5A. Armed with the newly introduced Arrow IV launcher and a pair of large lasers, the 5B is built to provide fire support at long range. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Emperor EMP-6A
details:
The Emperor is one of the earliest assault BattleMechs, dating back to 2502. The Emperor also bears the distinction of being the first 90+ ton BattleMech to mount jump jets (the famed Highlander began production in 2592). In 2612, StarCorps introduced an upgraded Emperor, EMP-6A designed for and distributed exclusively to Star League Defense Forces Royal Units. The Emperor was produced continuously until Marik forces destroyed StarCorps Industries facility with nuclear arms on Son Hoa during the Second Succession War. Production of the Emperor resumed in 3057 alongside the legendary Highlander. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Emperor EMP-6A-EC
details:
Carries Clan-spec ER Large Lasers, an LB 10-X and LB 5-X, supported by a prototype Streak SRM-4. Used extensively by Clan Star Adder before it was replaced by various Highlander variants. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Emperor EMP-EC
details:
Using a mixture of newly developed or prototype weapons paired with older SLDF surplus, the Emperor EC was produced by the Star Adders before being supplanted by the development of the Highlander IIC. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enfield END-6J
details:
The Enfield was originally designed to replace the Wyvern as an urban combat 'Mech, but the design never made it to mass production. The plans for the Enfield were lost during the Succession Wars and were recovered by the Federated Suns on the world of Achernar in 2870. Knowledge of the design was kept hidden until the 3050s, when the NAIS selected the Enfield as a companion 'Mech to the Enforcer. The Enfield began production in 3055 and has seen heavy deployment to the Lyran Alliance because of the constant threat presented by the Clans. The 'Mech carries eleven tons of StarGuard III armor with CASE to protect against ammunition explosions. The Enfield is built on a Blackstone MD2E Endo Steel chassis and uses a Magna 250 XL engine which gives the 'Mech a top speed of 86.4 km/h to save weight, allowing it to carry a heavy arsenal. Due its extra-light engine, however, the 'Mech developed an undeserved reputation for being fragile in heavy combat. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enfield END-6J-EC
details:
Created during the Golden Age by Clan Mongoose, the Enfield END-6J-EC incorporates newly developed technology into the original END-6J design. Powered by a 250-rated Fusion Core, the Enfield END-6J-EC is armed with an Improved Large Laser and a prototype UAC/10, with a Medium Laser filling the remaining tonnage. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enfield END-6Q
details:
The Enfield was originally designed to replace the Wyvern as an urban combat 'Mech, but the design never made it to mass production. Due its extra-light engine, however, the 'Mech developed an undeserved reputation for being fragile in heavy combat. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04
