name: Enforcer ENF-3R
details:
The precursor to the Enforcer 4R, the 3R models originally mounted twin Medium Lasers in the left arm along with 2 extra Heat Sinks to help the 'Mech dissipate heat. It was also slightly better protected, as it had an additional ton of armor. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer ENF-4D
details:
An attempted modernization of the Enforcer that never was mass produced, the -4D carries a ER PPC and a LB 10-X Autocannon, with a Guardian ECM for sensor protection. With the launch of the Enforcer III this variant was quickly forgotten. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer ENF-4KH
details:
A Kell Hound's custom upgrade, replacing most of the internals and equipment with Clan tech. Sporting Clan Ferro-Fibrous armor allows a better protection for only 8 ton weight. With the improved cooling of using Clan Double Heat Sinks, the -4KH can mount a Large Pulse Laser together with the Ultra AC/10 and an ER Small Laser for anti-infantry protection. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer ENF-4P
details:
Only retaining the 4R's torso mounted Small Laser, the 4P instead mounts an AC/20 in the right arm and a pair of Medium Lasers in the left arm. Carrying three tons of autocannon ammunition and eleven Double Heat Sinks, the 4P is powered by 250-rated standard engine, saving weight through the use of Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo-Steel internal structure. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer ENF-4R
details:
Enforcer 4R models combine the hefty power of an Autocannon and massive Laser with the mobility of Jump Jets, a deadly combination. Able to engage at medium-long all the way to point-blank range, these 'Mechs are flexible and surprising in combat. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer ENF-4RR
details:
A battlefield refit of the -4R upgrading the cooling to double heat sinks, a change that allows dropping two external heat sinks and still improve the overall cooling performance. The saved weight is used for a second Small Laser, a C3 unit and a CASE system for the AC/10 ammunition. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer ENF-4R-WDR
details:
The -4R-WDR is a custom refit of the stock variant by the mercenary outfit the Wolf's Dragoons, improving the 'Mech considerably by using Clan tech. Using a 200 XL engine allows extra free weight, used to improve the cooling and a mounting C3 unit. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer ENF-5D
details:
First walking off the production line in late 3050, the 5D Enforcer is a major upgrade to the standard 'Mech, meeting many of its pilots' desire for something faster, better-protected and with more endurance. The Nissan 200 engine has been removed and replaced with a Magna 250 Extralight Engine, increasing the Enforcer's top speed to 86.4 km/h and the amount of space available for other additions. The armor has been stripped from the 'Mech and replaced with StarGuard CIV Ferro-Fibrous armor with CASE to protect against an ammunition explosion while the weapons payload has also been changed. Retaining the small laser both the Autocannon/10 and the Large Laser were replaced for a new Mydron Excel LB-X Autocannon/10, fed by two tons of ammunition, and a BlazeFire Sweetshot ER Large Laser. Finally, an additional jump jet was added, increasing the jumping distance by thirty meters to keep up with the Enforcer's new speed profile. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer ENF-5DR
details:
An alternate loadout to the -5D, the -5DR exchanges the ER Large Laser for an ER PPC, dropping the Ferro-Fibrous armor but instead using an Endo Steel structure and finally switches to double heat sinks. These changes further allows the addition of an Beagle active probe. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer ENF-5P
details:
The -5P is an uncommon variant mounting twin Ultra AC/5s at the cost of less armor and only 2 Jump Jets. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer ENF-7S
details:
The Enforcer 7S is an NAIS prototype carrying a mostly functional Gauss rifle prototype. This one seems to be stolen. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Gauss Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer ENF-NAIS-WC
details:
A research variant of the Enforcer by the New Avalon Institute of Science for Worst Case, a scenario created to deal with any situation by using the latest and greatest technology. The result was not as great as hoped, as the ENF-NAIS-WC never got far beyond prototype stage. Lessons learned during its design were however used for later models and their improvements. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Enforcer III ENF-6M
details:
The aging Enforcer was commissioned to be redesigned by then First Prince Victor Steiner-Davion in an effort to rebuild his image within the sundered Federated Commonwealth. The resulting Enforcer III is built on a Endo Steel chassis, with further weight savings achieved through the use of a 250 XL Engine. Five jump jets grants a jumping capability of one hundred and fifty meters. The Enforcer III is armored with ten tons of standard armor that gives it good armor protection for its size. The Enforcer III carries as its primary weapon a UAC/10, backed up by an ER Large Laser and an ER Small Laser. This balanced mix of weapons makes the Enforcer III a powerful medium 'Mech. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Excalibur EXC-3BK
details:
The 3BK is a refurbished version of older Excalibur B2 models mainly sold to the periphery states. It drops the AMS for a C3 slave and some more armor. Quirk: Breaching Shot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Excalibur EXC-B1
details:
The Excalibur BattleMech was designed to blend range and mobility, boasting an impressive top speed for its tonnage. The name comes from the unique appearance of its lower right arm actuator, reminiscent of a medieval Terran sword. The B1 was the first model of Excalibur to be produced and served as a solid basis for all models to follow. Quirk: Breaching Shot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Excalibur EXC-B2
details:
The Excalibur BattleMech was designed to blend range and mobility, boasting an impressive top speed for its tonnage. The name comes from the unique appearance of its lower right arm actuator, reminiscent of a medieval Terran sword. The B2 is the standard model of Excalibur adopted by the SLDF in 2620, serving well during Operation Smother and the Amaris Civil War. Quirk: Breaching Shot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Excalibur EXC-B2b
details:
The Excalibur BattleMech was designed to blend range and mobility, boasting an impressive top speed for its tonnage. The name comes from the unique appearance of its lower right arm actuator, reminiscent of a medieval Terran sword. The B2b model was utilised by the Star League's Royal Divisions and boasted more advanced components over the stock B2. Quirk: Breaching Shot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Excalibur EXC-B2b-EC
details:
A Clan-tech overhaul of the original SLDF Royal Excalibur B2b. The B2b-EC enjoys the early fruits of Clan weapons research, but otherwise retains the original Spheroid technology. Quirk: Breaching Shot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Excalibur EXC-C1
details:
The Excalibur BattleMech was designed to blend range and mobility, boasting an impressive top speed for its tonnage. The name comes from the unique appearance of its lower right arm actuator, reminiscent of a medieval Terran sword. The C1 is a later model of the Excalibur produced during the Clan Invasion Era. The redesign aimed to address the notorious lack of armor present on the B2. Quirk: Breaching Shot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Executioner A
details:
The Executioner A equips the 'Mech with much needed close-range firepower. Three Large Pulse Lasers can inflict excellent damage, and are more accurate, to compensate for any jumping the Executioner A may be doing. Four ER Medium Lasers back this up, and this configuration also carries the Machine Guns of the primary configuration. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner B
details:
The Executioner B is configured to be able to engage an enemy at any range. For long range combat, the 'Mech carries a deadly ER PPC. When an enemy closes ranges, the Executioner B has a rapid-fire, and also deadly, Ultra Autocannon/20, which is backed by an ER Medium Laser. To shield the 'Mech from indirect fire, the Executioner B also mounts an Anti-Missile System. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner C
details:
Armed in a similar vein as the B configuration, the Executioner C mounts an LRM-20 missile rack as a long-range, indirect-fire weapon. An Artemis IV FCS is attached to the LRM for increased accuracy. The Executioner C also carries an Ultra Autocannon/20, which is backed by an ER Small Laser, a downgrade of the ER Medium Laser carried by the original. A Targeting Computer is attached to the laser and autocannon, greatly improving their accuracy. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner D
details:
A close combat configuration, the Executioner D mounts a plethora of various pulse laser weapons, which have increased accuracy to compensate for the movement the Executioner D will likely be doing. The right arm mounts a Large Pulse Laser as a primary weapon, supported by an additional three Medium Pulse Lasers, and the support is supported by an array of five Small Pulse Lasers. An ER Small Laser provides some more variation, and the Executioner D also mounts two SRM-6 racks to exploit - or more accurately, explode - breaches in enemy armor. However, no additional heat sinks are mounted, and the 'Mech may overheat if too many weapons are fired at once. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner E
details:
Capable of effectively engaging enemies at any range, the Executioner E uses the modern Advanced Tactical Missile system, which has the flexibility of being able to fire missiles effective at any range. The Executioner E mounts a pair of ATM-9 racks. A pair of ER Large Lasers provide long-range firepower, and at close range the Executioner E relies on its modern, high-damage heavy lasers in the form of two Heavy Medium Lasers and a Heavy Small Laser. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner H
details:
Using recently developed heavy laser technology, the Executioner H specializes in close combat, and mounts a Heavy Large Laser for prodigious medium-range firepower. Complementing the laser is a devastatingly powerful Ultra Autocannon/20. Supporting this heavy firepower is a pair of ER Medium Lasers and a Flamer, which is very effective against infantry, and is also a powerful tactical weapon. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner N
details:
The N configuration of the Executioner was an attempt to make the 'Mech less ammunition reliant. However, instead it created major issues with heat management and the practically all energy loadout never got produced in any larger batches. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner O
details:
A Missile Boat version of the Executioner, the O carries two side torso mounted ATM 12 launchers combined with an assortment of lasers - the largest which is a Large Pulse Laser. Four tons of various ATM ammunition allows the loadout some further flexibility. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner Prime
details:
The Executioner's primary configuration uses its mobility to keep enemies as far away as possible. A Gauss Rifle is the 'Mech's primary weapon, backed up by dual ER Large Lasers, which give it excellent direct firepower. For use against soft targets and possibly any light vehicles that manage to close the ranges, the Executioner carries two Machine Guns. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner Q
details:
The Q configuration has a slight focus on more survivability, in the way of an Anti-Missile System and an ECM Suite. Besides this the 'Mech also carries a four ton Targeting Computer to support the two Large and four Medium Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner R
details:
An unofficial configuration mostly used by Mercenary bands that somehow managed to aquire the 'Mech. The weapons consist of a Light Gauss Rifle, two ER Large Lasers and one LRM10 launcher, and a C3 slave unit rounds out the build. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner S
details:
A command configuration of the Executioner, combining a C3 Master system with advanced ECM and Sensors. The 'Mech still manages to fit a combination of ER and Pulse Lasers to defend itself, or even help with the actual battle in times of crisis. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner TC
details:
A Battle of Tukayyid 'temporary configuration' that became a standard variant, the TC is an energy boat with limited recon capabilities. The right arm carries the customary pair of energy weapons, in this case Large Pulse Lasers. The left arm carries an ER PPC, an ER Small Laser, and an additional heat sink. Two more ER Small Lasers are mounted in the right torso. The right torso also carries an additional heat sink and an Active Probe that allows the TC to detect hidden enemy units. Drastically increasing the lethality of the TC, a Targeting Computer in the left torso helps ensure the 'Mech hits what it shoots at. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner-B A
details:
A configuration almost fully focused on ballistic weapons, the Executioner-B A brings a LB 10-X and an Ultra AC/10 in each arm. Two ER Small Lasers provide some improved anti-infantry defense. Although the heavy focus on ballistic reduces the flexibility of the design, this configuration still is amongst the more favored as it actually has excessive cooling capacity. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner-B B
details:
The B configuration of the Executioner-B mounts a Gauss Rifle in each arm as well as two ER Large Lasers for long range engagements. Four Medium Pulse Lasers provide extra damage at closer ranges. Even with 18 double heat sinks the 'Mech still suffers from easy overheating due to the many energy weapons. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner-B C
details:
The C configuration is focused at long-range assaults with its four ER PPC and two Ultra AC/5. To help with protection at close range, two SRM-2 launchers were added, but they seldom see much use in practice due to the far too weak cooling capabilities of the 'Mech. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Executioner-B Prime
details:
The primary configuration of the Executioner-B mounts an Ultra AC/20 in the left arm, two Large Pulse Lasers in the right, and one ER PPC and two Ultra AC/2 in the side torsos. All together this makes for a formidable weapons loadout, but as the cooling is insufficient for repeated alpha strikes the 'Mech seldom reaches its maximum damage potential as listed on paper. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Exterminator EXT-4A
details: A Succession Wars era downgrade of the original EXT-4D model, the Exterminator 4A model was created in 3007 by Kallon Industries as a potential replacement for their Wolverine line. While packing nearly the same weapons array as the original 4D, engineers were forced to substitute the AMS for a conventional Machine Gun and downgrade the engine to a smaller 325-rated model. Lacking the advanced stealth systems and high speed of its progenitor model, the design was considered a failure and only 25 models were constructed. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Exterminator EXT-4C
details: A variant of the EXT-4D, the Exterminator EXT-4C incorporates a Chameleon Light Polarisation Shield. Entering production at the same time as the EXT-4D, the 4C is otherwise unchanged from its parent design. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

name: Exterminator EXT-4D
details: The Exterminator is a BattleMech that was designed in 2630 for the most dubious, but necessary, of purposes: Headhunting. Advanced systems allowed it to easily infiltrate enemy lines. Once the Exterminator had breached the enemy's rear, its mission was to find and destroy as much of the enemy's command structure as possible. This mission profile included attacking Mobile Headquarters, field bases and command level officers. Rather than be part of the standard formation, Exterminators were attached to a regimental or higher headquarters unit, often as a fifth member of the command lance itself, before being assigned to individual units. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Exterminator EXT-4Db
details: The Exterminator is a BattleMech that was designed in 2630 for the most dubious, but necessary, of purposes: Headhunting. Advanced systems allowed it to easily infiltrate enemy lines. Once the Exterminator had breached the enemy's rear, its mission was to find and destroy as much of the enemy's command structure as possible. This mission profile included attacking Mobile Headquarters, field bases and command level officers. Rather than be part of the standard formation, Exterminators were attached to a regimental or higher headquarters unit, often as a fifth member of the command lance itself, before being assigned to individual units. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

name: Exterminator EXT-4Db-EC
details: An early clan Mech dating from the days of Operation Klondike, the Exterminator EXT-4Db-EC was an upgrade of the EXT-4Db that replaced the Medium Lasers with prototype ER Mediums. It would be discontinued and forgotten as modern clan spec weapons entered production. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Exterminator EXT-5E
details: Introduced in 3060, the Exterminator EXT-5E is a modernisation of the 4D model built for Comstar and the Word of Blake. A 390-rated Xl Engine and Endo Steel allow the designers to mount an iNarc and 4 ER Medium Lasers. The Jump Jets were removed to make space for C3i and MASC fitted to compensate for the loss of agility. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Exterminator IIC
details: A IIC version of the Exterminator used by the Clans that invaded the Inner Sphere. Rebuilt almost from scratch the design is fully Clan technology based, mounting six ER Medium Lasers and an LRM-10 with attached Artemis IV FCS. Two Anti-Missile Systems provide self-defense. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: Falcon FLC-4N
details: Designed for the SLDF in the wake of the Reunification War, the Falcon is a Scout Mech hunter and an anti-infantry Mech. A 30 ton Light Mech, the Falcon is powered by a 180-rated Fusion Core. The Falcon FLC-4N is armed with a Medium Laser, 2 Small Lasers and a pair of Machine Guns. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Falcon FLC-4Nb
details: Designed for the SLDF in the wake of the Reunification War, the Falcon is a Scout Mech hunter and an anti-infantry Mech. A 30 ton Light Mech, the Falcon is powered by a 180-rated Fusion Core. The Falcon FLC-4Nb is armed with a pair of Medium Lasers and a Snub Nose PPC. Endo Steel and Double Heat Sinks free up the weight needed for the experimental PPC. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Falcon FLC-4Nb-PP
details: Designed for the SLDF in the wake of the Reunification War, the Falcon is a Scout Mech hunter and an anti-infantry Mech. A 30 ton Light Mech, the Falcon is powered by a 180-rated Fusion Core. The Falcon FLC-4Nb-PP is armed with a Medium Laser and a PPC. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Falcon FLC-4Nb-PP2
details: Designed for the SLDF in the wake of the Reunification War, the Falcon is a Scout Mech hunter and an anti-infantry Mech. A 30 ton Light Mech, the Falcon is powered by a 180-rated Fusion Core. The Falcon FLC-4Nb-PP2 is armed with a Medium Pulse Laser, a Medium Laser and an ER Large Laser. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Falcon FLC-4P
details: Designed for the SLDF in the wake of the Reunification War, the Falcon is a Scout Mech hunter and an anti-infantry Mech. A 30 ton Light Mech, the Falcon is powered by a 180-rated Fusion Core. The Falcon FLC-4P is armed with a Medium Pulse Laser, 2 Small Lasers and an AMS. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Falcon FLC-5P2
details: The Falcon FLC-5P2 mounts a Large Laser in the left arm and two ER Medium Lasers in the right. A Single head-mounted Small Laser act as backup. The 'Mech carries six jump jets for increased mobility. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Falcon FLC-5PW
details:
A rebuild of the Falcon by the Wolf's Dragoons, utilizing Clan technology to much improve its systems. Two ER Medium Lasers and one Medium Pulse Lasers are connected through a small Targeting Computer to provide some basic firepower, but the 'Mechs main purpose is utilizing its TAG and C3 slave to scout out enemy foes for artillery strikes and indirect fire. To stay hidden the design carries a Guardian ECM, and an AMS protects it in case it is engaged. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Falcon Hawk FNHK-9K
details:
The Falcon Hawk 9K is armed with an ER PPC as its primary weapon, which allows engage targets at up to 690 meters. For close range combat the 'Mech carries two medium pulse lasers and a small pulse laser. In the event that an enemy is able to circle into its rear arc, the Falcon Hawk is prepared with a medium laser to defend its rear armor. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Falcon Hawk FNHK-9K1A
details:
The discontinued 9K1A variant of the Falcon Hawk reduces its long-range capabilities, but increases the raw firepower available. The ER PPC has been removed as well as the two medium pulse lasers. These have been replaced with an ER large laser, a standard large laser, and a medium laser; the original medium laser was retained. This weapons configuration provides the Falcon Hawk with a capable medium to long-range arsenal. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Falconer FLC-8R
details:
The Falconer FLC-8R carries a weapons mix that attempts to negate the range advantage of the weapons used by the Clans. The primary weapon on the 'Mech is a Gauss rifle, which is capable of stripping a ton of armor off an enemy unit at extreme ranges. It is backed up by an ER PPC, having a similar range profile to the Gauss Rifle and doing about a third less damage, but not dependent upon ammunition. Finally, the Falconer carries four medium lasers to give it a powerful close range punch. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Fenrir [MG]
details: Named for the demonic wolf of Germanic myth, the Fenrir was less a traditional battle suit and more a mobile fire support platform. The trooper controlling the suit was situated inside a cramped "cockpit" and piloted the Fenrir like a small walking tank. The single, configurable turret mounted on the suit could accept a wide variety of weapon configurations and the Fenrir's sturdy, powerful legs could propel it to much greater speeds than the Sloth. Quirk: Accurate Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.896 Can only be transported by internal bays, can not melee, can not swarm.

name: Fire Falcon A
details:
This first variant uses an UAC/2 and LRM-10 to bombard from long range. An ER small laser provides close defense. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Fire Falcon B
details:
The B loadout is a long-range configuration that makes use of a pair of ER large lasers guided by a targeting computer. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Fire Falcon C
details:
Designed for scouting and work against infantry, the C uses an active probe to find hidden targets. To use against those targets, it carries one medium pulse laser, one small pulse laser, one ER small laser, and a pair of SRM-6s. Against soft targets, four machine guns provide ample infantry killing power. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Fire Falcon D
details:
A spotter, the D carries TAG and a Narc missile beacon. If it gets caught in combat, it can use a pair of SRM-4s and one ER medium laser. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Fire Falcon E
details:
This variant uses a single ATM-12 with three tons of ammo—enough to carry each of the different ammo types. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Fire Falcon Prime
details:
The Primary configuration of the Fire Falcon is best at short to medium ranges where it can bring its twin Streak SRM-4 launchers, medium pulse laser, two ER medium lasers, and two ER small lasers to bear. While this barrage is powerful for a 'Mech its size, 10 double heat sinks are mostly able to keep the design cool. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Fire Moth A
details: Powered by a 200-rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro-Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth A is armed with a single Streak SRM-4. A Tag and an Active Probe enhance the A’s effectiveness as a scout. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Moth B
details: Powered by a 200-rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro-Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth B is armed with paired Medium Pulse Lasers and Machine Guns. An A-Pod fills the remaining free tonnage. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Moth C
details: Powered by a 200-rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro-Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth C is armed with a pair of LRM-5’s and an AMS. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Moth D
details: Powered by a 200-rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro-Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth D is armed with 5 ER Medium Lasers augmented by a Targeting Computer. A Flamer fills the remaining free tonnage. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Moth E
details: Powered by a 200-rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro-Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth E is armed with an ATM-6. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Moth H
details: Powered by a 200-rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20 ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro-Fibrous and Endo Steel give the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth H is armed with 9 Heavy Small Lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Moth P/E
details: One of four prototype variants created in the aftermath of Operation REVIVAL to advance the clan light 'Mech capabilities further. Never saw full mass production, but enough were field tested that some still are around. Trades most of the weapons of the earlier models for a LB-X AC/2 and a single ER small laser. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Moth P/F
details: One of four prototype variants created in the aftermath of Operation REVIVAL to advance the clan light 'Mech capabilities further. Never saw full mass production, but enough were field tested that some still are around. Heavy anti-infantry focused version, mounting a machine gun array in each arm and dual machine guns in each torso, with an auxiliary rear facing machine gun mounted in the head. Two Small Pulse lasers provide some ammo-independent weaponry. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Moth P/G
details: One of four prototype variants created in the aftermath of Operation REVIVAL to advance the clan light 'Mech capabilities further. Never saw full mass production, but enough were field tested that some still are around. Mounts a total of nine ER small lasers, further enhanced by a energy targeting computer. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Moth P/J
details: One of four prototype variants created in the aftermath of Operation REVIVAL to advance the clan light 'Mech capabilities further. Never saw full mass production, but enough were field tested that some still are around. Combines an ER PPC with a head mounted ER small laser. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Moth Prime
details: Powered by a 200-rated XL Engine and mounting MASC, the 20-ton Fire Moth is one of the fastest Mechs ever created. Designed for scouting and as an Elemental transport, the Fire Moth entered production in 2874. A combination of Ferro-Fibrous and Endo Steel gives the Fire Moth 7.5 tons of Pod Space. The Fire Moth Prime is armed with a pair of ER Medium Lasers, an SRM-6 and an SRM-4. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Moth X
details: A heavily modified variant of the Fire Moth, normally only used for batchalls. Five independent SRM-2 launchers are mounted in the 'Mech's right arm, a single heavy medium laser in the left, and each torso sports a ER small laser. An energy targeting computer provides extra support the lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Fire Scorpion 1
details: As a quad design, the Fire Scorpion 1 lacks the amount of internal space that bipedal designs have, so its creators opted for two heavy guns; a LB 10-X Autocannon and an Ultra Autocannon/10. Each of these is fed by three tons of ammunition, giving the quad 'Mech enough shots to finish most Trials. To defend against unarmored infantry, the Fire Scorpion carries an Anti-Personnel Pod in each leg. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: Fire Scorpion 2
details: The Fire Scorpion 2, which was introduced 3060 at the prompting of a Star Commander Temujin of the Twentieth Scorpion Cuirassiers, removes the weaponry of the base chassis and replaces it with a massive Ultra Autocannon/20, two LRM-10s, and four Machine Guns. This variants continues to excel in urban combat, especially against conventional infantry thanks to its anti-personnel Machine Guns. The inclusion of an Active Probe helps the MechWarrior locate hidden enemies. As with the base variant, ample ammunition ensures that the Fire Scorpion 2 rarely has to withdraw from a battlefield because of reduced ammo stores. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: Fireball ALM-7D
details: The Fireball was a quick response BattleMech built as a direct result of the Clans' Elemental infantry. As the Clans swept through the Inner Sphere, members of the Armed Forces of the Federated Commonwealth met with scientists from the New Avalon Institute of Science to discuss, among other things, how to counter their new Battle Armored foes. The result was a 'Mech which on paper met many of the criteria for successfully dealing with Elementals: it had weapons with a high rate-of-fire for taking on swarms of Toads as they were known, had ammunition stores to maintain that rate for extended periods, and an extremely high speed so it could quickly come to the aid of heavier units. These Fireballs were given to units with prior experience fighting the Clans but assigned to rookie pilots, partly because the 'Mech's capabilities fit the personality of many of these new Mechwarriors, partly to more quickly build up their combat experience. The Crucis Lancers, Deneb Light Cavalry and Ceti Hussars were the first regiments to receive these 'Mechs in 3053, employing them immediately on the front lines as raiding along the border between the Inner Sphere and Occupation Zones commenced following the Truce of Tukayyid. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Fireball ALM-8D
details: The Fireball was a quick response BattleMech built as a direct result of the Clans' Elemental infantry. As the Clans swept through the Inner Sphere, members of the Armed Forces of the Federated Commonwealth met with scientists from the New Avalon Institute of Science to discuss, among other things, how to counter their new Battle Armored foes. The result was a 'Mech which on paper met many of the criteria for successfully dealing with Elementals: it had weapons with a high rate-of-fire for taking on swarms of Toads as they were known, had ammunition stores to maintain that rate for extended periods, and an extremely high speed so it could quickly come to the aid of heavier units. These Fireballs were given to units with prior experience fighting the Clans but assigned to rookie pilots, partly because the 'Mech's capabilities fit the personality of many of these new Mechwarriors, partly to more quickly build up their combat experience. The Crucis Lancers, Deneb Light Cavalry and Ceti Hussars were the first regiments to receive these 'Mechs in 3053, employing them immediately on the front lines as raiding along the border between the Inner Sphere and Occupation Zones commenced following the Truce of Tukayyid. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Firebee FRB-1E
details:
The original Firebee used a single LRM-5 backed up by a trio of SRM-2s. The Primitive Engine provided a top speed of 85 km/h, more than enough to engage armored vehicles and infantry, and supporting heavier units. The lack of jump jets, combined with six and a half tons of Primitive Armor, forced pilots to pay attention to the terrain to insure they could move effectively. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.78

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Firebee FRB-2E
details:
The 2E Firebee mounts a Star Cutter 80cm Large Laser, giving it respectable firepower. Up close, four Maui Crossbow SRM-2 launcher can unleash eight missiles. Whether it is using Inferno rounds or not, something that its two tons of ammunition allows MechWarriors to utilize on a regular basis, the Firebee is a potent anti-vehicle platform. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Firebee FRB-2Ep
details:
Designed with the aim of upgrading the ageing Firebee with more advanced Star League technology, the 2Ep was still a prototype when the Succession Wars began. The only completed models of this design were lost with the destruction of the Exedor factory in the First Succession War. The design was briefly revived in the 3045, with a few surviving Firebee’s being converted as a showcase of home grown Capellan science and engineering. Armed with an ER Large Laser, dual Streak SRM-2's and augmented with the addition of a Beagle Probe, the 2Ep is a fast scout hunter and skirmisher. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Firefly FFL-3A
details:
First built in 2679, the standard Star League Defense Force model, the 3A utilizes an XL engine, double heat sinks, and Ferro-Fibrous armor to reduce weight. A battery of four Small Lasers, three Medium Lasers, and an LRM-5 provide significant offensive capabilities for a recon 'Mech. Target Acquisition Gear enhances its ability to spot for artillery, while CASE protects from ammunition explosion. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Firefly FFL-3PP
details:
A Pentagon Powers variant of the FFL-3SLE that removes the CASE and ECM in order to upgrade the missile rack to an LRM-10. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Firefly FFL-3PP2
details:
Another refit of the FFL-3SLE, this time simply using standard armor plating instead of the advanced Ferro-Fibrous composites. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Firefly FFL-3PP3
details:
This variation on the -3SLE removes both the Ferro-Fibrous armor and the ECM system, instead upgrading the LRM rack with an Artemis IV fire-control system. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Firefly FFL-3SLE
details:
Built by the Star League in Exile at Strana Mechty MechWorks, the 3SLE is almost identical to the original 3A, carrying three Martell medium lasers, four Martell Small Lasers, and a Coventry Five-Tube LRM-5 for offensive firepower. the only difference is the replacement of the SLDF standard TAG with a Guardian ECM suite. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Firefly FFL-4A
details:
A basic variant of the Firefly that accompanied the Dragoons to the Inner Sphere, the 4A carries a similar weapons payload to the 4B model, although it keeps the small laser battery of the -3A instead of the anti-missile system. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

details:
The main variant reintroducing the thought extinct 'Mech to the Inner Sphere by Wolf's Dragoons in 3005. The -4B only carries three Medium Lasers and an LRM-5 launcher as its main weaponry, unlike the original SLDF models and their direct descendents. However, the design does add an Anti-Missile System to the left arm. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

details:

All three lasers are upgraded to Medium Pulse Lasers, and an Artemis IV FCS is slaved to the missile launcher. To handle the increased heat, the heat sinks are upgraded to doubles. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Firefly FFL-5B
details:
As a scout 'Mech, the Firefly gives average performance with its energy weapon-heavy arsenal and is useful in both a recon and in a guerrilla fighter role. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Firefly FFL-7A
details:
The -7A is a strange rebuild of the Firefly. It's origins are unknown, but as it carries a mix of Cland and Inner Sphere tech, it is thought to be the result of mercenary outfits upgrading other versions with battlefield loot. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Firefly C
details:

The Firefly C is built on an Endo Steel chassis and is armed with four ER Small Lasers, three Medium Pulse Lasers, and an SRM-2 launcher. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Firestarter FS1-H
details:
The Firestarter is a dangerous 'Mech for its tonnage, carefully timed attacks with its Flamers can shut down any 'Mech and leave it open to punishment from your other forces. The FS1-H is a prototype from the Age of War. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.73

name: Firestarter FS9-H
details:

The weapons carried are four flamers, two medium lasers, and a single small laser. An Anti-Missile System with one ton of ammo has been added to protect against missile attacks, and a Beagle Active Probe has been installed to enhance the Firestarter's scouting role. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

details:
The FS9-S1 is an overhaul of the FS9-H introduced in 3049. The structure has been upgraded to use an Endo Steel chassis. The weapons carried are four flamers, two medium lasers, and a single small laser. An Anti-Missile System with one ton of ammo has been added to protect against missile attacks, and a Guardian ECM suite has been installed to increase survivability. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Flashfire FLS-P2
details:
The original Flashfire lacks the FLS-P5's jump jets, and mounts two flamers and a medium pulse laser in each arm, as well as dual SRM-6 launchers on the right shoulder. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Flashfire FLS-P3
details:
The Flashfire P3 is quite similar to the P4, just applying a slightly different layout. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Flashfire FLS-P4
details:
This is a retrofit of the FLS-P2, and upgrades the weapons to that of the FLS-P5. It trades in one SRM-6 launcher for false ports and jump jets. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Flashman FLS-7K
details:
A far cry from the fast and deadly 8K Flashman, the 7K model is a downgraded version that was produced by Defiance Industries in 2796 after the destruction of the Renault-Prime factories, using a blueprint that was acquired prior to the factory's destruction. The advanced extralight engine was no longer being produced though, and with a standard Vlar 300 the design now has a top speed of only 64.8 km/h. In addition, the center torso Large Laser, the AMS and the advanced targeting-tracking system were also removed and the double heat sinks replaced with standard single versions. The design now instead only carries two arm-mounted Large Lasers and five Medium Lasers. Surprisingly, the armor protection has not been sacrificed in any way, which has resulted in the 7K being more durable than the SLDF version due to its lack of an XL engine. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Flashman FLS-8K
details:
The Flashman is an underrated heavy 'Mech, commonly called a "flashbulb" by MechWarriors for its heavy-energy configuration. The Flashman, which was first introduced in 2701, is a 'Mech that is capable of engaging an enemy for extended periods of time with little re-supply. The primary weapons on the Flashman FLS-8K are three Large Lasers mounted in the right arm, left arm, and center torso. These are backed up by five Medium Lasers, two mounted in either arm coaxial to the large lasers, two in the left torso and one in the right. The Flashman also carries an Anti-Missile System with one ton of ammo in the right torso to defend against missile attacks, and a Flamer in the head, to deter infantry attacks. The use of a Faust/Shinji AT/TS targeting-tracking system gives the Flashman a level of accuracy few can match, while fifteen double heat sinks give it an effective heat management system. The 'Mech is also notable for using an extralight engine which makes it fast for its size, though not at the expense of protection thanks to thirteen and a half tons of armor. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Flashman FLS-8KH
details:
A mercenary upgrade of the -8K, like many other similar upgrades the easier parts have been upgraded with 'aquired' clan tech. In the case of the -8KH, it is very reminisicent of the later introduced official variant -10E, which rumours says was heavily influenced by this design. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Flashman FLS-9C
details:
The 9C, a complete overhaul of the Flashman produced by Defiance Industries for ComStar in 3061, carries three ER Large Lasers, four Medium Pulse Lasers, a single Medium Laser, and an Improved C3 computer. In order to accomplish this, the armor on the design has been upgraded to Ferro-Fibrous and the 'Mech now has an Endo Steel chassis. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Fox CS-1
details:
Created during the Golden Century by Clan Sea Fox, the CS-1 Fox had few equals. The 50-ton Mech was powered by a 300-rated cXL engine, that propelled the Mech to speeds of 97 km/h. Protected by 10 tons of armor, the CS-1 Fox was armed with a pair of Improved LRM-15’s. At closer ranges, a trio of Medium Lasers, a pair of Streak SRM-2’s and a pair of Machine Guns provided additional firepower. Production of the Fox mysteriously stopped partway through the Golden Century as the Mech was dropped from use in the Sea Fox Touman. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Fox CS-2
details:
Created during the Golden Century by Clan Sea Fox, the CS-2 Fox had few equals. The 50-ton Mech was powered by a 300-rated cXL engine, that propelled the Mech to speeds of 97 km/h. Protected by 10 tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, the CS-2 Fox was armed with a pair of LRM-15’s and an ER Large Laser. At closer ranges, a pair of ER Medium Lasers, a pair of Streak SRM-2’s and a pair of Machine Guns provided additional firepower. Production of the Fox mysteriously stopped partway through the Golden Century as the Mech was dropped from use in the Sea Fox Touman. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Foxfire FXR-4R
details: The Foxfire FXR-4R was designed around its Center Torso mounted flamer, the original purpose of even creating the ultralight BattleMech. A small laser mounted in the head provides some secondary fire for self-defense, but the 'Mechs very high movement speed is by far its best defense. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Franky MU-TT7
details:
The Franky is a typical periphery Frankenmech sporting a weird array of weaponry and being cobbled together from many different MechParts Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

name: Freedom FREE-1A4
details:
The 1A4 is the originally produced version of the Freedom, establishing the chassis line as long range missile boats. A total of four 15-tubed LRM launchers provide adequate fire power for both direct and indirect suppressive fire. Two Medium and one ER Large Laser are available as secondary firepower, although the cooling is insufficient to handle repeated use of the energy weapons. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Missile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Freedom FREE-1A5
details:
The 1A5 is fully focused on its four LRM-20 launchers. The lack of any secondary weapons means the 'Mech is quite vulnerable to short range or flanking attacks, increasing the need for protection by other forces even further. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Missile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Freedom FREE-2B
details:
The 2B was considered the first of the second generation refresh of the Freedom chassis. In practice the changes are not very large beyond an updated weapons loadout, five LRM-10 launchers and one Large and one Medium Pulse Laser. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Missile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Freedom FREE-2Br
details:
Although marked as a simple refit of the 2B, the 2Br is in fact a considerably larger update to the design. By adding Artemis IV to its six LRM-10 launchers, the direct fire capabilities are much higher. Two Medium Pulse Lasers, one in each arm, are mounted as secondary and defensive firepower. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Missile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Freedom FREE-2F
details:
The 2F is the only variant using Ferro-Fibrous armor to save further weight. The extra tonnage is used to create a more flexible weapons profile to handle the increasing need for more tactical use of its ammunition. A combination of two LRM-20, two LRM-15 and two LRM-5 serve as the main weapons, while a single AC/2 provide further long range direct fire harassment capabilities. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Missile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Galahad GLH-1D
details:
Born from the Terran Hegemony's attempts to create a medium fire-support platform that would be more advanced than the RLN-1N Rifleman, Mitchell Vehicles unveiled the GLH-1D Galahad in 2570. Though it outgunned the earlier design and found significant acceptance within the Hegemony Armed Forces, the Galahad suffered from the same heat issues as the BattleMech it was meant to replace. This variant uses the original 50-ton mech weapon loadout. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Galahad GLH-2D
details:
Born from the Terran Hegemony's attempts to create a medium fire-support platform that would be more advanced than the RLN-1N Rifleman, Mitchell Vehicles unveiled the GLH-1D Galahad in 2570. Though it outgunned the earlier design and found significant acceptance within the Hegemony Armed Forces, the Galahad suffered from the same heat issues as the BattleMech it was meant to replace. With the development of the new Gauss Rifle, Mitchell Vehicles decided in 2594 to redesign the Galahad around these new weapons. The Galahad utilizes special building materials in the form of eleven tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo Steel internals. To fit the massive weapons on the Galahad, the engine was dropped to a GM 180, giving it a maximum speed of only 54 km/h, making it difficult for the 'Mech to keep up with its companions in most cases. The GLH-2D carries two massive M-7 Gauss Rifles, with two tons of ammo for each rifle. It was a showing of the powerful new weapons at the time and earned it the nickname of Gausszilla. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Gallowglas GAL-1GLS
details:
The weapons payload on the Gallowglas is an all energy arsenal. The primary long-range weapon is a Tiegart Magnum ER PPC, which provides a powerful long-range punch. For intermediate ranges, the 'Mech carries two Sunglow Large Lasers. Finally, for short-range protection, the 'Mech has two Magna Quasar Medium Pulse Lasers and a Magna Starglow Small Laser. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Gallowglas GAL-2GLS
details:
The 2GLS variant of the Gallowglas is modified to increase its long-range effectiveness. This is done by removing the ER PPC, a Medium Pulse Laser, the Small Laser, as well as eight double heat sinks and replacing them with a Blackwell Fury Gauss rifle and two tons of CASE-protected ammunition. This modification greatly reduces the 'Mechs heat load and gives it a greater damage potential at long range. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Gallowglas GAL-WD
details:
A variant of the Gallowglas available only to Wolf's Dragoons, the Gallowglas WD is built using all Clan technologies. The 'Mech carries an ER PPC as its primary weapon, and two ER Medium Lasers and two Small Pulse Lasers for close range combat; three double heat sinks are removed. The WD variant uses the weight savings to increase its engine size, allowing for a maximum speed of 86.4 km/h, making the WD a highly maneuverable and effective 'Mech. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Gallowglas GAL-WD1
details:
A special version of the Gallowglas for the Wold's Dragoons using all Clan technology. An ER PPC and two ER Large Lasers are the main damage dealers, while two Medium Pulse Laser and two ER Medium Lasers provbide secondary fire. Finally, two Small Pulse and one ER Small Laser provide short range defense. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Gargoyle A
details:
Also an effective all around 'Mech, the A configuration ups the firepower with two ER PPCs as its primary long-range weapons. These are supported by a Large Pulse Laser for intermediate range engagements and a Medium Pulse Laser, ER Medium Laser, and ER Small Laser for close combat. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Gargoyle B
details:
Configured almost exclusively for long range combat, the B configuration of the Gargoyle carries a powerful Gauss Rifle backed up by an LRM-10 launcher linked to an Artemis IV FCS, allowing it to keep its distance from enemy units. For self-defense at short ranges, the 'Mech has an SRM-4 launcher which is also enhanced with an Artemis IV FCS. The main drawback to this configuration is its over reliance on ammunition based weaponry, making it effective only so long as it has sufficient ammunition for its weapons. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Gargoyle C
details:
A dedicated close combat configuration, the Gargoyle C carries as its primary weapon a powerful Ultra Autocannon/20 that has twice the rate of fire as a standard Autocannon. This is supported by a brace of six ER Medium Lasers that make the 'Mech a highly effective brawler. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: Gargoyle D
details:
The D configuration of the Gargoyle is armed with two ER Large Lasers for long range combat. These are backed up for short range engagements with three highly accurate Medium Pulse Lasers and an ER Small Laser. The 'Mech is frighteningly accurate due to its advanced Targeting Computer, which increases the accuracy of all the weapons in this configuration. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Gargoyle D2
details:
A loadout for engagements at medium to long ranges, the D2 mounts two LRM-20 and three ER Large Lasers. Three tons of LRM ammunition ensures enough salvos can be fired for most battles. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Gargoyle E
details:
This variant makes use of Clan technology developed in the 3060s. An ATM 12 in the right arm has enough ammunition bins to make use of all of the types available to an Advanced Tactical Missile Launcher. Four Heavy Medium Lasers provide a powerful punch as short range, while a Streak SRM-6 can exploit those holes. A pair of ER Micro Lasers round out the offensive armament. A Targeting Computer makes the lasers more accurate. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Gargoyle E2
details:
The E2 configuration combines the high damage output of an Ultra AC/10 with several ER Lasers. A Streak SRM-6, mounted in the right arm, provides some extra punch when needed. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Gargoyle F2
details:
The Gargoyle F2 is a full energy configuration. Three Large Pulse Lasers, two in the right arm and one in the left, serve as the main sources of damage, while three ER Medium Lasers in the Left Torso provide secondary damage capacity. A single ER Small Laser in the right torso allows dealing with infantry at very close ranges. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Gargoyle G2
details:
The G2 loadout is mainly for close range fighting, with its massive LBX AC/20 in the right arm. The left arm contains three ER Medium Lasers, and another five ER Small Lasers are mounted in the left torso. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Gargoyle H
details:
Configured to take advantage of new Heavy Laser technology, the H configuration is a capable 'Mech at any range. For long range jousting with an enemy, the 'Mech has an LRM-10 launcher. This is backed up by an Ultra Autocannon/10 and a new Heavy Large Laser for intermediate ranges. Finally, for added punch at close range, the 'Mech has two ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Gargoyle H2
details:
This configuration of the Gargoyle was created for anti-squad and infantry fighting, but can also be successful against light 'Mechs or Vehicles. Four Medium Pulse Lasers and two ER Medium Lasers provide accurate daamge, while a Flamer and Stream SRM-6 can provide more damage as needed. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Gargoyle Prime
details:
The Primary Gargoyle configuration is capable of engaging enemies at a variety of ranges. For long range encounters, the Gargoyle has two LB 5-X Autocannon that are capable of firing both solid rounds and cluster ammunition, making the 'Mech effective against aircraft and vehicles. For short ranges, the 'Mech has two SRM-6 launchers and a single ER Small Laser which provide adequate close in protection. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Garm GRM-01A
details: The Garm is capable of providing both direct and indirect fire support. For direct fire support, the Garm has a LB-X AC/5, capable of firing both standard and cluster ammunition. A LRM-10 launcher provides the Garm with added long-range combat capabilities and allows indirect fire support. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Garm GRM-01B
details: The 01B variant of the Garm is built to operate independently of supply lines and increases its long-range indirect fire capabilities. To do this, the Garm removes the heavy LB-X AC/5 and replaces it with an ER large laser. The 'Mech also adds an Artemis IV fire control system to increase the accuracy of its LRM-10 launcher. Finally, the 'Mech adds two single heat sinks and an additional ton of armor. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Gladiator GLD-1R
details: The first homegrown BattleMech produced by the Draconis Combine was the Gladiator. The 55-ton 'Mech took seven years to design, as Coordinator Kozo Von Rohrs refused to open up the process to anybody but a select group at New Samarkand Armor Works (the predecessor of Luthien Armor Works) who were under constant surveillance by DEST. 2468 finally saw the GLD-1R Gladiator hit mass-production. Following the Battle of Nox in 2475, the dishonored 'Mech was retired from official production, with NSAW closing down the production lines by 2488. Merryweather Industries was the first private company to attempt BattleMech production without governmental support. Despite their location in the Terran Hegemony, they acquired the plans to the Gladiator and produced a new run in 2490. They were unable to raise the capital to finish their second run, the 4R, and nearly went bankrupt before moving into IndustrialMechs. The GLD-4R production lines were closed down in 2495. A few salvaged Gladiator -1Rs were still in service with militaries across the Inner Sphere and Periphery, though these relics were finally pushed to extinction during the Reunification War. The 55-ton Gladiator has a top speed of 86 km/h, comparable to many other 'Mechs of the same weight. Nine and a half tons of armor provides a respectable amount of protection. Five jump jets enables the 'Mech to jump up to 150 meters at a time. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.83

name: Gladiator GLD-2R
details: The first homegrown BattleMech produced by the Draconis Combine was the Gladiator. The 55-ton 'Mech took seven years to design, as Coordinator Kozo Von Rohrs refused to open up the process to anybody but a select group at New Samarkand Armor Works (the predecessor of Luthien Armor Works) who were under constant surveillance by DEST. 2468 finally saw the GLD-1R Gladiator hit mass-production. Five jump jets enables the 'Mech to jump up to 150 meters at a time. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Gladiator GLD-3R
details: The first homegrown BattleMech produced by the Draconis Combine was the Gladiator. The 55-ton 'Mech took seven years to design, as Coordinator Kozo Von Rohrs refused to open up the process to anybody but a select group at New Samarkand Armor Works (the predecessor of Luthien Armor Works) who were under constant surveillance by DEST. 2468 finally saw the GLD-1R Gladiator hit mass-production. Five jump jets enables the 'Mech to jump up to 150 meters at a time. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Gladiator GLD-3R2
details: A simple refit of the GLD-3R, dropping on of the Jump Jets to add more armor. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Gladiator GLD-4R
details: The first homegrown BattleMech produced by the Draconis Combine was the Gladiator. The 55-ton 'Mech took seven years to design, as Coordinator Kozo Von Rohrs refused to open up the process to anybody but a select group at New Samarkand Armor Works (the predecessor of Luthien Armor Works) who were under constant surveillance by DEST. 2468 finally saw the GLD-1R Gladiator hit mass-production.
