Five jump jets enables the 'Mech to jump up to 150 meters at a time. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Glass Spider 1
details:
Descended from the Star League era Galahad, the Glass Spider is a second line Clan Battlemech specializing in anti aircraft and direct fire support duties. A 60-ton mech, the Glass Spider is powered by a 240-rated Fusion Engine and relies on a combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and an Endo Steel skeleton. A pair of Gauss Rifles form the mechs only weapons and are supplied by 5 tons of ammo. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Glass Spider 2
details:
Descended from the Star League era Galahad, the Glass Spider is a second line Clan Battlemech specializing in anti aircraft and direct fire support duties. A 60-ton mech, the Glass Spider 2 is powered by a 240-rated Fusion Engine and relies on a combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and an Endo Steel skeleton. A pair of Large Pulse Lasers are supported by a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a trio of Small Pulse Lasers. A Targeting Computer enhances the weapons accuracy. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Gnome [STD]
details: The Gnome battle armor was created by Clan Hell's Horses in response to Inner Sphere responses to the ubiquitous Elemental battle armor. Since its introduction the Gnome has been eclipsed in size by other assault-weight suits but still serves as the mainstay in most Hell's Horses' front-line Clusters and found its way into the toumans of other Clans through various Trials. Quirk: Armored Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.935 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can not swarm.

name: Goliath GOL-1A
details: The -1A manages to squeeze in a AC/20 in the right torso while still keeping the two LRM-10 launchers, only removing the Machine Guns and PPC. To save weight the design however drops all the extra heatsinks, leaving the 'Mech more at risk of overheating. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

name: Goliath GOL-1C
details: A short range version of the Goliath, the 1C mounts two SRM-6 launchers and an AC/10, with one medium and two small lasers as support. The variant is surprisingly effective at dealing with infantry and battle armor squads. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

name: Goliath GOL-1E
details: The Goliath GOL-1E has two main weapons, a Large Laser and an Autocannon AC/10. Two SRM-4 launchers are mounted in the Left Torso for close quarters engagements. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

name: Goliath GOL-1H
details: An 80-ton Quad Mech, the Goliath entered production in 2652. Partially based on data from the earlier Scorpion Quad Mech, the Goliath carries a heavier payload of weapons and armor, intended to boost its effectiveness on the battlefield. Powered by a 320-rated Fusion Core, the Goliath GOL-1H is armed with a PPC and a pair of LRM-10’s. A pair of Machine Guns provide closer ranged firepower. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

name: Goliath GOL-1HR
details: A battlefield refit of the Goliath, with the aim of improving its long range combat capabilities and durability. The LRM-10 launchers are now supported by Artemis IV attachments, both sides torsos are protected by C.A.S.E. and the cockpit has been armored to improve MechWarrior survivability. A C3 slave unit is also mounted in the Center Torso to improve squad efficiency and the cooling system has been upgraded to use double heat sinks. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Goliath GOL-1T
details: A refresh of the -1H, this variant upgrades the weapons to use LRM-15 launchers and an ER PPC. A Guardian ECM suite and three Medium Pulse Lasers are also added to the design. A switch to double heat sinks, dropping the Machine Guns and use of an XL engine allows all the changes, and still allows increasing the armoring to 17.5 tons. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Goliath GOL-3J
details: The COL-3J combines an LRM-20 launcher with a Gauss Rifle for long range damage, and two Streak SRM-4 launchers for short range engagements. Two ER Medium Laser provide extra firepower as needed. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Goliath GOL-3M
details: The 3M is a 3047 upgrade of the Goliath that uses Star League technology. The 'Mech has had a 320 XL Engine installed to reduce the engine's weight by half. The 'Mech retains the LRM launchers and Machine Guns of the 1H model. The 'Mech replaces the PPC with a Gauss Rifle which gives the Goliath devastating long-range firepower. The 'Mech still suffers from its close combat deficiencies but with its updated arsenal most 'Mechs are hard pressed to close to short range. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Goliath GOL-3M2
details: An alterate variant to the 3M, using Small Pulse Lasers instead of the Machine Guns. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Gorgon 1
details: The Gorgon is a heavy fire support unit that often anchors ProtoMech Points. With a standard LRM-10 launcher and one ton of ammunition, the Gorgon can provide almost as much firepower as a Valkyrie. For close in work, the Gorgon mounts an ER Micro Laser. Quirk: Standard Parts Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Grand Crusader GRN-D-01
details:
The first production model of the Grand Crusder. A 240 XL engine propels the 'Mech to a top speed of 54.0 km/h, while still leaving enough weight capacity for a balanced design. The Grand Crusader is protected by 15.5 tons of armor and, to handle the 'Mech's heat burden, the Grand Crusader carries 10 double heat sinks. The Grand Crusader is well-armed to engage an enemy at medium to long ranges. The primary long-range weapons are a pair of LRM-20 launchers fed from a combined six ton of ammunition, mated with an Artemis IV fire control system for greater missile accuracy. For medium range combat, the Grand Crusader has two Large Pulse Lasers and, for close range combat, the 'Mech has two Medium Pulse Lasers. For added protection against missile attacks, the Grand Crusader carries an AMS, mounted on a pivot point on top of the cockpit. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Grand Crusader GRN-D-01-U
details:
The -01-U production variant retains larger 320 XL engine of the -01-X prototype, but keeps the pulse lasers from the -01. This meant that over 5 tons of the armoring of the 'Mech had to be removed, and as a result this variant never saw any larger success and was only produced in limited numbers. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Grand Crusader GRN-D-01-X
details:
A prototype based of the -01 model with some experimental upgrades. Two shoulder mounted turrets containing the Artemis IV enabled LRM-20 launchers and an upgraded 320 XL engine were the key highlights of the prototype. However, it's energy weaponry had to be reduced to only one ER Large Laser and five normal Medium Lasers. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Grand Crusader GRN-D-02
details:
One of two subvariants of the -02 line of the Grand Crusader, based of the -01-X prototype. The -02 kept the original 240XL engine from the -01 over the upgraded 320XL engine of the prototype, and dropped the shoulder turrets as they were causing reliability concerns. These changes allows the addition of two LRM5 launchers to the Mech's arms instead of the Medium Lasers. The two Large Pulse Lasers and the two LRM-20 launchers were kept untouched from the -01 model. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Grand Crusader GRN-D-02-B
details:
One of two subvariants of the -02 line of the Grand Crusader based on the -01-X prototype. The -02-B retained the larger engine of the prototype, but like the other production models based of it dropped the shoulder turrets. The design switched to two ER Large Lasers and two Medium Pulse Lasers as the energy weapons, while keeping the -01's Anti Missile System. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Grand Crusader GRN-D-02-W
details:
The -02-W is a battlefield refit if the -02-B often used by experienced Grand Crusader pilots. With just a small adjustment to the chassis, the Medium Pulse Lasers were able to be moved into the side torsos, thus making the loss of an arm less crippling. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Grand Dragon DRG-1G
details:
Affectionately known as the 'Grand Dragon', the DRG-1G replaces the AC/5 with a PPC, Medium Laser and 2 extra Heat Sinks. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Grand Dragon DRG-1GK-DC
details:
A Grand Dragon variant introduced in 3050, mainly for use by commanding officers. It has dropped the rearward-firing medium laser in the left torso section to free up tonnage for a Command Console. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Grand Dragon DRG-3K
details:
The Grand Dragon 3K is a beefy machine that can take a serious beating and carries heavier weaponry than its smaller cousin. Equipped with a heavy-duty gyro, a PPC and Gauss rifle, this variant is a formidable heavy weapons platform. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Grand Dragon DRG-5K
details:
The DGR-5K Grand Dragon introduced in 3050 incorporates a number of lostech improvements over the original DRG-1G.Mounted in its right arm is a Lord's Light 2 ER PPC. The ER PPC is backed up by a LRM-10 in the center torso, which gives the 'Mech an impressive and formidable long-range striking capability. The launcher is fed by a two-ton reload bin in the left torso protected by CASE. If an enemy 'Mech gets into close ranges, the Grand Dragon carries three Victory 23R Medium Lasers for defense, one in the left arm and two split between the rear-facing left and right torso. Protected by ten tons of armor, the Grand Dragon uses thirteen double heat sinks for excellent heat management and uses a 16.5 ton Hermes 360 XL engine to achieve a moderate cruising speed of 64 km/h. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Grand Dragon DRG-5K-DC
details:
A command variant of the Grand Dragon DRG-5K, dropping one medium laser to fit a Command Console cockpit. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Grand Dragon DRG-C
details:
Modified specifically to carry a C3 slave unit into combat, the C is a modification of the DRG-5K introduced in 3050. The 'Mech carries a C3 slave in the place of its rear-facing medium laser. While this does reduce the Grand Dragons short range firepower somewhat, it also makes the machine far more accurate when working in a C3 lance. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Grand Titan T-IT-N10M
details: Designed by Vining Engineering and Salvage Team, the Grand Titan was conceived to take on and defeat any opponent. Built around a 400-rated XL Engine and an Endo Steel chassis, the Grand Titan has 18 tons of armor. The Grand Titan carries a large arsenal of weapons that allow it to work best at short to medium range. The longest-range weapon carried is an Artemis IV enhanced LRM-15 with 2 SRM-6's for closer range engagements. Two Large Pulse Lasers, two Medium Pulse Lasers and two Small Pulse Lasers provide additional mid to short range firepower. An AMS system provides a degree of protection from missiles. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Grand Titan T-IT-N11M
details: The N11M model of the Grand Titan is a major modification of the design. The 'Mech carries as its primary long-range weapons a Light Gauss Rifle and an ER PPC which gives the 'Mech powerful long-range reach. The 'Mech has for short-range combat four Medium Pulse Lasers and two Streak SRM-4 launchers. It is also protected by a Guardian ECM Suite. This upgrade brings the Grand Titan to modern standards and makes it as powerful on the battlefield now as it was when it was first released. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Grand Titan T-IT-N11M2
details: The Grand Titan T-IT-N11M2 is despite its name not related to the -N11M version, instead it was a parallel design project. Two LBX AC/10 act as the main weapons, while a LRM-10 and seven lasers of various sizes and types provide more firepower as needed. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Grasshopper GHR-5H
details: Don't be fooled by its whimsical name, the Grasshopper is a killer that specializes in hunting down light and medium 'Mechs. Its superb jump ability and good armor allow it to get behind foes easily to bring its all-Energy weapons to bear. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Grasshopper GHR-5HR
details: A battlefield refit of the GHR-5H, replacing two heat sinks with a small laser, a C3 Slave unit and C.A.S.E. protection for the ammunition. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Grasshopper GHR-5J
details: An upgrade of the Grasshopper using Star League technology, the 5J replaces the Diplan large laser with a Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Laser, replaces the Conan/S launcher with a Hovertech Streak SRM-2 model, and removes the two torso-mounted medium lasers for a SureFire 444 Anti-Missile System. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Grasshopper GHR-5KDI
details: A rare version of the Grasshopper mainly seen with various mercenary outfits. Two ER Large Lasers, four Medium Lasers and two Medium Pulse Lasers provide significant damage capabilities, with a Stream SRM-4 as backup for close range engagements. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Grasshopper GHR-5KH
details: The 5KH is a Clan tech refit originally fielded by the Kell Hounds. Its weapons loadout consist of an ER Large Laser, two Medium Pulse Lasers and two Streak SRM-6 launchers. An Anti-Missile System helps protect the 'Mech. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Grasshopper GHR-5N
details: The 5N is a very basic field upgrade of the Grasshopper introduced around 3040. The large laser and missile launcher have both been removed and in their place was added a PPC and a fifth medium laser respectively. Though the change increases the design's firepower, it also comes at a greater risk of overheating the 'Mech, especially if the pilot is careless. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Grasshopper GHR-5P
details: An upgrade package incorporating Helm core technology, the Grasshopper 5P is armed with 2 Medium Lasers, 2 Medium pulse Lasers and 2 PPCs with Double Heat Sinks installed to handle the increased heat. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Grasshopper GHR-5S
details: The Grasshopper GHR-5S upgrades the cooling to use double heat sinks, allowing the Large Laser to be exchanged for an Extended Range version. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Grasshopper GHR-6H
details: First observed in the Periphery, the Grasshopper 6H is a refit of the standard 5H that improves the Grasshoppers utility as a scout/skirmisher. A relatively simple refit, the 6H removes 7 heat sinks and replaces the rest with double strength models. A second Large Laser is mounted in the Right Arm and the standard ammunition bay is swapped for a CASE protected one. The remaining weight is dedicated to a rare Beagle Active Probe, improving the Grasshoppers scouting capabilities in urban environments. Since being observed in the Periphery, this refit has spread throughout the Inner Sphere, with every House possessing at least 1 unit. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Grasshopper GHR-C
details: A basic modification of the 5J model introduced by the Combine in 3052, the Grasshopper-C carries a C3 slave unit to allow it to be integrated into a C3 lance. These models often served as the point 'Mech in a C3 lance, where its speed and armor allowed it to get close enough to the enemy and share this targeting data with friendly units. To make room for the addition of the C3 unit, ammunition for the Streak SRM-2 launcher was reduced by one ton, though since the Streak launcher was already an ammo-efficient design this resulted in no drop in performance Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Grasshopper II
details: Although called the Grasshopper II, this variant is just a modified Grasshopper used by certain mercenaries. It mounts a Large Pulser Laser and an ER Large Laser as the main damage weapons, with four Medium and two Small Lasers providing extra damage as needed. What makes the 'Mech stand out from other Grasshoppers is its large hatchet carried in the left hand. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Gray Death Scout [STD]
details: Though Gray Death Scout armor has no integral weapons, its Armored Gloves allow soldiers to wield standard small arms and perform other functions as normal. While this does not allow for very much damage potential against hardened targets, a scout squad can be a serious threat to unarmored infantry. The armored gloves, in combination with the suit's strength enhancements, allows the trooper to ride on OmniMechs via their handholds or perform anti-'Mech attacks. That the trooper's natural dexterity is otherwise unaffected by the suit is an added bonus for placing Satchel Charges in exposed 'Mech joints. Quirk: Information Gatherer Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.886 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Gray Death Standard [FL]
details: The Gray Death Standard battle armor was developed by the technicians of the Gray Death Legion after the New Avalon Institute of Science sent them prototype battle armor suits, the progenitors of what eventually became the Inner Sphere Standard, for field testing. Using what was learned from these tests, the Legion decided to remove the suits' jump jets to make room for dedicated anti-infantry firepower, superior sensor systems, and reinforced myomer bundles to improve ground speed. While losing the ability to leap over obstacles, these changes made the suit easier to maintain and cheaper to build than the Inner Sphere Standard. Quirk: Intuitive Controls Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Gray Death Standard [L]
details: The Gray Death Standard battle armor was developed by the technicians of the Gray Death Legion after the New Avalon Institute of Science sent them prototype battle armor suits, the progenitors of what eventually became the Inner Sphere Standard, for field testing. Using what was learned from these tests, the Legion decided to remove the suits' jump jets to make room for dedicated anti-infantry firepower, superior sensor systems, and reinforced myomer bundles to improve ground speed. While losing the ability to leap over obstacles, these changes made the suit easier to maintain and cheaper to build than the Inner Sphere Standard. Quirk: Intuitive Controls Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Gray Death Standard [MG]
details: The Gray Death Standard battle armor was developed by the technicians of the Gray Death Legion after the New Avalon Institute of Science sent them prototype battle armor suits, the progenitors of what eventually became the Inner Sphere Standard, for field testing. Using what was learned from these tests, the Legion decided to remove the suits' jump jets to make room for dedicated anti-infantry firepower, superior sensor systems, and reinforced myomer bundles to improve ground speed. While losing the ability to leap over obstacles, these changes made the suit easier to maintain and cheaper to build than the Inner Sphere Standard. Quirk: Intuitive Controls Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Gray Death Standard [SRM]
details: The Gray Death Standard battle armor was developed by the technicians of the Gray Death Legion after the New Avalon Institute of Science sent them prototype battle armor suits, the progenitors of what eventually became the Inner Sphere Standard, for field testing. Using what was learned from these tests, the Legion decided to remove the suits' jump jets to make room for dedicated anti-infantry firepower, superior sensor systems, and reinforced myomer bundles to improve ground speed. While losing the ability to leap over obstacles, these changes made the suit easier to maintain and cheaper to build than the Inner Sphere Standard. Quirk: Intuitive Controls Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Great Wyrm 1
details:
As an early Clan design, the Great Wyrm utilizes less advanced technology compared to later Clan 'Mechs. As such, it is built on a standard chassis, powered by a 225 fusion engine, and is protected by seven tons of armor. A max speed of 86.4 km/h was respectable, and the heat generated was kept under control by the base 10 double heat sinks. The Great Wyrm mounts weaponry that covers all ranges, giving it good engagement flexibility. For long-ranges it makes use of a LRM-10 and a pair of UAC/2s, and uses its speed to stay out of the range of most enemies' guns while peppering them with these. If any enemy manages to close, or if the one ton of ammunition for those weapons is expended, the Great Wyrm also mounts a pair of ER medium lasers and ER small lasers. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Grendel A
details:
This missile boat carries a pair of LRM 15s with two tons of ammunition for each. A Medium Pulse Laser and ER Small Laser provide backup firepower. A MechWarrior will find it difficult to overheat this design. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Grendel B
details:
This variant uses an Ultra Autocannon/5 for long range work. It mounts an ER Medium Laser and a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers for close-up engagements. An ER Small Laser is again added. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Grendel C
details:
This close-range brawler mounts an LB-X Autocannon/10 as its main armament. A single ER Medium Laser backs it up. An Anti-Missile System provides added defense for the variant. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Grendel D
details:
A different take on the primary configuration, the Grendel D mounts an ER PPC for long-range engagements. When the 'Mech closes, it bring bring a Medium Pulse Laser, ER Medium Laser, and SRM-6 to bear. A Small Pulse Laser provides protection against conventional infantry. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Grendel E
details:
The E configuration takes the missile launchers of the A and replaces them with a pair of ATM 6s. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Grendel Prime
details:
The Grendel features a powerful 315-rated engine, enabling it to move at a fleet 119 km/h, and enough jump jets fixed on the chassis to propel it up to 210 meters at a leap. The Sharks spared no expense in weight-saving materials, making use of an XL Engine, Endo Steel structure, and seven and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. The incredible speed of the Grendel is not terribly helpful in most zellbrigen duels, but it is effective in large-scale actions. The primary configuration uses an ER Large Laser at long range, but really excels at closer ranges. It mounts three ER Medium Lasers that can be devastating to light 'Mechs and a Streak SRM-6 that exploits any holes the lasers make. An ER Small Laser that is effective at point-blank range seems an afterthought. This design is best using its large laser to soften up an opponent, then dash closer in a flurry of lasers and missiles. Two extra double heat sinks help to keep the design mostly cool. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Griffin GRF-1A
details:
The original Griffin produced by Maxwell Manufacturing, Inc. weighed sixty tons (thus technically falling into the Heavy category of BattleMechs) and used primitive components. It could reach a top speed of 64 km/h and cover ninety meters with Prototype Jump Jets. It also carried a Prototype PPC and a single LRM-5 with a ton of ammunition. It was protected by fourteen and a half tons of Primitive Armor and equipped with eleven single heat sinks. A Primitive Cockpit was provided for the pilot. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.86

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Griffin GRF-1DS
details: The 1DS variant of the Griffin, built by Defiance Industries, Kallon Industries and Norse BattleMech Works from their respective production lines starting in 3049, was intended to become the new standard model for the Federated Commonwealth. The engine was upgraded to Hermes 275 extralight engine, fourteen double heat sinks improved cooling and the weapons were stripped from the chassis. The 'Mech now carried a Doombud LRM-20 launcher over the right shoulder and a Thunderbolt-12 Large Pulse Laser in the right arm. It also employed CASE to protect the two tons of missile reloads stored in the left torso. The capture of Norse BattleMech on Marduk by the Draconis Combine meant this variant was also employed by the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Griffin GRF-1N
details: Griffin 1Ns use their Jump Jets to stay at range and pelt their opponents from relative safety. 1Ns can run hot if they spend all their time bounding around the battlefield taking potshots, though. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Griffin GRF-1NR
details: A battlefield refit of the 1N, adding a small laser for anti-infantry protection and a C3 slave unit at the cost of dropping the extra heat sinks. The 1NR also protects the LRM ammunition with a C.A.S.E. system. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Griffin GRF-1RG
details: An anti-infantry refit of the Griffin, mounting three medium and two small lasers and two machine guns. One Large Laser is used for dealing with heavier targets. To be able to fit all the weapons, the Jump Jets have been removed, reducing the mobility of the 'Mech quite a bit. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Griffin GRF-1RGb
details: A battlefield refit of the GRF-1RG, removing half a ton of machine gun ammunition to upgrade one of the small lasers to a medium lasers and also move it to the center torso. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Griffin GRF-1S
details: Griffin 1Ss mount closer-range weaponry than their 1N cousins, allowing them to jump in for closer attacks and then move away to disengage or flank. They're generally better at dealing with heat buildup, too. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Griffin GRF-2N
details: The Griffin 2N is an old Star League model that was among the most versatile 'Mechs in its heyday. Its weapons generated a lot of heat, but the old Double Heat Sinks were put in to handle it. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Griffin GRF-2N2
details: The -2N2 is a major refit of the original Griffin 2N. It exchanges the 10 tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor for 9.5 tons of standard, and replaces the two SRM-6 launchers with a Streak SRM-6 instead. It further exchanges the Guardian ECM for a Beagle Active Probe and removes one heat sink, but adds two Medium Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Griffin GRF-2Nb
details: The Griffin 2N is an old Star League model that was among the most versatile 'Mechs in its heyday. The rare B variant was specifically made for Covert Ops and carried advanced surveillance and stealth equipment. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Griffin GRF-3M
details: The 3M Griffin was an upgraded version of the design built for House Marik by Earthwerks and Brigadier Corps starting in 3049. With production lines on Keystone and Oliver this variant sought to enhance the original's long-range capabilities. The engine was exchanged for a Hermes 275 extralight model and carried fourteen double heat sinks to improve heat management. The normal PPC was replaced by a Fusigon Longtooth ER PPC, for longer reach at the expense of more heat, and the LRM launcher had been upgraded to a Doombud LRM-20 launcher, for more indirect fire support capabilities. Finally a ChrisComp Small Laser was mounted in the head and the two tons of LRM reloads in the left torso were protected by CASE. While intended for the Free Worlds League Military the capture of Oliver by FedCom forces meant the 3M also appeared in large numbers in the Armed Forces of the Federated Commonwealth. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Griffin GRF-3RG
details: A Clan Invasion era version of the GRF-1RG, the 3RG retains the right-arm medium laser and torso machine guns but swaps the remaining lasers for their pulse laser equivalents. This swap is made possible in part by dropping one ton of machine gun ammo and removing three heat sinks though a swap to double strength models compensates somewhat for the reduction. Just like its predecessor the 3RG is mostly used to guard the leaders of the Lyran Commonwealth. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Griffin GRF-6CV
details: Created by a pilot who lost the LRM rack off his Griffin, the -6CV replaces the long-range payload with a mid-range weapon system: a MRM-30. Backing up the MRM rack is an ER PPC with a PPC Capacitor for extra punch. To keep the heat under control, the -6CV mounts double heat sinks and is powered by a Light Fusion Engine for speed. It also has gained a little armor for extra survivability Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Griffin GRF-KH
details: A custom modified Griffin used by the Kell Hounds. Using exclusively clan weapons allows the 'Mech the ability to cause far more damage than expected with its LRM-20 and ER PPC combo. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Griffin IIC
details: The Clans upgraded and lightened the venerable Griffin design until the BattleMech now known as the Griffin IIC emerged. Seven tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor are mounted on an Endo Steel frame, giving the Griffin IIC almost maximum armor protection for its size. It is slightly faster than its antecedent, and it correspondingly mounts enough jump jets to leap up to 180 meters at a time. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Griffin IIC 2
details: The Clans upgraded and lightened the venerable Griffin design until the BattleMech now known as the Griffin IIC emerged. Seven tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor are mounted on an Endo Steel frame, giving the Griffin IIC almost maximum armor protection for its size. It is slightly faster than its antecedent, and it correspondingly mounts enough jump jets to leap up to 180 meters at a time. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Griffin IIC 3
details: Similar to the IIC 2, this variant retains the large laser, but trades out the rest of the armament for a Heavy Small Laser, two Streak SRM-2s and two Heavy Medium Lasers. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Griffin IIC 4
details: This upgrade was first designed by Clan Nova Cat with assistance from Clan Diamond Shark and Clan Cloud Cobra. It retains the Series 7NC ER Large Laser and Series 1NC ER Small Laser, but replaces the missile launchers with a pair of ATM 3s. Three tons of ammunition allow for maximum flexibility. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Griffin IIC X
details: The Clans upgraded and lightened the venerable Griffin design until the BattleMech now known as the Griffin IIC emerged. Seven tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor are mounted on an Endo Steel frame, giving the Griffin IIC almost maximum armor protection for its size. It is slightly faster than its antecedent, and it correspondingly mounts enough jump jets to leap up to 180 meters at a time. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Grim Reaper GRM-R-PR29
details: The Grim Reaper was a 'Mech designed by ComStar to help replenish the heavy material losses suffered by the Com Guards during the Battle of Tukayyid, with the Word of Blake maintaining production after it captured Terra to help rebuild and expand the Word of Blake Militia. Thus the Grim Reaper is seen in moderate numbers in both secular and fanatical militaries. Designed to be a generic trooper 'Mech, the Grim Reaper carries a varied and non specialized weapons payload. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Grizzly 1
details:
The Grizzly is a BattleMech that was developed by Clan Ghost Bear scientists in the 30th century. Unfortunately, the design excels at no one thing, so it never carved a niche in the Clan's touman. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Guardian GRD-1N
details: The Guardian GRD-1N is armed with five machine guns, one mounted in each arm, in each torso side and in the center torso, respectively. Two and a half tons of ammunition in the right torso provide an ample supply of ammunition. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - MG Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Guardian GRD-1NR
details: A frequent field refit for Guardians is to drop half a ton of ammunition to replace one machine gun with a medium laser, to give it at least a chance to stand against other 'Mechs. It remains a poor fighting machine when compared to virtually any other BattleMech. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - MG Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Guillotine GLT-3N
details:
Designed in 2499 for the Terran Hegemony and later the SLDF, the Guillotine served as a heavy raider; using a combination of speed and Jump Jets to out manoeuvre opponents. The Guillotine 3N is armed with a Large Laser and a quartet of Medium Lasers, backed up by an SRM-6 for close range engagements. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Right Lower, Left Upper

name: Guillotine GLT-4L
details:
The 4L Guillotine is a downgraded version of the original 3N model introduced in 2825. Although 3N used a significant number of off-the-shelf components, the two exceptions were its Endo Steel internal structure and CASE to protect its ammunition bay. The 4L was a simple redesign that consisted of utilizing a standard internal structure, removing its CASE system and three single heat sinks to free up the necessary tonnage. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Right Lower, Left Upper

name: Guillotine GLT-4P
details:
This variant of the 4L model was introduced in 2833. While few pilots were willing to tamper with the original design, this refit replaces the Large Laser with a PPC at the expense of two tons of armor. Results with this variant have been mixed. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Right Lower, Left Upper

name: Guillotine GLT-5M
details:
The 5M model is a redesign performed after the technological renaissance that started in the late 3040s. Introduced in 3049 the 5M is a 'Mech that is nearly identical to the original 3N. With the sole exception of the primary weapon being upgraded to a Sunbeam ER Large Laser model for extended reach, the 5M has an almost identical weaponry configuration, speed profile, and armor coverage as the 3N. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Right Lower, Left Upper

name: Guillotine GLT-C1
details:
An unofficial refresh of the basic Guillotine, mainly used by mercenaries, pirates and the occasional deep periphery militia. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Right Lower, Left Upper

name: Guillotine IIC
details:
A Clan built upgrade of the Guillotine, the Guillotine IIC is assigned to second line units and solahma troops. The Guillotine IIC is armed with a pair of Large Pulse Lasers and an ER PPC. 2 ER Medium Lasers and an SRM-6 give the mech a nasty punch at closer ranges. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Gunslinger GUN-1ERD
details:
Jointly developed by the Federated Commonwealth and the Draconis Combine, the 85 ton Gunslinger entered production in 3053. Powered by a 255-rated XL Engine, the Gunslinger 1ERD is armed with a pair of Gauss Rifles. 4 Medium Lasers, a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a Small laser add additional firepower at close ranges. A Guardian ECM Suite and a Beagle Active Probe enhance the Mechs capabilities, while a pair of Jump Jets increase mobility. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ha Otoko 1
details: A missile boat, the Ha Otoko 1 uses a pair of torso-mounted LRM-20s and a pair of arm-mounted LRM-10 launchers. However, it only incorporates thirteen single heat sinks, so MechWarriors must carefully manage their heat. Many only fire the LRM-10s when enemies attempt to flank them. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: Ha Otoko HKO-1C
details: This variant is the Draconis Combine model that Clan Jade Falcon merchants predicted would appear. The variant replaces the Clan weaponry with missile launchers of Inner Sphere manufacture. In order to account for the increased weight, this Ha Otoko variant makes use of an extralight fusion engine and double heat sinks. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Hammer HMR-3C 'Claw-Hammer'
details: The Hammer is a 'Mech that was built to provide fire support for light 'Mechs. The 'Mech is built around a long-range arsenal that can provide both direct and indirect fire support. It is also often paired with the Anvil, using its missiles to soften up the enemy at a distance until the Anvil can bring its lasers to bear. The Hammer has a maximum speed of 86.4 km/h, which is enough for a 'Mech intended to stay at the edges of a battlefield acting in a fire support role. Additionally, the 'Mech has a respectable six tons of armor protection. With its average speed and good armor protection combined with its long-range weapons, the Hammer is a good overall light fire support 'Mech. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Hammer HMR-3M
details: The Hammer is a 'Mech that was built to provide fire support for light 'Mechs. The 'Mech is built around a long-range arsenal that can provide both direct and indirect fire support. It is also often paired with the Anvil, using its missiles to soften up the enemy at a distance until the Anvil can bring its lasers to bear. The Hammer has a maximum speed of 86.4 km/h, which is enough for a 'Mech intended to stay at the edges of a battlefield acting in a fire support role. Additionally, the 'Mech has a respectable six tons of armor protection. With its average speed and good armor protection combined with its long-range weapons, the Hammer is a good overall light fire support 'Mech. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Hammer HMR-3P 'Pein-Hammer'
details: The Hammer is a 'Mech that was built to provide fire support for light 'Mechs. The 'Mech is built around a long-range arsenal that can provide both direct and indirect fire support. It is also often paired with the Anvil, using its missiles to soften up the enemy at a distance until the Anvil can bring its lasers to bear. The Hammer has a maximum speed of 86.4 km/h, which is enough for a 'Mech intended to stay at the edges of a battlefield acting in a fire support role. Additionally, the 'Mech has a respectable six tons of armor protection. With its average speed and good armor protection combined with its long-range weapons, the Hammer is a good overall light fire support 'Mech. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Hammer HMR-3S 'Slammer'
details: The Hammer is a 'Mech that was built to provide fire support for light 'Mechs. The 'Mech is built around a long-range arsenal that can provide both direct and indirect fire support. It is also often paired with the Anvil, using its missiles to soften up the enemy at a distance until the Anvil can bring its lasers to bear. The Hammer has a maximum speed of 86.4 km/h, which is enough for a 'Mech intended to stay at the edges of a battlefield acting in a fire support role. Additionally, the 'Mech has a respectable six tons of armor protection. With its average speed and good armor protection combined with its long-range weapons, the Hammer is a good overall light fire support 'Mech. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Hammerhands HMH-3D
details:
An early FedSuns BattleMech, the 75 ton Hammerhands debuted in 2475 and served as one of the progenitor designs that would influence the iconic Warhammer. Powered by a 225-rated Fusion Core, the Hammerhands HMH-3D is armed with a pair of AC/10’s, with a pair of Medium Lasers and an SRM-6 for close range combat. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Hammerhands HMH-4D
details:
An early FedSuns BattleMech, the 75 ton Hammerhands debuted in 2475 and served as one of the progenitor designs that would influence the iconic Warhammer. Powered by a 225-rated Fusion Core, the Hammerhands HMH-4D is armed with a pair of AC/10’s and a PPC. A pair of Medium Lasers support the bigger guns at close range. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Harpy 1
details: The Harpy, the first ProtoMech ever created, it is about as effective as a single elemental, it did however show that Protomechs could be a effective weapon. This Variant carries a MG and 20 rounds of ammo. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

name: Hatamoto-Chi HTM-26T
details:
The original version produced during 3039. Though lacking the LosTech of the HTM-27, the single production run of the original field-test Hatamoto-Chi completed on the verge of the War of 3039 came as a total shock to the attacking Lyran and Davion Forces. Since it was built on a standard chassis, the 26T had less armor, one less heat sink, and single ton of SRM ammunition in a standard ammo bin. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hatamoto-Chi HTM-27T
details:
Constructed with an Earthwerks VOL Endo Steel chassis, fitted with CASE protected ammo bins and clad in fifteen and a half tons of Mitchell Argon armor, the Hatamoto-Chi shared the features which made its parent design a nearly indestructible zombie 'Mech. The main area that Combine was unable to replicate the Thug was the older design's advanced Double Heat Sinks, eighteen standard Heat Sinks giving the Hatamoto-Chi a high heat curve in heavy combat. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hatamoto-Hi HTM-27U
details:
The 27U, also known as the Hatamoto-Hi, is almost identical to the 27T. The differences in the designs come in with the removal of the two SRM-6 launchers and the addition of four Medium Pulse Lasers and an additional heat sink to help with the additional heat burden. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hatamoto-Kaze HTM-27V
details:
The 27V, known within the Combine as the Hatamoto-Kaze, is a variant focused on long range combat. The 'Mech removes both of the SRM-6 launchers and replaces them with a pair of LRM-5 launchers, giving the Hatamoto-Kaze the ability to stay back from the battlefield and provide indirect fire. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hatamoto-Ku HTM-27W
details:
The 27W, also known as the Hatamoto-Ku, removes both of the SRM-6 launchers and replaces them with an Autocannon5. The 'Mech has a powerful direct fire capability. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hatamoto-Mizo HTM-27Y
details:
The 27Y, known as the Hatamoto-Mizo, removes both of the SRM-6 launchers and replaces them with a single ER Large Laser. This 'Mech is a powerful long range combat 'Mech and can keep an enemy at range and slowly take the armor off of a 'Mech. By the time an enemy is able to close with the Hatamoto-Mizo it can usually be taken out in physical combat. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hatamoto-Chi HTM-28T
details:
A 3059 upgrade of the 27T model, the 28T exchanges the two PPCs for two ER PPCs. The 'Mech also upgrades the two SRM-6 launchers to Streak SRM-6 launchers. Finally, the 'Mech is armed with two ER medium lasers and carries a C3 slave unit to allow it to share targeting data with other friendly units. The 'Mech achieves this by reducing its top speed to 54 km/h and makes up for some of the 'Mech's lost maneuverability by adding three jump jets, giving it a jumping distance of ninety meters. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hatamoto-Ni HTM-56K
details: The HTM-56K, also known as the Hatamoto-Ni or Hatamoto-Chi II, mounts two ER PPC as the main damage dealers, one in each arm. Four side torso mounted Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-2 act as reserve firepower as needed, while an AMS and a Small Laser provide defensive capabilities. The 'Mech also carries a Guardian ECM and a C3 Slave computer. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Hatamoto-Ni HTM-56K2
details: A simple refit of the 56K, dropping the C.A.S.E. protection to instead increase the armoring by a half-ton. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Hatamoto-Chi HTM-60T
details:
An mercenary variant of the HTM-27T, upgraded with ER PPC. Although not officially sold by the Draconis Combine, several of these somehow found their way across the galaxy. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hatamoto-Hi HTM-60U
details:
The Hatamoto-Hi HTM-60U is an unofficial mercenary refit of the original Hatamoto-Hi. It upgrades the PPC to Extended Range versions, and replaces all the lasers with four Medium Pulse Lasers. A C3 slave computer is alos added to the head of the 'Mech. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hatamoto-Ku HTM-60W
details:
A unsanctioned variant of the Hatamoto-Ku, which replaces the cooling to use double heat sinks. The freed up weight capacity is used to exchange the PPCs for ER version as well as adding two Medium Lasers. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hatamoto-Mizo HTM-60Y
details:
The Hatamoto-Mizo HTM-60Y replaces the PPC with ER PPC and adds an extra Medium Laser. This is achieved by converting the design to use double heat sinks, thus freeing two tons of weight capacity. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hatamoto-Samurai HTM-60Z
details: The HTM-60Z, or the Hitamoto-Samurai, carries a large Katana-like vibro sword, mainly to bring fear to its opponents. The 'Mech still manages to fit two ER Large Lasers, four Medium Pulse Lasers, three Medium Lasers and two Small Lasers, as well as a C3 slave unit. Quirk: Way of the Samurai Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Hatamoto-Hi HTM-C
details:
A further variation of the Hatamoto-Hi, the C variant is identical to the 27U with the exception of the removal of a single heat sink. The HTM-C also carries a C3 slave unit into battle. The 'Mech is an excellent sniper 'Mech because of the ability to share targeting data with friendly units. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hatamoto-Hi HTM-CM
details:
The HTM-CM is also based on the Hatamoto-Hi variant and carries a C3 master computer into battle, allowing it to coordinate an entire C3 lance. This is done by removing two of the Medium Pulse Lasers and a heat sink. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hauptmann HA1-O
details:
The first OmniMech both designed and built by the Lyran Alliance. The inspiration for the Hauptmann is drawn from the Daishi OmniMech used by the Clans. Using information from captured Daishis and data gleaned from the construction of the Firestarter OmniMech, which was shared by the Draconis Combine, the end result is a powerful OmniMech capable of defending itself in most combat situations. The Hauptmann is built on a standard chassis and powered by a 285 fusion engine, adding to the 'Mech's durability as it cannot be killed by a side torso loss. The Hauptmann has eleven double heat sinks fixed on the chassis and can add more if needed in its various configurations. For protection, the Hauptmann carries eighteen and a half tons of armor and has CASE fixed in the right torso to protect against an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Hauptmann HA1-OA
details:
The first OmniMech both designed and built by the Lyran Alliance. The inspiration for the Hauptmann is drawn from the Daishi OmniMech used by the Clans. Using information from captured Daishis and data gleaned from the construction of the Firestarter OmniMech, which was shared by the Draconis Combine, the end result is a powerful OmniMech capable of defending itself in most combat situations. The Hauptmann is built on a standard chassis and powered by a 285 fusion engine, adding to the 'Mech's durability as it cannot be killed by a side torso loss. The Hauptmann has eleven double heat sinks fixed on the chassis and can add more if needed in its various configurations. For protection, the Hauptmann carries eighteen and a half tons of armor and has CASE fixed in the right torso to protect against an ammunition explosion. name: Hauptmann HA1-OB
details:
The first OmniMech both designed and built by the Lyran Alliance. The inspiration for the Hauptmann is drawn from the Daishi OmniMech used by the Clans. Using information from captured Daishis and data gleaned from the construction of the Firestarter OmniMech, which was shared by the Draconis Combine, the end result is a powerful OmniMech capable of defending itself in most combat situations. The Hauptmann is built on a standard chassis and powered by a 285 fusion engine, adding to the 'Mech's durability as it cannot be killed by a side torso loss. The Hauptmann has eleven double heat sinks fixed on the chassis and can add more if needed in its various configurations. name: Helepolis HEP-0H
details:
The precursor to the 1H, the 0H was a flawed design that ran too hot and had insufficient armament or heat sinks for sustained combat. Armed with a Howitzer in place of the iconic Sniper piece, it lacks the range and stopping power of the later versions, whilst running significantly hotter due to the second large laser it mounted. Only a couple of test models were every introduced and the design was lost to the mists of history with the debut of the 1H and then the 2H, in 2480. Occasionally Helepolises in the periphery will be rebuilt along similar lines, the prized Sniper artillery pieces stripped off for other uses and local hardware retrofitted in its place. The Hellion is a product of Clan Ice Hellion and their philosophy that espouses speed above all else. Based on the Mist Lynx, the Hellion is a fast OmniMech that has respectable firepower. This light 'Mech is rather difficult to kill, incorporating five and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. To save weight, the Hellion also uses an Endo Steel chassis. name: Highlander HGN-732
details:
The Highlander is one of the most well-known Star League Defense Force assault 'Mechs, serving with distinction for almost two centuries since first entering service in 2592. Initially designed as a dedicated city and installation defender, the original model featured a variety of weaponry along with fifteen and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, but perhaps its most useful asset were the three Hildco jump jets giving it a jumping range of 90 meters. The heaviest 'Mech design to feature jump jets at the time, their original task was to allow the Highlander the ability to jump over inconvenient obstacles such as buildings and outpace other 'Mechs with a faster ground speed, but because of this increased mobility and its versatile weaponry the Highlander proved to be a capable fighter on any battlefield and within decades nearly every BattleMech regiment of the Regular and Royal Armies featured them. However it was during the design's initial trial runs that pilots began using these 'Mechs in what would infamously become known as the "Highlander Burial". Leaping into the air and landing directly on their enemy, a Highlander could literally drive a light 'Mech into the ground. So successful was this maneuver that the design team re-engineered the legs to withstand repeated death-from-above attacks and turned what had been a desperation move into an art form, giving Highlander pilots an additional psychological edge. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

The Highlander 732B is an ancient model from the Star League days! Its Gauss Rifle was a terrifying weapon that gave it a huge punch at almost any range, but you can't find those anymore. And of course, it still has the jump capability it's always been known for. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Highlander HGN-733
details:
The Highlander 733 is one of the few jump-capable assault 'Mechs. A mixture of medium- and long-range weaponry ensures that while the Highlander excels at no particular role, it is decent at all of them. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Highlander HGN-733C
details:
The Highlander 733C is a simple variant of the 733 model that removes 2 tons of missile ammunition and upscales its Autocannon 10 to an Autocannon 20. This sacrifices some of its long range functionality, but give it a true brawler profile. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Highlander HGN-733P
details:
The Highlander 733P is a variant of the 733 model that removes its Autocannon and replaces it with a PPC. It also handles heat buildup better. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Highlander HGN-736
details:
This ComStar version of the Highlander introduced in the late 3050s has been upgraded to carry the improved C3 computer, as well as upgrading the LRM-20 with an Artemis IV fire control system and replacing the SRM-6 to a Streak SRM-4. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Highlander IIC 1
details:
One of the most popular Star League BattleMechs, many a Highlander accompanied General Aleksandr Kerensky into exile. Some were mothballed, but many found their way into the toumans of the Clans. As technology advanced, the weapons systems were upgraded until the design known as the Highlander IIC finally emerged. With the use of newer, lighter weapons, the damage potential of the Highlander has roughly doubled. The IIC also contains enough ammunition that it rarely needs to conserve any during Trials. Clan scientists were forced to rearrange the placement of some weapons within the 'Mech to allow it proper ammo feeds, but the design is largely unchanged. It carries the maximum amount of Ferro-Fibrous armor that can be crammed on the frame, fourteen and a half tons. As with the original, the IIC carries enough jump jets to move up to ninety meters at a time, allowing MechWarriors to execute the Highlander Burial. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Highlander IIC A
details:
The Highlander IIC A is an ER PPC boat. Swapping the Gauss Rifle for ER PPC, the left-torso pulse lasers are also replaced by twin ER PPCs. These swaps are made possible by the removal of one of the left arm Streak 6 launchers and the Artemis unit from the right torso LRM-20, carrying three tons of missiles for each launcher. The Highlander IIC A downgrades the Ferro-Fibrous armor to standard plating to free up space for a Endo Steel frame instead and carries a total of twenty Double Heat Sinks. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Highlander IIC B
details:
Like the original Highlander IIC, the B retains the Gauss Rifle and twin Streak SRM-6 racks, but replaces the single LRM-20 with twin LRM-15 racks in the right torso, removing one of the Medium Pulse Lasers to help free up the weight needed. Trading Ferro-Fibrous armor to standard to free up space for a Endo Steel frame like the A, the Highlander IIC B is fitted with fourteen double heat sinks. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Highlander IIC C
details:
The Highlander IIC C trades the standard variant's Gauss Rifle for a pair of Ultra Autocannon/10s, retaining the trio of Medium Pulse Lasers while removing the LRM-20's Artemis module and one of the left-arm Streak SRM-6 launchers Such a heavy loadout is made possible thanks to the use of 280-rated XL Engine. The C is clad in the maximum amount of Ferro-Fibrous armor and fitted with fourteen double heat sinks. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Hitman HM-1
details:
The Hitman was designed to work as a spotter 'Mech for advanced Arrow IV missile artillery rounds. In order to do this, the 'Mech is built to be able to close to effective range for its Forward-1 Target Acquisition Gear spotting gear rapidly with a Kagushima 210 XL propelling it up to 118.8 km/h and a MASC system pushing the 'Mech up to 151.2 km/h in short bursts. The 'Mech also carries an Apple Churchill Guardian ECM Suite to foul any enemy electronics warfare equipment and a Wunderland Beagle Active Probe to detect any hidden enemy units. With the recent invention of semi-guided LRMs the Hitman can also guide LRM fire to a unit targeted with its TAG unit. The Hitman carries five tons of armor protection to protect it against any attacks that may hit it. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hitman HM-2
details:
The Hitman was designed to work as a spotter 'Mech for advanced Arrow IV missile artillery rounds. In order to do this, the 'Mech is built to be able to close to effective range for its Forward-1 Target Acquisition Gear spotting gear rapidly with a Kagushima 210 XL propelling it up to 118.8 km/h and a MASC system pushing the 'Mech up to 151.2 km/h in short bursts. The 'Mech also carries an Apple Churchill Guardian ECM Suite to foul any enemy electronics warfare equipment and a Wunderland Beagle Active Probe to detect any hidden enemy units. With the recent invention of semi-guided LRMs the Hitman can also guide LRM fire to a unit targeted with its TAG unit. The Hitman carries five tons of armor protection to protect it against any attacks that may hit it. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hollander BZK-F3
details: The Hollander was introduced in 3054 specifically to carry a Gauss Rifle into combat and act as a sniper. The Federated Commonwealth was in dire need of a response to the fast-moving, long-range firepower of the Clan Invaders at the time, and looked at a number of light 'Mech designs featuring PPCs or LRMs as a potential answer. It was Coventry's unorthodox decision to mount such a large weapon, one that had neither the overheating or ammunition explosion drawbacks of the other designs, which won them the contract. With its single massive cannon and use of rediscovered technology, the Hollander can destroy another light 'Mech in a single hit at extreme range and threaten heavier targets easily. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Hollander BZK-G1
details: The G1 variant of the Hollander is built to address concerns about the Hollander's lack of back up weapons. First debuting in 3056 the 'Mech replaces the heavy Gauss Cannon with an LB-X Autocannon/10 as its primary weapon, freeing up weight to mount two Defiance B3M Medium Lasers in its arms as backup weapons and add two tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. The G1 is an excellent 'Mech for vehicle hunting as well as anti-aircraft use with its LB-X cluster rounds. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Hollander II BZK-F5
details: The F5 variant, called the Hollander II, is a variant of the Hollander that looks to alleviate the 'Mech's problems by building it on a chassis ten tons heavier than the original, pushing it into the medium weight class. First built in 3058 the 'Mech still carries a Gauss Rifle as its primary weapon, but is backed up by a single Medium Laser and a Streak SRM-2 launcher. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Hollander II BZK-F7
details: The F7, debuting in 3061 is a modification of the F5 that takes advantage of the Hollander II's larger weapons payload to mount the Lyran Alliance's new Heavy Gauss Rifle, which is capable of causing a great deal of damage at short to medium ranges. While improving upon the firepower of the variant, the removal of backup weaponry to fit these massive weapon leaves it with the same problems as the original Hollander. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Hoplite HOP-4A
details:
Conceived by Martinson Armaments of Terra in 2578 as an infantry support 'Mech, the Hoplite first saw service with the newly formed Star League Defense Force during the Reunification War before being relegated to Terran Hegemony militia units in the twenty-seventh century. Intended for infantry support, the Hoplite is slow for a medium 'Mech with a top speed of only 64.8 km/h. However its eleven and a half tons of armor and heavy arsenal, both impressive for a 'Mech of its size, makes the Hoplite a rugged machine able to fight its way out of most situations using superior firepower. The original Reunification War era model, save for using an older Dalban Sniper targeting and tracking system, was all but identical to the 4C. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hoplite HOP-4B
details:
Conceived by Martinson Armaments of Terra in 2578 as an infantry support 'Mech, the Hoplite first saw service with the newly formed Star League Defense Force during the Reunification War before being relegated to Terran Hegemony militia units in the twenty-seventh century. Intended for infantry support, the Hoplite is slow for a medium 'Mech with a top speed of only 64.8 km/h. However its eleven and a half tons of armor and heavy arsenal, both impressive for a 'Mech of its size, makes the Hoplite a rugged machine able to fight its way out of most situations using superior firepower. The 4B variant of the Hoplite is an early variant of the 'Mech that attempts to both alleviate the ammunition dependence of its primary weapon and increase its long-range damage potential. This is done by mounting a Magna Hellstar PPC as the primary weapon that is backed up by a massive Mitchell Systems LRM-15 launcher with two tons of reloads, giving it excellent long-range and indirect fire support capabilities. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hoplite HOP-4Bb
details:
Essentially a Royal variant in everything but name, the Double B Hoplite was put into production at Strana Mechty MechWorks and Eden Weaponry Consolidated just before the death of Aleksandr Kerensky and found its way both into the forces of the Pentagon Powers and the infant toumans of the Clans. Keeping the LRM rack of the 4B, the Double B upgrades the Holly LRM-15 launcher with an Artemis IV system, swaps the PPC for an Kinslaughter H-Class ER PPC, and increases the 'Mech's survivability with a Guardian ECM system, CASE in both torsos, double heat sinks, and an anti-missile system. However, the design's speed and armor were not upgraded, enforcing the need to deploy the 4Bb as a fire-support unit. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hoplite HOP-4C
details:
Conceived by Martinson Armaments of Terra in 2578 as an infantry support 'Mech, the Hoplite first saw service with the newly formed Star League Defense Force during the Reunification War before being relegated to Terran Hegemony militia units in the twenty-seventh century. Intended for infantry support, the Hoplite is slow for a medium 'Mech with a top speed of only 64.8 km/h. However its eleven and a half tons of armor and heavy arsenal, both impressive for a 'Mech of its size, makes the Hoplite a rugged machine able to fight its way out of most situations using superior firepower. Effectively identical to the original Hoplite, the 4C carries as its primary weapon a Luxor HV Autocannon/10, which allows it to put a good amount of damage on a target, with a low amount of heat. The 'Mech is also armed with a Conan/5 LRM-5 launcher. Arriving with the Wolf's Dragoons, these were the first Hoplites seen in the Inner Sphere since their extinction during the Succession Wars. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hoplite HOP-4Cb
details:
A field upgrade of the 4C, the 4Cb replaces the brawler loadout with a Gauss rifle, SRM-6, and Ferro-Fibrous armor. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hoplite HOP-4D
details:
Conceived by Martinson Armaments of Terra in 2578 as an infantry support 'Mech, the Hoplite first saw service with the newly formed Star League Defense Force during the Reunification War before being relegated to Terran Hegemony militia units in the twenty-seventh century. Intended for infantry support, the Hoplite is slow for a medium 'Mech with a top speed of only 64.8 km/h. However its eleven and a half tons of armor and heavy arsenal, both impressive for a 'Mech of its size, makes the Hoplite a rugged machine able to fight its way out of most situations using superior firepower. Refitted by the Dragoons after the Inner Sphere's recovery of the Helm Memory Core, the HOP-4D Hoplite is armed with an impressive Mydron Excel LB-X Autocannon/10, which allows it to fire either standard rounds or cluster rounds, which are similar to the blast from a shotgun, only on a 'Mech scale. As a secondary weapon, the Hoplite carries a Conan/5 LRM-5 launcher, which also allows it to keep the enemy at long ranges. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hoplite HOP-5W
details:
A Wolf Dragoons refit if the classic Hoplite, the 5W mounts both a Gauss Rifle and an MRM-40 launcher. A C3 slave unit was also added. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hoplite C
details:
Developed after the Battle of Luthien, the Hoplite C is a variant exclusively used by the Wolf's Dragoons that uses all Clan technology. Clad in 10 tons of Ferro-Fibrous and fitted with double heat sinks, the 'Mech carries as its primary weapon an Ultra Autocannon/10. This is supported for long-range engagements by an LRM-15 launcher and for close range combat the 'Mech carries two Medium Pulse Lasers and an ER Medium Laser. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Horned Owl 1
details: Armed with a single large pulse laser in the center torso and a medium pulse laser in each arm, the Horned Owl HOW-1's devastatingly accurate fire can quickly destroy other light 'Mechs. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Horned Owl 2
details: This variant trades in its lasers for six LRM-5s and four tons of ammunition. Though it is entirely ammunition-dependent, this model can provide light Stars with sustained support, as it will not build up heat under normal circumstances. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Horned Owl 3
details: Unlike the 2, this variant returns to a design similar to the original. In place of the large pulse laser there is an ER PPC tied to a targeting computer, allowing this variant to snipe efficiently. In place of the medium pulse lasers are two trios of light machine guns, allowing the design to deal with infantry should it need to. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hornet HNT-151
details:
The Hornet debuted in 2760 as an urban recon 'Mech, but lack of interest forced the design to be shelved two years later. In 2990, Kallon Industries rediscovered the blueprints and resumed production. The upgraded HNT-171 started production in 3051. The production line was destroyed by the Capellans in 3069. The 'Mech is designed around the concept of being able to swiftly move through an urban environment with relatively heavy armor. Overall, because of its eclectic mix of weapons and relatively slow speed, the Hornet is only somewhat effective when inside of a city. When caught outside an urban environment the 'Mech is hard pressed to defend itself. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hornet HNT-152
details:
The Hornet debuted in 2760 as an urban recon 'Mech, but lack of interest forced the design to be shelved two years later. In 2990, Kallon Industries rediscovered the blueprints and resumed production. The upgraded HNT-171 started production in 3051. The production line was destroyed by the Capellans in 3069.
