Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hornet HNT-172
details:
A NAIS sponsored modification to the 171 Hornet model, the 172 transforms the mech into a close range ambush fighter. Mounting a pair of experimental Medium X-Pulse lasers and a SRM-2, the 172 is designed to hunt and harass enemy recon units in urban environments. Never entering full production, the limited production of the experimental lasers quickly shelved the 172 design with only a dozen units entering field trials with frontline units. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hounddog HDG-5L
details: The Hounddog mounts a total of six machine guns, but only with a single ton of ammunition. For increased mobility it also mounts two jump jets, but at the cost of only being able to fit 1.5 tons of standard armor. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Howler 1
details: Originally developed by Clan Fire Mandrill during the Golden Century, the 20-ton Howler is a light support mech. Built around a 140-rated Fusion Core the Howler HWR-1 uses a combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo Steel; allowing the Mech to carry 3 LRM-5’s and 3 tons of ammo. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Howler 4
details: Originally developed by Clan Fire Mandrill during the Golden Century, the 20-ton Howler is a light support mech. Built around a 140-rated Fusion Core the Howler HW-4 uses a combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo Steel; allowing the Mech to carry a single LRM-5 and a ton of ammo. 7 Jump Jets round out this variant; which is typically used as a trainer Mech. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Howler 5
details: Originally developed by Clan Fire Mandrill during the Golden Century, the 20-ton Howler is a light support mech. Built around a 140-rated Fusion Core the Howler HWR-5 uses a combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and Endo Steel; allowing the Mech to carry 6 ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Hunchback HBK-1G
details: The Hunchback 1G is a primitive refit trying to retain the 4G's impressive firepower by replacing the weapons with a Medium and Heavy Rifle in place of the AC/20. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.82

name: Hunchback HBK-4A
details: The -4A replaces the AC/20 with a LBX 20 Autocannon, and drops the Small Laser to add a C.A.S.E. system for better protection against ammo explosions. This variant was introduced as a response to the arrival of the Clans in the Inner Sphere, and with that the need for a modernization of second line 'Mechs. However, the change proved to not make a large impact and the design never saw wide use. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-4E
details: Designed by the Explorer Corps to provide heavy fire support in environments unsuited to a normal tank or support unit, the 4E is a field refit that mounts a Thumper Artillery piece in place of the standard AC/20. Removing a mostly superfluous s heat sink, frees up the weight for the 4E retain its secondary weaponry should it be engaged by head hunter units. By 3010, the Explorer Corps had entered into a long term contract with Kali Yama Weapons to produce limited numbers of this design under license. The design spread to other interested parties, after the Corps relaxed their licensing arrangements, following the Scarlet Fist debacle; in which the a lone Corps pilot – Larissa ‘‘Raza’’ Brooks – managed to successfully evaded the pirate band responsible for the destruction of her lance, before stalking them back to their base and leveling it with repeated Thumper volleys in the middle of the night. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Hunchback HBK-4G
details: The Hunchback 4G is a tried and tested juggernaut on the field. One of the lightest 'Mechs to mount such a massive Autocannon, it is capable of destroying some lighter units in a single volley. It tends to mount heavy armor to boot. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Hunchback HBK-4G Gauss Prototype
details: During the War of 3039, the 9th Ghost regiment was engaged by the Screaming Eagles mercenary company during the Elidere IV campaign, when they decided to modify two of their Hunchbacks to carry prototype Gauss Rifles. Thus, the HBK-4GG was born, able to cause tremendous damage at ranges beyond anyone's expectations. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Gauss Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-4Gb
details: Created for the SLDF Royal Divisions, the Hunchback 4Gb is a variant of the regular 4G. Built around a larger 250-rated XL Engine the 4Gb is capable of achieving speeds in excess of 80 km/h. The excess weight generated by the larger engine allowed engineers to replace the AC/20 with a Gauss Rifle. The other major change made by the SLDF engineers was to swap the 4G's heat sinks for double strength models; freeing up additional weight that was used to upgrade the Lasers to Pulse models and add CASE to the volatile Gauss Rifle. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Hunchback HBK-4G-EC
details: An early clan Mech dating from the days of Operation Klondike, the Hunchback HBK-4G-EC was an upgrade of the HBK-4G that replaced the weapons with Early Clan variants. It would be discontinued and forgotten as modern clan spec weapons entered production. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Hunchback HBK-4GK
details: A custom refit of the Hunchback HBK-4G by the Kell Hounds. The mercenary band upgraded the outdated design greatly by just replacing all weapons with Clan-tech, and otherwise keep the rest of the 'Mech almost the same. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-4GR
details: A minor battlefield refit of the -4G, removing the head mounted Small Laser and a heat sink to be able to add a C3 slave unit and C.A.S.E. protection. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Hunchback HBK-4GW
details: A full conversion of the -4G to Clan-tech by the Wolf's Dragoons using parts from destroyed or captured 'Mechs during battle. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Hunchback HBK-4H
details: A 'Swayback' variant, the 4H replaces the AC/20 with the lighter AC/10 and two additional Medium Lasers. While this reduces its overall raw firepower, it gives the Hunchback some much needed ranged capabilities. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Hunchback HBK-4J
details: Modified to aid with indirect fire support as well as being able to act as a guardian for fire support lances, the HBK-4J succeeds at both roles. With its twin LRM-10s it can contribute to the barrage, whilst its five Medium Lasers allow it to fend off the Light 'Mechs that tend to harass fire support teams. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Hunchback HBK-4Jb
details: Another Swayback 'Mech, this variant was first employed in 2856, and changed the Hunchback's focus from short range combat to fire support by removing the AC/20 and replacing it with an LRM-20 launcher. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Hunchback HBK-4K
details: A field grade refit turned official variant often fielded by House Kurita, the Hunchback HBK-4K features a massive MRM-40 as its primary weapon. Armour protection is improved with the addition of Ferro-Fibrous and CASE is installed to protect the ammunition bay. The remaining free tonnage is devoted to upgrading the Head Laser to a Medium model and adding additional Heat Sinks. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-4MA
details: An upgrade to the HBK-4G, adding both an Anti Missile System and C.A.S.E. for better resilience and switching the 'Mech to use double heat sinks for better heat management. The extra free weight capacity is used to add another half ton of armor. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-4MJ
details: A subvariant of the -4G, the -4MJ mounts four Jump Jets for increased mobility. A C.A.S.E. system, slightly different armor profiles, and an upgrade to double heat sinks fills out the design. Mainly seen amongst backwater garrisons and other out of the way locations as the main design is mostly the -4G still, making it very outdated. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Hunchback HBK-4MW
details: The HBK-4MW drops a ton of armor to enable fitting a Large Laser, but to make up for the added fragility a C.A.S.E. system was added and the 'Mech was switched to use double heat sinks. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-4N
details: Combining elements of the 4H and 4J 'Swaybacks', the HBK-4N uses an AC/5 and two LRM-5s to give it range, while the four Medium Lasers give it punch up close. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Hunchback HBK-4P
details: The 4P version of the Hunchback trades the singular impact of a massive Autocannon for a frightening array of lighter Energy weaponry that is actually capable of dealing more damage overall. This all comes at the cost of greatly increased heat buildup, of course. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Hunchback HBK-4SP
details: The 4SP variant of the Hunchback replaces the Autocannon with two SRM6 launchers. This has the potential of doing more damage than the standard model, though the damage is more spread out. This firepower is supplemented by two Medium Lasers in each arm. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Turbo Hunchback
details: The Hunchback HBK-4T, nicknamed Turbo Hunchback, drops both the Medium Lasers to upgrade to a new 250-rated fusion engine core. Due to the increased size of the engine the chassis had to be adapted in such a way that the engine is literally part of the frame, making it impossible to replace. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Turbo Hunchback Deluxe
details: The -4TD has one big change from the -4G, the fact that it houses a 350 XL engine core. Also knows as the 'Turbo Hunchback Deluxe', it drops the armoring down to 7 tons and uses an Endo Steel chassis to be able to fit both the massive engine and an extra Medium Laser. Similar to its predecessor, the normal 'Turbo Hunchback', the chassis had to be modified in such a way that replacing the engine core is not possible. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-4U
details: The -4U replaces the AC/20 with an Ultra AC/10, allowing more ammunition and a C.A.S.E. system to be added. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-5A
details: Developed during the Clan Invasion, the 5A takes advantage of the newly reintroduced Arrow IV and an Artemis IV FCS. Intended to operate in support of a lance or as part of a dedicated battery, the 5A carries a mix of homing missiles and utility ammo; enabling it to bombard targets that have been tagged by supporting forces or deploying FASCAM and other speciality ammo as and when needed. Guardian ECM confuses and blinds enemy sensors, vastly reducing the chances of accurate counter battery fire, whilst the use of CASE protects against catastrophic ammunition explosions. Sold to any interested buyer as part of Kali Yama’s contribution to the war effort, the design has been seen all across the Inner Sphere and is increasingly found in the Periphery, where reliable and cheap Artillery assets are in high demand. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-5J
details: A field upgrade kit for the popular 4J model, the 5J is a set of simple upgrades enhancing the effectiveness of the aging design. The addition of double heatsinks enables the removal of 3 heat sinks, whilst still running cooler than the original design. This free weight is used to upgrade the LRM's to the Artemis IV Fire Control system and to replace a pair of medium lasers with pulse variants. The small laser is removed to allow for the addition of CASE , preventing lethal ammo explosions. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-5L
details: An attempt at creating an energy only based Hunchback, the -5L has a total of nine Medium Lasers and two ER Large Lasers. For obvious reasons this design never caught on despite its otherwise similarity to the -5M base design, as even a switch to use 12 double heat sinks still provided far too low cooling capacity. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-5M
details: Utilizing locally produced components such as the Kali Yama Big Bore autocannon and Hellion-V medium lasers, the Kali Yama-produced 5M Hunchback is a simple upgrade of the original 4G model that first saw production in 3046. The most notable changes saw the heat sinks upgraded to double-strength models, while the small laser was upgraded to a Sunglow Prism-Optic Small Pulse Laser, and CASE was added to protect against ammunition explosions. The extra weight required to add the newer systems forced Kali Yama to reduced ammunition storage to a single ton of reloads, making it unpopular with MechWarriors and spawning the unofficial HBK-5N variant. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-5N
details: A very simple FWLM field upgrade of the lackluster 5M Hunchback introduced in 3057, the 5N model simply downgrades the pulse laser back to a small laser and removes the CASE to carry an extra ton of reloads, retaining the double heat sinks. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-5S
details: Originally a refit line converted to full production, the -5S is a complete overhaul of the Hunchback design developed by Norse-Storm BattleMechs in 3058. The structure has been modified to use Endo Steel construction techniques, the engine has been upgraded to a Light Fusion Engine, and four Jump Jets were added for increased mobility. The 'Mech carries, as its primary weapon, an LB-X Autocannon/20 with CASE-protected ammunition supported by two medium pulse lasers and a single small laser. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-5SU
details: The -5SU, or the -5MU as it should really have been called if not for a clerical error when formalizing the prototype patent, is a -5M but with an Ultra AC/20 rather than the normal AC/20 and upgraded ER Medium Lasers. To fit the new weapons, the three extra heat sinks have been dropped. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-6A
details: An early concept version of what would eventually become the -6S, based around the same 300 XL engine and Endo Steel chassis. The main weapon is still kept as the classic Autocannon 20 and lasers, unlike the -6S's LBX/20 and ER lasers. The six jump jets mounted on the concept never made it to the final production model either. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback HBK-6N
details: This variant, produced in 3059, was Kali Yama's response to the complaints about the lack of AC/20 ammunition that spawned the ad hoc -5N field refit. The -6N removes three extra double heat sinks and replaces them with three more tons of reloads. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Hunchback IIC
details: The Hunchback IIC is a ClanTech refit of the venerable Hunchback. Its meager armor, coupled with paltry ammunition and lack of long-range weapons, led Inner Sphere observers to conclude that this 'Mech was a last-ditch effort for failed warriors to die with glory. In truth, the assignment of a Hunchback IIC was essentially a death sentence. Warriors given this machine were not expected to survive their next battle. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Hunchback IIC 2
details:
Like their Inner Sphere counterparts, Hunchback IICs mounting smaller weaponry are frequently referred to as Swayback IICs. This Hunchback IIC 2, a Crusader variant, utilizes four Heavy Large Lasers that can quickly cause a debilitating heat-induced shutdown. As secondary weapons the variant includes two Medium Pulse Lasers. The nineteen double heat sinks cannot handle the heat build up for long. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Hunchback IIC A
details: Each side torso of the Hunchback IIC A carries an ER Large Laser and twin Medium Pulse Lasers, supported by the standard pair of ER Medium Lasers in the center torso. Built on an 200XL engine with an Endo Steel frame, the remaining weight goes towards four jump jets, twenty double heat sinks and eight tons of armor. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Hunchback IIC B
details: A Streak SRM Missile Boat, carrying a pair of Streak SRM-6 launchers in each side torso, supported by twin center torso mounted Medium Pulse Lasers. The IIC B carries a mammoth six tons of Streak reloads, the remaining weight going to an extra two double heat sinks and eight tons of armor. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Hunchback IIC C
details: A version of the standard Hunchback IIC with greater field endurance, the C variant downgrading the Ultra AC/20s to lighter Ultra Autocannon/10s, the saved weight going towards an ER Medium Laser in each arm and two tons of Ultra Autocannon rounds in each side torso. The remaining features are identical to the standard model. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Hunchback IIC XA
details: One of several attempts by Xander BattleMech Design to create a cheaper, alternative Hunchback IIC design. Never saw any real success and only few production series were run before most of the 'Mechs fell into pirate hands. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Hunchback IIC XJ
details: One of several attempts by Xander BattleMech Design to create an alternative Hunchback IIC design. Never saw a lot of usage, but the occasional model can still be found in Clan garrisons. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Hunchback IIC XW
details: The most successful of several attempts by Xander BattleMech Design to create an alternative Hunchback IIC design, the few models that survived the early days are now part of Clan reserves. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Huntsman A
details:
A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250-rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro-Fibrous armor giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman A is armed with an LRM-10 and a LB-2X. A pair of Large Pulse Lasers provide additional firepower at close range. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Huntsman B
details:
A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250-rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro-Fibrous armor giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman B is armed with an ER PPC. A pair of Medium Pulse Lasers, a pair of Machine Guns and an LB-10X provide additional firepower at close range. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Huntsman C
details:
A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250-rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro-Fibrous armor giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman C is armed with a UAC/5, an LRM-15 and an LRM-20. A ER Medium Laser, ER Small Laser, Flamer and Streak SRM-4 provide additional firepower at close range. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Huntsman D
details:
A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250-rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro-Fibrous armor giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman D is armed with a UAC/10 and an ATM-6. A pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a Small Pulse Laser provide additional firepower at close range. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Huntsman P
details:
A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250-rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro-Fibrous armor giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman P is armed with a pair of LRM-10’s. A UAC/10, a pair of Streak SRM-4’s, an ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser provide additional firepower at close range. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Huntsman Prime
details:
A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250-rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro-Fibrous armor giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman Prime is armed with a UAC/2 and an Artemis IV enhanced LRM-10. 4 ER Medium Lasers, a Streak SRM-6, Flamer and a pair of A-Pods provide additional firepower at close range. A combination of a TAG and an Active Probe allow the Huntsman to scout or spot for allied units. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Huron Warrior HUR-WO-R4L
details:
The primary weapon that the Huron Warrior carries is a Grizzard Gauss Rifle (Modified 210 Version) that is capable of stripping off a ton of armor with each shot at extremely long ranges. The Gauss Rifle is backed up by a Martell ER Large Laser that provides good supplemental firepower at long ranges. Finally, it is armed with a Martell Medium Pulse Laser, which gives the Huron Warrior the ability to protect itself at short ranges. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Huron Warrior HUR-WO-R4M
details:
The 3056 R4M variant of the Huron Warrior is a simple modification that removes the medium pulse laser in favor of a standard medium laser. The saved weight is used to add an additional ton of armor to the 'Mech. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Hussar HSR-200-D
details: The Hussar has a single weapon on its chassis in a unique turreted mount on the center torso, an Extended Range Large Laser. While the use of a single weapon limits the defensive capabilities of the Hussar, the superior reach of the ER laser allows the 'Mech to engage enemies at a standoff range and its speed means the Hussar can dictate the range of the engagement, forcing enemies to fight on its terms. If enemies do get too close the Hussar can still engage in physical combat with kicks and punches but this is less than ideal. Ten double heat sinks are enough to keep the 'Mech cool in combat, but only one and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor makes the Hussar among the least-protected 'Mechs ever built. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Hussar HSR-200-Db
details: An upgrade of the 200 introduced in 2735 and used exclusively by SLDF Royal units, the 200Db is powered by an XL Engine. This enables an upgrade of the 'Mech's electronics with a Beagle Active Probe and a Guardian ECM Suite in the side torsos. In addition, the armor coverage is increased to five and a half tons. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Hussar HSR-300-D
details: The 300-D Hussar is a simple downgrade of the 200-D Hussar, gifted to the Draconis Combine by ComStar in 3035. The primary changes in the design are the replacement of the ER large laser with a standard Defiance B3L Large Laser, standard heat sinks in place of the double-strength models, and replacement of the Ferro-Fibrous armor with standard Riese Reliable armor at a negligible cost to the already weak armor protection. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Hussar HSR-350-D
details: This Combine variant on the 300-D was introduced in 3038. It lowers the Hussar's top speed to 126 km/h by replacing the engine with a Pitban 240. The weight saved from the smaller power plant was used to add a Medium Laser to each arm and an extra ton of armor. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Hussar HSR-400-D
details: One of the Clanbuster upgrades developed by ComStar in 3052, the 400-D is an extreme modification of the original Hussar. The ER large laser and the engine have both been stripped from the chassis to make room for a LB-X Autocannon/10 with one ton of ammo, an additional 1.5 tons of armor and a GM 240 XL Engine, reducing the Hussar's speed to 129.6 km/h. This variant of the Hussar, due to the cluster rounds that can be fired from the LB-X Autocannon, performs admirably in anti-vehicle screening forces. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Hussar HSR-450-D
details: A next generation design, partly based on data from the Battle of Tukkayid; the Hussar 450-D entered production in 3059. An LB-5X provides the bulk of the Mechs ranged firepower, with a pair of ER Medium Lasers offering additional firepower at closer ranges. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Hussar HSR-500-D
details: The 500-D Hussar, built by Bonn Mekarmorwerks and introduced in 3060, is armed with an ER PPC. The targeting system has been mated to an Improved C3 Computer, making it deadly accurate at long range when working closely with other units. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Hydra 1
details: Intended to serve as a medium assault unit, the Hydra carries heavy armor and a decent weapon suite. For its primary weapon, the Hydra uses a Streak SRM-3 launcher, with a Micro Pulse Laser for backup Quirk: Accurate Weapons - Missile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Icarus ICR-1X
details:
The original prototype Icarus was developed at the Happen Military Reservation on Xanthe III in 2466, and was first deployed on Alula Australis in 2469. Its premiere date in official documents is listed as 2470. The prototype used primitive equipment and lacked jump jets. It had a Large Laser to complement the Small Laser. Two SRM-2s and twin Machine Guns could prove devastating to conventional troops. Only six of these were ever produced and they are all long gone. The primitive engine drove it to a maximum of 64 km/h. Ten and a half tons of Primitive Armor provided protection. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.8

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Icarus II ICR-1S
details:
The Icarus II was the first homegrown BattleMech design to be mass-produced by the Free Worlds League. It was originally designed as a speedy striker to compliment the Mackie and combat vehicles with a similar speed profile. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Ice Ferret A
details:
First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360-rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-A is armed with an LB-2X and a pair of ER Medium Lasers. AMS improves the Ice Ferrets defensive capabilities. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ice Ferret A1
details:
The A1 configuration is similar to the Alpha loadout, but replaces the AMS with a LRM-5 and one of the ER Medium Lasers is downgraded to a Small. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ice Ferret B
details:
First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360-rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-B is armed with an ER Large Laser, Small Pulse Laser, SRM-4 and an SRM-6. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ice Ferret C
details:
First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360-rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-C is armed with an ER Small Laser and a trio of Artemis IV enhanced LRM-5’s. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ice Ferret D
details:
First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360-rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-D is armed with a quad of Medium Pulse Lasers. AMS improves the Ice Ferrets defensive capabilities. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ice Ferret E
details:
First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360-rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-E is armed with an ATM-9, ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ice Ferret E2
details:
The E2 secondary configuration combines the firepower of one ER Large Laser in each arm. A ER Medium and a ER Small Laser provide auxiliary damage as needed. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ice Ferret F2
details:
The F2 secondary loadout mounts a Large Pulse Laser in the Left Arm, and an ER Medium Lasers in the right arm. A Left Torso mounted ER Small Laser finishes the weapons loadout. All the weapons are routed through a powerful Targeting Computer, improving their battlefield performance. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ice Ferret H
details:
First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360-rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-H is armed with an ER Large Laser, a pair of Heavy Medium Lasers and an SRM-6. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ice Ferret Prime
details:
First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360-rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-Prime is armed with an ER PPC, ER Small Laser and a Streak SRM-2. An Active Probe improves the Ice Ferrets scouting capabilities. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ice Ferret W
details:
A Wolf's Dragoons specific loadout, mounting only a single ER Large Laser as the main damage dealer. Instead a large part of the left torso is used to mount a C3 Master unit. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Ice Ferret W2
details:
The W2 is an alternate loadout used by the Mercenary outfit knows as the Wolf's Dragoons. One ER Large Laser and three ER Small Lasers provide direct damage capabilities, while a TAG provides targeting information for fire solutions from other units. An ECM suite, Active Probe and C3 slave unit all help strengthen the scouting capabilities of the 'Mech. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Icestorm 1
details: Created in the late twenty-ninth century, the Icestorm is an incredibly fast BattleMech that is used as a scout and a spotter. It is based on the Cameroon, a Star League design that was modified by Clan Ice Hellion Khan Stephan Cage. Its speed is its defense, not its paltry three and a half tons of standard armor, and its meager weapons do not tax the ten single heat sinks. The Icestorm still sees use in the majority of Hellion Galaxies, though Clan Wolf also maintains a fair number in their garrison Clusters. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Imp IMP-1A
details:
The original Imp, introduced in 2793, carries an ER PPC and Medium Pulse Laser in the right and left torso. Supporting these weapons are 2 Medium Pulse Lasers mounted in the center torso and a Small Laser in the head. The left arm mounts another Medium Pulse Laser, while the right arm carries an Artemis IV enhanced LRM-20. The engine is a standard fusion model, and the missile ammunition is protected by CASE. This version was the original Imp design specified by Nicholas Kerensky and was intended for battlefield commanders. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Imp IMP-1B
details:
Similar to the Imp 1A variant, this model trades the Medium Pulse Lasers for Medium Lasers. It also trades the head mounted Small Laser for a Medium Pulse Laser. It keeps the ER PPCs and LRM-20 and Artemis IV system. The biggest change is the addition of a Guardian ECM suite in the 'Mech's right torso. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Imp IMP-1C
details:
Another early version based on the Imp 1B, this variant mounts a Gauss Rifle in the right arm. The Imp 1C uses the head mounted Small Laser of the Imp 1A in place of the Medium Pulse Laser. The Guardian ECM suite is still in the right torso. One heat sink is removed, giving the Imp 1C a total of seventeen double heat sinks. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Imp IMP-2E
details:
An early variant of the Imp and the first version to be seen by the Inner Sphere, the 2E model uses all non-Star League technology. The 'Mech is armed with a pair of PPCs and an LRM-15 launcher for long range combat. For close combat, the 'Mech carries five Medium Lasers. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Imp IMP-3E
details:
An upgrade to the 2E model, the 3E carries, a pair of Magna Firestar ER PPCs and a Mitchell Systems LRM-15 as it's primary weapons. For closer range combat, the 'Mech relies on a Thunderbolt-12 Large Pulse Laser, backed up by two Magna 400P Medium Pulse Lasers and two Martell Model 5 Medium Lasers. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Imp IMP-3W
details:
A custom version of the 3E created by the Wolf's Draggons, upgrading the whole design to Clan spec technology. The combination of two Large Pulse Lasers, two LRM-15, two ER PPC, two Medium Pulse Lasers and finally two ER Medium and one ER Small laser means the 'Mech is able to handle fights at almost any distance. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Imp IMP-4E
details:
A massive upgrade of the Imp, the 4E model carries two ER PPCs for long range direct fire, as well as an LRM-20 launcher with an Artemis IV Fire Control System. The 'Mech carries three ER Medium Lasers for intermediate range combat. The 'Mech also carries two Medium Pulse Lasers and two ER Small Lasers for close combat. Much like the original Clan models, the 21 heat sinks are double-strength and the engine is a standard model. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Imp IMP-4U
details:
A short range modification of the 4E mainly used by mercenaries, the 4U carries four Stream SRM-6 and five Medium Lasers, while still retaining the two ER PPC. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Imp IMP-4W
details:
A Wolf's Dragoons custom refit of the Imp, using all Clan tech. The 'Mech's primary weapons are two ER PPC, two Large Pulse Lasers and two LRM-15 with attached Artemis IV FCS. As secondary fireline the 4W carries two ER Medium Laser and two Medium Pulse Laser, while two ER Small Lasers are kept for defensive purposes. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Imp C
details:
This upgrade of the Imp is built exclusively for Wolf's Dragoons using only Clan technology. The 'Mech is armed with two ER PPCs and an LRM-20 launcher with an Artemis IV Fire Control System for long range combat. For close ranges, the 'Mech carries five Medium Pulse Lasers. The Imp C is also armored with nineteen tons of armor. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Incubus 1
details: A second line mech designed for settling clan duels, the laser armed Incubus has found considerable success with Clan Hell's Horses'49th Battlemech Cluster as a protomech hunter. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Incubus 2
details: An example of the semi-modularity offered by the Incubus's 'rifle', this variant replaces the pulse laser with an ER PPC. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Incubus 3
details: The second variant mounts a Streak SRM-6 and a single ton of ammo in the 'rifle', the weight saved allowing the torso lasers to be upgraded to Medium Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Incubus 7
details: A second-line battlemech designed for dueling, the Incubus is a frequent sight in Clan garrison units. A 30 ton light Mech, the Incubus is built around a 270-rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Chassis and Ferro-Fibrous armor. The Incubus 7 is armed with a UAC/2, a pair of ER Medium Lasers and 4 Machine Guns. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Incubus 8
details: A second-line battlemech designed for dueling, the Incubus is a frequent sight in Clan garrison units. A 30 ton light Mech, the Incubus is built around a 270-rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Chassis and Ferro-Fibrous armor. The Incubus 8 is armed with an LRM-20, a pair of ER Medium Lasers and 4 Machine Guns. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Infiltrator Mk I [STD]
details: The only weapon on the Infiltrator is a Grenade Launcher carried in the left arm. Firing a burst of five grenades at once, the launcher has limited offensive value against most combat units. The right arm ends in a Basic Manipulator, however the Infiltrator is not set up for making anti-'Mech attacks or being transported via OmniMech. While it can achieve a top speed of 21.6 km/h, the suit has an ungainly gait, likened to a "waddling toy robot", and hence its nickname of the "Waddler". Quirk: Ambusher Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.886 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Infiltrator Mk II [STD]
details: The Infiltrator Mk. II is a battle armor suit designed as a replacement for the earlier Infiltrator Mk. I. With better armament and protection than its predecessor, the Mk. II was superior in all ways except cost. A battle armor-scale Magshot rifle provides firepower while an anti-infantry SMG provides light defense. A suite of stealth armor keeps the suit protected on the field. The only serious downside is the slow ground speed of the Mk. II, though jump jets help keep the suit semi-mobile. Quirk: Ambusher Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Initiate INI-02
details:
The Initiate started production after the Word of Blake retook Terra. This medium 'Mech has been produced in record numbers by the Word of Blake with no shortage of pilots. It is built on a Geometric 1000 Endo Steel chassis to save weight and is powered by a LTV 160 fusion engine that gives it a top speed of 64.8 km/h. For protection from enemy fire, the Initiate carries eight and a half tons of armor that allows the 'Mech to stand up to fire from most other 'Mechs of the same weight class or lower, and enjoys increased durability because of its CASE system that protects against ammunition explosions. Overall, the Initiate is a reliable trooper 'Mech that is capable of filling a variety of roles on the modern battlefield. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Inner Sphere Standard [FL]
details: The Inner Sphere Standard was developed following the initial thrust of the Clan invasion, as Inner Sphere powers rushed to duplicate the battle armor technology the Clans fielded. Lacking any battlefield salvage on which to base their development though, engineers were forced to work off of ancient rumors of early power armor suits like the Nighthawk, more akin to armored Exoskeletons than the 'Toads' currently rampaging through known space, and these prototypes fared poorly during testing. It took salvage from the first victories over the Clans to truly kick-start the development of battle armor. The New Avalon Institute of Science was the first to reproduce in part the Clans' Elemental armor as the Inner Sphere Standard. Quirk: Standard Parts Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

Quirk: Standard Parts Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount any unit, can melee, can swarm.

Quirk: Standard Parts Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Ion Raptor ION-2R
details:
One of the Vining Engineering and Salvage Team’s more curious creations, the Ion Raptor is a hand built marque of battlemechs built with salvaged mech chassis's from the Clan front lines. First debuting in 3053, the original Ion Raptor was built from the remains of a Masakari and a Crab. Built specifically for the Solaris Arenas, less than a dozen Ion Raptors are known to exist, though speculation is rife that VEST intends to sell the design to a major manufacturer in the near future. The ION-2R is the standard model offered by VEST and the most well known one. 4 Medium Pulse Lasers and 4 Streak-4’s form the bulk of the Mechs armament, with a pair of Large Lasers providing a ranged punch. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Iron Cheetah A
details:
The A configuration of the Iron Cheetah mounts two Large Pulse Lasers and one Ultra AC/20 as the main weapons. Two Streak SRM-6 launchers provide some extra close quarters damage potential. To defend against infantry, the 'Mech also carries six machine guns. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Iron Cheetah B
details:
Mounting two Large and six Medium Pulse Lasers and a targetting computer optimizing their output makes the B configuration of the Iron Cheetah quite lethal. Four Jump Jets have also been added for better flanking and mobility. However, it struggles to vent all the generated heat in warmer biomes, making its usefulness situational. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Iron Cheetah C
details:
The C configuration mounts four Extended Range Large Lasers and four Medium Pulse Lasers. Combined with a LRM-15 launcher, there is great damage potential even at longer ranges. Two Streak SRM 2 launchers add some extra punch in close quarters. Even with 24 double heat sinks, the generated heat is almost half again over the cooling capacity, so pilots have to be careful with their weapons usage. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Iron Cheetah D
details:
The D configuration uses a combination of four ER Lasers, one Gauss Rifle and an Ultra Autocannon/20. An ECM suite is also added in the Center Torso. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Iron Cheetah E
details:
The E configuration combines the two base ER PPC with one Large and one Medium Pulse Laser in each arm. A center mounted ER Small Laser for anti-infantry and a ECM suite completes the loadout. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Iron Cheetah F
details:
The Iron Cheetah's F configuration is based from the B loadout, but adds another Large Pulse Laser instead of the jump jets. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Iron Cheetah Prime
details:
The last OmniMech created by Clan Smoke Jaguar, the Iron Cheetah is the pinnacle of their OmniMech design line. Building upon the success of the Dire Wolf, the clan engineers created a brutal and efficient killer. By using an Endo Steel chassis, a 400 XL engine and 16 ton of Ferro-Fibrous armor, the largest weakness of the Dire Wolf - its slow speed - was corrected, yet still leaving an impressive 39.5 tons of free pod space. The Prime configuration uses this space to mount two ER PPC, two Medium Pulse Lasers, one Gauss Rifle and an Artemis IV-enabled LRM15. For close range defense it also carries an ER small laser and an AMS system. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Jackal JA-KL-1532
details: The Jackal JA-KL-1532 was armed with a simple but effective arsenal. The primary weapon carried by the 'Mech is an ER PPC, which allowed the Jackal to damage a target at just under 700 meters, while a Streak SRM-2 missile launcher provided close combat power. An anti-missile system was mounted on the 'Mech's head for missile defense; each system carried a ton of ammunition. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Jackal JA-KL-1540
details: The JA-KL-1540 is able to mount an extra Medium Laser over the JA-KL-1532 by switching to double heat sinks, thus reducing the total need by one sink. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Jackrabbit JKR-8T
details:
Conceived as a long-range infantry support Mech, the ill-fated Jackrabbit entered prototyping mere weeks before the Amaris Coup. Mass produced without regard for its design flaws, the 25 ton Jackrabbit suffered from anaemic firepower and poor armor; resulting in a bad reputation and the eventual extinction of the design. Powered by a 150-rated Fusion Engine, the Jackrabbit carries 3.5 tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor and has a top speed of 97 km/h. An endosteel skeleton allows the Jackrabbit JKR-8T to carry an AC/2 and a Streak SRM-2, both with a single ton of ammo. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Jackrabbit JKR-9R 'Joker'
details:
Conceived as a long-range infantry support Mech, the ill-fated Jackrabbit entered prototyping mere weeks before the Amaris Coup. Mass produced without regard for its design flaws, the 25 ton Jackrabbit suffered from anaemic firepower and poor armor; resulting in a bad reputation and the eventual extinction of the design. Powered by a 150-rated Fusion Engine, the Jackrabbit carries 4.5 tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor and has a top speed of 97 km/h. An endosteel skeleton allows the Jackrabbit JKR-9R to carry a Large Laser and a Streak SRM-2 with a single ton of ammo. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: JagerMech IIC
details:
The JagerMech IIC carries a LB-X AC/5 and an Ultra AC/2 in each arm, with enough ammunition to keep the weapons firing for longer engagements. Two ER Medium Lasers act as close range secondary weapons and four Jump Jets allow the 'Mech to reposition easily. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech IIC 1
details:
One of two 100 ton IIC variant created by the cleans mounts four Gauss Rifles with 16 tons of ammunition, and nothing else. This leaves the 'Mech very vulnerable if engaged directly, and was considered a colossal failure. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech IIC 2
details:
The second 100 ton IIC variant created by the Clans drops four ton of Gauss ammunition for two Medium Pulse Lasers to add some self-protection. This minor change did not change the fact that the whole project was seen as a huge failure, and was quietly cancelled not long after. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech III JM6-D3
details:
The primary weapons the JagerMech III JM6-D3 carries, for long-range combat, are two Ultra Autocannon/2s that are capable of hitting with light damage out to seven hundred and fifty meters. For intermediate ranges, in spite of the state-of-the-art construction techniques used on the 'Mech, the JagerMech III relies on two PPCs backed up by two Medium Lasers for close combat. The -D3 carries armor in line with its role as a long-range 'Mech, with only nine and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Finally, to dissipate waste heat, the 'Mech has twelve double heat sinks. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM6-A
details:
The JagerMech A model attempts to provide an indirect-fire support platform that can dish out damage without ever being seen. It has lower overall focused damage capability, but it usually mounts decent armor. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM6-ACE
details:
A variant of uncertain origins, but likely on one of the Gamesworlds despites the unsuitability of the chassis for arena combat. Four LRM-5 launchers allow causing some light damage before its SRM and Medium Lasers are in range. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM6-B
details:
A recent variant to the JagerMech, the JM6-B removes most of the ammunition dependencies of the original model by swapping out the AutoCannons for Lasers. To make up for the loss in range, a pair of LRM-15 launchers have been added. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM6-DD
details:
The DD was the first variant incorporating technology recovered from the Gray Death Memory Core. The DD replaces the standard engine with an XL model and converts the armor to ferro-fibrous, adding an additional half-ton. The Mydron Medium Autocannons are replaced by General Motors Nova-5 Ultra Autocannons, and the Magna standard lasers are replaced with Sutel Precision Line Medium Pulse Lasers. CASE is mounted in both side torsos to protect the ammunition, with the AC/2 ammunition doubled and moved into these side torsos to take advantage of this. The original design's single heat sinks are retained. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM6-DG
details:
This field refit was the result of inspired technicians working on JagerMechs undergoing major overhauls. Introduced in 3054 it replaces the autocannons with two Gauss Rifles and six tons of ammunition. In order to accommodate this change, the lasers were swapped out for ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM6-DGr
details:
An obvious update to the DG field refit introduced in 3058. It replaces the standard medium lasers with ER medium lasers thus justifying the upgrade of the heat sinks to double-strength models. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM6-S
details:
The JagerMech S model is highly specialized at long-range Autocannon fire support. It doesn't have much in the way of protection or closer-range weapons, though, so keep it distant and out of harm's way. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM6-SR
details:
A battlefield refit of the JM6-S, the -SR trades the two Medium Lasers for a C3 slave unit and C.A.S.E. protection for the autocannon ammunition. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM6-TD
details:
Designed by the famous 'Tricky Dick', this custom variant has the attached design notes of: When you think of 'bad' 'Mechs, the JagerMech has to be one that comes to mind. By adding an XL engine with double heat sinks and Endo Steel, we were able to save enough weight that we could remove the two Ultra Autocannon/5's, and replace them with ER PPCs! As usual, maximum armor is a must, and the 'Mech can fire its long range suite of weapons with no heat buildup. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM6-U
details:
A mercenary refit of the classical JagerMech, replacing all weapons with a Light Gauss Rifle in each arm and three Medium Lasers for closer ranges. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM6-X
details:
The JagerMech X model mounts unusually thick Armor alongside 2 LBX5 Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM7-A
details:
The 70 ton JM7-A slightly modifies the JM7-D to create a cheaper variant. Keeping the Ultra AC/5 and one of the ER Large Lasers, but replacing the remaining weapons with just two Medium Lasers allows the 'Mech to drop its cost by over 3 million c-bills. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM7-D
details:
The first of the heavier JM7 JagerMech variants introduced in 3057, the D variant adds five tons of overall weight to the JM6-DD, four and one-half of which go directly to increased ferro-fibrous armor. The Autocannon/2s are replaced with ER Large Lasers. The weight savings from this swap allows the design to mount thirteen double heat sinks. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM7-J
details:
The JM7-J mounts four Jump Jets as an attempt to make it more mobile. Fitting two Ultra AC/5 and an ER Large Laser, the 'Mech is capable of some good damage if able to flank its enemies while jumping. Two Medium Lasers and CASE protection for the UAC ammunition round out the design. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM7-W
details:
Introduced in 3059 the JM7-W combines two imposing Ultra AC/5 with a Large Pulse Laser and an ER Large Laser. Not much else of the design is changed from the earlier JM7 designs. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM8-HK
details:
An illegally manufactured JagerMech variant from somewhere in the Periphery, the JM8-HK uses cheaper and more commonly available equipment than many of the other more recent variants. Two ER PPC and two AC/2 serve as the main damage dealers, with two Medium Lasers for close range. A C3 Slave unit was added to improved battlefield coordination within its lance. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: JagerMech JM8-KH
details:
A Kell Hounds custom variant, replacing much of the 'Mech with Clan grade technologies. Two Ultra AC/5, two ER Large Laser and two Small Pulse Lasers, all of Clan tech base, and a C3 slave marks the key upgrades. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner IIC 1
details:
The Jenner was first fielded in September 2784, the same year the Exodus fleet that would eventually become the Clans left the Inner Sphere in November. How exactly they acquired this design in that short timeframe is not known, but what is known is that the Clan version fields Clan weaponry. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner IIC 2
details:
This support variant replaces the short-range missile launchers with an ER Large Laser and an LRM-5. A Small Pulse Laser provides defense against conventional infantry and other units that stray too close. Its jumping capacity is increased to 270 meters. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner IIC 3
details:
The Jenner was first fielded in September 2784, the same year the Exodus fleet that would eventually become the Clans left the Inner Sphere in November. How exactly they acquired this design in that short timeframe is not known, but what is known is that the Clan version fields Clan weaponry. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner IIC 4
details:
Clan Nova Cat, the primary users of the Jenner IIC, created this variant after they moved to the Inner Sphere. Though it changes the appearance of the 'Mech, the actual specifications of the design changed little. It retains the Streak SRM-4, but replaced the standard missile launchers with a pair of ATM 3s, each of which is accompanied by a ton of ammunition. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner JR7-A
details:
The original Jenner model mounted a Large Laser with a pair of Medium Lasers in a torso mounted turret. While it was a solid fast moving 'Mech, its Argra 27C Medium Lasers suffered from a targetting defect. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner JR7-C
details:
The JR7-C was a basic upgrade of the JR7-K, removing one of the Medium Lasers and replacing it with a C3 Slave Unit. Combined with its speed this made the Jenner an ideal spotter for a C3 company. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner JR7-D
details:
Jenner Ds run hot, and they run fast but can quickly bound into combat to deliver a knockout punch, even against heavier units. Their capability with speed and weaponry tends to come at the expense of lower armor capacity, though. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner JR7-DR
details:
A mercenary refit of the JR7-D which allows adding two extra Medium Lasers and a C3 slave unit by switching to Double Heat Sinks and dropping the SRM-4 launcher. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner JR7-F
details:
The Jenner F drops the SRM in favor of increasing armor across the entire 'Mech, producing a more durable striker. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner JR7-K
details:
The JR7-K adds a higher degree of survivability to the Jenner by upgrading the armor to Ferro-Fibrous, while removing a half ton of the armor. This provides virtually the same armor protection while allowing space for CASE to protect the SRM-4 ammunition. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner JR7-KH
details:
A full Clan tech refit by the Kell Houds, doubling it's available tonnage for weapons by the combination of Endo Steel, Ferro-Fibrous armor and an XL engine. As a result the JR7-KH can mount 4 Medium Pulse Lasers and a Streak SRM-4, while still having space for an Active Probe, ECM and C3 slave unit to strengthen the battlefield presence. Even with all this enough free weight remains to increase the armoring by half a ton. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner JR7-R
details:
The Jenner R was downgraded to accommodate a lack of replacement parts, carrying 2 SRM-6s, 2 Rocket Launchers and 2 Medium Lasers. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.78

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner JR8-K
details:
A pirate version of the Jenner, using as light components as possible to fit twin Streak SRM-2 launchers, a single Streak SRM-6 and 7 tons of armor. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jenner JR9-F
details:
Not much is known of this pirate variant, a few have been spotted in recent raids around the Periphery and they seem to mostly be a random assortment of equipment thrown together. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Jinggau JN-G8A
details:
The Jinggau is built on a lightweight Chariot Type II Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a VOX 325 XL engine that gives it a top speed of 86.4 km/h. To increase its mobility, the Jinggau has five Hellespont Leaper jump jets that allow it to jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. For protection, the Jinggau carries eleven and a half tons of armor that protects the 'Mech from enemy fire. To dissipate the waste heat produced by the Jinggau's weapons and jump jets, the 'Mech has thirteen double heat sinks that are more than adequate. Overall, with its high ground speed, superior mobility, armor, and firepower the Jinggau is a 'Mech more than capable of handling most enemies on today's battlefield. The primary weapon on the Jinggau is a powerful Zhi-tong-yao Gauss Rifle that gives the 'Mech a maximum striking distance of up to six hundred and sixty meters which allows the Jinggau the opportunity to draw the first blood on the battlefield. For close combat, the Jinggau has a set of four Diverse Optics Type ER Medium Lasers and a single, highly accurate, Raker-IV Medium Pulse Laser. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Juggernaut JG-R9T1
details: A lumbering mountain of armor and weaponry, Solaris Arms' massive assault 'Mech definitely lives up to the name of Juggernaut in the Solaris Games. While not a flashy design, Solaris Arms kept up steady production of the design since the early 3050s. Sixteen and half tons of Valiant Chainmail armor protect a GM 270 Fusion Engine, propelling the 'Mech at fairly standard assault 'Mech speed of 54 km/h. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Juggernaut JG-R9T2
details: The Juggernaut's main armament is a trio of Large X-Pulse Lasers, one in each arm with one in its center torso, backed up by three Sutel Precision Line Medium X-Pulse Lasers divided between each arm and the head. Due to the 'Mech's lack of hand actuators, at knife-fighting range the Juggernaut is protected by a staggering twelve Machine Guns fed from two tons of reloads. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Junior JNR-7P
details: The Junior JNR-7P remains among the best-armed 'Mechs in its weight class, sporting a reliable combination of a medium laser in the center torso and a small laser in each side torso. Two tons of armor provides minimal protection. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Kabuto KBO-7A
details: Developed by Diplan mechyards as an easy to repair, scout and ambusher. This mech can deliver a nasty punch, before having to withdraw. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

name: Kage (DEST)
details: The Kage (translating to "shadow" in japanese) light battle armor was one of the first battle armor designs produced by the Draconis Combine after the Truce of Tukayyid. Built for reconnaissance and battlefield infiltration, development of the Kage was a joint operation between Internal Security Force scientists and Draconis Elite Strike Team advisers. Indeed the Kage was meant to provide an alternative to the much-respected DEST Infiltration Suit for missions in which DEST teams could expect heavy opposition, and since production started in 3056 the battle armor has virtually replaced the older Sneak Suit. Quirk: Ambusher Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.886 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Kage [ECM]
details: The Kage (translating to "shadow" in japanese) light battle armor was one of the first battle armor designs produced by the Draconis Combine after the Truce of Tukayyid.
