name: Kanazuchi [STD]
details: The Kanazuchi, Japanese for 'hammer', is a Draconis Combine battle armor design, one of the heaviest to come from that realm. Quirk: Armored Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.896 Can only be transported by internal bays, can melee, can not swarm.

name: Katana CRK-5003-2
details:
In the CRK-5003-2's left torso is a LB-X Autocannon/10 which draws from a two-ton ammo bin in the right torso. A pair of Large Lasers split between both arms take the place of the extended-range versions found in the Crockett. For close-range combat the CRK-5003-2 carries two SRM-6s in either side torso, with two tons of reloads concentrated in the right side, and for point blank defense the 'Mech carries two Small Lasers mounted co-axially with the large lasers. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Katana CRK-5003-C
details:
A simple variant of the Katana introduced in 3057, the 5003-C variant is a modification intended to carry a C3 Slave unit into battle. In order to achieve this, the 'Mech has removed both of the small lasers from the chassis, freeing up the needed room for the slave unit and allowing the Katana to share targeting data with friendly units. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Katana CRK-5003-CM
details:
Introduced at the same time as the C variant, this modification is intended to carry a C3 Computer onto the battlefield to coordinate a C3 Lance. The CM variant does this by removing both of the small lasers and one of the SRM-6 launchers to make room for the master computer. This also allows the 'Mech to share targeting data with friendly units. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Katana CRK-50003-2OS
details:
A highly unusual version, the 50003-2OS is only found amongst mercenaries and in the periphery. No official sales was ever recorded of the variant, which makes it likely an unlicensed reproduction. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: King Crab KGC-0000
details: One of the most heavily armed and armored 'Mechs ever constructed, the King Crab 0000 is capable of massive burst damage. A pair of heavy, close-range Autocannons form its primary weaponry, backed up by ranged weaponry to fire as it closes distance. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: King Crab KGC-000
details: The King Crab's primary weapons are two massive Autocannon/20s, among the most powerful BattleMech weapons ever created. Each arm carries one of these massive weapons, and they are fed by two tons of ammo split between the side torsos. The firepower of these weapons is enough to destroy a medium 'Mech in one salvo. To protect the autocannons in combat, engineers designed the King Crab with simple hand actuators. In appearance and movement, the actuators are very similar to pincers or claws found on real crabs, a contributing factor to the 'Mech's name. To back up the autocannons, and provide some long-range capabilities, the King Crab carries a LRM-15 launcher, mounted in the left torso and fed by one ton of reloads in the same location, and a Large Laser in the right torso. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: King Crab KGC-000b
details: The King Crab-000b, the Star League's Royal variant, is every bit as powerful as its downgraded cousin, the -0000. Still armed with twin AC/20s, the -000b's double heat sinks and doubled ammo keeps the massive cannons firing far longer and more frequently making the -000b a true terror on the battlefield. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: King Crab KGC-0
details: The King Crab KGC-0 is a badly maintained primitive version of one of the most heavily armed and armored 'Mechs ever constructed. While carrying lesser weaponry, its arsenal still able to deliver a crushing Blow. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: King Crab KGC-001
details:
One of the so-called Clanbuster variants developed in 3052 during the lead-up to the Battle of Tukayyid, ComStar's techs replaced the twin autocannons with two M-7 Gauss Rifles and four tons of ammo in the arms, trading a minor reduction in destructive capacity for greatly increased range. While retaining the LRM launcher the large laser was upgraded to a Tronel XIII Large Pulse Laser and two Hovertec Streak SRM-2s, split between the side torsos with a single ton of reloads each, were added. These changes were accomplished by using an extralight engine in place of the standard model. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: King Crab KGC-002
details:
One of the most heavily armed and armored 'Mechs ever constructed, the King Crab 0002 variant mounts twin UAC/10 with MRM's. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: King Crab KGC-010
details:
This version of the King Crab was created by the Star League to be a command 'Mech and introduced alongside the original 000 model in 2743. Conceived in secret between Cosara and the Terran Hegemony, it was an attempt to produce a deadly command 'Mech by mounting a pair of newly-developed Hellstar Magna PPCs in either side torso backed by a pair of SRM-6s. A pair of newly developed LBX/10s replaced the standard autocannon. The 010 model was more than capable of taking down an Atlas, but the entire line left with Kerensky during the Exodus and even knowledge of the design's existence became lost during the Succession Wars. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: King Crab KGC-200
details: The King Crab 200 is a precursor to what would later become the 005. Rather than the two Streak SRM-4 launchers the 005 carries, the 200 instead mounts an ER PPC and adds slightly more armor. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Kingfisher A
details:
One of the earliest second generation OmniMech designs, the Kingfisher debuted in 2887 and is reputed to have influenced all subsequent Clan Assault OmniMech designs. A 90-ton mech powered by a 360-rated Fusion Engine, the Kingfisher has 24 tons of podspace provided by a combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and an Endo Steel skeleton. The Kingfisher A is armed with an LB-10X and an ER PPC. At closer ranges, the A can bring to bear an SRM-6, an ER Small Laser, an ER Medium laser and a Medium Pulse Laser. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kingfisher B
details:
One of the earliest second generation OmniMech designs, the Kingfisher debuted in 2887 and is reputed to have influenced all subsequent Clan Assault OmniMech designs. A 90-ton mech powered by a 360-rated Fusion Engine, the Kingfisher has 24 tons of podspace provided by a combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and an Endo Steel skeleton. The Kingfisher B is armed with a UAC/20 and an ER Large Laser. 5 ER Medium Lasers and an ER Small offer additional firepower, while an AMS helps defensively. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kingfisher C
details:
One of the earliest second generation OmniMech designs, the Kingfisher debuted in 2887 and is reputed to have influenced all subsequent Clan Assault OmniMech designs. A 90-ton mech powered by a 360-rated Fusion Engine, the Kingfisher has 24 tons of podspace provided by a combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and an Endo Steel skeleton. The Kingfisher C is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s. At closer ranges, the C can bring to bear 5 ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kingfisher D
details:
One of the earliest second generation OmniMech designs, the Kingfisher debuted in 2887 and is reputed to have influenced all subsequent Clan Assault OmniMech designs. A 90-ton mech powered by a 360-rated Fusion Engine, the Kingfisher has 24 tons of podspace provided by a combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and an Endo Steel skeleton. The Kingfisher D is armed with a trio of ER Large Lasers. At closer ranges, the D can bring to bear a UAC/10. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kingfisher F2
details:
An alternative configuration of the F designation that existed mainly in the design stages. The goal was to achieve a more flexible profile during engagements than the E configuration by combining three ATM 9 pods with 5 ER Medium Laser pods. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kingfisher H
details:
One of the earliest second generation OmniMech designs, the Kingfisher debuted in 2887 and is reputed to have influenced all subsequent Clan Assault OmniMech designs. A 90-ton mech powered by a 360-rated Fusion Engine, the Kingfisher has 24 tons of podspace provided by a combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and an Endo Steel skeleton. The Kingfisher H is armed with a pair of Heavy large Lasers. At closer ranges, the H can bring to bear 5 ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kingfisher Prime
details:
One of the earliest second generation OmniMech designs, the Kingfisher debuted in 2887 and is reputed to have influenced all subsequent Clan Assault OmniMech designs. A 90-ton mech powered by a 360-rated Fusion Engine, the Kingfisher has 24 tons of podspace provided by a combination of Ferro-Fibrous armor and an Endo Steel skeleton. The Kingfisher Prime is armed with a pair of Large Pulse Lasers and a LRM-10. At closer ranges, the Prime can bring to bear a Streak SRM-6, an ER Small Laser and a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kintaro KTO-18
details: The Kintaro 18 is a beast of a machine. It's fast for its size, mounts heavy armor, and can literally shred most other 'Mechs with its almost ridiculous amount of close-range weaponry. But, it runs hotter than Hell's saunas. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Kintaro KTO-18K
details: The Kintaro 18K is a beast of a machine. Still running hot does this Kurita refit carry a light PPC and Deadfire enhanced launcher for every engagement range. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Kintaro KTO-18S
details: This Marik refit of the Kintaro was built in cooperation with Holly as a testbed for Streak and NARC missiles. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Kintaro KTO-19
details: The Kintaro 19 is a beast of a machine. It's fast for its size, mounts heavy armor, and can literally shred most other 'Mechs with its almost ridiculous amount of Narc supported close-range weaponry. But, it runs hotter than Hell's saunas. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Kintaro KTO-19b
details: Introduced in 2587 for the SLDF, the Kintaro was designed with one sole mission: tagging enemy units with a Narc Missile Beacon. As such, it is a 'Mech that is intended to work in a team with a missile-heavy lance. The KTO-19b was an upgrade utilized by the Royal Brigades of the SLDF. It used an XL Engine and Double Heat Sinks to free up space to upgrade the KTO-19's LRM-5 launcher to a larger LRM-15 with two tons of CASE-protected ammunition. CASE was also added to the SRM ammo bins, with the leftover half ton devoted to more armor. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Kintaro KTO-20
details: The KTO-20, used to good effect in the War of 3039, was the slightly downgraded version of the KTO-19 given to the Draconis Combine by ComStar as part of Operation Rosebud. The KTO-20 was nearly identical to its Star League era cousin, the only real difference being the loss of the Narc Missile beacon in exchange for a Magna Mk III Large Laser. It was equipped with double heat sinks. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Kintaro KTO-21
details: Developed by both ComStar and the Word of Blake, the KTO-21 was the first 'Mech to utilize both the new Improved Narc Missile Beacon (iNarc for short) and the improved C3 computer system. In order to utilize these new systems, the KTO-21 was refitted with an Endo Steel chassis and carried half a ton less armor than the KTO-19. Retaining only the two SRM launchers, the LRM launcher was dropped and the standard medium lasers were upgraded to more advanced ER Medium Lasers, enhanced by a switch to Double Heat Sinks. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Kintaro KTO-C
details: A variant of the Combine's KTO-20, the KTO-C was one of the test bed 'Mechs for the C3 Slave Unit, one of the Medium Lasers being removed in order to free up the necessary weight. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Kintaro KTO-K
details: An upgrade to the KTO-C, the KTO-K removed the Large Laser and LRM launcher to upgrade the short-range missiles to Streak SRM-6s. The lasers were upgraded to ER Medium Lasers and a third was added. The most significant difference was the addition of Jump jets to allow the unit to leap up to 150 meters. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Kit Fox A
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox A is armed with a Gauss Rifle and 2 ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox B
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox B is armed with a UAC/10, SRM-6, ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox C
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox C is armed with an ER Large Laser. A Small Pulse Laser, a pair of Machine Guns and a pair of A-Pods provide protection at close range. 3 Anti Missile Systems, a TAG, Guardian ECM and an Active Probe round out the variant. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox D
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox D is armed with a pair of LRM-15’s, an LRM-5 and a Narc Beacon. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox E
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox E is armed with an ER PPC and an ATM-3. An ER Small Laser, and 6 Jump Jets round out the variant. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox E2
details:
The E2 configuration of the Kit Fox mounts one Large Pulse Laser in each arm, with a Stream SRM-4 launcher in the left torso as support. To fit the weapons the 'Mech drops two of the heat sinks, and as a result suffers from subpar cooling. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox F2
details:
An all energy configuration, the F2 has a total of four Medium Pulse Lasers, two residing in each arm. A single Small Pulse Laser helps deal with close range targets. The loadout also adds an ECM suite in the left torso. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox F3
details:
The main weapon of the F3 configuration is an ER PPC, with three ER Medium Lasers and one Medium Pulse Laser as support. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox G
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox G is armed with a ER Large Laser and a pair of LRM-10’s. An ER Medium Laser and a Guardian ECM Suite round out the variant. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox G2
details:
The G2 loadout combines three Medium with one Large Pulse Laser, while also adding an Active Probe. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox H
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox H is armed with a Gauss Rifle and 2 Heavy Medium Lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox J
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox J is armed with a UAC/5. A pair of ER Medium Lasers and a Streak SRM-2 make up the close range firepower. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox M1
details:
The M1 configuration drops the jump jets and the Endo Steel chassis is converted to standard specification. An Ultra AC/5 in the right arm is matched with a Stream SRM-4 launcher in the left, and one ER Medium Laser in each side torso. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox M2
details:
The M2 configuration adds the Jump Jets back that the M1 removed, but at the cost of downgrading the Streak SRM-4 to a Streak SRM-2. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox M3
details:
The M3 configuration is similar to the M1, but is able to add another Streak SRM-4 by keeping the Endo Steel chassis. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox Prime
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox Prime is armed with a LB/5X and an ER Large Laser. A Small Pulse Laser and a Streak SRM-4 round out the variant. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox S
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox S is armed with a Large Pulse Laser and a Streak SRM-4. A Medium Pulse Laser, Small Pulse Laser and a pair of Machine Guns complement this. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox V
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox V is armed with an Arrow IV. A pair of ER Small Lasers provide close range firepower. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox W
details:
A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of firepower and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox W is armed with paired Large and Medium Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kit Fox XP
details:
This XP configuration mounts a UAC/5 as its primary weapon in the left arm, backed up by an SRM-4 in each arm and three ER medium lasers. For anti-infantry work and increased close-range firepower, the 'Mech mounts a machine gun in each torso. A laser AMS in the right arm supplements the defensive capabilities of this configuration. All ammo-dependent weapons have one ton of ammunition allocated. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Kodiak 1
details: A fast moving assault ’Mech, the Kodiak was originally designed by Clan Ghost Bear as a second-line mech and represents the epitome of Ghost Bear thinking: mostly defensive but capable of surprising speed and a devastating attack when launched. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

name: Kodiak 5
details: This variant is a dedicated close range brawler. Adding three more heat sinks helps keep it cool as it employs nine ER Medium Lasers and two ER Large Lasers. The Gauss Rifle remains in the right torso. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

name: Kodiak Protoype 'Ghost Bear'
details: A prototype of the late stages of design of what would eventually become the Kodiak. Main differences are a slightly different armor profile to the production version, weapons are a mix of what eventually be the primary and fifth loadout configuration, a combination of a Gauss Rifle, nine ER Lasers and two Streak SRM-6 launchers. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

name: Kodiak Prototype 1
details:
One of two early concept models for the Kodiak. With the prototype being only 85 ton, it has considerably less armor and a smaller engine. It also contains less powerful weapons, with a single LB-X AC/10 being the main weapon, two ER PPC as support and a LRM-10 for indirect fire. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Kodiak Prototype 2
details:
The second version of the 85 ton prototype by Clan Ghost Bear before the final design at 100 tons was finalized. The main difference was the attempt to not have to use an XL Engine by use of a smaller 255-rated engine core. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Komodo IIC
details:
The Komodo IIC mounts a total of ten Medium Pulse Lasers, for an surprising amount of damage if they all manage to hit its target. An AMS protects the 'Mech from incoming missiles while a basic ECM provides rudimentary electronic warfare protection. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Komodo KIM-2
details: The Komodo was designed in 3053 to hunt and kill Clan Elemental Battle Armor. The 'Mech is built to be able to catch up to and destroy them with exceptional speed and maneuverability. The 'Mech is powered by a VOX 225 XL Engine that propels the 'Mech to a maximum speed of 86.4 km/h. The Komodo can jump up to one hundred and fifty meters allowing it to traverse just about any terrain with ease, and is armored with seven and a half tons of armor. The 'Mech is also equipped with a Matabushi Guardian ECM Suite to defend against any enemy electronic warfare systems and also a Forward-1 TAG allowing the Komodo to designate a target for an Arrow IV artillery strike. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Koto KT-2A
details: Custom built from discarded Locust wrecks, the Koto is a 25-ton mech built exclusively for the Solaris 7 arenas by Omnitech Industries. Sharing the same basic shape as it’s parent design the Koto is extensively rebuilt with an Endo Steel skeleton, Ferro-Fibrous armor, double heat sinks and an XL Engine. Weighing 5 tons heavier then the Locust, the Koto has a significantly heavier weapons array; built for annihilating opponents in the arena. The Koto 2A is armed with a Large X-Pulse Laser, 2 ER Medium Lasers and an ER Small Laser. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Lancelot LNC25-01X
details:
This prototype Lancelot variant was produced by Krupp prior to Amaris' seizure of Terra. An upgrade of the LNC25-01, it uses an Endo-Steel chassis and Ferro-fibrous armor. The weapons array is same, except the large lasers are Extended Range Type and four jump jets are added for mobility. Early field tests revealed that the inclusion of jump jets did little to improve the design, with most pilots requesting either more armoring or more heat sinks instead. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Lancelot LNC25-02
details:
The Lancelot did not survive the loss of Star League technology as well as most of its older cousins. Manufactured by Luthien Armor Works from their huge plant on Luthien, the 02 retained the same weapons array though with different models: a Lord's Light PPC, two Sunglow Heavy Lasers, and a Victory 23R Medium Laser. This came at the expense however of a smaller Pitban 240 fusion engine and nineteen single heat sinks. With a new maximum speed of only 64.8 km/h the thin-skinned Lancelot made for an easy target for other 'Mechs of its weight class, and the less efficient heat dissipation system made it unable to unleash its full firepower safely and consistently; firing both large lasers and the PPC at the same time now entailed risking a shutdown from overheating. LAW also had to replace the Krupp electronics used in the Star League variants, installing a Sipher KIT-4 communications system and a Hawkeye B3 targeting and tracking system. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Lineholder KW1-LH2
details:
The Lineholder was the first BattleMech design to come from Kressly Warworks. The Lineholder is designed around a set of Common Sense Rules for 'Mech design. This approach has produced a 'Mech with a good ground speed and respectable amount of armor and firepower. The 'Mech has a top speed of 86.4 km/h, allowing it to keep up with all but the fastest light and medium 'Mechs. The Lineholder also carries ten tons of armor protection and has fourteen heat sinks. Its mix of off-the-shelf weapons and equipment makes the Lineholder a reliable 'Mech that is easy to repair and is dependable in battle. However, the ultimate selling point for the Lineholder, especially to its target audience of small units and minor nobles, is value and price. In the first year of sales, the Lineholder was historically successful compared with other 55-ton BattleMechs. For minor factions able to afford brand new BattleMechs, the Lineholder has become the garrison machine of choice. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

Achernar BattleMechs already produces the Locust, Wasp, Phoenix Hawk and the Enforcer at their headquarters on New Avalon. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.82

details:
Developed by Majesty Metals in 3056 to produce an upgraded Locust model for the MAF, the Locust 3P is based on the original LCT-1V and swaps the Machine Guns for Small Lasers. The Medium Laser is upgraded to a Pulse model and armor protection increased through the use of Ferro-Fibrous armor. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

details:
The 3S Locust, constructed on Furillo by Defiance Industries in 3049, carried the 1S upgrade further. This time, as with the 3M, the structure used Endo Steel and the armor was upgraded with Ferro-Fibrous. The SRM-2s were upgraded to Coventry T4H Streak SRM-2s while the medium laser was kept Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

details:
Based on the earlier 3P model, the Locust 3T is produced by Pinard Protectorates. Introduced in 3059, the LCT-3T is a near clone of the 3P with identical levels of armor protection. Pinards engineers chose to swap the Medium Pulse Laser and 2 Small Lasers for a trio of Medium lasers for increased firepower. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

details:
The Locust 3V trades off protection for more firepower, relying on its superior speed to avoid getting hit in the first place. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

An anti-infantry variant of the Locust, the 4M mounts eight Small and one Medium Laser. To deal with the heat, the cooling uses double Heat Sinks. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

details:
A Clan-tech retrofit of the classic Locust and intended for second-line and solahma troops, the Locust C replaced each of the arm-mounted Machine Guns with a Clan ER Small Laser which frees up the weight to replace the center Medium Laser with a Clan-grade Medium Pulse Laser but leaves the structural components of the LCT-1V unaltered. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

name: Longbow LGB-0C
details:
The original Longbow built in 2480, carried twin LRM-20s each with three tons of ammunition, supported by two Medium Lasers and a Small Laser. The Primitive Technology used limited the design's top speed to 54 km/h, but this was deemed acceptable for a fire support unit. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Longbow LGB-0W
details:
To add some speed to the Longbow, the OW variant removes two Medium Lasers and five and a half tons of armor. This allowed the 255 Fusion Engine to be replaced with a larger 340, increasing the top speed of the Longbow to 64 km/h, allowing the 'Mech to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs. The -0W is otherwise the same as the -7Q variant. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Longbow LGB-0W2
details:
A refit of the original -OW, the -OW2 is mostly similar, but instead of a head mounted Small Laser and with one ton of ammo less the armor protection is instead increased. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Longbow LGB-7Q
details:
The Longbow, introduced in 2480, has seen service in the armies of the Inner Sphere since the days of the Star League and is one of the most well-known fire support 'Mechs in existence. As a fire-support 'Mech though, the Longbow is a trusted and reliable machine that can be counted on to carry out the mission it is designed for. The primary weapons on the Longbow are its LRM launchers, four in all, a pair of 20s and a pair of 5s, letting the Longbow put out 50 LRMs into any target it can see. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Longbow LGB-7V
details:
The 7V variant of the Longbow upgrades the design to more modern specifications. The 'Mech is powered by an XL engine that weighs half as much as the original engine. The 'Mech also removes the two LRM-5 launchers and adds Artemis IV to the LRM-20 launchers, and CASE for added protection. For close combat, the 7V has 5 Medium Pulse Lasers. To add a little more long range firepower, the 7V has also has an ER Large Laser. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Longbow LGB-7W
details:
An uncommon variant of the Longbow that mounts an Arrow IV artillery in each arm. A head mounted TAG helps with aquiring targets, and two ER Medium Lasers are available for defense. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Longbow LGB-8C
details:
The Longbow LGB-8C mounts two LRM-20 and two LRM-5 launchers, combined with 4 Medium Lasers. The -8C carries a total of 22 heat sinks, but it still isn't enough to cover the heat generated from full alpha strikes. Five tons of LRM ammo rounds up the design. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Longbow LGB-10C
details:
The -10C is a refresh of the -8C, converting it to use more advanced technology. By changing to double heat sinks, 8 tons of cooling can be dropped while still improving the performance. The freed tons are used to add Artemis IV capabilities to all the LRM launchers, replacing the lasers with their extended range counterpart and adding CASE protection to the side torso. Another ton of ammo was also added, while keeping the same level of armoring. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Longbow LGB-12C
details:
A Star League era fire support platform, the Longbow is an 85 ton Assault Mech and one of the most used fire support mechs in existence. The LGB-12C is armed with paired LRM-20 and LRM-15 launchers, supported by a trio of ER Small Lasers. A 255-rated XL Engine, DHS and 12.5 tons of armor round out the design. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Longbow LGB-12U
details:
An attempt to create the ultimate missile platform based on the Longbow chassis, the -12U mounts four Artemis IV enabled LRM-20 launchers and 10 tons of ammunition. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Longbow LGB-OW
details:
The confusingly named -OW variant of the Longbow is despite its similarity in designation with the more common variant -0W not actually based of it. Instead the -OW - or as it is commonly referred to due to its often garrison duties, the OverWatch - is a refit of the standard -7Q, adding two more Medium Lasers by dropping two tons of LRM ammunition. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Though they were unable to match the original Clan-tech machine, the Longinus came the closest of any Inner Sphere attempt at the time, thanks in part to the help of the Word of Blake. Quirk: Well Designed Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Longshot LNG-1B
details:
The original Longshot comes equipped with a Narc missile beacon system, dual SRM-6 racks, a pair of medium lasers, and a pair of small lasers. Instead of the LNG-2's reactive armor, it was instead protected by six tons of standard armor. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Lupus A
details:
This configuration was used for direct fire support roles. A Large Pulse Laser in one arm supported an Ultra AC/10 in the other. A pair of ER Medium Lasers gave the Lupus A additional firepower in case the 'Mech went through all 30 reloads for the autocannon. Twelve double heat sinks kept the heat manageable. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Lupus B
details:
This version also used an autocannon, but it was a massive LB 20-X AC with three tons of ammunition. This was supported by a pair each of Medium Pulse Lasers, ER Small Lasers, and ER Medium Lasers. This variant carried eleven double heat sinks. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Lupus Prime
details:
The primary configuration of the Lupus replaces the Archer and Bombardier 'Mechs. A pair of LRM-20 launchers with improved Artemis IV guidance systems allows the warrior to destroy a foe before they can reach close range. The Lupus Prime also carries a set of jump jets which allowed a smart warrior the opportunity to hold the range open, bombarding the enemy with heavy missile barrages. The only drawback is the limited ammunition supply: A mere three tons of ammunition allows for only a brief engagement. Should the enemy close with the Lupus all is not lost. The ER Medium Laser in each arm allow the Lupus to slice off armor, and the ECM Suite makes the Lupus Prime more difficult to target. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Lynx LNX-8Q
details:
A hard hitting striker mech, the Lynx was one of the first mechs to mount an ER PPC. Produced by Blue Shot Weapons, the Lynx was designed as a striker mech, with a design that blended speed, armor and firepower into a fearsome package. Built around a 275-rated Fusion Core, the Lynx LNX-8Q is armed with a pair of Large Lasers. A pair of Medium Lasers provide close range firepower. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Lynx C
details:
An evolution of the Star League Lynx, the Lynx C was an early Smoke Jaguar mech. Pushed out of front line service by the newly developed Omnimechs, the Lynx C was relegated to garrison and Solahma units with significant numbers of Lynx C’s still in service during the Word of Blake Jihad. Retaining the 275 XL Engine of the original Lynx, the Lynx C is a full clan tech rebuild of the older Star League design. An ER PPC is paired with an ER Large Laser and a Large Pulse Laser. A pair of ER Medium Lasers and a ER Small Laser provide close range firepower. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Mackie MSK-5S
details:
The initial prototype Mackie was designated the MSK-5S, and carried a slightly different weapons load than the production model MSK-6S. Using an Autocannon/5 in the right arm instead of the AC/10, the MSK-5S also mounted a Large Laser in the center torso, rather than the twin Medium Lasers, and had two more heat sinks. Twenty tons of Primitive Armor protected the first generation Mackie. This armor, though heavier, provided less protection than later models. The MSK-5S was used by Colonel Kincaid in his now-famous combat trial versus the Merkava tanks. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Mackie MSK-5U
details:
An update of the Mackie mounting a combination of weapons for various situations; an AC-20, a Large Laser, a PPC, five Machine Guns and two Medium Lasers. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Mackie MSK-6S
details:
Developed by the Terran Hegemony in the 25th century, the Mackie was the first true BattleMech. Based on advanced technology that the Hegemony Armed Forces (HAF) had been developing for decades under Director-General Jacob Cameron, the Mackie was the ultimate manifestation of Hegemony military might. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Mackie MSK-6S2
details:
The Mackie 6S2 is a prime example of the patchwork mechs of the Deep Periphery. Battered and rusting, these Mackies are in a shoddy state of repair, maintained by people with neither the skills nor the resources for anything better than rudimentary patch jobs. The original AC/10 has been removed and replaced with a locally made knock off of the classic Thumper artillery piece, whilst the delicate PPC has been replaced with a Large Laser. Never seen in the Inner Sphere, these Mackies are found in the deepest parts of the Periphery, their existence only confirmed by the expeditions of the Explorer Corps. Other variants are rumoured to exist, but have not been confirmed at this time. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Mackie MSK-7A
details:
Onee of multiple variants emerged from factories with an "MSK-7#" designation. Dating to the late 2400s, these variants utilized powerful autocannons and energy weapons. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Mackie MSK-8B
details:
This catchall series of Mackies was used to designate -6S's retrofitted with a wide variety of more modern components. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Mackie MSK-9H
details:
Though most nations got rid of their cloned Mackies in favor of their own 'Mechs, the Hegemony was proud of their achievement. Moreover, many Hegemony militia units made extensive use of the first BattleMech, resulting in a continuous production of the first BattleMech right up until the Amaris Coup. Many of the various militia upgrades coalesced into the -9H, helped by the fact that Skobel continued to produce small quantities of this design. It mounts two PPCs and an Autocannon/20, backed up by the pair of Medium Lasers. Nineteen tons of armor gave it full protection, allowing the 9Hs longevity. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Mackie MSK-9Hb
details:
Built during the Amaris civil war, the Mackie 9Hb was a stopgap attempt to solve the SLDF's sudden dearth of advanced assault mechs. By taking Mackie 9H's from the remaining Hegemony stockpiles and upgrading them with surplus parts, the SLDF hoped to create a multi role assault mech for rear echelon and support duties; potentially freeing up better equipped machines that could be used on the frontlines. Equipped with 2 Thumper Artillery pieces and a cockpit command console, the 9Hb functions as both a command mech and an Artillery support platform. Though this design functions well as a support unit, it performs poorly in direct combat. Particularly devastating is the lack of CASE around the ammo magazines, a consequence of the rushed design process. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Mackie MSK-9Hc
details:
A refit developed with Comstar’s mothballed 9Hb’s, the Mackie 9Hc was an attempt to fix the failings of it’s predecessor design. Identifying the lack of CASE and adequate secondary weapons as the key weaknesses, the Comguard designers searched for a solution. The designers made the decision to slow the 'Mech's top speed even further as the preferred option. With the additional weight, both ammo magazines were upgraded with CASE and the designers installed an additional 3 Medium Lasers with the heat sinks upgraded to double strength models to handle the increased heat. The 5 completed prototypes served with distinction on Tukayyid, though the design never reached production status; with only 2 other conversions finished before the Word of Blake seized Terra and the remaining stocks of 9Hb’s. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Mackie MSK-10E
details:

details:
An alternate base loadout for the Mad Dog, focused on pure Pulse Laser performance. Two Large and four Medium Pulse Lasers combined with a Targetting Computer and cooled by 16 double heat sinks makes it meet the intended design goal with ease. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Mad Dog Prime
details:
The Mad Dog is a heavy Clan OmniMech used for long-range indirect fire support. With hunched shoulders, a protruding head, and reverse-jointed legs, the Mad Dog resembles a vulture, so much so that it was codenamed Vulture by the Inner Sphere forces which first encountered it. The Mad Dog’s most distinctive feature is its side torso and arm pods, which are practically full modules by themselves, suggesting that the mech was conceived as a long-range support unit. The torso modules, angled high, are ideal for missiles while the arms serve as extended turrets suited for direct-fire weaponry. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Mad Dog S
details:
Designed primarily as a fire support Mech, the Vulture emphasizes speed and firepower over armor. The 60 ton OmniMech is powered by a 300-rated XL Engine with Ferro-Fibrous Armor; giving the OmniMech, 28 tons of pod space. The Vulture S is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s and a trio of Medium Pulse Lasers. An Active Probe allows the Vulture to function as a scout, while 5 Jump Jets improve it’s mobility. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

details:
A special loadout used by Wolf's Dragoons, the famous mercenary unit with clan ties. Used as a command 'Mech it carries a C3 master unit, but still has enough space to mount two ER Large Lasers and two Medium Lasers combined with two Streak SRM-6 launchers. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Mad Dog WDR2
details:
A loadout used by Wolf's Dragoons, the famous mercenary unit with clan ties. Mounting two ER Large Lasers and two Medium Lasers combined with two Streak SRM-6 launchers and seven extra double heat sinks for cooling. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Maelstrom MTR-5K
details:
The Maelstrom was originally designed to carry on legacy of the Marauder, with its hunched-over profile and the unique ball-and-socket construction. The collapse of the Star League doomed the project and left the Maelstrom on the drawing board. With the discovery of the Helm Memory Core by the GDL, the plans for the Maelstrom were also rediscovered and production was started in the Inner Sphere. The Maelstrom is built using a weight-saving 375 XL engine that propels the 'Mech up to 86.4 km/h. For protection, the Maelstrom carries 14.5 tons of armor and uses 19 double heat sinks to handle the 'Mech's heavy heat load. The armament of the Maelstrom is a Defiance 1001 ER PPC paired up with a Cyclops XII ER Large Laser. For close combat, the Maelstrom carries two Defiance P5M Medium Pulse Lasers and a Jackson Model 12 Small Laser. Finally, the Maelstrom carries a TAG laser designator. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Maelstrom 'Redback'
details:
Created by Clan Widowmaker in the Golden Century, it carries an Enhanced ER PPC and a standard Clan ER Large Laser. The small laser has been replaced by a prototype ER Medium Laser. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Mandrill 1
details: Over a third of the Mandrill's tonnage is devoted to a pair of LRM-20 launchers and their attendant ammunition, which is limited, but usually enough for duels. The head-mounted ER small laser is something of an afterthought, though it does allow Mandrills to keep fighting after they run out of ammo. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Mantis MTS-S
details: Debuting in 3052, the Mantis is a light mech designed for the Mech arenas on Solaris VII. A 30-ton Mech, the Mantis is powered by a 270-rated XL Engine, giving it the speed to outrun or out-maneuver almost any other Mech. The Mantis MTS-S is armed with 3 ER Medium Lasers and a pair of ER Small Lasers. MASC and a pair of Claws allow it to tear apart other Mechs. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Mantis SA-MN
details: Debuting in 3052, the Mantis is a light mech designed for the Mech arenas on Solaris VII. A 30-ton Mech, the Mantis is powered by a 270-rated XL Engine, giving it the speed to outrun or out-maneuver almost any other Mech. The Mantis SA-MN is armed with a pair of Small Lasers and a Medium Laser. MASC and a pair of Claws allow it to tear apart other Mechs. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Marauder II MAD-2K
details:
The Marauder II was first built in 3012 in an attempt to take the firepower of the Marauder and combine it with the reliability and ruggedness of an assault chassis. This Variant was captured and rebuilt by Kurita to carry 2 Heavy and 2 Light PPC. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder II MAD-4A
details:
The Marauder II was first built in 3012 in an attempt to take the firepower of the Marauder and combine it with the reliability and ruggedness of an assault chassis. This was achieved by generally upgrading the entire 'Mech's chassis to allow it to carry a much heavier armor and weapons load. The 'Mech was then armored with nineteen tons of armor, giving it protection that rivals that of the Atlas. Finally, to make up for the reduced mobility of the Marauder II, the 'Mech was outfitted with jump jets that give it a jumping capability of up to ninety meters. Blackwell Heavy Industries produced the design exclusively for Wolf's Dragoons until the end of the Fourth Succession War, when Jaime Wolf allowed them to sell to others. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder II MAD-4B
details:
The Marauder II was first built in 3012 in an attempt to take the firepower of the Marauder and combine it with the reliability and ruggedness of an assault chassis. This variant of the Marauder II, the -4B, is a rare introtech variant that carries a ballistic-heavy loadout while maintaining the -4A's armor and speed profile. The -4B carries a pair of AC/10s for its main firepower with 4 tons of ammo while a Large Laser and a pair of Medium Lasers back the autocannons up. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder II MAD-4HB
details:
While the standard Marauder II, the MAD-5A, was built to spec for the Wolf's Dragoons to be a line combat unit and a traditional assault mech, the MAD-4HB is only one step removed from being a pirate design. Constructed by pirates after stealing a shipment of Marauder IIs meant for someone else, they removed the fancy equipment they couldn't maintain and filled in the holes with a frankly ungodly number of rockets, allowing the -4HB a punch that can instantly delete lesser mechs and even seriously damage mechs of its own caliber. After the rockets though, the -4HB has little firepower for an assault mech. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder II MAD-5A
details:
Appearing in 3012, the Marauder II is a redesign of the classic Marauder, turning the 75 ton Heavy Mech into a 100 ton Assault. Originally a Wolf's Dragoons exclusive Mech, it wasn’t until after the 4th War of Succession in 3030 that the Mech would spread beyond the Dragoons. Powered by a 300-rated XL Engine, the Marauder II MAD-5A is armed with an LB-10X, paired ER PPC’s and Medium Lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder II MAD-5B
details:
Appearing in 3012, the Marauder II is a redesign of the classic Marauder, turning the 75 ton Heavy Mech into a 100 ton Assault. Originally a Wolf's Dragoons exclusive Mech, it wasn’t until after the 4th War of Succession in 3030 that the Mech would spread beyond the Dragoons. Powered by a 300-rated Fusion Core, the Marauder II MAD-5B is armed with a Gauss Rifle, paired ER PPC’s and Medium Lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder II MAD-5C
details:
Appearing in 3012, the Marauder II is a redesign of the classic Marauder, turning the 75 ton Heavy Mech into a 100 ton Assault. Originally a Wolf's Dragoons exclusive Mech, it wasn’t until after the 4th War of Succession in 3030 that the Mech would spread beyond the Dragoons. Powered by a 300-rated XL Engine, the Marauder II MAD-5C is armed with a UAC/5, paired ER PPC’s and Medium Lasers. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder II MAD-5V
details:
The Maruder II MAD-5V is mainly seen amongst mercenary outfits, as it is one of the cheapest and most accessible variants of the Marauder II. A LBX AC/10 and two ER PPC are the main damage sources, with two Medium Lasers as backup. The design also includes CASE protection, a Beagle active probe and a Guardian ECM suite. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder II MAD-6W
details:
Used by the Wolf's Dragoons, the 6W is a full Clan technology conversion of the Marauder II. Besides the two ER PPC, two Large Pulse Lasers and the LBX AC/10, the variant also brings a C3 slave unit. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder IIC 1
details:
Built around the Extended Range Particle Projector Cannon, one of the most powerful weapons in the Clan arsenal, the Marauder IIC's weapon layout is typical of the standard Marauder, each pod-like forearm carrying an ER PPC paired with Medium Pulse Lasers. Where the Marauder IIC differs is with its torso weaponry, replacing the top-mounted autocannon and its vulnerable ammunition-feed linkage with another ER PPC, and adding a set of four ER Small Lasers. Twenty-one double heat sinks keep heat levels manageable, with an enterprising MechWarrior able to use volley fire to keep up a steady barrage of fire. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder IIC 8
details:
Introduced back in 3025 but unknown to Inner Sphere intelligence forces until the Jihad era, this older version replaces the ER PPC found in the left arm with the Medium Pulse Laser from the right arm. An LRM-10 with a ton of ammunition is added to the left torso and the ER Small Lasers in the center and right torsos are replaced with a single Medium Pulse Laser in each. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder IIC 9
details:
This variant uses the ER PPCs of the standard Marauder IIC but replaces the short range weapons with two Streak SRM-4s, one in the center torso and one in the right torso. These missile launchers share a single ton of ammunition. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder IIC A
details:
A modern Clan take on the classic Succession Wars era MAR-3R Marauder, the A variant retains the arm-mounted weaponry of the standard Marauder IIC, removing the torso-mounted ER PPC and ER Small Lasers in exchange for a LB 5-X AC in its right torso supplied with single ton of ammo. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-1R
details:
The Marauder is among the most classic of all Mech designs, venerable, powerful, respected. However, the original Marauder, the -1R, is mostly forgotten today. Clad in Ferro-Fibroous armor, it is otherwise the same as the downgraded -3R and is just as formidable. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-2R
details:
The Marauder-2R is the Star League Royal regiments variant of the classic and powerful Marauder. It makes minimal changes, simply upgrading the PPCs to ER PPCs and the heat sinks to doubles, but those changes are enough to give the -2R much better staying and hitting power. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-2R-CE
details:
This Early Clan upgrade of the SLDF's Marauder 2R replaces the AC/5 with a prototype Ultra AC/2 and both ER PPCs with Clan Wolverine's Enhanced ER PPC. Everything else on the 'Mech remains the same as the original Royal variant. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-3D
details:
The 3D Marauder was a modification of the 'Mech introduced for House Davion in 2834 which removed its ammunition dependency. In order to do this, the 3D replaced the Autocannon/5 and with a Large Laser. The saved weight was used to add four more heat sinks to the 'Mech to handle the added heat burden from the large laser. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-3DR
details:
A battlefield refit of the Marauder MAD-3D, which adds both considerable more armor and a C3 slave unit by switching to Double Heat Sinks. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-3G
details:
A Marauder variant update on a Clan tech base, designed and primarily used by the Grey Death Legion mercenary forces. Two ER PPC and a single Ultra AC/5 are the main damage dealers, with two secondary Medium Pulse Lasers as support. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-3K
details:
The -3K is a custom Clan tech variant of the Marauder fielded by the Kell Hounds. It centers around a Gauss Rifle in the Right Torso and two ER PPC, one in each arm. Two Medium Pulse Lasers provide extra firepower as needed. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-3L
details:
Built for House Liao in 2905, the 3L attempted to make the Marauder more heat efficient (and make up for a shortage in reliable PPCs) by replacing one of the arm-mounted particle cannons with a large laser. Additionally, two more heat sinks were added to further increase the Marauder's heat efficiency. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-3M
details:
The 3M was introduced in 2873 specially for the Free Worlds League. Because of the abundance of large lasers built by that realm, the 3M model carried two large lasers in place of the PPCs. While running cooler than the weapons they replaced, the large lasers also caused slightly less damage. Additionally, the 3M added four heat sinks to the design, making the 'Mech much more manageable for pilots who have trouble with overheating their 'Mechs. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-3R
details:
The Marauder was first built by General Motors in 2612 for use as an attack and direct fire support BattleMech. The first 'Mech to diverge from the traditional humanoid shape of previous machines, the Marauder was one of the most well-known 'Mechs in existence and originally meant to usher in a new generation of 'Mechs. Unfortunately, with the fall of the Star League, this new generation never quite materialized. On its own merits though, the Marauder was a devastatingly powerful 'Mech, outclassed only by larger machines like the Stalker and BattleMaster. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-3RR
details:
A common refit of the 3R. By upgrading to Double Heat Sinks both more weapons and better protection could be added to the design. A C3 slave was also part of the additions. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-3S
details:
Built for the budget conscious mercenary, the 3S is designed for prolonged operations and utilises an all energy loadout that is cheaper to maintain than the standard 3R; whilst using widely available components cuts down on repair costs. The maintenance intensive Autocannon and it’s infamously bad ammunition feed are replaced with an extra trio of Medium Lasers and 6 heat sinks, dramatically increases the amount of time the mech can go without resupply. The extra heat sinking helps offset the increased heat profile added by the lasers, whilst the increased number of medium lasers act as a strong deterrent to any lighter mechs seeking to get inside the PPC’s firing arc. Debuting in 2955, production has remained steady; with two dozen of these machines being built a year at the General Motors Kathil facility. Sold exclusively to the mercenary market, the 3S is a common site on worlds like Outreach and Galatia and remains a favorite of mercenaries everywhere despite it's age. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-3T
details:
The 3T is an uncommon variant of the Marauder, with its full energy build of four ER Large Lasers it tends to overheat easily even with 22 double heat sinks. The variant never saw any greater acceptance with MechWarriors due to this. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Marauder MAD-3W
details:
The 3W was used with the Wolf's Dragoons mercenary outfit as a command mech. Even though it looks like a normal Marauder on the outside, most of its internal have been replaced by Clan grade technology. The weapons consist of two ER PPC, one Large and two Medium Pulse Lasers, and a C3 Master unit is mounted in the left torso. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-4D
details:
The Marauder 4D is, despite its variant name starting with a 4, not based on the Marauder II chassis, but the original Marauder. It combines two ER PPC with four ER Medium Lasers and a single Large Pulser Laser. A TAG is further mounted in the head. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-4T
details:
Born of a collaboration between Majesty Metals and Taurus Territorial Industries, the Marauder MAD-4T is an upgrade package for the standard Marauder MAD-3R. Largely identical to the MAD-3R, the 4T swaps the standard SHS for 14 DHS. The remaining 2 tons are devoted to a CASE protected ammo bay for the autocannon and a Beagle Active Probe sourced from the Cappellans. Intended as a bodyguard Mech for Command Lances, the MAD-4T is marketed as a cheaper alternative to the newer Marauder variants appearing in the Inner Sphere. Approved for limited export by both the Magistracy and the Concordant, the MAD-4T is starting to spread to customers through out the Periphery. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-4X
details:
This experimental variant was made at Ronin Incorporated's facility on Wallis in 3039. Techs removed the standard weaponry from a Marauder and replaced the arm mounted weapons with a Binary Laser Cannon in each arm, while the torso mounted autocannon was replaced by twin SRM-6 launchers backed by one ton of ammunition. The Marauder-4X was also noteworthy because it used a Prototype Endo Steel chassis. To keep the heat under control, technicians installed twelve single heat sinks and six prototype Double Heat Sinks. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-5CS
details:
A Clan Buster upgrade, the Marauder 5CS was developed specifically for Tukayyid. More or less an upgrade package for the Marauder 3R, the 5CS used Star League era technology to improve it’s effectiveness against the Clans, while being designed to be for new pilots to use. Powered by a 300-rated XL Engine with DHS, the Marauder 5CS is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s, a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and an LB-10X. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-5D
details:
The 5D Marauder was the first updated variant to be designed in the wake of the Helm Memory Core recovery. A direct upgrade of the 3D model, the 5D's engine was replaced with a 300 XL engine, retaining the same speed profile at a much-reduced weight, to allow the entire weapons payload to be stripped out and upgraded. The 5D's primary weapons were two ER PPCs, carried in either arm, supported by a Large Pulse Laser in place of the autocannon. The medium lasers were replaced with two Medium Pulse Lasers, while a Streak SRM-2 launcher was also added to the left torso, along with one ton of CASE-protected ammo, for more close-range firepower. The model was protected by fourteen tons of armor, and carried sixteen double heat sinks for heat management. It also had a jumping capability of up to 120 meters thanks to four jump jets mounted in its legs. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-5D-DC
details:
A command version of the MAD-5D. It strips out the Streak launcher, ammunition, CASE, and one heat sink to make room for a Command Console. The rest of the design remains the same. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-5M
details:
The 5M variant of the Marauder was introduced in 3051 by Ronin Inc. and Free Worlds Defense Industries for the Free Worlds League. Compared to the original it replaced the standard fusion engine with an XL Engine and completely re-armed the 'Mech with recovered Star League-era weapons. The primary weapons were two Large Pulse Lasers, backed up by two Medium Pulse Lasers, in either arm. Finally, in place of the Autocannon/5, the 5M carried a LB-X Autocannon/10. The 5M had a jumping distance of up to one hundred and twenty meters thanks to four jump jets mounted in the legs and carried sixteen double heat sinks. One ton of ammunition for the LB-X was carried in the left torso and protected by CASE. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-5R2
details:
The Marauder 5R2 is an export model for the Periphery market. It was constructed on the same line as the 5R, but with much cheaper components, in an attempt to sell based on the relation to the actual 5R alone. Its weapons consist of only three Large and two Medium standard lasers, its cooling is using single heat sinks and the engine is a standard 300 rated core. Overall, the design is pretty much very subpar for a Marauder, but a number of 5R2 were produced and sold before this was fully realized. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-5S
details:
The 5S variant of the Marauder dates to the Clan Invasion, introduced in 3051 by Bowie Industries after the Draconis Combine captured plans for the 5D design. The variant was built around an XL engine to save weight and upgraded the heat sinks to double-strength models. Like the 5D, the 5S carried ER PPCs and medium pulse lasers, but replaced the autocannon with a Gauss Rifle. One ton of ammunition for this powerful, long-ranged weapon was carried in the left torso. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder C
details:
A Clan-tech retrofit of the classic MAD-3R Marauder, designed for use by second-line garrison and solahma forces, the Marauder C replaced some of the Inner Spheroid weaponry with Clan equivalents. The Marauder C swapped the PPCs for a pair of Clan-tech Large Pulse Lasers and the standard autocannon for a Ultra AC/5 model, but retained the IS medium lasers. The munitions for the autocannon were also protected with CASE. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Marauder MAD-NAIS-WC
details:
A variant designed by the New Avalon Institute of Science as part of the Worst Case initiative. The right arm carries an Extended Range Particle Projection Cannon and two Medium Lasers. The left arm has two Medium Lasers as well, but the ER PPC was swapped out for an ER Large Laser. The usual AC/5 was replaced by the newly invented Gauss Rifle. With its smaller range, but a much larger hitting power, this change may be the most important. The Marauder's mobility was also upgraded by the addition of four jump jets. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Masauwu 1
details:
Developed by Clan Coyote as a dueling machine, scientists used an Endo Steel chassis as a base. It also carries an XL engine and sixteen double heat sinks. Four jump jets allowed it to jump one hundred twenty meters at a time. The right arm carried an LB 10-X and the left arm carried a pair of Large Pulse Lasers. The right and left torsos had a Streak SRM-2 to capitalize on the damage inflicted by the heavier weapons. The right torso had an anti-missile system, while an ER small laser was mounted in the opposite torso. The AMS and Streaks each had one ton of ammunition and the LB 10-X had three tons of ammo. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Mauler MAL-1P
details:
The MAL-1P utilizes just about the same weapons as stock maulers, except this version carries a PPC in each arm. It retains both LRMs, downgrading these from the LRM-15s to LRM-10s, and keeps the MAL-1R's four Autocannon/2s. A extra-light 270 engine keeps it moving and eleven Double Heat Sinks keep the heat at bay. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Mauler MAL-1R
details:
The Mauler is armed with four Imperator Smoothie-2 Autocannon/2s as its longest ranged primary weapons. Individually, the damage the AC/2s deal is insignificant, but together they can steadily whittle away armor at extreme range. The 'Mech also carries two Shigunga LRM-15 launchers, adding much needed punch to the extreme reach of its four autocannons. The 'Mech also carries two Victory Nickel Alloy ER Large Lasers for added long range punch. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Mauler MAL-1X-AFFC
details:
Captured Maulers, deployed in Federated Commonwealth with the MAL-1X-AFFC designation, swapped the LRMs for quad SRM 4s.Their fewer but more pronounced missile ports are an easy identifier of the variant in early Clan Invasion footage. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Mauler MAL-1Y
details:
Some early MAL-1R had their ER Large Lasers replaced by standard ones due to supply shortages. These sub-variants were designated the Mauler MAL-1Y. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Mauler MAL-2P
details:
The Mauler MAL-2P should be considered a prototype. Unlike the -1P or MX90, the -2P carries a pair of Lasers in each arm; it's rumored that more than two can affixed if need be. Its twin LRM-10s allow it to send missiles at a greater distance and two Ultra Autocannon/5s give it long to close range support. Both the LRMs and UAC/5s have two tons of ammunition a piece, and like the -1P and MX90, the 2P has Cellular Ammunition Storage Equipment to help protect it from ammo explosions. Eleven Double Heat Sinks and a 270 Standard Engine round out the rest of it load out. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Mauler MAL-2R
details:
The -2R variant of the Mauler uses relatively new weapons. The standard AC/2s are replaced with Ultra versions, doubling their potential damage. Paired ER Medium Lasers are fitted in arms formerly housing the ER Large Lasers. The missile launchers are reduced to smaller LRM-10s. A heavier standard fusion engine is utilized instead of the expensive XL. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Mauler MAL-C
details:
The -C variant of the Mauler is a modification that was made to the -1R model to allow it to carry a C3 Slave unit into battle. This is achieved by removing one ton of autocannon ammunition. This small modification allows the Mauler to share targeting data with friendly units and makes the 'Mech a highly effective sniper. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Medusa MED-1
details:
The Medusa is an expensive but effective cavalry 'Mech developed by Clan Cloud Cobra during the Golden Century to act as the follow-up hammer-blow to their favored aerospace assaults. The primary variant sports a Large Pulse Laser and two ER Medium Lasers for ranged combat and uses its battery of three SRM-6s arranged around the cockpit as a devastating follow-up in close combat. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Medusa MED-2
details:
Developed only a year after the original, the Medusa 2 variant is a logical companion to the Medusa 1. Unlike many fire-support designs, this variant relies on the speed and manueverability provided by its 300XL engine and six jump jets to keep pace with the Medusa-1. The Medusa 2 fields three LRM-10s and a pair of ER Medium Lasers in each arm. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Medusa MED-3
details:
Regarded by some as a survivable alternative to the Hunchback IIC, the Medusa 3 packs an incredible close-range punch while still keeping the speed, manueverability, and armor of the previous designs. The Medusa 3 hosts a massive Ultra Autocannon 20 on its right torso supplemented by an ER Medium Laser in each arm. In order to capitalize on any weaknesses in enemy armor, this variant retains an SRM-6 in the center torso. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Medusa MED-4
details:
Despite the animosity between Clan Cloud Cobra and Clan Coyote, it did not take long for the former to field a new variant of their venerable Medusa 'Mech once they had access to the new Advanced Tactical Missile system. The Medusa 4 carries a staggering seven ATM-3s with six tons of ammunition to allow it unparalleled flexibility during combat and all are supplemented by an ER Large Laser. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Men Shen MS1-O
details:
Named for the door guards who serve to ward off evil spirits from a home, the Men Shen is the first OmniMech to come from the Capellan Confederation, it borrows heavily from the Raven BattleMech for its basic design concept. The 'Mech is built on a lightweight Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a vulnerable but light VOX 330 XL Engine that gives it a top speed of 97.2 km/h that is augmented by MASC system allowing the 'Mech to be pushed up to 129.6 km/h in short bursts. The Men Shen comes with eleven tons of armor, giving it a respectable amount of protection. The Men Shen carries on its base chassis a Beagle Active Probe allowing it to serve in a recon role regardless of its configuration. For weapons and equipment the Men Shen has seventeen tons of free pod space. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Men Shen MS1-OA
details:
Named for the door guards who serve to ward off evil spirits from a home, the Men Shen is the first OmniMech to come from the Capellan Confederation, it borrows heavily from the Raven BattleMech for its basic design concept. The 'Mech is built on a lightweight Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a vulnerable but light VOX 330 XL Engine that gives it a top speed of 97.2 km/h that is augmented by MASC system allowing the 'Mech to be pushed up to 129.6 km/h in short bursts. The Men Shen comes with eleven tons of armor, giving it a respectable amount of protection. The Men Shen carries on its base chassis a Beagle Active Probe allowing it to serve in a recon role regardless of its configuration. For weapons and equipment the Men Shen has seventeen tons of free pod space. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

details:
