name: Mercury II MCY-100
details:
An upgrade to the original Mercury line, Clan Wolverine spared no expense in the production of the Mercury II, including seven and a half tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, double heat sinks and an XL Engine. Despite this the medium 'Mech is still slower than its lighter antecedent, only managing 119 km/h, though it makes up for that with jump jets that enable it to leap up to 210 meters at a time. The inclusion of a Beagle Active Probe and Guardian ECM Suite make the 'Mech a capable scout. Though the Mercury II is designed to be a scout, it can hold its own in a fight. An ER Large Laser gives it a credible ranged threat, while paired Medium Lasers and Small Lasers make it an effective hunter-killer. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Mercury MCY-97
details: The MCY-97 variant of the Mercury was created by ComStar in 3049 for recon duties. The armor, engine and MASC system are kept and one medium laser and one small laser have been dropped in favor of a Beagle Active Probe, giving the MCY-97 Mercury superior enemy detection capabilities at the cost of half of its firepower. Though an excellent scout this variant was largely discarded after the Battle of Tukayyid on account of insufficient firepower. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Mercury MCY-98
details: The Mercury debuted for the first time in 2742, intended as a replacement for the aging Wasps and Stingers in use by the Star League Defense Force. Hailed as the beginning of a new age in 'Mech design, the Mercury was faster and better-armed than its competition without sacrificing armor protection. It also featured an advancement in weapons installation, making use of a modular replacement system to allow for considerably faster and easier repairs. The MCY-98 is a downgraded version introduced during the Succession Wars in 2810. While it retains the same armament and engine of the original, the primary changes in the 'Mech is its armor, using standard plating in place of Ferro-Fibrous, and the MASC system, which has been removed to allow for the armor to be one ton heavier. These changes lower its maximum speed to 129.6 km/h and slightly increases the overall armor protection. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

name: Mercury MCY-99
details: The Mercury debuted for the first time in 2742, intended as a replacement for the aging Wasps and Stingers in use by the Star League Defense Force. Hailed as the beginning of a new age in 'Mech design, the Mercury was faster and better-armed than its competition without sacrificing armor protection. It also featured an advancement in weapons installation, making use of a modular replacement system to allow for considerably faster and easier repairs. The Mercury carries an assortment of energy weapons which helps to extend its endurance on long campaigns. The primary weapons are two Medium Lasers in the right arm and left torso, supported by two Small Lasers in the center torso and head. The heart of the Mercury is its MASC System which, in combination with a 160 fusion engine, allows for momentary bursts of speed up to 172 km/h. Three tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor gives it superior protection compared to other 20-ton 'Mechs. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Mercury MCY-100P
details: The MCY-100P is an early prototype of what would become the Mercury II, but before it's tonnage was increased. Using an 180 XL engine and MASC, it is even faster than the MCY-99 while keeping the 3.5 tons of ferro-fibrous armor. Using double heat sinks improved the cooling enough to change the weapons to one Medium Laser and a Center Torso mounted Extended Range Large Laser. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Merlin MLN-1A
details:
Released in 3010, the Merlin was the first original design to be manufactured in over a century. Designed by mountain Wolf Battlemechs as a durable and easy to repair mech, the Merlin is powered by a 240-rated fusion engine. Clad in 10 and a half tons of standard armor, it carries 18 heatsinks and a varied weapons load, designed to engage an enemy at any range. A PPC and LRM-5 launcher provide long range firepower, with a pair of medium lasers covering the shorter ranges. Also installed a machine gun and a flamer to guard against infantry attacks. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Merlin MLN-1A1
details:
A rare variant of the Merlin, the 1A1 is a rebuild that strips out the expensive lasers and replaces them with cooler running Chemical alternatives. With the reduced heat burden, the LRM-5 is upgraded to an LRM-15 and a second ton of LRM ammo is added. Only seen among the poorer parts of the Periphery, its increased ammo dependency makes it a poor choice in anything other than a defensive role. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Merlin MLN-1Ar
details:
An unofficial refit kit that incorporates Star League era technology, the Merlin 1Ar never entered mainstream production but was a common upgrade if the parts could be obtained. The 1A's standard PPC is swapped for an Extended Range version, whilst the Medium Lasers are exchanged for Pulse versions. To handle the extra heat load and free up the weight needed for the Pulses, double heatsinks are added to the design. With the excess free weight, the LRM-5 is upgraded to a LRM-10. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Merlin MLN-1B
details:
Introduced in 3053, the Merlin 1B variant removes the Machine Gun and its ammunition and replaces them with an additional heat sink to help handle the Merlin's heat load. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Merlin MLN-1B1
details:
A field modification of the Merlin 1A, the 1B1 removes the Machine Gun and Flamer of the 1A and replaces them with an additional pair of medium lasers. Hotter running then the regular 1A or 1B designs, it nonetheless packs a greater punch at close range and is a favorite configuration for pilots assigned to long range reconnaissance or raiding operations. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Merlin MLN-2A
details:
A prototype that never saw widespread adoption, the Merlin 2A was Mountain Wolfs next generation offering unveiled alongside the 1B variant in 3053. Built around a 240-rated XL Engine, it is armed with a pair of ER Large Lasers and a pair of Medium Pulses. The 1A's Machine Gun is retained and the LRM-5 upgraded to a LRM-10. The addition of CASE protects the ammunition bays and 14 Double Heat Sinks handle the increased heat burden. At almost 19 million CBills, the design was rejected as too expensive and too reliant on advanced technology that the Outworlds Alliance struggled to produce. Mountain Wolf shelved the design, though not before a single run of 20 2A's were produced. Most of these were fielded by the Mountain Wolf security team, but some found their way into the hands of the elite Avellar Guard. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Minotaur 1
details: The Minotaur is the 'assault class' of the first generation ProtoMechs. Weighing more than any other ProtoMech, it trades speed for armor and weaponry. Carrying a pair of ER Medium Lasers, the Minotaur has enough firepower to seriously damage any light 'Mechs foolish enough to close with it. Quirk: Resilient Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Minsk MNK-1
details:
The first Mech to be produced by the Ghost Bears, the 70 ton Minsk entered production in 2830. Surpassed in performance by newer designs, the Minsk fell out of favour and was eventually retired. Powered by a 210-rated Fusion Core, the Minsk 1 is armed with a pair of Gauss Rifles and an LRM-10. Paired SRM-6’s, Small Pulse Lasers, B-Pods and Machine Guns add additional firepower at close range. An Active Probe allows the Minsk to spot hidden opponents.n Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Mist Lynx A
details:
A common Light OmniMech, the Mist Lynx is fielded by every Clan since its introduction in 2926. A 25-ton mech, the Mist Lynx is powered by a 175-rated XL Engine and is built with a combination of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous that gives it a respectable 7.5 tons of pod space. An Active Probe is hardwired into the chassis boosting the Mist Lynx’s effectiveness as a scout. The Mist Lynx A is armed with a pair of AMS, a TAG and a Flamer. A pair of A-Pods and Machine Guns are installed to deter infantry. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Mongoose MON-66
details: The Mongoose BattleMech was introduced in 2660 as a deep recon 'Mech and a direct competitor (and hopeful replacement) for the Locust. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Mongoose MON-66b
details: The 66b is an upgraded version of the 66 that was used by the SLDF Royal units in 2740. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Mongoose MON-66CG
details: Built by Krupp Armament Works under contract for the ComGuard, the 66C was intended for deployment on Tukayyid. Unfortunately the design was unable to be finished in time and Krupp was left with a finished mech that had no prospective buyers. In a deal brokered by Comstar, the company agreed to sell it's finished production to the reformed SLDF and provide them with additional production runs as requested. Built as a fast interdiction unit, the design was designed to chase down and annihilate elemental formations. Armed with 4 small pulse lasers, a medium pulse laser and a Streak SRM-2; the variant performed with distinction throughout the post Tukayyid years and then through Operations Bulldog and Serpent. The Word of Blake invasion choked off the flow of new mechs, as Krupp’s production shifted to the newer designs demanded by the Word. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Mongoose MON-67
details: The MON-67 is the downgraded version of the MON-66 Mongoose introduced in 2830. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Mongoose MON-67L
details: An upgrade to the Mongoose 67, the 67L is a locally produced model used by the Outworlds Alliance. Assigned to the First and Second Long Road Legions, every part of the mech is manufactured in the Alliance, save for the imported TAG system. The Alliance Military Corps provides the Mongoose chassis from their reserve stocks of Mon-67 models. Refitting the original MON-67 chassis in Ferro-Fibrous armor allows for additional protection and when combined with the removal of the Small Laser; the addition of the TAG system. Developed as a fast harasser and spotter, designed to work in concert with the Alliance Air Wings and Planetary garrisons; the design has proven popular among Mongoose pilots as much for it's improved capabilities as it's locally made parts. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Mongoose MON-68
details: This variant of the downgraded MON-67, removes all the standard weaponry in exchange for a single Large Laser, the swap to a lighter 175-rated engine reducing the MON-68's ground speed by 10 km/h but freeing up the weight to mount two additional heat sinks. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Mongoose MON-68K
details: An upgrade to the ageing 68 model, this Mongoose was one of the first models to trial the Combines new C3 Slave unit. Featuring a characteristically minimalist upgrade package, this Mongoose variant served with distinction during Operation Bulldog. An ER Large Laser serves as the sole weapons system, augmented by a new fire control system and the C3 unit. A cheap upgrade, this is a favorite of pilots who were previously assigned a 68; with many praising the enhanced range and accuracy of the Laser. Paired into demi lances, and assigned a C3 Master equipped mech to coordinate, these Mongoose's are deployed as head hunters and long range harassers; both roles that make use of their high ground speed and manoeuvrability. Fast and deadly, they have already made a name for themselves, with one Mongoose formation accounting for 5 kills, including a Star Colonel in a Timberwolf during the Great Refusal. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Mongoose MON-69
details: A variant of the MON-66 introduced in 2819, the MON-69 replaced the LosTech active probe with an SRM-2 and one ton of reloads since the advanced electronics were difficult to come by during the Succession Wars. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Mongoose MON-69K
details: Originating from the short lived Concord of Kapteyn, this design was designed to showcase each realms newly rediscovered technology in one show-piece design. Unfortunately the Concord fell apart before the design could be put into production. The Clan Invasion left the Free Worlds League scrambling for new designs that could be used in the fight against the Clans. Among the designs pushed into production was the 69K, redesigned to use modern technologies from across the Inner Sphere. The chassis is sourced from the Combine, whilst the engine is of Lyran make; paired with a FWL built Streak SRM-2 and one of the Capellan Confederation’s newly rediscovered Beagle Probes. Produced at Irian technologies Shiro III facility until the early 3060’s, the mech was sold at cost to buyers; with the FWL subsidising production as part of their contributions to the war. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Mongoose MON-70
details: The MON-70 dates to 2819 and is another variant of the standard MON-66 introduced following the loss of the active probe. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Mongoose C
details: A Clantech upgrade to the again Royal Mongoose, that debuted during the Golden Age. Found in most Clan Toumans, the design played a key role in the battle for Tokasha, where it was employed with great effect by Alpha Galaxy of Clan Ghost Bear; against the dug in foces of the Hells Horse Beta Galaxy. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Mongoose C 2
details: A Clantech upgrade to the again Royal Mongoose, that debuted during the Golden Age. The C2 was a Clan Mongoose model developed as a testbed for the newly developed Targeting Computers. Removing 2 heat sinks allowed Mongoose engineers to install the targeting computer, otherwise this design is unchanged from the standard MON-C. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Morpheus MR-P1
details: The original Morpheus carried a medium laser, pair of Medium Pulse Lasers, and an anti-missile system. It also carried a Beagle active probe and Guardian ECM suite. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Mosquito MOS-1K
details: The Mosquito mounts two small and one medium laser, a C3 Slave and a MASC. To free the space required, the 'Mech uses both lighter Ferro-Fibrous armor and an Endo Steel chassis. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Munin LAM MN-1B
details: This apparent precursor to the Phoenix Hawk LAM may have had a different name originally, but in any case became known as the Munin LAM. The only samples known to exist were those recovered from a cache by the Tyr Resistance Movement shortly before the Fourth Succession War. Unbeknownst to many, recovered blueprints and manufacturing manuals not only allowed production to resume, but aided in Upgraded Designs. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

details:
The Naginata NG-C3A serves in the dual role of command and fire support 'Mech. The C3 master computer allows the 'Mech to share the targeting data of its lancemates and to take advantage of their targeting information, making the three LRM-15s with Artemis IV fire control systems and the ER PPC extremely accurate. The Artemis IV fire control system gives the 'Mech increased missile accuracy. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

name: Naja KTO-19b-EC
details: An early Clan Mech, the Naja was built by the Cloud Cobras, using the Royal Kintaro as the base chassis. Designed to showcase the Cobras new missile technology, the Naja is armed with a Clan LRM-20, along with paired Improved SRM-2's, a pair of Improved SRM-6's, and 3 lasers supplementing this. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Naja NAJA-1
details: An early Clan mech used by Clan Cloud Cobra, the Naja is built on the Kintaro chassis sporting an LRM-20, and a trio of ER Lasers. A pair of Improved SRM2's and Improved SRM6's are retained from the first generation Naja. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Nexus NXS1-A
details:
As a recon 'Mech intended to rarely engage an enemy in a pitched battle, the Nexus is armed with a Medium Laser backed up by two highly accurate Medium Pulse Lasers. As a weapon of last resort, the Nexus also has two Small Lasers. For added protection against missile attacks, the Nexus has an AMS. The Nexus has a top speed of 119 km/h and is powered by a 175-rated fusion engine which is both light and rugged. To save weight without the vulnerability of an XL engine, the Nexus is built on a Endo Steel chassis. For protection, the 'Mech carries a light two tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, relying on its speed and maneuverability, which is enhanced with a jumping capability of up to one hundred and twenty meters. Finally, to handle the heat from the arsenal of energy weapons, the Nexus carries ten double heat sinks. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Night Chanter A
details: The alternate loadout of the Night Chanter combines an LRM-10 launcher with an ER Medium Laser and an ER PPC as primary weapons, while mounting two A-Pods and two Machine guns to deal with vehicles and infantry. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Night Chanter Prime
details: The Primary loadout of the Night Chanter is a combination of pulse and extended range lasers, making the 'Mech somewhat able to deal damage at most ranges. The varied loadout does mean it lacks the weapon profile to excel at any particular range, but the idea of the design is that any intended engagement does not occur within only a limited amount of ranges, and instead it is a constant flow back and forth. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Night Gyr A
details:
The A variant is a short-range powerhouse. It mounts an Ultra Autocannon/20 to breach opponent's armor and a pair of Streak SRM-6s to exploit those holes. A Large Pulse Laser and a trio of Medium Pulse Lasers are highly accurate weapons that can help to minimize collateral damage in an urban environment. Even with four additional double heat sinks, this variant can be quickly overwhelmed by heat. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Night Gyr B
details:
The Night Gyr B seeks to destroy opponents before they can return fire. A pair of Gauss Rifles and LB-X Autocannon/2s carry out that mandate. Ammo is somewhat lacking, however, so this design cannot stray far from supply, especially as it has no backup energy weapons. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Night Gyr C
details:
Another long-range variant, the C mounts three Ultra Autocannon/2s and two ER Large Lasers. A pair of ER Medium Lasers are present for backup. All of these weapons are linked to a Targeting Computer. Six extra heat sinks ensure the 'Mech stays mostly cool. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Night Gyr D
details:
This missile boat carries four LRM-20 launchers, each of which is slaved to an Artemis IV FCS. Six tons of ammunition is barely enough to keep it firing for a minute. A Large Pulse Laser and Medium Pulse Laser are effective backup weapons. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Night Gyr E
details:
This variant uses massed pulse lasers, two large and six medium, in conjunction with an ATM 6 and an SRM-6. The ATM only mounts two tons of ammunition, limiting its flexibility. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Night Gyr Prime
details:
The primary configuration is hard-hitting, mounting a pair of ER PPCs located in the left arm and an Ultra Autocannon/10 in the right. This blistering firepower can often take down an opponent before they are in range. Three Medium Pulse Lasers serve as accurate backups. Eight additional double heat sinks keep the 'Mech fairly cool. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Nighthawk Mk. XXI
details: The Nighthawk Mk. XXI is a PA(L) design and the progenitor of modern battle armor. The original Nighthawk was based upon exoskeletons originally used for commercial purposes during the Star League. It took fifteen years and twenty prototypes before the SLDF finally perfected the design that would eventually be produced. A working prototype was first introduced in 2718, which was followed by two years of field testing and, finally, full production, entering service with the Special Forces Command. Quirk: Power Armor Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.8832 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

details:
A fast reaction mech designed to hunt down enemy scouts and raiding units, the 35 ton Night Hawk was developed by Mountain Wolf Battlemechs in 2656. Built around a 210-rated XL Engine, the Night Hawk NTK-2Q is armed with an ER Large Laser and a Large Laser. A Medium Pulse Laser provides additional firepower should enemies close in. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

details:

Built around a 210-rated XL Engine, the Night Hawk NTK-2Q-EC was an early Clan upgrade from the dawn of the Golden Century. Armed with an ER Large Laser and a Large Laser, a prototype ER Medium Laser provides additional firepower should enemies close in. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Night Hawk NTK-2S
details:
A fast reaction mech designed to hunt down enemy scouts and raiding units, the 35 ton Night Hawk was developed by Mountain Wolf Battlemechs in 2656. Built around a 210-rated XL Engine, the Night Hawk NTK-2S is armed with an ER Large Laser and a Large Laser. A Guardian ECM Suite and a Beagle Active Probe increase the Mechs effectiveness as a scout. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Nightstar NSR-7J
details: In the aftermath of the Amaris Civil War and the chaos of the Succession Wars, the Nightstar which was already rare and prized began to be unable to be repaired with its advanced components. Thus, the -7J downgrade was created to make use of damaged Nightstars that lacked the proper components. Without the delicate XL engine, the -7J could no longer carry its massive Gauss Rifles, instead carrying a pair of AC/10s. The remaining weaponry was downgraded, as well as the heat sinks being replaced with the weaker standard versions of the day. The two things that stayed the same however was the mech's ponderous speed and tremendous armor capability. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: Nightstar NSR-9FC
details: Reconfigured for greater speed, the 9FC variant of the Nightstar replaces the two Gauss Rifles with a pair of LB-X Autocannon/10s that are not as destructive as the weapons they replace, but can use both standard and cluster ammunition, making them effective in a variety of roles. The Small Laser has also been upgraded and the Medium Pulse Lasers downgraded, giving the Nightstar a total of three medium lasers. To make the 'Mech fit better into the mobile warfare doctrine of the Federated Suns and Federated Commonwealth, the 9FC model has used the saved weight to upgrade its engine, giving it a top speed of 64.8 km/h. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

name: Nightstar NSR-9J
details: The genesis of the Nightstar lies in the Amaris Civil War. The 'Mech itself was only produced until the the First Succession War, when both of the factories and engineers capable of producing the Nightstar were destroyed or killed. The Nightstar is armed to keep an enemy at standoff ranges. The primary weapons carried are a pair of Gauss Rifles, each of which can strip almost a ton of armor off an enemy unit. These are backed up by a ER PPC that is capable of hitting a target at six hundred and ninety meters. For defense at short ranges, the 'Mech has two Medium Pulse Lasers and an Small Laser. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

name: Nightstar NSR-9JC
details: In the late 3050's the Federated Commonwealth developed this offshoot of the standard NSR-9J in response to the proliferation of stealth technology. High end senors, targeting systems and actuators enable the NSR-9JC to deliver devastatingly accurate gauss rounds to even the most challenging targets. The XL engine of it's parent has been replaced with a standard model, greatly increasing survivability, which is further enhanced with spall liner and hardened arms. A C3 Master computer aids tactical coordination. For close range defense a pair of Medium X-Pulse lasers is mounted in each arm and an ER Small laser sits below the cockpit. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

name: Nova Cat A
details:
The A variant is armed with 4 ER Large Lasers linked to a targeting computer for increased accuracy. Additional heat sinks keep heat mostly in check, while jump jets rocket the 'Mech up to one hundred and twenty meters at a time. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Nova Cat B
details:
Alternate Configuration B deviates from the formula of the Primary and Alternate Configurations greatly, as it is a missile boat rather than a sniper, being equipped with six LRM-15s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers provide short-range backup. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Nova Cat C
details:
The C configuration, like the B is not all energy weapons, and is equipped with two Ultra AC/5s, one LB 5-X AC and Two Large Pulse Lasers. This makes it very potent against aircraft. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Nova Cat D
details:
The D configuration is very similar to the C variant, being equipped with an LB 10-X AC and three Heavy Large Lasers. The extra heat sinks are still overtaxed by the heavy lasers, though a targeting computer does make them more accurate. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Nova Cat P/A
details:
One of several prototype rebuilds of the Prime configuration with the goal of making it run less hot. This was done by shifting the weapons more towards ballistics with two LB-X 20 Autocannons, but still mounting three Medium Pulse Lasers. Further, the A prototype mounts a MASC instead of jump jets to keep some mobility. These prototypes eventually lead to the standardized M configuration. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Nova Cat P/J
details:
One of several prototype rebuilds of the Prime configuration with the goal of making it run less hot. This was done by shifting the weapons more towards ballistics with two LB-X 20 Autocannons, but still mounting three Medium Pulse Lasers. Further, the J prototype added Ferro-Fibrous structuring to free enough weight capacity to keep the jump jets. These prototypes eventually lead to the standardized M configuration. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Nova Cat Prime
details:

This was done by shifting the weapons more towards ballistics with two LB-X 20 Autocannons, with two Streak SRM-6 launchers for close range fire support. These prototypes eventually lead to the standardized M configuration. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

The O-Bakemono weighs in at eighty tons and has a top speed of 64.8 km/h, which is considered a good ground speed for an assault 'Mech. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Omni-Corvis A
details:
For close combat, the A configuration has six medium pulse lasers; two in each arm and two in the center torso. A Streak SRM-6 and one ton of ammunition is mounted in each side torso. A small pulse laser is mounted in the head for anti-infantry work. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Omni-Corvis B
details:
A long range fire support model, the B configuration has an LRM-20 and three tons of ammunition in each arm. These are supported by a right torso Narc missile beacon with two tons of ammunition. A pair of machine guns with a half-ton of ammunition are carried in the left torso. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Omni-Corvis Prime
details:
The default configuration is inspired by the Corvis. A UAC/10 with four tons of ammunition is supported by an ER large laser and an ER medium laser. Two additional pod-mounted double heat sinks are installed as well. This allows the Omni-Corvis to operate in the same medium range brackets that Corvis pilots are used to. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Onslaught SA-OS
details:
This is the original version of the Onslaught. It is protected by only 12 tons of armor and is armed with an Ultra AC/5, Large Laser two SRM-6 and six Machine Guns. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

name: Onslaught SA-OS-S7
details:
This slight modification of the original SA-OS removes one of the C.A.S.E. systems, allowing the increase of Machine Gun ammunition. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

name: Orion IIC 1
details:
Since it was the chosen BattleMech of the Great Father, the venerable Orion has always held a special place in the mystique of the Clans. Out of respect for General Kerensky's legacy, all the Clans maintained the design for several decades even as the development of newer and more advanced technologies increasingly left it less effective on the battlefield. Not a radical reworking of the design, as some Clan upgrades are, the Orion IIC replaces much of the innards and weapons of the original, while preserving its mass and aesthetics. This IIC upgrade utilizes an Endo Steel chassis and twelve tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, while also making use of twelve double heat sinks, freeing up weight for heavier weapons loadout. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-C
details:
The original primitive Orion 'Mech as it was first commissioned lacked an LRM launcher and used an Autocannon/5 in place of the AC/10. A massive 360 engine allowed the 'Mech to obtain a maximum speed of nearly 64.8 km/h, however there was not enough saved weight to mount additional weaponry besides two Medium Lasers, one in each arm. In addition it only mounted 14.5 tons of armor, and ultimately would be considered too lightly armed and armored with the prototype dismissed as a candidate for production. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.89

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-E
details:
The Orion ON1-E is a seldom seen variant of the Orion heavy 'Mech. As its main loadout the ON1-E mounts a LB-X 10 in the right torso and an Artemis IV enabled LRM-15 in the left torso. For close quarters combat and defense, the variant also has a Streak SRM-6 launcher in the left arm and an ER Medium Laser in each arm. To be able to comfortably carry the weapons, the chassis uses an Endo Steel structure. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-H
details:
Built by General Mechanics, the ON1-H was the third known primitive prototype of the Orion 'Mech that was eventually accepted for mass production in 2456. While slower than the first iterations, with a top speed of only 54 km/h (the same as that of a Mackie or Banshee), due to the inclusion of a smaller 275-class engine, the additional weight saved allowed the designers to mount far more firepower. A newly developed Class-10 Prototype Autocannon was installed and two tons of ammo in place of the AC/5. This was backed up by two 5-tube Long-Range Missile launchers with one ton of reloads in the left torso for striking enemies at range and a short-range SRM-4 missile launcher and a ton of ammunition installed in the left arm for close-in defense. It was also heavily protected by 21 tons of armor. A minimal amount of heatsinks, however, could cause build-up of heat within crippling levels, but could be avoided by competent MechWarriors. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.89

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-K
details:
The Orion K was the first true heavy 'Mech. As a multirole brawler, the Orion can engage enemies at a variety of ranges, and with plenty of armor, it can survive combined fire for quite some time. Slow, yes, but powerful. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-K-CE
details:
Eager to test the brand new LB 2-X autocannon prototypes, the Orion ON1-K had its AC/10 replaced with two of the Clan Early LB-X. Using the fact that Clan Early missile launchers are considerably lighter, it was also possible to upgrade them to an Improved SRM-6 and an Improved LRM-20 - with two tons of ammunition each. Even then, enough capacity remained to add two more heat sinks. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-KR
details:
A battlefield refit of the ON1-K, replacing the SRM-4 with a Small Laser. This leaves enough room to add an Artemis IV FCS for the LRM launcher, C.A.S.E. protection for the ammunition, as well as a C3 Slave computer. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-M
details:
The M variant is an upgrade using Star League technology first fielded in 3049. Replacing the standard engine with a Hermes 300 XL Engine and shaving off a half-ton of armor allows the 'Mech to retain the same speed while mounting a number of upgrades. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-MA
details:
This is one of the many minor variants of the ON1-M model introduced in 3052. The Narc Missile Beacon is removed to allow a larger SRM-6 to replace the four pack. Both missile racks also have Artemis IV Fire Control System to increase accuracy. Finally, medium pulse lasers are mounted in place of original mediums. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-MB
details:
A second minor variant of the ON1-M introduced in 3058. The LB-X Autocannon/10 is swapped for a Light Gauss Rifle with a single ton of ammunition while the medium lasers are upgraded to extended range versions. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-MC
details:
A minor variant of the ON1-M introduced in 3058. The designers removed both missile racks and Narc launcher to make room for two Medium Range Missile launchers. In place of the LRM-20 is an MRM-20, while a larger MRM-30 is crammed in the torso where the SRM-4 formerly sat. Enough room is left to add a head-mounted C3 Slave Unit. This variant was much-used by the Draconis Combine. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-M-DC
details:
Introduced in 3053, this 1-M sub-variant trades one ton each of SRM and Narc ammunition plus one double heat sink for a Command Console. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-V
details:
The Orion V trades some of the armor the K model is known for to mount additional weaponry. This increases its overall damage output, but many pilots consider the loss of armor to be risky. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-VA
details:
Instead of sacrificing armor, the Orion VA trades out some of it's long range punch by removing the LRM-15. This allows it to not only maintain the stock armor, but also add 6 Heat Sinks for better heat management. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Orion ON1-V-DC
details:
Command Console refit built in 2913 - Standard refits usually installed the Command Console on a ON1-V, requiring the removal of one ton of SRM, LRM, and AC ammunition. The loss of ammunition reduces its capability to maintain fire for long, but a Commander will typically not be located at the head of a formation. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Osprey OSP-15
details:
The original SLDF model created in 2738, the Osprey OSP-15 mounted the same M-7 Gauss Rifle as the modern models, but had an LRM-10 Launcher backed up by three Medium Lasers in place of the MML and ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: OstLord OSL-9R
details: When Ostmann Industries first tried creating a heavier 'Mech than the Ostwar it resulted in the OstLord. It used much of the same components as the Ostwar but with size increased as needed. This 80 ton prototype assault 'Mech carried double LRM15 launchers, a Large Laser and two Medium Lasers and used a 320 rating fusion core. However, the design never went past prototype stage as it showed severe reliability problems during its trials and Ostmann Industries sold the few prototypes created on the second hand market before shutting the project down. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

name: Ostroc Mk II OSR-9C
details:
The Ostroc Mk II swaps the SRM-4 for one SRM-2 launcher in each side torso, with one ton of ammunition in the center torso. Half a ton of armor was added to the front torso and legs (adding one point to each leg and side torso, and four to center torso), and four more heat sinks were installed along with three jump jets for a jump capacity of 90 meters. To make room for these components, the engine had to be changed to a Pitban 240, reducing the top speed to 64.8 km/h. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostroc OSR-2C
details:
The Ostroc carries as its primary weapons two Fuersturm-C Large Lasers in the left and right torsos. These give the Ostroc good medium to long range damage capabilities. The Ostrocs secondary weapons are two Fuersturm-b Medium Lasers also mounted in the side torsos and a Totschlagen SRM-4 launcher in the right torso for close-range combat, with one ton of reloads carried in the center torso. While the Ostroc's laser-heavy weapons payload allows it to operate well as a guerrilla fighter since it has limited dependency on supply lines, its short arms are a handicap in close combat, and the shocks of hand-to-hand fighting can easily damage the Fuersturm systems. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostroc OSR-2Cb
details: This upgrade of the 2C was used by the SLDF Royals starting in 2729. The large lasers are upgraded to ER Large Lasers, and the SRM-4 is replaced with a pair of Streak SRM-2s. Fourteen double heat sinks keep this 'Mech cool, while Ferro-Fibrous armor gives it additional protection. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Ostroc OSR-2CR
details: A variant of the Ostroc OSR-2C adding a C3 slave unit and replacing the single heat sink with doubles. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Ostroc OSR-2D
details: Upgraded with Star League technology, the 2D variant of the Ostroc extends the 'Mechs maximum range by replacing the Large Lasers with two ER Large Lasers. The 2D retains the Medium Lasers and SRM-4 of the 2C model. To handle the heat burden it is also equipped with double heat sinks. Being a relatively rare design, the Ostroc had no official field refit kit but the 2D variant was a common upgrade in 3050 if the parts could be obtained. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Ostroc OSR-2L
details:
The 2L variant of the Ostroc introduced in 2884 is modified for long range combat. The SRM-4 launcher has been replaced with an LRM-5 launcher, increasing the 'Mechs long-range damage capabilities slightly by sacrificing some of its close range firepower. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostroc OSR-2M
details:
An experimental model produced by Kong Interstellar for the Free Worlds League in 2793, the 2M variant of the Ostroc focuses on the 'Mech's maneuverability. Five jump jets, two in each leg and one in the rear torso, have been added to the design, giving it a maximum jumping distance of one hundred and fifty meters. In order to make this change, the medium lasers and the SRM-4 launcher were removed. Relatively few of these were built between the League's annexation of Connaught and the factory's destruction. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostroc OSR-3C
details:
The 3C variant looks to improve the long-range direct firepower of the Ostroc. Introduced in 2876, the two medium lasers and the SRM-4 have been removed in order to add a third large laser mounted in the right torso. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostscout OTT-7J
details:
The Ostscout was designed as a pure recon BattleMech by Ostmann Industries. To that end, it was built entirely around gathering data and getting out of trouble, tasks for which it is exceptional; the Ostscout is quick enough to escape most traps, and very few other designs can match it in terms of speed and maneuverability. The Ostscout 7J carries a single medium laser mounted in its center torso. This weapon, while not extremely powerful, is enough to dissuade most light scout assets from attempting to pursue. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostscout OTT-7Jb
details:
The Ostscout was designed as a pure recon BattleMech by Ostmann Industries. To that end, it was built entirely around gathering data and getting out of trouble, tasks for which it is exceptional; the Ostscout is quick enough to escape most traps, and very few other designs can match it in terms of speed and maneuverability. Introduced at the same time as the original model and used by the SLDF Royal units, the 7Jb is the only variant of the Ostscout built prior to the Clan Invasion. This variant uses endo steel to free up enough mass to add a Beagle active probe. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostscout OTT-7JR
details: The Ostscout was designed as a pure recon BattleMech by Ostmann Industries. To that end, it was built entirely around gathering data and getting out of trouble, tasks for which it is exceptional; the Ostscout is quick enough to escape most traps, and very few other designs can match it in terms of speed and maneuverability. The 7R is a variant of the OTT-7J that replaces two of the Jump Jets with a C3 slave unit and some extra armor. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Ostscout OTT-7K
details:
The Ostscout was designed as a pure recon BattleMech by Ostmann Industries. To that end, it was built entirely around gathering data and getting out of trouble, tasks for which it is exceptional; the Ostscout is quick enough to escape most traps, and very few other designs can match it in terms of speed and maneuverability. The 7K Ostscout was introduced in 3050 and replaces the medium laser with a Garret Mole TAG laser designator, sacrificing its limited offensive capability to allow it to designate targets for Arrow IV artillery missiles. Otherwise, the 7K Ostscout is identical to the 7J model, and while utterly defenseless, is still swift enough to escape from most danger. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostsol OTL-4D
details:
Nine tons of armoring is considered decent for a heavy 'Mech, while its fast cruising speed of 54 km/h is thanks to a nineteen-ton Vlar 300 fusion engine. Besides speed though it's the 'Mech's highly-sensitive TRSS.2L3 targeting-tracking system, able to detect enemies over several kilometers in even the most difficult terrain, which makes it a good command platform for scouting missions. Sixteen heat sinks also help manage the heat output of its all-energy weapons payload. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostsol OTL-4DR
details:
The Ostsol OTL-4DR was an attempt by Ostmann Industries to create a version of the 'Mech that could be built faster and handled hot environments better. Replacing all weapons with a pair of ER PPCs, switching to Double Heat Sinks and adding a C3 Slave unit did not meet the goals and the variant was never built in any larger volumes. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostsol OTL-4F
details:
The 4F Ostsol introduced in 2871 was the only common variant of the 'Mech pre-Clan Invasion, completely removing the laser weapons and replacing them with two Dominion-V PPCs in the side torsos. The 'Mech is seen as, in some ways at least, a poor man's Marauder or Warhammer, and the PPC array can quickly overload the sixteen heat sinks. Though, on its own merits, the variant is a good long-range direct fire support 'Mech which uses its top speed of 86.4 km/h to dictate combat ranges against most heavier 'Mechs. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostsol OTL-5M
details: The 5M variant of the Ostsol is an upgrade of the design using Star League technology and is built for close-range combat with production starting in 3050. The original engine, heat sinks, and weapons have been stripped from the chassis and replaced with a Hermes 300 XL engine and sixteen double heat sinks. Taking the place of its standard weapons, the 5M Ostsol carries two Tronel XIII Large Pulse Lasers and four Tronel XII Medium Pulse Lasers, two of which remain rear-mounted to discourage attacks against the 'Mech's weak rear armor. Finally, for added protection against missile attacks, the 5M carries a Lindblad Shotgun Anti-Missile System in its right torso with one ton of ammo in the left. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Ostwar OWR-2M
details:
The 2M Ostwar was armed with a twenty-tube Doombud Long Range Missile launcher for its long range attacks. In close range, the 'Mech was armed with two four-tubed Shannon SH-40 Short-Range Missile launchers in each of its paddle shaped forearms. It also mounted two Martell Medium Lasers mounted on the left torso. The 'Mech carried three tons of ammunition for the LRM rack, while carrying a ton of SRM ammunition in its left arm. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.87

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostwar OWR-2Mb
details:
An updated version of the primitive Ostwar developed in 2620, this variant carries 12 tons of standard BattleMech armor and a modern cockpit. The chassis has been upgraded to use Endo Steel, while an XL Engine increases the Ostwar's ground speed to 84 km/h. Eighteen double heat sinks dissipate the heat from three ER Large Lasers and twin SRM-6 launchers. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ostwar OWR-2MX
details:
A refresh of the Ostwar OWR-2M, the OWR-2MX replaces the LRM and Medium Lasers with an upgrade to double SRM6 launchers and 3 Extended Range Large Lasers. Using an XL engine and Endo Steel structure allows the switch to Double Heat Sinks for better cooling performance as well as an upgrade to a 325-rated fusion core. One large oddity is the fact the SRM6 launchers are in the legs, leading a strange angle of launching that can surprise enemy Mech Warriors. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Owens OW-1
details:
The Owens is intended to be an OmniMech upgrade of the Jenner BattleMech. The intended role for the Owens is as a cavalry 'Mech that can move along the enemy lines and designate targets for bombardment with Arrow IV artillery attacks. The Owens is a strong spotting unit as well as a point 'Mech for C3 lances with its permanently mounted TAG laser designator, Beagle Probe and C3 Slave unit. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Pack Hunter 1
details: The Pack Hunter is the first new design produced by Clan Wolf-in-Exile on Arc-Royal. It also represents a new partnership between Phelan's Wolves and the Kell Hounds, as the armor and communications gear are Kell Hound products, traded to the Wolves in exchange for Endo Steel. Reflecting their Khan's bias towards light, fast designs, Wolf scientists designed the Pack Hunter to be fast and have a sharp bite. Though its four tons of armor are light, the BattleMech is supposed to use its speed and maneuverability to stay out of trouble. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Paladin PAL-1
details:
The original Paladin features seven Machine Guns and a single Large Pulse Laser providing long range firepower, and the Machine Guns are backed up by an Artemis IV-equipped SRM-6 and a pair of Streak SRM-2 missile launchers. It features a standard engine, standard ferro-fibrous armor and an Endo Steel chassis. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Right Lower, Left Upper

name: Panther PNT-5T
details: The Panther 5T is a Taurian refit, replacing the PPC and SRM with a low-tech Heavy Rifle and Flamer. Born from extreme shortages of replacement parts, this is a cheap alternative favoured by mercenaries and hired security. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Panther PNT-6-KH
details: Custom variant used by the mercenary unit 'Kell Hounds', one of the most renowned in the Inner Sphere. Most of the standard equipment has been replaced by Clan tech, resulting in a considerably better performing light 'Mech. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Panther PNT-8X
details: An early attempted design of the Panther by Draconis Combine, using a SRM-4 launcher and a Large Laser. Was never produced in large quantities. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Panther PNT-8Z
details: An early version of the Panther that is occasionally seen in the Periphery, it is armed with the ancient Tronel Large Laser in place of the PPC. This laser suffers from faulty heat exchangers and generates more heat than a standard Large Laser. Most of these have long since been retrofitted. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Panther PNT-9ALAG
details: Known for their highly mobile nature, the Draconis Combine's Amphigean Light Assault Group upgrade the engines by removing the Jump Jets. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Panther PNT-9R
details: Panther 9Rs are solid all-around 'Mechs, if a bit on the slow side. They make up for it with Jump Jets, considerable armor, and a hefty punch from their trademark PPC. They've even been used in physical slugging matches to good effect. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Panther PNT-9RR
details: The -9RR is a refit of the -9R that by switching to double Heat Sinks allow the addition of a medium and a small laser, while still improving the cooling. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Panther PNT-10K
details: The 10K Panther is a high tech upgrade of the 9R model introduced by Wakazashi Enterprises. The chassis has been rebuilt using Endo Steel construction techniques and the saved weight used to add an Artemis IV fire control system to the missile launcher, as well as upgrading the PPC to a Lord's Light 2 ER PPC. Since its introduction the 10K has gone on to replace the 9R as the most common model employed by the DCMS. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Panther PNT-10KA
details: The 10KA Panther is a field refit of the Panther 10K. It removes the ER PPC and replaces it with a standard PPC to alleviate some heat problems. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Panther PNT-12DC
details: An early draft for an upgraded Panther by the Draconis Combine. Only a few units were ever produced and ended up in the hands of various mercenary units despite its too high maintenance cost for House Kurita. Utilizing an XL engine and Endo Steel allows mounting three Streak SRM-2 launchers, one ER PPC, one medium laser and 5 Jump Jets. The cooling is handled by double heat sinks and a C3 slave unit is installed for better battlefield awareness. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Panther PNT-C
details: The PNT-C is a modification of the -10K model and simply removes the Artemis IV for a C3 slave. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Panther PNT-CA
details: The PNT-CA is a simple weapon swap. A cooler firing standard PPC is used in place of the PNT-C's ER PPC. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Penetrator PTR-4D
details:
The Penetrator PTR-4D has an all energy weapons arsenal and uses twelve double heat sinks to handle the massive heat load from its weapons. The 'Mech uses a Vlar 300 fusion engine for its combat durability, giving the 'Mech a top speed of 64.8 km/h. To help offset the 'Mech's lack of mobility, the Penetrator has four Anderson 398 jump jets giving it added mobility with a jumping distance of one hundred and twenty meters. The Penetrator also carries a respectable thirteen tons of armor. The 'Mech's heavy armor protection, combined with its standard engine and limited amounts of ammunition, make for a 'Mech that is very rugged and hard to kill. The primary weapons are a pair of arm mounted Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Lasers for long range firepower. For close range combat, the 'Mech carries six Sutel Precision Line Medium Pulse Lasers which are mounted in its right and left torsos. Finally, the 'Mech carries its only ammunition based weapon, a Yori Flyswatter Anti-Missile System, for added defense against missile attacks. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Penetrator PTR-4F
details:
Intended to act as a fire support 'Mech, The PTR-4F Penetrator sacrifices two of its Medium Pulse Lasers and the ER Large Lasers, freeing enough tonnage to add two LRM-10 missile launchers. The LRM-10s were then mated to Artemis IV fire control systems for added accuracy. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Penetrator PTR-4FX
details:
In an attempt to make the -4F more durable, the -4FX variant was a field modification of the Penetrator. Replacing the 4 Medium Pulse Lasers with 6 Medium Lasers allowed the addition of CASE in both side torsos, which after moving the Anti-Missile System ammunition from Center Torso to the Left Torso ensured any ammo explosion should not be able to penetrate the Center Torso. The 0.5 ton weight capacity still remaining was used to improve the armor of the legs and side torsos. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Penetrator PTR-6M
details:
The 6M is a variant of the Penetrator that looks to alleviate the 'Mech's heat build up by removing two of the Medium Pulse Lasers and replacing them with five additional double heat sinks. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Penetrator PTR-6S
details:
A simple modification of the Penetrator, the 6S model removes one and a half tons of armor. This frees enough weight to add a Guardian ECM Suite to the 'Mech, protecting the 'Mech from foes' advanced electronics. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Perseus P1
details:
The Perseus is the product of a program begun by the League Central Coordination and Command to create an OmniMech completely indigenous to the Free Worlds League from concept to production. The Perseus shares much with the venerable Orion, a staple of Free Worlds League Military, both broadly resembling the older design visually and using a number of the same components. This similarity prompted more than a few FWLM technicians to nickname the new design the Omni-Orion and the deployment of Perseus has largely been to front-line units that fielded large concentrations of its progenitor, replacing older Orions on a one-for-one basis. Built on a lightweight Endo Steel chassis, the Perseus is powered by a Hermes 300 XL engine helping save even more weight and giving the 'Mech a top speed of 64.8 km/h. The advanced structure and engine save a great deal of weight for weapons and equipment. The Perseus is protected by fourteen tons of Valiant Lamellor armor, giving it around average armor protection for a 'Mech of its size. It also has twelve double heat sinks that are fixed on the chassis. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Phantom A
details:
Debuting by Clan Wolf in 3052, the Phantom is a 40 ton Clan Omnimech designed as scout and light mech hunter. A combination of an Endo Steel chassis and a 360-rated XL Engine allow the Phantom to achieve speeds of 151 km/h and maintain 6.5 tons of pod space. The Phantom A carries 5 ER Small Lasers, alongside an ER Medium Laser and a pair of LRM-5’s. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Phantom B
details:
Debuting by Clan Wolf in 3052, the Phantom is a 40 ton Clan Omnimech designed as scout and light mech hunter. A combination of an Endo Steel chassis and a 360-rated XL Engine allow the Phantom to achieve speeds of 151 km/h and maintain 6.5 tons of pod space. The Phantom B is armed with an ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. A pair of SRM-4’s give it a close range punch while an Active probe enhances the Phantoms scouting capabilities. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

details:

The Phantom C is armed with an ER Medium Laser and 8 ER Small Lasers. A Flamer helps deter Infantry and a Targeting Computer enhances accuracy. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

details:

Debuting by Clan Wolf in 3052, the Phantom is a 40 ton Clan Omnimech designed as scout and light mech hunter. A combination of an Endo Steel chassis and a 360-rated XL Engine allow the Phantom to achieve speeds of 151 km/h and maintain 6.5 tons of pod space. The Phantom E is armed with 8 Micro Pulse Lasers and an ATM-3. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Phantom Prime
details:
Debuting by Clan Wolf in 3052, the Phantom is a 40 ton Clan Omnimech designed as scout and light mech hunter. A combination of an Endo Steel chassis and a 360-rated XL Engine allow the Phantom to achieve speeds of 151 km/h and maintain 6.5 tons of pod space. The Phantom Prime is armed with an ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. A TAG unit, Active Probe and ECM suite allow it to act as a scout, while an LRM-5 gives it some ranged capabilities. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Phoenix PX-1R
details:
A first generation BattleMech, the 50 ton Phoenix was the first native BattleMech to be built by the Rim Worlds Republic. Built with primitive components and powered by a 240-rated Fusion Core, the Phoenix 1R carried a PPC and a pair of SRM-2’s. 3 Jump Jets gave the Phoenix limited jump capability, at the cost of the original SRM-4s being downgraded. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.82

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Phoenix PX-3R
details:
A first generation BattleMech, the 50 ton Phoenix was the first native BattleMech to be built by the Rim Worlds Republic. Powered by a 250-rated Fusion Core, the Phoenix 3R carried a PPC and a pair of SRM-2’s. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Phoenix PX-4R
details:
A first generation BattleMech, the 50 ton Phoenix was the first native BattleMech to be built by the Rim Worlds Republic. Powered by a 250-rated Fusion Core, the Phoenix 4R carried an AC/10 and a single SRM-2. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Phoenix Hawk LAM PHX-HK1
details: Developed for the Star League Defense Force Royal Divisions in 2692, this variant of the Phoenix Hawk LAM used four Medium Lasers and a single ER Large Laser as its main firepower. Twelve double heat sinks kept the heat curve low, but the limited fuel, armor, and maneuverability made the Phoenix Hawk LAM easy prey for AeroSpace Fighters of the same weight. It could maneuver fast enough to evade heavier foes however Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Phoenix Hawk LAM PHX-HK1R
details: This version was created before the introduction of the PHX-HK2, in 2695. It removed the ER Large Laser, a Medium Laser, and two heat sinks, replacing them with an experimental Snub-Nose PPC, Beagle Active Probe, and an additional half ton of armor. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Phoenix Hawk LAM PHX-HK2
details: The Phoenix Hawk LAM was the largest Land-Air 'Mech produced during the Star League. Allied Aerospace reworked their designs for conversion equipment and the size of the LAM, learning from their mistake with the Shadow Hawk LAM and the success of the Stinger LAM. The resulting LAM was the largest LAM ever constructed capable of remaining in AirMech mode. Unfortunately, large Land-Air 'Mech conversion technology was not fully researched before the fall of the Star League, and the Phoenix Hawk LAM frequently met its end due to the occasional glitch. The end of the Star League and destruction of the Allied Aerospace facilities at the beginning of the First Succession War prevented further development and refinement. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Phoenix Hawk LAM PHX-HK2M
details: House Marik produced a variant of the Phoenix Hawk LAM which replaces the Large Laser and Machine Guns with a Holly LRM-10. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Pillager PLG-1N
details: The original Pillager, designed in 2575 and fielded for the first two decades of the Reunification War, uses a standard fusion engine instead of the extralight model that later went into production. Other limitations include a 60 meter jump range and 17 tons of armor. The weapons suite was also different, relying on twin torso mounted Autocannon/20s, a single SRM-4, and three medium lasers; one mounted in each arm and a head-mounted laser firing to the rear. Sixteen single heat sinks kept the heat under control. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Pillager PLG-3Z
details: The PLG-3Z Pillager is built using a 300 XL engine, which weighs half as much as a standard fusion engine and gives the Pillager a top speed of 54 km/h. The small mass of the engine allows the 'Mech to mount an obscene array of weapons. The 'Mech's mobility is enhanced with three jump jets that allow it to jump up to ninety meters. The Pillager has excellent armor protection at nineteen and a half tons and has fourteen double heat sinks that provide more than enough heat dissipation capability for the Pillager's needs. The primary weapons on the Pillager are a pair of Gauss rifles, which allows the 'Mech' to engage an enemy at very long ranges. The Gauss rifles were supported at intermediate to close range by a Large laser and four Medium lasers. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Pillager PLG-3Z-EC
details: An early clan Mech dating from the days of Operation Klondike, the Pillager PLG-3Z-EC was an upgrade of the PLG-3Z that replaced the weapons with Early Clan variants. It would be discontinued and forgotten as modern clan spec weapons entered production. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Piranha 1
details: The Piranha's main threat is its twelve Series XII Rotary Machine Guns. These are a serious threat to any foe on such a speedy 'Mech, especially if a Star of Piranhas operate in a pack, and such a large array allows the 'Mech to chew through an opponent's rear armor almost instantly. They are most deadly, however, to unarmored infantry, capable of wiping out an entire company in seconds. For work against hardened targets, the Piranha mounts a pair of Mk. 3 ER Medium Lasers and a single Series 1 ER Small Laser. Since the design only uses ten single heat sinks, the MechWarrior must still manage heat levels. The ammunition dependency of the Machine Guns ensure that Piranhas must stay close to supply lines, so most have been relegated to solahma or garrison roles. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Short Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

name: Pouncer A
details:
The Pouncer was originally a test bed design that was upgraded to combat specifications on the orders of then-IlKhan Ulric Kerensky, as it was realized that a more mobile 'Mech was needed when combating Inner Sphere forces. The Pouncer is built on a lightweight DSAM Endo 4 Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a 240 XL engine which gives it a maximum speed of 97.2 km/h. The 'Mech's mobility is enhanced with five Grandthrust Mk. Four jump jets that allow it to jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. For protection from enemy fire, the Pouncer has a respectable six tons of Forging ZM15 Ferro-Fibrous armor. Overall, the Pouncer is an excellent OmniMech with fifteen and a half tons of pod space, allowing it to carry a wide variety of weapons payloads. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

details:

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Pouncer X 'Batchall'
details:
A 'Batchall' version of the Pouncer, seldom seen outside the Clan honor fights. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Predator II 1
details:
The Predator II 1 combines a large Gauss Rifle with four Medium Pulse Lasers, enabling a surprising amount of damage for what can fool the inexperienced MechWarrior as a simple 'Mech design. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Predator II 2
details:
The Predator II 2 replaces the gauss rifle of the original variant with a LB 10-X Autocannon and an extra Medium Pulse Laser. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Predator 1
details:
Roughly a third of the Predator's mass is consumed by two LB 10-X Autocannons. These have ample ammunition for most Clan Trials and usually stock both cluster and slug rounds. They are supported by a pair of ER Medium Lasers and paired ER Small Lasers. Not only can the lasers keep the symmetrical design in the fight after its autocannon ammunition runs out, they do not create a burden on the 'Mech's ability to control heat under normal circumstances. Ten double heat sinks is all the Predator needs to keep its heat in check. Quirk: Advanced Optics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Pulverizer PUL-2V
details: Built for long-range firepower, the Pulverizer relied on a modified ER PPC and LRMs to strike at a distance, while ECM systems and large lasers discouraged enemy sensors and kept wary opponents at arm’s length. More than 15 tons of armor, CASE and a standard fusion engine made the Pulverizer extremely hard to kill compared to more sophisticated early Clan machines. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Pulverizer PUL-3R
details: Developed by Clan Snow Raven this configuration trades the standard Large Lasers for Improved Large Lasers. The armor has also been replaced by Clan spec Ferro-Fibrous armor. The weight savings from these changes allows the Pulverizer to carry eighteen double heat sinks. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Pulverizer C
details: The PUL-C has been fully upgraded with clan tech from the previous mixed variants. A Clan ER PPC has replaced the early Enhanced ER PPC and the Large Lasers have been upgraded to Clan Large Pulse Lasers giving the PUL-C the ability to deal and withstand damage at long ranges. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - PPC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

name: Quickdraw QKD-4G
details: Quickdraw 4Gs are among the fastest and most maneuverable of heavy 'Mechs, with decent weaponry. They suffer from problematic heat buildup when using all their features at once, so some caution is needed. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Quickdraw QKD-4GR
details: A simple refit of the -4G, adding a C3 Slave unit by dropping one of the Medium Lasers. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Quickdraw QKD-4H
details: Quickdraw 4Hs are among the fastest and most maneuverable of heavy 'Mechs, with decent weaponry. They suffer from problematic heat buildup when using all their features at once, so some caution is needed. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Quickdraw QKD-4P
details: The -4P is an uncommon variant of the Quickdraw, made largely obsolete by more modern mechs and therefore only seen with mercenary bands low on luck, pirates or deep periphery garrisons. The largest drawback of the 'Mech is the giant Electronic Warfare Equipment fixed to its side torso, weighing in at 7.5 tons while providing considerably worse EWS capabilities then the most basic modern system. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Quickdraw QKD-5A
details: The Quickdraw 5A was designed to give the 'Mech more endurance than the stock 4G. By removing the LRM-10, two additional Medium Lasers and four additional Heat Sinks could be mounted. Unfortunately, the 5A still runs too hot for most pilots. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Quickdraw QKD-5K
details: The 5K Quickdraw is an upgraded variant using Star League technology produced by Luthien Armor Works in 3049. Carrying the same weaponry as the 5A model, its use of seventeen double heat sinks solves the problem of excessive waste heat. It also uses Ferro-Fibrous armor, giving the 5K superior armor protection to the 5A model, with no added weight. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Quickdraw QKD-5K2
details: A simple modification of the 5K's weapons array introduced in 3057, the rear-firing medium lasers are remounted to fire forward. The SRM-4 is then mounted to be fired rearward. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Quickdraw QKD-5M
details: Technicron's replacement for the original 4G model, the 5M was introduced in 3049 as an answer to the original's heat problems by replacing the thirteen normal heat sinks with double-strength versions. It also improved the design's defenses by swapping out the regular armor with Kallon FWL Special Ferro-Fibrous and installing CASE for the LRM's ammunition. The space necessary for these upgrades was provided for by removing the SRM launcher for a one-shot Hovertec SRM-4 Launcher, a disposable missile launcher more commonly found on VTOLs, hovercraft and similar combat vehicles. The loss in sheer short-range firepower is more than made up for by the other upgrades to the design. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Quickdraw QKD-5P
details: A periphery refit of a QKD-5M, the -5P combines the standard four medium lasers with a large Hatchet and a Supercharger, to bring the 'Mech quickly into melee range. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Quickdraw QKD-6KH
details: The -6KH is a clan conversion of the Quickdraw, initially seen amongst the mercenary band the Kell Hounds. A total of four ER Medium Lasers and an Artemis IV enabled LRM-10 missile launcher as the primary armament, while a Streak SRM-4 provides secondary close range firepower. The design even manages to fit both a C3 slave and a small targeting computer. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Quickdraw QKD-C
details: The C is a modified version of the 5K Quickdraw first fielded in 3053. One of the rear-facing lasers is replaced with a C3 slave unit, allowing it to work as part of a C3 lance. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Quickdraw IIC
details: A Clan IIC variant of the Quickdraw, utilizing the smaller and lighter Clan based technology to fit a total of nine ER Medium Lasers. However, the design never passed trials and is very seldom used by except piloting it into battle as a punishment. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

name: Raiden (Anti-Infantry)
details: The Raiden is a battle armor design that hails from the Draconis Combine. It is essentially the Combine's take on the Inner Sphere Standard which, though debuting first and also produced by the Kuritans themselves, represents an improvement on the design. Quirk: Well Designed Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Raiden [FL]
details: The Raiden is a battle armor design that hails from the Draconis Combine. It is essentially the Combine's take on the Inner Sphere Standard which, though debuting first and also produced by the Kuritans themselves, represents an improvement on the design. Quirk: Well Designed Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Raiden [L]
details: The Raiden is a battle armor design that hails from the Draconis Combine. It is essentially the Combine's take on the Inner Sphere Standard which, though debuting first and also produced by the Kuritans themselves, represents an improvement on the design. Quirk: Well Designed Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

details: The Raiden is a battle armor design that hails from the Draconis Combine. Quirk: Well Designed Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.
