Quirk: Well Designed Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Raiden [Tsunami]
details: The Raiden is a battle armor design that hails from the Draconis Combine. It is essentially the Combine's take on the Inner Sphere Standard which, though debuting first and also produced by the Kuritans themselves, represents an improvement on the design. Quirk: Well Designed Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.888 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Raijin RJN-101-A
details:
The Raijin is designed to be highly mobile and capable of engaging an enemy at a variety of ranges. The Raijin is built around a 300 XL Engine that gives it a top speed of 97.2 km/h. For added mobility, the Raijin carries six jump jets, allowing the 'Mech to jump up to one hundred and eighty meters. The Raijin carries seven tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. The 'Mech's relatively light armor can be a liability if it is engaged in close combat or finds itself in a protracted engagement. To handle the heat from the weapons onboard, the Raijin carries ten double heat sinks. For long-range striking power, the Raijin carries a ER PPC that can be used to engage a target at up to six hundred and ninety meters. For close combat, the Raijin has three Medium Pulse Lasers. Additionally, to seek out any weak points in an enemy's armor, the Raijin has a SRM-6 and an ammunition efficient Streak SRM-2 Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Raijin RJN-101-B
details:
The Raijin is designed to be highly mobile and capable of engaging an enemy at a variety of ranges. The Raijin is built around a 300 XL Engine that gives it a top speed of 97.2 km/h. For added mobility, the Raijin carries six jump jets, allowing the 'Mech to jump up to one hundred and eighty meters. The Raijin carries seven tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor. The 'Mech's relatively light armor can be a liability if it is engaged in close combat or finds itself in a protracted engagement. To handle the heat from the weapons onboard, the Raijin carries ten double heat sinks. For long-range striking power, the Raijin carries a ER PPC that can be used to engage a target at up to six hundred and ninety meters. For close combat, the Raijin has three Medium Pulse Lasers. Additionally, to seek out any weak points in an enemy's armor, the Raijin has a SRM-6 and an ammunition efficient Streak SRM-2 Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Raijin RJN-101-X
details:
A failed prototype to improve the survivability rate of the MechWarriors piloting Raijins. By converting the SRM6 launcher to a one shot, a CASE system was added to protected the Streak SRM ammunition. However, in real battle scenarios this only meant that the Mech's firepower got considerably nerfed for a minimal durability improvement. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Rakshasa MDG-1A
details:
The Rakshasa was designed by engineers at the New Avalon Institute of Science in an attempt to copy the Mad Cat. The finished product, while not as powerful as the OmniMech it emulates, is a powerful 'Mech with an undeserved bad reputation. The Rakshasa is powered by a GM 375 XL engine and built on a GM Marauder Special MD Endo Steel chassis to save weight and allow the 'Mech to carry as similar a weapons payload as possible to the Mad Cat. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Rampage RMP-2G
details:
Produced by the Rim Worlds Republic in 2735, the Rampage 2G was a standard line unit in the Rim Worlds Army. The 2G model was basic, but effective in its role, carrying a wide assortment of weapons to handle threats at any range of engagement. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Rampage RMP-4G
details:
Built in 2750, the Rampage 4G was a massive overhaul to the original 2G model, upgrading many of the components to modern equivalents. Most notable was the addition of a Gauss rifle at the expense of the missile tubes, giving the 4G considerable punch at longer ranges. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Rampage RMP-5G
details:
While the original Rampage had its debut in 2735 as a standard line unit, it saw a large scale redesign following the Amaris Coup in 2767. Taking advantage of the newly acquired SLDF R&D facilities, the Rampage 5G was outfitted with state-of-the-art weaponry previously unheard of in the Rim Worlds Republic. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Raptor RTX1-O
details:
The Raptor began as a proof of concept design by Luthien Armor Works that turned into a respected recon and fast strike OmniMech. The Raptor is built on an Alshain Type KR140 Endo Steel chassis and uses a weight-saving Omni 175 XL Engine, which gives the Raptor a top speed of 118.8 km/h. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Raptor RTX1-OA
details:
The Raptor A is intended for extended operations from supply lines. The Raptor A carries as its primary weapons two Large Lasers and for close range combat the A configuration carries three Small Lasers. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Raptor RTX1-OB
details:
The B configuration carries three SRM-6 launchers and a Small Laser. This configuration is intended for close combat and works well in a vehicle-hunting role as well as in mop up operations. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Raptor RTX1-OC
details:
Configured for medium to close range combat, the C configuration of the Raptor is built to swoop in on a target and overwhelm an enemy with fire from its six Medium Lasers and two Small Pulse Lasers and adds two more double heat sinks. For missile defense the Raptor C carries an Anti-Missile System. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Raptor RTX1-OD
details:
Loaded with advanced electronic equipment, the D configuration carries a TAG laser designator, a Beagle Active Probe, and a C3 Slave unit. The Raptor D is armed with a short-range arsenal of three Streak SRM-2 launchers and two Small Lasers. To deter infantry attacks, the D configuration has two Machine Guns. The combination of a Beagle Active Probe with TAG and a C3 slave make the Raptor D an excellent point 'Mech for light C3 lances, since it is able to share targeting information with allied units and also find hidden units and designate them for highly accurate artillery fire. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Raptor RTX1-OE
details:
A medium range missile barrage 'Mech, the E configuration carries three MRM-10 launchers with a single Small Laser as a backup weapon. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Raptor RTX1-OF
details:
Similar to the C configuration, the F configuration of the Raptor carries five ER Medium Lasers and adds three additional double heat sinks. The Raptor F has added maneuverability with the addition of seven jump jets, allowing it to jump up to two hundred and ten meters. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Raptor RTX1-OR
details:
A field upgrade developed in the midst of Operation Bulldog, this configuration utilized captured Clan Smoke Jaguar weapons to help bolster the SLDF forces in later waves. This configuration mounts an array of Clan-tech Extended Range Lasers, with an ER Large and medium in each arm and a ER Small Laser beside a C3 Slave unit in the center torso. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Rattlesnake JR7-31
details:
An offshoot of the Jenner, the 35 ton Rattlesnake JR7-31 was developed as part of the joint MIIO-LIC Trapdoor Project during the early years of the Clan Invasion. Meant primarily as a disinformation campaign targeted at House Kurita, few Rattlesnakes were ever manufactured, with the design becoming extinct within 30 years. Built around a 245-rated XL Engine and 7 Jump Jets, the Rattlesnake mounts 7 Medium Lasers. Guardian ECM is included and the remaining tonnage devoted to additional armor. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Rattlesnake JR7-31B
details: The JR7-31B is a slightly cheaper version of the JR7-31P. By dropping one of the heat sinks, the armor was able to be switched from the more expensive Ferro-Fibrous to standard grade. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Rattlesnake JR7-31P
details:
An offshoot of the Jenner, the 35 ton Rattlesnake JR7-31P was developed as part of the joint MIIO-LIC Trapdoor Project during the early years of the Clan Invasion. Meant primarily as a disinformation campaign targeted at House Kurita, few Rattlesnakes were ever manufactured, with the design becoming extinct within 30 years. Built around a 245-rated XL Engine and 7 Jump Jets, the Rattlesnake mounts 7 Medium Lasers. A C3 Slave is included and the remaining tonnage devoted to additional armor. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Rattlesnake JR7-31PX
details: The 31PX is the early prototype version of what eventually got introduced as the JR7-31P. The C3 slave computer of the later version is missing in the PX, but instead an extra Medium Laser is mounted in the head. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

name: Rattlesnake JR7-31U
details:
The JR7-31U switches to an endo steel chassis to free enough weight capacity to increase the amount of armor. The Guardian ECM of the original JR7-31 is also replaced by a C3 Slave computer. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Razor Jaw 1
details:
The Razor Jaw carries an ATM-9 in each side torso and a Medium Pulse Laser in each arm. Five Jump Jets improves mobility enough to compensate for its lack of a high max speed. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Reconquista 1
details:
As a BattleMech design the Reconquista was a mixed-bag. Its numerous faulty components included the internal combustion engine, myomer, chassis, spare parts, controls and software. The Reconquista's slow speed and limited agility were also severe weaknesses exploited by Umayyad artillery and tanks. On the other hand, the armor, heat sinks and mix of weaponry (autocannon, machine gun and long-range missiles) proved adequate, and the 'Mech could be built in (relatively) large enough numbers at a critical time of the invasion. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.89

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Rhino Battle Armor
details: The Rhino was an early attempt made by Clan Hell's Horses to develop true battle armor during the Golden Century. The Rhino's weapons layout and equipment was similar to the Elemental (Battle Armor), but was not as capable as the later machine. Its weapons ranges were shorter and it lacked maneuverability and speed. However, the armor was greater than what the Elemental battlesuit would carry. In addition, while the suit's SRM 2 was easy to use and reload, it had a significant jamming issue. This issue would cause catastrophic ammo explosions dealing major damage to the suit and the pilot (for an example, see Bertram). Engineers tried to resolve the issue, but the Rhino was shelved before the issue could be rectified. Quirk: Armored Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.935 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can not swarm.

name: Rhino RHN-10
details: The Rhino's main armament is a Large Laser mounted in the center torso, while it also carries a Medium Laser in each leg, one rear-facing one in the left torso and another in the head. A basic 300-rated fusion core keeps mobility up just enough to not be easily flanked. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

name: Rifleman IIC 1
details:
Simple, straightforward, and accurate; the Rifleman IIC is armed with four Large Pulse Lasers. This allows it to pick apart enemies from a respectable range, as well as easily target incoming aircraft. A single ER Small Laser is installed, seemingly as an afterthought. Nineteen double heat sinks keep heat mostly in check, though volley fire should be used. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Rifleman IIC 2
details:
This variant removes all of the weapons and equipment, and replaces them with four Ultra Autocannon/2s and six tons of ammunition. The weight saved, plus a half ton from armor, is used to upgrade the engine to allow the 'Mech a top speed of 64 km/h. MechWarriors must be exceptionally wary of the large, vulnerable ammo bins. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Rifleman IIC A
details:
A modern Clan take on the classic Succession Wars era RFL-3N Rifleman, the A variant carries a Large Pulse Laser and Ultra Autocannon/5 in each arm, supported by an ER Medium Laser in each side torso. Built around a 260-rated XL Engine, Endo Steel frame, and ten tons of Ferro-Fibrous armor, the A is fitted with sixteen Double Heat Sinks and four tons of UAC ammo. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Rifleman III RF2-A
details:
Developed for the Emperor Stefan Amaris's occupying army, the Rifleman III was an experimental prototype which was rushed into service to defend against the invading Star League Defense Force Army led by General Aleksandr Kerensky in 2777. Only a single prototype was produced after years of development, and it was destroyed during the battle for Terra. Used in the role of an ambusher before being destroyed, the 'Mech's Battle ROM would recount that it had downed nine SLDF BattleMechs before it was rendered inoperable by battle damage. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Roadrunner RD-1R
details: Originally conceived by Clan Jade Falcon during the Clans' Golden Century, the Emerald Harrier is a 15-ton BattleMech. It was out of production by the time of the Clan Invasion of the Inner Sphere and, as such, was only sparsely deployed there. ComStar ROM operatives gave it the reporting name RD-1R Roadrunner when they first observed it in the Jade Falcon occupation zone. It was last reported with Eyrie units on Coventry in 3058 and is thought to have been meant as a training 'Mech. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Roc 1
details: The Roc is considered one of the best of the first generation ProtoMechs, and most known successful, as it was produced, operative and fighting for almost a century. In a sense a 'super-Elemental', a Roc carries a single ER Medium Laser and is equipped with sufficient Jump Jets to leap 150 meters at a time. Quirk: Accurate Weapons - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.9

name: Ronin SA-RN
details:
The SA-RN model uses four Artemis IV FCS-guided SRM-4 launchers protected by CASE. It also sports a prototype claw in the left arm and a Large Pulse Laser in the right. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Ronin SA-RNS
details:
The SA-RNS is almost identical to the SA-RN, but drops one ton of SRM ammunition to increase the armoring of the 'Mech. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Rook RK-BU3
details: The Rook relies on its many weapons and substantial amount of armor rather than speed, but to improve mobility it has three Assault-class Jump Jets. The two PPC, three SRM-6 and three Medium Lasers are cooled by a total of 22 heat sinks, which despite the large number of sinks is far from enough to cool a full alpha strike of the 'Mech. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Roughneck RGH-1A
details: A militarized BattleMech version of Achernar's Loader King IndustrialMech, the Roughneck is a low-cost heavy 'Mech intended for price conscious buyers such as planetary militias and down-on-their-luck mercenary units. Featuring a mixed if short ranged weapons loadout, the Roughneck's primary weapons are an AC/10 and SRM-4 in its torsos, supported by a trio of Machine Guns and a head-mounted Small Laser. While tying it to supply lines, two tons of SRM and autocannon rounds provide adequate field endurance, only a ton and a half of rounds supporting three machine guns run dry quickly. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Roughneck RGH-1B
details: A militarized BattleMech version of Achernar's Loader King IndustrialMech, the Roughneck is a low-cost heavy 'Mech intended for price conscious buyers such as planetary militias and down-on-their-luck mercenary units. The Roughneck-1B swaps the AC/10 of the -1A for an AC/5 and upgrades the missiles to a pair of SRM-6 racks. The Small Laser and two of the Machine Guns are retained. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Roughneck RGH-1C
details: A militarized BattleMech version of Achernar's Loader King IndustrialMech, the Roughneck is a low-cost heavy 'Mech intended for price conscious buyers such as planetary militias and down-on-their-luck mercenary units. The Roughneck-1C leans hard on its missiles for firepower, carrying a pair of SRM-6s and a pair of Machine Guns for close range power, with long range firepower provided by a LRM-10 and an AC/5. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Roughneck RGH-3A
details: A militarized BattleMech version of Achernar's Loader King IndustrialMech, the Roughneck is a low-cost heavy 'Mech intended for price conscious buyers such as planetary militias and down-on-their-luck mercenary units. The Roughneck-3A is an advanced technology version of the Roughneck that makes heavy use of Double Heat Sinks to power an all-energy loadout of 2 PPCs, 4 Medium Lasers, and a solitary Small Laser. 18 Double Heat Sinks keep the mech nice and cool. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Salamander PPR-5S
details:
An assault grade fire support mech, the Salamander entered production in 3055. An 80-ton mech, the Salamander is built around a 320-rated XL Engine and an Endo Steel Skeleton, allowing it to carry 43 tons of weapons and equipment. The Salamander PPR-5S is armed with a trio of LRM-20’s. A pair of Medium Lasers act as back up weapons. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Salamander PPR-5T
details:
An assault grade fire support mech, the Salamander entered production in 3055. An 80-ton mech, the Salamander is built around a 400-rated XL Engine and an Endo Steel Skeleton. The Salamander PPR-5T is armed with a trio of LRM-15’s, with 2 Small Lasers as back up weapons. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Salamander PPR-6S
details:
An assault grade fire support mech, the Salamander entered production in 3055. An 80-ton mech, the Salamander is built around a 320-rated XL Engine and an Endo Steel Skeleton, allowing it to carry 43 tons of weapons and equipment. The Salamander PPR-6S is armed with a pair of Artemis IV enhanced LRM-20’s and an Artemis IV enhanced SRM-6. A pair of Medium Pulse Lasers act as back up weapons. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Salamander PPR-6T
details:
An assault grade fire support mech, the Salamander entered production in 3055. An 80-ton mech, the Salamander is built around a 320-rated XL Engine and an Endo Steel Skeleton, allowing it to carry 43 tons of weapons and equipment. The Salamander PPR-6T is armed with a pair of LRM-20’s. A pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a Large Pulse Laser act as back up weapons. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Salamander PPR-6U
details:
The PPR-6U Salamander is a sidegrade kit for the 6S, removing the Artemis IV systems and instead fits a Large Pulse Laser. The two Medium Pulse Lasers also had to be downgraded to standard versions. The kit is mainly used by mercenary outfits when advanced electronics like the Artemis IV FCS are rare or difficult to maintain. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Salamander [STD]
details: The Salamander the design incorporates fire-based weapons; its primary armaments being a pair of Flamers slung under the arms and a single, one-shot short-range missile strapped to the shoulder, invariably one with an Inferno payload. This makes the Salamander especially potent against infantry and combat vehicles, though that does not mean it is less intimidating to MechWarriors: few would want to get caught in the sights of a Salamander Point. Quirk: Fire Demon Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93 Can mount any unit, can melee, can swarm.

name: Sarissa MN1-K
details: The Sarissa MN1-K was armed simply. It carried a battery of lasers, one large and several medium, and mounted as much armor as could be fi tted with the remaining weight budget. Though truly a BattleMech, it drew heavily on a century of IndustrialMech construction experience and was often assembled in civilian facilities. The result was a mechanically reliable and durable machine ideal for Marik militias with little BattleMech training, but otherwise not terribly impressive. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.82

name: Sasquatch SQS-TH-001
details:
The original Sasquatch model produced in 3054, the 001 would infamously be stolen resulting in VEST creating the 002 model to hunt down and destroy the prototype. Hand made for the Solaris arenas, the Sasquatch SQS-TH-001 is an 85 ton Assault Mech powered by a 340-rated XL Engine. Primarily armed with a Gauss Rifle, the 001 has 4 Medium Pulse Lasers and an SRM-6 for close range combat. A pair of Machine Guns and a Small Laser are added as an after thought. AMS is mounted in the right torso and 6 Jump Jets improve mobility. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Sasquatch SQS-TH-001U
details:
The SQS-TH-001U adds more heat sinks for improved cooling at the cost of dropping some armor and replacing the SRM-6 launcher with two Small Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Sasquatch SQS-TH-007
details:
The SQS-TH-007 upgrades the original Sasquatch with ferro-fibrous armor, allowing more protection. One additional ton each of Gauss and AMS ammunition is also added. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Satyr 1
details: The Satyr ProtoMech was designed to serve as a deep raider and reconnaissance unit. Offering only slightly more protection than a Harpy or Siren, the Satyr's best defense is to remain hidden from enemy units. The Satyr's single ER Small Laser allows it to inflict moderate damage on any enemy unit that gets too close. It also carries a Light Active Probe in its torso, allowing it to more easily find hidden units. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

name: Savage Coyote A
details:
Though the first alternate configuration is focused on close-range combat, it carries an ER Large Laser and Gauss Rifle for long-range work. Three ATM 6s are effective at all ranges, while a trio of Medium Pulse Lasers aid with the devastating attack. Enough jump jets to vault up to ninety meters at a time helps MechWarriors get into close range, while an Anti-Missile System grants added defensive capability. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Savage Coyote B
details:
This variant is effective at all ranges. A pair of ER Large Lasers and a Large Pulse Laser combine with an Ultra Autocannon/5 to provide an effective long-range punch. Six Small Pulse Lasers aid at knife-fighting range and can quickly devastate conventional infantry. Two pairs of ATM 3s provide support at all ranges. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Savage Coyote Prime
details:
The primary configuration of the Savage Coyote makes use of a pair of the largest ATM, An ER PPC, an LB-X Autocannon/10, three ER Medium Lasers, and a pair of ER Small Lasers. MechWarriors must carefully manage heat levels, even with three additional double heat sinks. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Scorpion SCP-1N
details: One of the first mass production QuadMechs, the 55 ton Scorpion entered production in 2570 as an infantry support unit. Shunned by most MechWarriors due to its notoriously unstable gait, the Scorpion would nevertheless see uninterrupted use throughout the Succession Wars and beyond. The Scorpion 1N is powered by a 330-rated Fusion Core giving it a top speed of 97 km/h. A PPC and an SRM-6 form the Mechs weapons load. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Scorpion SCP-1O
details: One of the first mass production QuadMechs, the 55 ton Scorpion entered production in 2570 as an infantry support unit. Shunned by most MechWarriors due to its notoriously unstable gait, the Scorpion would nevertheless see uninterrupted use throughout the Succession Wars and beyond. The Scorpion 1O is powered by a 330-rated Fusion Core giving it a top speed of 97 km/h. An ER PPC and an SRM-6 form the Mechs weapons load. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Scorpion SCP-1W
details: This 'Mech was used by the Wolf's Dragoons during their campaigns in the Inner Sphere. The design replaces most of the technology in the 'Mech with Clan-grade equivalents, considerably improving the performance compared to the original Scorpion designs. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Sentinel STN-1S
details:
The Sentinel is a medium BattleMech built by Defiance Industries, originally under exclusive contract for the Lyran Commonwealth, as an infantry support and installation defense 'Mech. While initially pleased to have a then Terran Hegemony controlled factory manufacturing the 'Mech exclusively for the LCAF, the Lyrans were less so when a Star League Council amendment in 2652 permitted the Star League Defense Force to purchase a highly advanced version of the design which Houses Steiner, Marik and Davion would not receive until years later. The Sentinel was one of many designs to suffer from the technological decline of the Succession Wars era, with Defiance first losing the ability to manufacture its advanced weapon systems before discontinuing production entirely in 3014 due to lack of both parts and interest. Rather than disappear from the battlefield, the Sentinel now began to appear in increasing numbers thanks to ComStar and its massive stockpile of SLDF material, both providing the design to the Draconis Combine prior to the War of 3039 and using it to help outfit its Com Guards. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

name: Sentinel STN-3K
details:
The Sentinel is a medium BattleMech built by Defiance Industries, originally under exclusive contract for the Lyran Commonwealth, as an infantry support and installation defense 'Mech. While initially pleased to have a then Terran Hegemony controlled factory manufacturing the 'Mech exclusively for the LCAF, the Lyrans were less so when a Star League Council amendment in 2652 permitted the Star League Defense Force to purchase a highly advanced version of the design which Houses Steiner, Marik and Davion would not receive until years later. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

name: Sentinel STN-3L-EC
details:
An early clan Mech dating from the days of Operation Klondike, the Sentinel STC-3L-EC was an upgrade of the standard STL-3L that replaced the weapons with Early Clan variants. Prodcution of the Mech was discontinued when modern clan spec weapons entered production. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Upper

name: Sentinel STN-3M
details:
The Sentinel is a medium BattleMech built by Defiance Industries, originally under exclusive contract for the Lyran Commonwealth, as an infantry support and installation defense 'Mech. While initially pleased to have a then Terran Hegemony controlled factory manufacturing the 'Mech exclusively for the LCAF, the Lyrans were less so when a Star League Council amendment in 2652 permitted the Star League Defense Force to purchase a highly advanced version of the design which Houses Steiner, Marik and Davion would not receive until years later.
