details: The 2C is a mercenary rebuild of the Tarantula using mainly Clan Tech. Originally introduced by the Kell Hounds, but has since seen use with other mercenary outfits as well. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Tempest 1
details: Using an all energy loadout, the Tempest 1 uses an ER PPC and Large Pulse Laser as the main damage dealers, with four Medium Pulse Lasers as an extra punch. Seven ER Small lasers provide anti-infantry defense at closer ranges. Although the Tempest mounts 16 double heat sinks, this is far from enough to handle the total heat build-up from all the energy weapons, so it is recommended only experienced MechWarriors who know how to manage heat properly pilots the 'Mech. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

name: Templar CRD-1G
details: The Templar CRD-1G mounts a PPC and two machine guns in the right arm, a SRM-6 in the left arm, and two medium lasers and an LRM-15 in the left torso. Both missile launchers have one ton of ammunition, while the machine guns has a half ton. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Templar CRD-1R
details:
The -1R is a large upgrade of the original TMP-1G. It replaces the engine with a 325 XL, switches to double heat sinks and uses an Endo Steel chassis. As for its weapons, the 1R drops the PPC and machine guns of the -1G, replacing them with a second copy of both the SRM-6 and LRM-10 launchers. One more ton of LRM ammunition was also added. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Templar CRD-6T
details: The Tempest CRD-6T is not a natural evolution of the design of the original Tempests, as it completely replaces all the weapons of the Tempest. In their place a total of twelve Medium Lasers, two flamers and a C3 slave computer were added. This design is in fact a identical to the Crusader CRD-6T, but the designers claim this is just by happenstance. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Tessen TSN-1C
details:
For long range combat, the TSN-1C carries a single ER PPC capable of hitting enemy units at extreme ranges. For close combat, the 'Mech has a single Medium Pulse Laser with which to defend itself. Additionally, the Tessen has an Improved Narc Missile Beacon, allowing it to designate targets for missile attacks from friendly units and a TAG laser designator allowing the Tessen to spot for Arrow IV artillery missile attacks. The Tessen is built on a lightweight Endo Steel chassis and is powered by a lightweight 300 XL engine, giving the 'Mech a top speed of 97.2 km/h. The Tessen carries an improved C3 computer allowing it to share targeting data with other C3i equipped friendly units. For protection from enemy fire, the Tessen has nine tons of ferro-fibrous armor with CASE to protect against complete destruction in the event of an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Thanatos TNS-4M
details:
A small rework of the -4S, the C3 Slave is removed, with all the weapons loadout the same as the C3 version. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Thanatos TNS-4P
details:
A small rework of the -4T, the LB 20-X is replaced with an AC/20 fed by 4 tons of ammo, the C3 Slave is removed. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Thanatos TNS-4S
details:
Intended to emulate the Thor OmniMech used by the Clans, the Thanatos is an incredibly sturdy and hard-hitting design. Copying both the looks and the capabilities of the Clan Thor, the Thanatos is a fast all-range design, though it skimps on armor a bit for a mech its size. Carrying an ER Large Laser for long range and a brace of advanced medium lasers and a MRM-20 for medium to close range, the Thanatos has a weapon for any situation. Combined with a fast 86.4 km/h top speed and five jump jets, the Thanatos can often catch what it cannot out-range. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Thanatos TNS-5P
details:
A 300 rated Light Fusion Engine provides improved survivability. The -5P mounts an LB 10-X Autocannon with 2 tons of ammo in the left arm, an ER PPC in the right arm, and 3 LRM-5s split between the left arm and both torsos with 3 tons of ammo feeding them. The ECM and Jump-Jets remain, with 12 Double Heat Sinks dissipating the relatively cool weapons loadout. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Thanatos TNS-5S
details:
The -5S' primary weapons are a pair of Light Gauss Rifles with 3 tons of ammo split between the torsos, with two ER medium lasers in the left arm and an LRM-10 with a ton of ammo in the right arm. A 300 rated extra-light allows these weapons to be mounted, along with the ECM and Jump-Jets, and 13 Double Heat Sinks. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Thanatos TNS-5T
details:
A dedicated missile boat, the -5T mounts six MRM-10s, two in each arm, and one in each side torso, fed by 10 tons of ammo. This variant is protected by fourteen tons of armor along with Guardian ECM, with a 300 light engine further increasing durability, and four Jump-Jets increase the 'Mech's mobility. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Thantos THS-4A
details: With a Gauss rifle in the right arm and a total of twelve Machin Guns, the THS-4A has a highly unbalanced damage profile. It can either damage foes at a long distance or a close range, while it struggles to deal with targets at medium ranges. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Thorn THE-F
details:
The original pre-endo steel model introduced in 2490 carries two Medium Lasers and a LRM-5 launcher, 4 tons of standard grade armor and uses a standard 120-rated fusion core. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Thorn THE-N
details:
The Thorn carries a weapons array that is not usually seen on light 'Mechs: a Zeus LRM-5 launcher mounted in the right arm with one ton of reloads in the right torso, paired with two Hellion Spitfire Medium Lasers split between the head and left arm. Four and a half tons of armor provides the Thorn with good protection, especially when mated with CASE to contain any ammunition explosions. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Thorn THE-N1
details:
Developed in 3051 on the orders of Precentor Martial Anastasius Focht to try and close the gap between the Clans and Com Guards, the factory refit THE-N1 received its baptism of fire during the Battle of Tukayyid. Having reached a similar conclusion that resulted in the THE-Nb, the CASE was dropped and the standard engine was swapped for an XL Engine to allow the standard weaponry to be stripped for an all energy weapon array: a right arm mounted Kinslaughter H-Class ER PPC and a head-mounted Intek Small Laser. This new weapons array, enhanced by double heat sinks, added a level of lethality never seen before on the Thorn. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Thorn THE-Nb
details:
The advanced model employed by the Star League Defense Force Royal Divisions in 2743 changed the role of the 'Mech from a missile to an energy boat, replacing the LRM launcher with an ER Large Laser, retaining one medium laser and downgrading the other to a Small Laser. Dropping the no longer required CASE, the 'Mech also used a MASC system for temporary speed bursts and Double Heat Sinks to vent its increased waste heat output. The THE-Nb mounted an XL Engine to save the weight to mount this extra equipment, at the cost of reduced survivability. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Thorn THE-N-EC
details:
An early clan Mech dating from the days of Operation Klondike, the Thorn THE-N-EC was an upgrade of the THE-N that replaced the weapons with Early Clan variants. It would be discontinued and forgotten as modern clan spec weapons entered production. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Thorn THE-S
details:
Supplied by ComStar to the Draconis Combine as part of Operation Rosebud in 3035, the THE-S was a downgraded factory refit of the THE-N. Stripping out the advanced Endo Steel chassis and CASE, the use of a heavier standard chassis forced a reduction in the Thorns armor protection by half a ton, most of which was removed from the head and rear torso. The communications system was also changed to a more primitive Olmstead 30, although the Omicron VII targeting-tracking system was similar in capabilities to the Orion 80 it replaced. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Thorn THE-T
details:
Developed in 3038 by the Draconis Combine in an attempt to upgrade the 'Mech's short range firepower prior to the War of 3039, the THE-T is a field refit of the downgraded THE-S that swaps out the LRM launcher for an SRM-4. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Thresher 1
details:
The largest gun on the Thresher is its Ultra Autocannon/10. The medium range weapon can dish out a fair amount of damage, but it is not a legitimate long-range threat. At closer ranges, the Thresher can bring a ER Medium Laser and a pair of accurate Medium Pulse Lasers to bear. Two SRM-6 launchers can exploit holes the other weapons make in an enemy's armor. Thirteen double heat sinks keep the 'Mech cool. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Thresher 2
details:
This variant is more respectable at long range. It downgrades the autocannon to an LB-X Autocannon/5. The weight saved is used to upgrade the pulse lasers to ER Large Lasers Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Thug THG-10E
details: The 10E is a downgraded version of the 11E produced by Earthwerks Incorporated following the destruction of Maltex's facilities in 2835. The primary changes come from the loss of the double heat sinks, CASE, and the Endo Steel structure. To compensate for the weight needed for a standard structure, the SRMs have been downgraded from six tube launchers to SRM-4s. In addition, the Thug lost one ton of ammunition. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

name: Thug THG-11E
details: The Thug was designed by Maltex Corporation as a direct competitor to the popular Warhammer BattleMech. First seeing production in 2572, the Thug sought to directly address some of the challenges which faced the Warhammer, chief of which was to increase armor protection without sacrificing firepower. The Thugs long range striking power comes from a pair of arm mounted PPC’s. Backing up the PPCs are two SRM-6 launchers mounted in either side torso with one ton of CASE-protected reloads. Eighteen double heat sinks comfortably dissipate the enormous heat generated by the PPC’s while an Endo Steel frame allows it to carry fifteen and a half tons of armor. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Thug THG-11E2
details: The 11E2 was an almost complete overhaul of the original 11E by the Clans using their original stock of Thugs and surplus gear from the Exodus. The only remaining weapon from the original design is one of the SRM-6 launchers. By switching to an XL Engine, the design can now fit two ER Large Lasers, to standard Large Lasers, two Small Lasers and a single Small Pulse Laser - besides the kept SRM-6 launcher. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Thug THG-11Eb
details: The 11Eb is an upgrade of the Thug used by the SLDF Royal Brigades in 2760. It upgrades the PPCs to ER PPCs. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Thunder Stallion 1
details: Ideal for working with spotters, the Thunder Stallion mounts four LRM-15 launchers and eight tons of ammunition for them. This gives the 'Mech a significant long-range punch that can be called down from behind cover. Perhaps the largest backup weapon ever is the Thunder Stallion's LB 20-X AC. This massive gun is capable of defending against infantry or blowing holes in all but the most well-armored of opponents. Fourteen double heat sinks keep the 'Mech cooled down. This relatively inexpensive, durable design is protected by a whopping seventeen and a half tons of armor. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

name: Thunder Stallion 2 'Fire Stallion'
details: This variant, introduced 2877 (also known as the Fire Stallion), lessens the ammunition dependency of the Thunder Stallion. It replaces the autocannon and its attendant ammunition with a pair of Large Pulse Lasers and two additional double heat sinks to handle the increased heat from the energy weapons. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

name: Thunder THR-1L
details:
The THR-1L Thunder is the first heavy ’Mech designed and produced by a Capellan manufacturer following the Clan invasion. Powered by a 350 XL Engine, the 70 ton Thunder is armed with an AC/20 supplied with three tons of ammunition. Complementing the autocannon is an LRM-5 located in the left torso, with one ton of ammunition. Three Medium Pulse Lasers back up the autocannon at close range, and the designers installed CASE to protect against ammo detonation. Quirk: Cowl Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: ThunderBird TRB-1D
details: The ThunderBird 'Mech is armed with the ER Large Laser from a TRB-D36b fighter, the LRM-20 launcher from a TRB-D36 and two Streak SRM-2 of uncertain origin. Further, the Artemis IV FCS from a TRB-D46 has been attached to the LRM launcher. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Thunderbolt TDR-1C
details: This was the original Thunderbolt design produced in 2491 by Earthwerks Limited, built with Primitive Technology, until the introduction of the modern TDR-5S in 2505. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.87

name: Thunderbolt TDR-5G
details: A Grey Death Legion custom variant, replacing most of the 'Mech with Clan technology. It has a varied assortment of armaments, one ER Large Laser, three Medium Pulse Laser, one LRM-15, one Stream SRM-4 and four Machine Guns. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: Thunderbolt TDR-5L
details: The so-called "Lost Thunderbolt", the 5L was a downgraded version of the Royal 5Sb Thunderbolt developed by Earthwerks Tikonov in 2823. Built on a more basic standard chassis, the now LosTech ER PPC was swapped for a Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Laser but most of the 5Sb's systems were preserved with only the loss of one double heat sink and the head-mounted Small Laser. Production of the design only lasted a mere twenty-seven years before further technology decline resulted in the 5LS. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Thunderbolt TDR-5LS
details: Developed in 2850 as the Second Succession War saw more and more technologies disappear, the 5LS was a downgraded field refit and a factory model of the now impossible to build 5L. While the ER Large Laser and Starfish Small Pulse Lasers were retained, the standard LRM-15 and Bical SRM-2 rack were noticeably less accurate than the 5L's more advanced launchers, but nothing compared to the replacement of the 5L's double heat sinks with fifteen standard models and the heat management issues that resulted. Production of even the "primitive" 5LS would end during the Third Succession War. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Thunderbolt TDR-5S
details: The Thunderbolt 5S is well armored and heavily armored for its size. It's often deployed as a frontline 'Mech where the fighting is heavy, and it needs to give as good as it gets. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Thunderbolt TDR-5Sb
details: This SLDF Royal variant of the Thunderbolt was introduced in 2753 and uses Star League technology. An Endo Steel chassis provides more space for an updated weapon mix. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Thunderbolt TDR-5Sb2
details: The 5Sb2 is a slight downgrade of the standard Royal 5Sb, replacing the ER PPC with a standard PPC. This allowed the 'Mech to be exported to other parties outside the SLDF. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

name: Thunderbolt TDR-5Sd
details: This Star League-era Federated Suns refit of the Thunderbolt removes the LRM-15, machine guns and their ammunition and replaces them with an Ultra AC/5 with two tons of ammunition. For close in work, an extra medium laser is added and the large laser is traded for a Large Pulse Laser. It upgrades the heat sinks to twelve double-strength models. How many of these variants survived past the Star League Era is unknown. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Thunderbolt TDR-5SE
details: Thunderbolt SE models lose a little of their firepower in exchange for mounting Jump Jets. The greater mobility is intended to allow for more precision attacking maneuvers, though it all depends on the battlefield terrain. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Thunderbolt TDR-5SP
details: A Periphery refit, the Thunderbolt-5SP does a little bit of everything. Armed primarily with a Large Chemical Laser and a LRM-10 launcher, the TDR-5SP is well suited for ranged trades. At closer ranges a trio of Medium Chemical Lasers provide support fire. At point-blank, an Inferno Rocket Launcher-20 and a pair of Machine Guns do heavy work. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Thunderbolt TDR-5SR
details: The Thunderbolt TDR-5SR variant slightly updates the 5S design, replacing the standard heat sinks with double versions. This allows adding one more Medium Laser in the Center Torso, as well as Artemis IV FCS for both missile launchers, CASE protection and a C3 slave unit. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Thunderbolt TDR-5SS
details: Known for its superb heat management, the Thunderbolt 5SS hits hard at long range with its PPC and then closes to disable or destroy its target with close-range weaponry. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Thunderbolt TDR-7M
details: Designed with Star League technology, the 7M has been re-armored using Ferro-Fibrous armor, allowing the 'Mech's weapons to be upgraded with the freed weight. With an arsenal based on the 5S model, the 7M carries an LRM-15 missile launcher in the right torso, an ER Large Laser in the right arm, three medium lasers and a Streak SRM-2 launcher in the left torso, and a pair of machine guns in the left arm. Two tons of LRM reloads are kept in the right torso while one ton each of Streak and machine gun ammo are kept in the left torso. Additionally, the heat sinks have been upgraded to double heat sinks and CASE has been added to protect against ammunition explosion. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Thunderbolt TDR-8M
details: The Earthwerks TDR-8M was released in 3058, combining aspects of established variants with then-new ER medium lasers. It was the basis for the Vicore Industries-influenced visual redesign of the Thunderbolt chassis that became the norm for all future Earthwerks models in the mid-3060s. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Thunderbolt TDR-9S
details: Based on the older 5SS model, the 9S was built in 3050 by Olivetti Weaponry using off-the-shelf structural components and armor after extensive changes delayed production. The 'Mech is armed with an ER PPC in its right arm as its primary long-range firepower. This is supported at closer ranges by a SRM-6 in the left torso along with the original three medium lasers. While retaining the left arm machine guns, in the right torso it carries a pair of flamers and an anti-missile system, along with one ton of AMS ammo. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Thunderbolt TDR-9SE
details: The 9SE variant of the Thunderbolt was introduced in 3050 as the Eridani Light Horse's update to the 5SE, based primarily around an energy weapons arsenal and maneuverability. The 'Mech is armed with a LRM-10 missile launcher for long-range combat. For close to medium ranges, the 'Mech carries a Large Pulse Laser and three medium lasers. Of note is the shifting of the missile launcher and its one ton of reloads from the right torso to the left. The additional mobility of the 9SE comes from its four jump jets, giving it a jumping distance of 120 meters. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Thunderbolt TDR-9W
details: This variant was built by Blackwell Industries for Wolf's Dragoons and it was based on a configuration from the Golden Century. Four jump jets let it cover 120 meters per jump. Fifteen double heat sinks dissipate the heat from various Clan-spec weapons. The right arm carries a Clan-spec Large Pulse Laser, the three torso-mounted lasers are Clan-spec Medium Pulse Lasers, and the LRM-10 is also Clan-spec and equipped with an Artemis IV FCS. Two tons of LRM ammo are carried in the left torso in a CASE-protected bin. Twelve tons of Inner Sphere-spec ferro-fibrous armor provides maximum protection. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Thunderbolt TDR-9WDR
details: The 9WDR, based of the 9W, is another variant created specifically for the Wolf's Dragoons. By switching to full clan armor, the CASE could be dropped and the armor weight is lowered by a ton. This allowed adding a C3 slave and an A-Pod in the right leg. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

name: Thunderbolt C
details: This is a field refit created by the Clans during Operation REVIVAL. Captured Inner Sphere Thunderbolts were refitted and used by garrison and solahma troops. The Thunderbolt C had a Large Pulse Laser in the right arm, an ER Large Laser in the left torso, and the left arm carried an ER medium laser and a pair of ER small lasers. Twenty-four single heat sinks are fitted to the legs and all the torsos. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Thunderbolt C 2
details: This variant was developed by Clan Jade Falcon after they recaptured Sudeten. Based on the Thunderbolt C, this model has an ER PPC in the right arm while the left arm carries an ER medium laser and a pair of ER small lasers. The left torso carries a Streak SRM-6, three ER medium lasers, and a ton of Streak ammunition. The right torso carries two small pulse lasers and an anti-missile system with a ton of ammunition. To make room for this equipment, the twenty-four heat sinks have been replaced by seventeen double heat sinks. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

name: Thunderbolt TDR-F4V
details: When the Magistracy of Canopus found an abandoned Star League facility in 3018, amongst the stored equipment was a number of Thunderbolt chassis. All of them were severely damage and missing key components such as the weapons, gyro and engine. The Magistracy had to acquire these at great cost from the open market, and therefore opted to install internal combustion engines instead of the fusion cores. The F4V was the first variant to enter service, armed only with twin Armstrong class-5 autocannons. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.87

name: Thunderbolt TDR-F4W
details: When the Magistracy of Canopus found an abandoned Star League facility in 3018, amongst the stored equipment was a number of Thunderbolt chassis. All of them were severely damage and missing key components such as the weapons, gyro and engine. The Magistracy had to acquire these at great cost from the open market, and therefore opted to install internal combustion engines instead of the fusion cores. The F4W was intended as a hedge against civil unrest. The planetary armory traded one AC/5 for a SRM-6 and a heavy battery of machine guns whose short range meant the F4W could only engage at close quarters – excellent for controlling unruly mobs, but nearly useless against anything else. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.87

name: Thunderbolt TDR-F4X
details: When the Magistracy of Canopus found an abandoned Star League facility in 3018, amongst the stored equipment was a number of Thunderbolt chassis. All of them were severely damage and missing key components such as the weapons, gyro and engine. The Magistracy had to acquire these at great cost from the open market, and therefore opted to install internal combustion engines instead of the fusion cores. The F4X was the final version, overhauled to use an AC/10 in the right forearm while a pair of ten-tube MRM launchers was fitted into the left torso. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.87

name: Thunder Hawk TDK-7KMA
details: Produced in the last years of the Amaris Civil War for the SLDF, the Thunder Hawk emphasizes firepower over speed. A 100-ton mech, the Thunder Hawk TDK-7Y is built around a 300-rated XL Engine and is armed with a pair of Gauss Rifles; and an Arrow IV Missile Launcher. 4 Medium Lasers act as back up weapons. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Thunder Hawk TDK-7X
details: Produced in the last years of the Amaris Civil War for the SLDF, the Thunder Hawk emphasizes firepower over speed. A 100-ton mech, the Thunder Hawk TDK-7X is built around a 300-rated XL Engine and is armed with a trio of Gauss Rifles, with 4 Medium Lasers as back up weapons. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Thunder Hawk TDK-7Y
details: Produced in the last years of the Amaris Civil War for the SLDF, the Thunder Hawk emphasizes firepower over speed. A 100-ton mech, the Thunder Hawk TDK-7Y is built around a 300-rated XL Engine and is armed with a trio of Gauss Rifles, with a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers as back up weapons. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: ThunderHawk 1
details:
The Mech's principal armament is an Ultra AC/20 in the left torso and a LBX/20 in the right torso, two weapons which together can deliver an immense punch. Two LRM-20 with attached Artemis IV systems are used until the ThunderHawk is able to close distance with its targets. Since the 'Mech only carries a 270 XL engine, as a result its largest weakness is open combat as more mobile units can easily keep it at a range of engagement where the ThunderHawk's large autocannons are not as effective. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Ti Ts'ang TSG-9H
details:
Built exclusively for medium to short range combat, the Ti Ts'ang TSG-9H carries a devastating array of five ER Medium Lasers backed up by four ER Small Lasers as its only ranged weapons. The 'Mech's most fearsome weapon is its Hatchet, which is capable of cleaving into an enemy's 'Mech and when the Triple Strength Myomer is active it is capable of slicing through armor like a hot knife through butter. Additionally, the Ti Ts'ang has an TAG laser designator that allows the 'Mech to call in highly accurate missile or artillery strikes. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Ti Ts'ang TSG-9J
details:
The 9J variant of the Ti Ts'ang is built with long range combat in mind. In order to allow the 'Mech to defend itself, the TAG laser as well as two ER Medium Lasers, two ER Small Lasers, and a double heat sink have been removed to make room for an ER Large Laser, allowing the Ti Ts'ang to strike at long ranges. Quirk: Hyper-Extending Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Timber Wolf A
details:
Configured specifically for long range, direct fire combat, the A configuration of the Timber Wolf is armed with a pair of ER PPCs. These give the Timber Wolf A the capability of stripping nearly two tons of armor off of an enemy 'Mech at extreme ranges. For close combat, the A configuration has three Medium Pulse Lasers, an ER Small Laser, and a Streak SRM-6 to find any weak points in an enemy's armor. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf B
details:
Armed to engage an enemy at either short or long ranges, the B configuration is an attempt to use the Timber Wolf in a workhorse role. For long range combat, a Gauss Rifle and an LRM-10 launcher gives the Timber Wolf B a powerful long range punch. For short to medium range engagements, a Large Pulse Laser is carried. Finally, for short ranges, a Small Pulse Laser and SRM-4 launcher are carried. Additionally, both of the missile launchers are linked to an Artemis IV Fire Control System to allow for greater missile accuracy. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf C
details:
A long range configuration of the Timber Wolf, the C configuration carries an assortment of long range weapons. For direct fire capabilities, the Timber Wolf C mounts two ER Large Lasers and an Ultra Autocannon/5. For indirect fire support capability, its two LRM-15 launchers provide an ample quantity of firepower. Finally, for close range protection, the C carries an ER Medium Laser and an Anti-Missile System. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf D
details:
This configuration mounts a pair of ER PPCs as its primary weapons. These are supported by four Streak SRM-6 launchers with two in the left torso and two in the right torso. One Streak SRM-6 on both torsos is rear mounted. A single ER Small Laser rounds out the Timber Wolf D's arsenal. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf E
details:
Configured to use the added flexibility of the new Advanced Tactical Missile system, the E configuration mounts two ER Large Lasers as its primary direct fire weapons. The E Configuration also carries two ATM 9 launchers which can fire ammunition that is tailored to the ranges which it is engaging the enemy at. Finally, it carries a Light TAG designator for calling in Arrow IV artillery fire. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf E2
details:
The E2 loadout is full energy based with two Large and four Medium Pulse Lasers. A single ER Small Laser serves as close range anti-infantry defense. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf E3
details:
A full energy configuration, the Timber Wolf E3 loadout mounts three ER Large and five ER Small Lasers. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf F2
details:
The F2 loadout mounts a massive AC/20 in the Right Arm and an ER PPC in the left. Three Medium and one Small ER Lasers provide secondary firepower as required. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf F3
details:
The F3 loadout of the Timber Wolf is a mix of two ER PPC and two LRM-10, with four ER Lasers as backup. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf G
details:
The G loadout brings two ER Large Lasers, four ER Medium Lasers and two Medium Pulse Lasers to the battlefield. It also mounts an Anti-Missile System and an ECM Suite for defensive purposes. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf H
details:
A configuration that is capable of engaging an enemy with devastating effect at any range, the H configuration carries a pair of LRM-20 launchers linked to an Artemis IV Fire Control System for long range firepower. For close combat, two Heavy Large Lasers are carried, each of which can strip a full ton of armor from an enemy 'Mech at short ranges. Finally, seemingly added almost as an afterthought, an ER Small Laser completes the H's weaponry loadout. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf H2
details:
A mainly support configuration of the Timber Wolf, the H2 mounts a total of five AMS spread throughout the 'Mech. It still is able to fit two ER Large and five ER Medium lasers, providing decent offensive firepower. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf I
details:
The I configuration is unusual in that it mounts a total of eleven ER Medium Lasers, combined together through a Targeting Computer with a single ER Large Laser. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf J
details:
The Timber Wolf J loadout mounts two Ultra AC/2 and two ER Large Lasers as the main weapons. Two ER Medium Laser act as secondary damage dealers, while an AMS provides some defense. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf K
details:
The K loadout mounts a total of 14 LRM-5 launchers, five ER Medium Lasers and a flamer. The large amount of LRM launchers can fire at multiple targets simultaneously by the use of an advanced targeting computer. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf KH
details:
A custom loadout specifically used by the mercenary outfit the Kell Hounds. It mounts two ER PPC and four Streak SRM-4 launchers. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf KHCM
details:
A custom loadout specifically used by the mercenary outfit the Kell Hounds. It mounts two ER PPC, two Medium Pulse Laser and two SRM-6 launchers. A C3 Master computer improves the performance of the whole lance. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf M/A
details:
The Timber Wolf M/A loadout is one of three configurations used mainly for Mastery trials. Two ER PPC, two LRM-10, one Large Pulse Laser and a Flamer ensures it is able to handle any situation in a trial. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf M/J
details:
The Timber Wolf M/J loadout is one of three configurations used mainly for Mastery trials. Two ER PPC, four LRM-5, one Large Pulse Laser and a Flamer ensures it is able to handle any situation in a trial. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf M/W
details:
The Timber Wolf M/W loadout is one of three configurations used mainly for Mastery trials. Two ER Large and two Large Pulser Lasers, two LRM-10 and one Medium Pulse Laser ensures it is able to handle any situation in a trial. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf N
details:
A mix of the Prime and the D configurations, alternate configuration N mounts an ER PPC in each arm alongside an LRM-15 rack in the left and right torsos. These weapons are supported at short range by paired Machine Guns and Medium Pulse Lasers in each side torso. Two tons of LRM reloads and a half ton of machine gun rounds force a focus on the energy weapons with an extra Double Heat Sink tries to assist in managing their heat. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf Prime
details:
The default configuration of the Timber Wolf features a well blended mix of energy and missile weaponry; primarily extended-range lasers and long range missile racks that give the Timber Wolf considerable firepower at medium and long range. A pair of LRM-20 racks supplemented by two Extended Range Large Lasers make up the bulk of the Timber Wolf's firepower. The Timber Wolf also has an array of lighter, shorter ranged weaponry for use once the 'Mech draws closer to its prey: two ER Medium Lasers and a Medium Pulse Laser. Finally, it has two Machine Guns for point defense against infantry. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf S
details:
A highly maneuverable urban combat configuration of the Timber Wolf, the S mounts five jump jets, allowing it to jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. To offset the inaccuracy from using jump jets, the S configuration is armed with a Large Pulse Laser backed up by two Medium Pulse Lasers. The S configuration also carries four SRM-6 launchers and two Machine Guns, making it a deadly close combat fighter. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf SG
details:
The SG configuration combines two Heavy Large and two ER Medium Lasers with two LRM-10 launchers, while also mounting a Light TAG and a Flamer. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf TC
details:
Recognised and feared throughout the Inner Sphere, the Timber Wolf is a 75 ton Clan OmniMech with a deadly blend of speed, armor and firepower. Powered by a 375-rated XL Engine, a combination of Ferro-Fibrous and Endo Steel give the OmniMech 27.5 tons of Pod Space. The Timber Wolf TC is a Clan Wolf special designed for Tukayyid and the expectation of an extended campaign. Armed with a pair of Large Pulse Lasers and a pair of Streak SRM-6’s, the TC mounts a pair of ER Medium Lasers and an ER Small as secondary weapons. 5 Jump Jets enhance the TC’s mobility. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf WDR1
details:
A anti-infantry loadout used by the Wolf's Dragoons, the fabled mercenary company. The quite unique configuration mounts eight Machine Guns, ten Streak SRM-2 launchers and two Large Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf WDR2
details:
A loadout used by the Wolf's Dragoons, combining an Inner Sphere Light Gauss Rifle with two ER Large Lasers and four LRM-5 launchers. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Timber Wolf WDR3
details:
This Wolf's Dragoons configuration of the Timber Wolf mounts only two ER PPC as its damage dealers. Instead it focuses on a support role with a C3 Master and advanced EWS equipment. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Titan TI-1A
details: Designed in 2787, the Titan was a prototype assault mech that never reached full-scale production. The 1A carried two PPCs, six Medium Lasers, four SRM-4s, and an SRM-6. 22 Single Heatsinks manage the heat load. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Titan TI-1AD
details: The -1AD is a major refit from the -1A, replacing most of the weapons with more powerful versions. The medium lasers were upgraded to pulse versions and the three PPCs replaced by two ER PPCs. The SRM-launchers were kept the same, but their ammunition are now protected by C.A.S.E. The 'Mech was also upgraded to double heat sinks, improving its cooling even though it has one less sink than the original variant. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Titan TI-1D
details: The Titan TI-1D is a further upgrade of the -1AD, but a quite costly one as it replaces the standard engine core with an extra light one. The freed space is used to add one more pulse laser, convert the SRM-6 to two SRM-4s and also add an active probe and one more heat sink. One ton of SRM ammunition is however dropped, leaving the 'Mech with only 200 missiles total. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Titan TI-2D
details: The only difference between the -1D and -2D is the removal of the Beagle Active Probe, the 'Mech instead mounts a Guardian ECM suite. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

name: Tornado G12
details: The Tornado is a Power Armor (Light) suit, created by ComStar in the late twenty-ninth century to equip their special forces units with added protection. The Tornado is based on the Star League Defense Force Nighthawk suit which, though they had acquired several, ComStar at the time was unable to produce. It incorporates stealth armor and an adaptive Camo System which mimics the effects of a combination Camo/IR/ECM Sneak Suit, hiding the Tornado from all types of sensors. The armor is also good enough to stop small-arms fire and even heavy weapons like a Flamer from hurting the wearer. Quirk: Power Armor Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.8832 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Tornado G12
details: The Tornado is a Power Armor (Light) suit, created by ComStar in the late twenty-ninth century to equip their special forces units with added protection. The Tornado is based on the Star League Defense Force Nighthawk suit which, though they had acquired several, ComStar at the time was unable to produce. It incorporates stealth armor and an adaptive Camo System which mimics the effects of a combination Camo/IR/ECM Sneak Suit, hiding the Tornado from all types of sensors. The armor is also good enough to stop small-arms fire and even heavy weapons like a Flamer from hurting the wearer. Quirk: Power Armor Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.8848 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Tornado P12
details: The Tornado is a Power Armor (Light) suit, created by ComStar in the late twenty-ninth century to equip their special forces units with added protection. The Tornado is based on the Star League Defense Force Nighthawk suit which, though they had acquired several, ComStar at the time was unable to produce. It incorporates stealth armor and an adaptive Camo System which mimics the effects of a combination Camo/IR/ECM Sneak Suit, hiding the Tornado from all types of sensors. The armor is also good enough to stop small-arms fire and even heavy weapons like a Flamer from hurting the wearer. Quirk: Power Armor Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.8848 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Toro TR-A-1
details:
The original prototype of the Toro, the A-1 was based of the primitive Firebee developed by the Cappellan Confederation. It had two SRM-2s which shared a ton of ammunition and a Large Laser. Though it could only manage 64 km/h, the A-1 had more armor protection than the Firebee, with ten and a half tons of Primitive Armor protecting the mech. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.78

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Toro TR-A-6
details:
Produced in 2546, the Toro was the Taurian Concordant’s first battlemech design. Based on captured Firebees, the Toro is a long range support mech. Armed with a PPC and a pair of LRM-5s the Toro carried two tons of ammo and 10 single heat sinks. The last Toro factory was demolished in 2598 by invading Star League troops and production would not resume until the Word of Blake Jihad. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Toyama TYM-1A
details:
Built due to an awkward exchange of technology between the Free Worlds League and the Word of Blake, the Toyama was designed by Dr. Thaddeus Anable and then given to the Word of Blake through an agreement made by Captain-General Thomas Marik. The Toyama is intended to be a multi-role BattleMech that can operate somewhat independently of supply lines. The 'Mech is built on a lightweight Endo Steel chassis which supports a Vlar 300 XL engine. The Toyama has a top speed of 64.8 km/h, making it capable of keeping pace with most heavy 'Mechs. The Toyama has an impressive twelve tons of Durallex Heavy armor. To dissipate heat, the Toyama carries fourteen double heat sinks. The 'Mech also carries a Garret/Guardian Interface Guardian ECM Suite to protect the 'Mech from advanced enemy electronic warfare systems. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Trebuchet IIC 1
details:
The Trebuchet IIC 1 carries two LRM-20 launchers and three Medium Pulse Lasers. The LRM launchers are improved by the addition of Artemis IV FCS, and have a total of 5 tons of Artemis ammunition available. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Trebuchet IIC 2
details:
The IIC 2 uses an LRM-20 with Artemis FCS for long range engagements, adding three ER Medium Lasers as the 'Mech closes in on its enemies. For close range fighting the IIC 2 also mounts a Streak SRM-6. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Trebuchet IIC 3
details:
The Trebuchet IIC 3 focuses on long range, high impact weapons. It mounts an Ultra AC/10 in the left arm and an ER PPC in the right torso. A Streak SRM-6 in the right arm can provide some extra punch at closer ranges. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Trebuchet IIC 4
details:
The IIC 4 drops the ferro-fibrous armor of the earlier IIC variants in an attempt to ease its maintenance needs. The main armament are two LRM-20 launchers with attached Artemis IV FCS and six ton of ammunition. Three ER Medium Laser and one ER Small Laser can help with dealing extra damage or self-defense. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-3C
details:
The original Trebuchet as produced for the SLDF, it consisted of two Artemis IV-equipped LRM-15s with CASE, four medium lasers, double heat sinks, an Endo-Steel chassis and a 300-rated Extra Light Fusion Engine. However, the attrition of the First Succession War forced Corean Enterprises into redesigning the 'Mech without advanced technology to keep the production lines running. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-4M
details:
One of the lightest dedicated fire support 'Mechs to be found, the Trebuchet 4M comes with Deadfire ammo and is among the cooler-running 'Trenchbuckets'. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-5J
details:
Trading off firepower for mobility, the Trebuchet 5J removes one of the LRM-15 launchers and adds in jump capabilities and 5 extra heat sinks. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-5K
details: The Trebuchet TBT-5K is a custom variant originally fielded by the mercenary outfit the Kell Hounds. The variant uses only Clan-grade specification weapons; two LRM-15 with attached Artemis IV and three ER Medium Lasers. The 'Mech also upgrades the heat sinks to Clan specification and adds a C3 Slave computer mounted in the head. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

name: Trebuchet TBT-5N
details:
One of the lightest dedicated fire support 'Mechs to be found, the Trebuchet 5N can mount enough missiles to give even heavy units pause. However, 'Trenchbuckets' are known for running hot and don't have much in the way of protection. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-5NR
details:
The -.5NR is a battlfield refit of the -5N, dropping one Medium Laser for a C3 Slave computer. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-5P
details:
Introduced in 3025, the -5P retains the dual right arm medium lasers, but otherwise alters the remaining loadout, downgrading the LRM racks to LRM-10s and moving the left arm launcher to the left torso, also shifting the left arm medium laser to the center torso. The weight reduction is needed to carry a medium mace in the left arm with specialized arm actuators to improve its performance. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-5S
details:
The TBT-5S shifts from long range to short range support. With SRM6s instead of LRM15s and eight extra Heat Sinks, the 5S is able to dish out a tremendous amount of close range damage. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-5SP
details:
Rebuilt from the salvaged remains of a Trebuchet 5S, this low tech refit is a common sight throughout the battlefields of the Deep Periphery. Mounting between 2 and 4 Rocket pods and backed up by a pair of Large Chem Lasers; makes the 5SP into a fearsome short range brawler. Some designs include scavenged or salvaged Endo Steel or Ferro-Fibrous, either for increased protection or to mount additional rocket pods. Limited by the 4 tons of Chemical Laser ammunition and the single salvos of the rocket pod, the SP lacks the endurance for protracted engagements. Fortunately these are rarely a concern in the Deep Periphery and this design is commonly seen during raids and border skirmishes, where its heavy firepower can give it an edge over less durable opponents. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-6X
details:
The TBT-6X 'Katyusha' is a slightly heavier Trebuchet designed as a testbed for the Artemis IV Smart Missile System. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-7A
details:
A refit of the -7M, removing the Narc laucher to instead add Artemis IV FCS for the LRM-15 launchers. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-7K
details:
Almost an entirely new 'Mech, the Trebuchet 7K moves away from its missile support to direct fire support, using a PPC and AC/5 along with a SRM-2 for some close in support. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-7KR
details:
The -7KR is an upgrade kit for the -7K, greatly updating its equipment. The PPC is replaced by an ER PPC and the AC/5 by an Ultra AC/5. The SRM-2 is dropped, to instead add a Small Laser. C.A.S.E. protection for the ammunition and a C3 Slave computer are also added. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-7M
details:
Upgraded with Star League technology, the 7M variant is built with on an Endo Steel chassis and uses a 250 Magna XL engine, giving it the same performance but allowing the design to mount ten double heat sinks and five Rawlings 50 jump jets for a jumping distance of one hundred and fifty meters. It also allows for the Zeus LRM-15s' ammo to be protected by CASE and for a Narc Missile Beacon with two tons of ammo, improving not only the Trebuchet's accuracy but allowing it to share targeting information with other similarly-equipped 'Mechs. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trebuchet TBT-8K
details:
The -8K is a medium to short range variant of the Trebuchet, mounting two MRM-10, 3 Medium Lasers and two Small Pulse Lasers. A single LRM-15 with attached Artemis IV FCS is used when a longer range is required. Its main purpose was export for use by the DCMS, but a number of units stayed within the FWLM. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Right Lower, Right Upper

name: Trebuchet TBT-8KL
details:
A -8KL, or -8K 'Long', regears the standard -8K for longer range engagements by replacing all the lasers with a single ER Large Laser. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limits: Right Lower, Right Upper

name: Trebuchet TBT-9K
details:
The 9K variant of the Trebuchet is a field refit of the 7M with a distinctive Kurita feel to it. Built on an Endo Steel chassis and powered by an XL engine, the 9K replaced the LRMs for two MRM-20launchers with three tons of ammo total. The medium lasers in the right arm are replaced with two Medium Pulse Lasers while the left arm-mounted medium laser is kept, and a C3 slave unit in the left torso allows it to share targeting telemetry with other units. The jump jets are also kept, giving it a jumping distance of one hundred and fifty meters. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Trooper BTM-1A
details: The Trooper delivers a lot of bang for the buck, as it's large AC/5 autocannon and three Medium Lasers are a respectable weaponry for a 'Mech of its size. The 'Mech still manages to fit an SRM-4 for short range damage bursts. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Trooper A
details:
The Alpha configuration of the Trooper OmniMech drops the LRM-15 launcher to instead add a five jump jets and an ER Small Laser. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Trooper H
details:
The H loadout is focused on close to medium range fights, mounting a massive Ultra AC/20 and a Heavy Large Laser as the main damage dealers. A Heavy Medium Laser provides some extra cover if needed, while an AMS will intercept any incoming missiles. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Trooper Prime
details:
The primary configuration of the Trooper uses an Ultra AC/10 in each arm as the main sources of damage, while two ER Medium Lasers and a LRM-15 launcher can be called on as needed. Four tons of autocannon ammunition and two tons of LRM missiles ensures the 'Mech can stand its ground without haveing to re-arm very often. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - AC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Tsunami TS-P1
details: The TS-P1's weaponry isn't very impressive, but is adequate for a 40-ton 'Mech. Two Medium Lasers and a Stream SRM-2 deal most of the external damage, while two Machine Guns can shred an opponents internals once the armor is breached. Six jump jets improves the mobility enough to compensate for its 240 standard fusion core. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

name: Tsunami TSU-1N
details: The Tsunami relies on its 400 XL fusion engine combined with a MASC to reach speeds such that it will surprise its enemies, enabling a flanking maneuver. Once the 'Mech is positioned for a strike, its ER PPC and five Medium Pulse Lasers can easily chew through any side or rear armor. The cooling is handled by 11 double heat sinks. Quirk: Integrated Adv. AMS Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Tunnel Rat
details: Envirosealed unarmored exoskeleton. Clearly unsuitable for combat, but desperate times call for desperate measures, and people had attempted to swarm mechs in exoskeletons with laser cutters and industrial drills. Quirk: Exoskeleton Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.8832 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: Turkina A
details:
The Turkina is named after Turkina, the first Jade Falcon to be tamed, who inspired the leaders of Clan Jade Falcon in its early days. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Turkina B
details:
The Turkina is named after Turkina, the first Jade Falcon to be tamed, who inspired the leaders of Clan Jade Falcon in its early days. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Turkina C
details:
Designed for fighting Inner Sphere forces, the Turkina C is optimised for Urban combat. An LB-X Autocannon/20 and twin Large Pulse Lasers can open up holes in enemy 'Mechs, while the Streak SRM-6 and paired Medium Pulse Lasers exploit them. Paired Anti-Personnel Pods, Machine Guns, and Flamers discourage conventional forces from closing. An Active Probe finds most hidden units, ensuring the MechWarrior is rarely surprised. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Turkina D
details:
The Turkina D is armed with 4 ATM 12s. Ten tons of ammunition allow it to make use of the flexibility of Advanced Tactical Missile technology. A pair of ER Medium Lasers provide backup. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Turkina M
details:
Each arm of this Turkina configuration carries an ER Large Laser, LB 2-X, and an LB 5-X, plus a ton of ammunition for each autocannon. These are supplemented by an LRM-5 in each side torso and a center torso mounted Medium Pulse Laser. Sixteen double heat sinks are carried as well. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Turkina MC/A
details:
The MC/A loadout was created as part of the 'Master Creation' project, an attempt to have the best warriors create their ideal configurations. The MC/A combines four LBX, two of them being AC/10 and two AC/2, together with two ER Large Lasers as the main damage dealers. A Medium Pulse Laser and LRM-5 can be used if some extra punch is needed. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Turkina MC/J
details:
The MC/J loadout was created as part of the 'Master Creation' project, an attempt to have the best warriors create their ideal configurations. The MC/J is very similar to the MC/A, as it keeps the weapons the same: two LBX AC/10, two LBX AC/2, two ER Large Lasers, one Medium Pulse Laser and one LRM-5. But by dropping some armor and converting the chassis to Endo Steel, the space for three Jump Jets were freed. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Turkina MC/W
details:
The MC/W loadout was created as part of the 'Master Creation' project, an attempt to have the best warriors create their ideal configurations. The MC/W replaces the two LBX AC/2 from the /A and /J with two Ultra AC/2 and the ER Large Lasers with ER PPC. The rest of the configuration is kept very similar. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Turkina Prime
details:
The Turkina is named after Turkina, the first Jade Falcon to be tamed, who inspired the leaders of Clan Jade Falcon in its early days. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Turkina X-B
details:
The X-B configuration is generally only used during batchalls, and is therefore very rare to ever been seen outside Clan occupied territory. It mounts twin Ultra AC/20 for impressive close range firepower, together with two ER Large Lasers for hitting targets further away. Finally it also has one SRM-4 and one LRM-5 missile launcher. Quirk: Aerial Assault Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Undine [STD]
details: The Undine battle armor was created by Clan Goliath Scorpion as a combat upgrade to the original "water elementals," the underwater exoskeletons that inspired Clan Wolf's Elemental battle armor. This Undine version replaces the UMU with standard Elementals JJs, while retaining its signature LRM/T launcher. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.93 Can mount Omni units, can melee, can swarm.

name: UrbanMech IIC 1
details:
The UrbanMech IIC is a Clan IIC-style upgrade of the original UrbanMech. Around the same time as the development of the OmniMech during the Golden Century, Clan Coyote technicians reworked this venerable design. They studied battle data from as far back as the Amaris Civil War and used this research as the basis for their upgrades. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: UrbanMech UM-K9
details:
Complete with a light bar, the K-9 is an UrbanMech refitted for use by a planetary police department. The standard variant's AC/10 is swapped for a UAC/5 and the left arm small laser is updated to a large laser, with two small lasers mounted in the center torso. While its ground speed remains unchanged, the K-9's heavier weapons loadout is made possible through the use of an endo steel chassis and mounting 10 double heat sinks. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: UrbanMech UM-R60
details:
Don't let the stubby 'Urbie' fool you, it may look like a walking trash can, but it can mount heavy armor and a grown-up-sized Autocannon. R60s aren't known for their speed, but they are very useful if you can draw the enemy into their firing range. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: UrbanMech UM-R60C
details:
A Capellan 'variant' when some factories were unable to keep up with production due to a shortage of Small Lasers, engineers replaced it with a MG and the unofficial R60C variant was born. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: UrbanMech UM-R60-CE
details:
Desperate to find any proper use of their UrbanMechs, two Improved AC/2 replaced the single AC/10 on the UM-R60-CE. The small Laser was further replaced by an Improved Large Laser, at the cost of dropping one no longer needed Heat Sink and half a ton of armor. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: UrbanMech UM-R60L
details:
Meant for close in city fighting, the R60L variant sacrifices armor to upscale its Autocannon 10 to an Autocannon 20. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: UrbanMech UM-R60R
details:
The R60R upgrade kit removes the Small Laser and one heat sink from the R60 to instead fit C.A.S.E. protection for the ammunition and a C3 Slave computer. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: UrbanMech UM-R60X
details:
A Capellan experimental 'variant' that was created when engineers removed the largely superfluous 11th heat sink and installed a Machine Gun with half a ton of ammunition in its place. While it has no official designation, it is typically referred to as the R60X. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: UrbanMech UM-R63
details:
Don't let the stubby 'Urbie' fool you, it may look like a walking trash can, but it can mount heavy armor and a grown-up-sized Autocannon. R63s aren't known for their speed, but they are very useful if you can draw the enemy into their firing range. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: SuburbanMech UM-R90
details:
The UM-R90 'SuburbanMech' adapts the traditional UrbanMech R60 into an energy weapon platform for higher performance. Because its weapons aren't limited by ammunition concerns, the R90 is better-suited to longer engagements. Quirk: 360° Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Ursus 1
details:
The Ursus 1 is a flexible defender that mounts a variety of weapons to engage enemies at all ranges. Its weakness is in its lack of long-range capability, though the ER Large Laser and LRM-10 are respectable for a 'Mech its size. For closer work, it uses two ER Medium Lasers, two Medium Pulse Lasers, and a SRM-6 launcher. This blistering hail of weapons fire is generally effective for an Inner Sphere heavy 'Mech, so the Ursus compares favorably to the designs that it is expected to stand up against. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Valkyrie II VLK-II-1A
details: The Valkyrie II project originated as an assignment for two NAIS student design teams to create a new heavy scout and skirmisher mech based on the Valkyrie VLK-QA. A rivalry between the two teams and outside pressures from Davion bureaucrats pushed both designs far beyond a replacement for the VLK-QA. Achernar BattleMechs was contracted to construct the Valkyrie II-1A which sports a Hermes 360XL Engine, six Jump Jets, an ER PPC, a LRM10, and over eleven tons of armor. Quirk: Modular Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Valkyrie LAM
details: A nice heavily armored scout, not too bad. Probably best to keep it at range however, out of harm's range. But an easy mech to find parts for and keep running. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

name: Valkyrie VLK-Q1
details:
The -Q1 is an upgrade kit for the -QA, upgrading the Medium Laser to an Extended Range version and adds Artemis IV capabilities to the LRM-10 launcher. One extra ton of LRM missiles are added, as well as C.A.S.E. protection for all of the ammunition. This was all possible by switching to double heat sinks - allowing the 'Mech to drop one sink - and upgrading the chassis to use Endo Steel. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Valkyrie VLK-QA
details:
A nice heavily armored scout, not too bad. Probably best to keep it at range however, out of harm's range. But an easy mech to find parts for and keep running. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Valkyrie VLK-QAR
details:
A battlefield refit of the VLK-QA, the -QAR switches to use ten double heat sinks, allowing the addition of a C3 Slave computer. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Valkyrie VLK-QD
details:
The QD Valkyrie is a major overhaul of the design debuting in 3049. The chassis has been re-engineered to use Endo Steel construction and the armor has been upgraded to Ferro-Fibrous with CASE. This allowed the variant to update the laser to a Sutel Precision Line Medium Pulse Laser and add an Artemis IV fire control system to the Devastator LRM-10. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Valkyrie VLK-QF
details:
The QF model of the Valkyrie trades in the medium laser for a flamer, which allows the 'Mech to work in an incendiary role and also acts as an excellent deterrent to infantry attacks. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Valkyrie VLK-QK
details:
A custom Clan technology conversion of the Valkyrie, the -QK was originally fielded by the Kell Hounds mercenary band. It provides three ER Medium Lasers in the right arm and one LRM with Artemis IV in the left arm. In the head a C3 Slave computer is mounted. The engine is a 150 XL core and the armor has been upgraded to ferro-fibrous. The 'Mech uses ten double heat sinks to handle the produced heat. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Vapor Eagle 1
details: The Vapor Eagle features an eclectic and close-ranged weapons load-out, mounting a Large Pulse Laser in its right arm, supported by a single Machine Gun, two Streak SRM-2s and three Medium Pulse Lasers split between its side torsos and rounded out by a trio of Machine Guns in a handgun shaped housing in the left arm. The addition of a Targeting Computer makes its firepower even more deadly as long as it can get its weapons into range. Eleven Double Heat Sinks, half a ton of machine gun ammunition and one Streak missiles are more than adequate for the average Clan trial. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Vapor Eagle 2
details: This variant of the Vapor Eagle removes two of the Medium Pulse Lasers, both Streak Missile pods, and the Large Pulse Laser as well as one of the 'Mechs double heat sinks in exchange for an Ultra Autocannon/10. Mounted in an over the shoulder arrangement like the venerable Shadow Hawk, the weapon fires at twice the rate of a standard Autocannon/10 and carries enough ammunition to continuously fire at its maximum rate of fire for over a minute and a half. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Vapor Eagle 5
details:
This variant carries three Machine Guns in the left arm, three Medium Pulse Lasers in the right arm, supported by a Machine Gun in the left torso and a Medium Pulse Laser in the right torso. It also retains the Targeting Computer. Long range fire is provided by an LRM-20 with an Artemis IV FCS. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Vapor Eagle 6
details: This version keeps the arm weapons and targeting computer of the base model, but in place of the Large Pulse Laser are an Ultra AC/2 in each side torso with a ton of ammunition for each cannon. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.09

name: Venom SDR-9K
details: The Venom was built in direct response to losses suffered by the Draconis Combine and to boost sales for Nimakachi Fusion Products Limited. The company, which at the time was producing only the Spider, was forced to comply with an order by the Coordinator himself that 'Mech manufacturers make up for the losses suffered by the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Venom SDR-9KA
details: The 9KA variant of the Venom is a simple modification that intends to increase the 'Mech's protection at the cost of firepower. Introduced in 3056, it does this by removing one of the medium pulse lasers and replacing it with an additional two tons of armor, increasing the total armor protection to five and a half tons. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Venom SDR-9KB
details: The 9KB variant of the Venom is intended to increase both the 'Mech's protection and its anti-infantry capabilities. This is done by removing one of the medium pulse lasers and two jumps jets and replacing them with a single machine gun with a half ton of ammunition and a heat sink. The remaining ton has been used to increase the 'Mech's armor. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Venom SDR-10K
details: The SDR-10K of the Venom is similar in armament to the -9K, but upgrades to use an Endo Steel chassis and double heat sinks. The saved space is used to almost double the amount of armor mounted on the 'Mech. Quirk: Nimble Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Victor VTR-9A
details:
An early variant of the Victor, the 9A adds on a Machine Gun and twin Flamers - making it an effective anti-infantry and brawler 'Mech. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Victor VTR-9A1
details:
Another anti-infantry and brawler variant, the VTR-9A1 adds twin Machine Guns and retains most of its armor. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Victor C
details:
A Clan-tech retrofit of SLDF VTR-9B Victors intended for second-line and solahma troops, this variant swaps the large bore autocannon for a Gauss Rifle, the SRM rack for an advanced Streak SRM-4 and standard Medium Lasers for paired ER Medium Lasers. Unlike the similarly armed 9D and 9K variants, lighter Clan weaponry allows this swap without the need to utilize an Endo Steel chassis and still leaves the refit two ton under weight. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Victor VTR-9B
details:
Few assault 'Mechs mount Jump Jets, but the Victor 9B is one of 'em. With a large ballistic gun and supporting close-range weaponry, the 9B is a deadly opponent with superior mobility for its size. Unfortunately, this comes at the cost of armor. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Victor VTR-9B-CE
details:
The Victor VTR-9B-CE replaces the AC/20 with a Clan Early LBX/20 and 4 tons of ammunition, and the SRM-4 launcher with an Improved SRM-6. Everything else is kept the same as on the original Victor VTR-9B. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Victor VTR-9BR
details:
An alternative version of the standard VTR-9B, replacing 5 heat sinks with 2 more Medium Lasers, CASE in the torsos and a C3 slave system. Its intended use is in low risk environments with high cooling capacity or where cooling trucks are available. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Victor VTR-9D
details:
An upgrade using Star League technology, the 9D replaces the Autocannon/20 with a Gauss Rifle which can do serious damage at much greater ranges. The 'Mech also carries two Medium Pulse Lasers and a SRM-4 launcher for close combat. In order to make these changes possible, the 9D is built on an Endo Steel chassis. With the weight saved the 'Mech also carries an additional ton of armor. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Victor VTR-9D-2
details:
A further upgrade, the VTR-9D-2 replaces the Gauss Rifle of the VTR-9D with a LB 20-X AC and the SRM4 with its Streak equivalent. To be able to accommodate the increased weight, the 15 single heat sinks have been replaced by 10 double. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Victor VTR-9Db
details:
The VTR-9Db replaces the three external heat sinks of the VTR-9D with two small lasers and extra medium pulse laser, increasing its medium to close range arsenal. The increased heat and reduced cooling capacity is addressed by converting the 'Mech to use double heat sinks. A bit more added armor and the removal of the CASE in the right torso finishes up the design changes. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Victor VTR-9G
details:
The -9G is a conversion of the traditional Victor to use Clan grade equipment, with even the armor switched to use the more weight efficient Clan Ferro-Fibrous. Its weapons have been replaced by a Gauss Rifle, two Medium Pulse Lasers and a Stream SRM-4. Three tons of Gauss ammunition and one ton of Streak SRM missiles are available. The 'Mech also carries a targeting computer, further enhancing the performance of its weapons. The -9G was originally created by and mostly seen with the Grey Death Legion mercenaries. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Victor VTR-9K
details:
An upgrade using Star League technology, the 9K replaces the Autocannon/20 with a Gauss Rifle which can do serious damage at much greater ranges. The 'Mech also carries two Medium Pulse Lasers and a SRM-4 launcher for close combat. In order to make these changes possible, the 9K is built on an Endo Steel chassis. With the weight saved the 'Mech also carries an additional ton of armor. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

name: Victor VTR-9P
details:
The -9P variant drops the VTR-9B's AC/20 and one medium laser for an AC/10 and larger SRM-6 rack while freeing up the weight to carry a massive assault claymore in its left arm. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Victor VTR-9RC
details:
The Victor VTR-9RC fits an ER PPC, two Large and three Medium Pulse Lasers by using a weight saving 320 XL engine. A Guardian ECM is also mounted in the right torso. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Victor VTR-9S
details:
The Victor 9S trades some of its already subpar armor to mount more weaponry. It's terrifying for enemy forces to see this 'Mech rocketing over a hill to unleash its considerable firepower, but it also needs to really worry about any return fire. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Victor VTR-10B
details:
Few assault 'Mechs can really fly, but the Victor 10B is one of 'em. With an Ultra AC/20 and improved Jump Jets, the 10B boasts incredible mobility for its weight, at the cost of some durability. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Upper

name: Victor VTR-C
details:
Based on the 9K variant, the VTR-C was built to incorporate a C3 slave unit, allowing the 'Mech to work as part of a C3 lance. In order to do this, a heat sink was removed. Otherwise, this variant of the Victor is identical to the 9K model. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

name: Vindicator VND-5L
details:
The 5L variant is a more basic upgrade than the 4L and represents Ceres' attempt to produce a close-combat 'Mech superior to the FS9-0 Firestarter. Introduced in 3060 the 5L uses a standard engine, armor, and structure. The changes and advancements come in the weapons and the addition of a TSM system. The 'Mech's new weapons include an ER PPC, two ER medium lasers, two medium pulse lasers, a single Small Pulse Laser, and a small laser. This varied mix of energy weapons allows the MechWarrior piloting the 'Mech to balance their heat load to keep the TSM working at its optimum efficiency. In so doing, the Vindicator can deal a fair amount of damage with its Sword. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Viper VP-1
details: For similar reasons of its suboptimal but extensive armor layout, its brute-force primary armament of a pair of binary laser cannons was thermally inefficient but could be produced inhouse, whereas the originally planned ER PPCs were already growing scarce. The rest of the layout, three Medium Pulse Lasers, were still readily available in large quantities when originally designed. A 280 XL engine and four Jump Jets ensured that the 'Mech was mobile enough to quickly adapt on the battlefield, further helped by its extra strong communications suite. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Viper VP-5
details: As the wars continued after the fall of the Star League, it became harder and harder to find the components to keep building the Viper. Eventually the Kallon Industries had to accept that it had no choice but start downgrading the design, eventually landing on the VP-5, an improvised Third Succession War-era downgrade with only standard components and lasers. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

name: Viper VPR-3X
details: The Viper's main weapon is a massive LBX AC/10 in the right torso, with two tons of ammunition in the right torso. A Streak SRM-2 and Small Laser are available to deal with any enemies too close for the large autocannon. Quirk: Improved Jammer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

name: Warhammer IIC LAM
details:
Jade Falcon commanders were shocked to find themselves suffering losses from an unknown LAM that resembled a small Warhammer. Insulted that the Inner-Sphere forces disgraced the Warhammer lineage with a half-baked LAM, and being a bit more open minded on units, Jade Falcon scientists went to work, producing a 70t version loaded with Clan tech. Fielding the same powerful combo of twin ER PPCs, as well as a pair of Arrow Anti-Air missiles, these Warhammer LAMs provide withering fire on ground targets, and are able to defend themselves from modest aerospace defenses. Coupled with the improved maneuverability of a LAM, these units are finding themselves to be the backbone of quick-response anti-militia garrisons across Jade Falcon territory. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16
