name: Warhammer LAM WHM-LAM-1A
details:
Developed as part of Project Thor's Hammer, the Warhammer LAM aims to merge the effectiveness of the Warhammer's twin PPCs, with the mobility of a LAM, in hopes of aiding the fight against the Clans. While weight requirements forced the PPCs to be downsized to Light PPCs, they are equipped with PPC Capacitors for that extra punch, and the expansion of SRMs to twin SRM4's, as well as a sizable bomb bay, provide devastating short range firepower. This allows the Warhammer LAM to inflict serious damage on a flyover, then pepper the target at range with the Light PPCs from the rear, until enough gaps open up for the SRMs to exploit. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Warhammer LAM WHM-LAM-1B
details:
Developed as part of Project Thor's Hammer, the Warhammer LAM aims to merge the effectiveness of the Warhammer's twin PPCs, with the mobility of a LAM, in hopes of aiding the fight against the Clans. The B variant replaces the bomb bay and SRMs for MMLs, providing 16 tubes in total, and was marketed towards Mercenary groups. The lack of PPC Capacitors aids in repairs, and the loss of damage is replaced by the MMLs providing long range fire support with the LRMs. For close range combat, the quadrupling of SRMs fired offsets the loss of the bomb bay, but allows for a few more short range passes as the MMLs can fire multiple times. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

While single-kill mechs were often relegated to the trashbin in the planning stages, the necessity of defeating a mech, and then claiming the salvage during the early Clan Invasion, saw such units come to the forefront of battle for a brief period. Quirk: Land Air Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Warhammer WHM-6R

The Warhammer BattleMech was introduced by StarCorps Industries in 2515 to be "a mobile 'Mech with enough firepower to destroy or severely damage any 'Mech of the same weight class or lower." In the mission it was designed for, the Warhammer proved to be a very capable 'Mech, and for centuries practically defined the entire class of heavy 'Mechs. Boasting incredible firepower and respectable armoring, the Warhammer served prominently in the Star League Defense Force and was one of the premier 'Mechs in the Gunslinger Program. Indeed, many of the greatest MechWarriors in history were Warhammer pilots. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

The 7S Warhammer was the official upgraded version built for the Federated Commonwealth by Olivettie Weaponry. Built out of their Sudeten factory starting in 3050, the 7S retained the small lasers of the original but updated the rest of the weaponry. It carried two arm-mounted ER PPCs, two Defiance P5M medium pulse lasers in the side torsos, and two Coventry T4H Streak SRM-2 launchers in place of the SRM-6 launcher. Eighteen double heat sinks handled the additional waste heat and one ton of reloads for the Streak launchers was carried in the center torso. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

A Clan-tech retrofit of the venerable Warhammer intended for second-line and solahma troops, this variant replaced most of the Inner Sphere-tech weaponry of the original WHM-6R with Clan equivalents and used the weight savings to add two more heat sinks. The PPCs were replaced with Large Pulse Lasers, the SRM-6 was upgraded to a Streak SRM-6, and all of the lasers were upgraded to ER medium and ER small lasers. Only the machine guns were not replaced with Clan-tech models. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Each side torso houses a Clan Medium Pulse Laser, and both a pulse and ER Small Laser. A Streak SRM-6 replaces the typical shoulder-mounted SRMs; its one ton of ammo is in the right torso. An ECM Suite protects this variant, while a Targeting Computer makes the already fearsome weaponry even more dangerous. 17 double heat sinks cannot keep the 'Mech cool unless the pilot fires either its long range or short range weapons. name: Warlord WAR-TT1

At closer ranges the 'Mech can switch to use its seven Medium Lasers, with an SRM-6 as an extra punch. The final weapon is an Artemis IV-enabled LRM-20, able to provide accurate missile fire at most ranges. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

The 'Mech is cooled by twelve double heat sinks, meaning some care in regards to heat build up has to be taken. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

In exchange the WSP-100 was equipped with a five ton bomb bay. This Bomb Bay allowed the WSP-100 to carry Arrow IVmissiles and conventional bombs without losing any speed. The primitive armor provided much less protection than the later Succession Wars-era Wasps, even though it carried three and a half tons of armor. Envisioning a variant highly adaptable to the raiding actions of the First Succession War, the Capellan Strategios deployed the 1L with multiple munition types based on their intended mission role, such as incendiary or gas SRMs for anti-infantry support or smoke SRMs for recon-concealment. The reduction in overall firepower made the 1L a adequate though not spectacular combatant. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

A small calibre rifle makes for a semi effective sniper weapon whilst its ammo lasts. The rest of the mech is almost standard spec, rebuilt by a succession of engineers to specs nearly identical to Inner Sphere counterparts. Surprisingly enough, this rebuild offers somewhat superior capabilities compared to most Inner Sphere models. Produced in any number of Periphery junk yards and back alley chop shops, this mech is incredibly common amongst periphery factions; who field the mech in vast quantities, praising its cheap firepower and easily repaired chassis. name: Watchman WTC-4M
details: Standing at ten meters tall, the Watchman is a 'Mech that was born of necessity. The idea for the design came when the bulk of the AFFS was moved to the Clan front. Because this seriously undermined the ability of the Federated Suns to keep its borders secure, the Watchman was designed to be distributed to militia units within the border marches to bulk up their strength. In its own right the Watchman is a durable and reliable 'Mech that is built with off the shelf components and is very easy to repair. The 'Mech is armored with eight and a half tons of standard armor, has a top speed of 86.4 km/h, and can jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. This, combined with the Watchman's varied arsenal, makes it an excellent trooper or trainer. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1

details: Infamously nicknamed the ''Varnay-1R'' the original primitive Wolverine was introduced in 2471. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.83

name: Wolverine WVR-2C (C)
details: An uncommon refit of some of the Wolverines the SLDF brought with them during their exodus from the Inner Sphere, the goal was to bring them in line with the more clear IIC versions of 'Mechs. However, very few were actually kept once Clan Wolverine was Annhiliated due to their name. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

name: Wolverine WVR-3R
details: Entering production in 2490, the primitive 3R was built in response to the Terran Hegemony creating new versions of the 'Mechs the Wolverine was originally based on. It traded in 3 tons of armor and a ton of autocannon ammunition for a shoulder-mounted six-pack SRM launcher with one ton of reloads - a loadout that would remain essentially unchanged for the later 'modernized' 6R. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.83

name: Wolverine WVR-6D
details: Introduced in 2834, the 6D drops the SRM and one heat sink of the 6R to upgrade the AC/5 to an Autocannon/10, mounted in the left arm. Two tons of ammunition in the left side supply it, spread through the arm and torso. One jump jet is moved from each leg to the corresponding side torso. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Wolverine WVR-6GD
details: A variant used by the Mercenary unit Gray Death Legion before their demise. Using mostly stolen or looted Clan tech they can upgrade the firepower considerable, including an Ultra AC/5 and Medium Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

name: Wolverine WVR-6K
details: Wolverine 6K models don't usually include Jump Jets in order to mount more Energy weaponry, Heat Sinks, and armor. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Wolverine WVR-6KH
details: The Wolverine WVR-6KH was made popular when the mercenary unit Kell Hounds used this custom design of theirs to infiltrate a pirate base by painting them in the same color scheme as the pirates own Wolverines. The mercenaries then opened fire without warning once inside, unleashing their advanced weaponry to great success at point blank range. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Wolverine WVR-6M
details: The 6M boasts an increase in firepower and endurance as a raider by dropping the AC/5 and replacing it with a Large Laser. This also allowed for the addition of another Medium Laser and extra Heat Sinks. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Wolverine WVR-6MR
details: Another of the many custom refits of the Wolverine WVR-6R by a mercenary outfit, the -6MR was the preferred variant of the famous McCarron's Armored Cavalry unit. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Wolverine WVR-6R
details: Wolverine 6Rs are fairly flexible in terms of weaponry ranges, tending somewhat more toward closer engagements. This is supported by their jump capability and pretty decent heat management. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Wolverine WVR-6R-CE
details: This Clan Early variant of the 6R exchanges the AC/5 for two LB 2-X Autocannons and upgrades the SRM-6 to an Improved version. Two of the heat sinks are dropped as a result of the lowered cooling needs. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Wolverine WVR-6RR
details: A Mercenary refit of the -6R which adds more durability in form of CASE protection to both side torsos and a C3 slave at the cost of two heat sinks. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Wolverine WVR-6SL
details: A high tech, high cost refit of the -6R initially by a small mercenary outfit called 'Silver Lining', but eventually caught attention of the larger units and as a result there are a number of them out there. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Wolverine WVR-6T
details: A Taurian variant, the WVR-6T design was created to capitalize on the less expensive ballistic weapons that were readily available within the Concordat to reduce their reliance on Star League member states. The 6T was also meant to act as anti-pirate garrison 'Mech, utilizing its long range AC/5 and LRM-5 combo to engage raiders at range. While the swap out of the Medium Laser for a Small Laser and the addition of two Machine Guns allow this Wolverine variant to better engage with the light vehicles and infantry common to raiding forces. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Wolverine WVR-7D
details: The 7D variant of the Wolverine is a major upgrade to the design introduced in 3050 by the Federated Suns' new Nanking factory. The standard engine on the 'Mech was replaced with a Nissan 275 XLversion and the armor has been upgraded to Kallon Unity Weave Ferro-Fibrous material with an extra half-ton added. To increase the Wolverine's speed, MASC has been added, allowing it to move up to 108 km/h in bursts. Finally, the weapons payload has been upgraded as well. The autocannon has been upgraded to a General Motors Nova-5 Ultra Autocannon/5 and the medium laser is now a Sutel Precision Line Medium Pulse Laser. The design retains its jumping capability, as well as the SRM-6, although CASE now protects the SRM reloads Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Wolverine WVR-7K
details: Another major upgrade of the Wolverine, this one for the Combine and first rolling off Marduk's production lines, the 7K model is also built with an XL Engine for power with the saved weight used to increase and upgrade its arsenal. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Wolverine WVR-7M
details: The 7M variant of the Wolverine has aspects of both the 7D and the 7K versions but is much closer to the original model. Introduced by FWDI in 3050 the 'Mech uses an XL engine, which is augmented with MASC, so as to push the machine up to 108 km/h in bursts. The 7M has twelve double heat sinks and, for a weapons package, it carries two Diverse Optics Sunbeam ER Large Lasers in the right arm and two Magna 400P medium pulse lasers in the head mount while retaining the SRM-6 for close range work. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Wolverine WVR-8Kp
details: A prototype version of the later mass produced -8K variant. Mounting a ER Large Laser, three Medium Pulse Lasers and an SRM-4 combined with a Guardian ECM Suite and a master C3 computer. The produced units of the variant eventually were sold off to mainly mercenary units or acquired in underhanded ways by pirates. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Wolverine WVR-TD
details: A refit by the design entity known as Tricky Dick. Based on the -7K, the TD replaces the SRM-6 racks with Streak SRM-6 tubes, and the Large Pulse Laser was turned into an ER PPC to make the 'Mech more viable for longer ranged attacks. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Woodsman II A
details:
The A loadout upsizes the LBX from the primary configuration to an LBX AC/20, but drops the Ultra AC/10 to instead mount two ER Large Laser. The LRM launcher is exchanged for a Streak SRM-6. Four additional heat sinks were also added. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Woodsman II B
details:
The Bravo configuration switches the 'Mech to a missile boat role, with four LRM-20 launchers as the main weapons. The 'Mech also mounts a Narc launcher and an AMS. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Woodsman II Prime
details:
The Primary configuration of the Woodsman II mounts both an LBX AC/10 and an Ultra AC/10, for the capability of a devastating hit at long range. An LRM-20 launcher can provide both direct or indirect fire as needed. The only short range weapon is a small ER Laser in the right torso. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Woodsman A
details:
The most common alternate configuration in the Woodsman's long career mounted two ER PPCs, two Medium Pulse Lasers, and a Large Pulse Laser and ER Small Laser for backup. It keeps the same number of double heat sinks as the primary configuration, but relocates them across the torso. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Woodsman B
details:
This configuration is a low-heat high damage option for pilots. A Gauss rifle is mounted in the right arm while the left arm has an ER Large Laser and ER Medium Laser. The right torso has an SRM-4 while the left torso carries an LRM-10. Both of these launchers have an Artemis IV FCS. For anti-infantry work, a Small Pulse Laser is carried in the center torso. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Woodsman Prime
details:
The primary Woodsman configuration would be mirrored in the default Timber Wolf weapon load. Each arm carried an ER Large Laser and an ER Medium Laser, and a pair of LRM-15s rounded out the configuration in each side torso. To provide anti-infantry capability, a pair of Machine Guns were mounted in the center torso. Five additional pod mounted double heat sinks brought the total up to seventeen, allowing the Woodsman to fire most of its weaponry without worrying about heat overloads. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

name: Wraith TR1
details: The Wraith marked Curtiss Militech's entry into BattleMech production. When the design was announced, many felt that the design would be little more than a walking water cooler. What the critics got was a shock. The Wraith is a 'Mech that, when properly employed, can wreak havoc on an enemy with its astounding speed and maneuverability. It is built around a massive LTV 385 XL Engine that allows it to reach speeds of just under 119 km/h. The Wraith has a simple, yet effective, pulse weapons payload. Pulse laser weaponry allows the Mech to negate most of the side effects on accuracy that are introduced by the Wraith's heavy use of jump jets, making it incredibly accurate and powerful for such a lightly armed Mech. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Wraith TR2
details: The Wraith marked Curtiss Militech's entry into BattleMech production. When the design was announced, many felt that the design would be little more than a walking water cooler. What the critics got was a shock. The Wraith is a 'Mech that, when properly employed, can wreak havoc on an enemy with its astounding speed and maneuverability. It is built around a massive LTV 385 XL Engine that allows it to reach speeds of just under 119 km/h. The Wraith has a simple, yet effective, pulse weapons payload. Pulse laser weaponry allows the Mech to negate most of the side effects on accuracy that are introduced by the Wraith's heavy use of jump jets, making it incredibly accurate and powerful for such a lightly armed Mech. A simple modification of the Wraith, the TR2 simply replaces the Large Pulse Laser with an ER PPC, turning the 'Mech into a highly capable sniper. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Wyvern IIC
details: A second line Clan mech, the 45 ton Wyvern IIC is an upgrade of the SLDF Wyverns that survived the Exodus. Built using a cache of Wyverns, Clan Burrock upgraded every aspect of the original mech with Clan tech. Retaining the original 180-rated Fusion Core, the Wyvern IIC is armed with a mix of weapons. An ER Large Laser and an LRM-10 make up the Mechs long range firepower, with a pair of ER Medium Lasers and an SRM-6 for medium range combat. A pair of MG’s, a Flamer and a pair of ER Smalls give additional firepower at close range. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.07

name: Wyvern WVE-5N
details: Designed for Urban combat, the 45 ton Wyvern blends heavy armor, jump jets and a versatile weapons package. Powered by a 180-rated Fusion Core, the Wyvern 5N is armed with a Large Laser and an LRM-10. For close range combat, the Mech carries a pair of Small Lasers and a SRM-6. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

name: Wyvern WVE-5Nb
details: Designed for Urban combat, the 45 ton Wyvern blends heavy armor, jump jets and a versatile weapons package. Powered by a 180-rated XL Engine, the Wyvern 5Nb is armed with a Large Pulse Laser and an LRM-10. For close range combat, the Mech carries a Medium Laser, a Small Laser and an SRM-6. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

name: Wyvern WVE-5Nsl
details: Designed for Urban combat, the 45 ton Wyvern blends heavy armor, jump jets and a versatile weapons package. Powered by a 180-rated Fusion Core, the Wyvern 5Nsl is armed with an ER Large Laser and an LRM-10. For close range combat, the Mech carries a 4 Small Lasers and 3 SSRM-2’s. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Wyvern WVE-5UX
details: Designed for Urban combat, the 45 ton Wyvern blends heavy armor, jump jets and a versatile weapons package. Powered by a 180-rated Fusion Engine, the Wyvern 5UX is armed with an ER Large Laser. For close range combat, the Mech carries a pair of SRM-6’s and a pair of Grenade Launchers. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

name: Wyvern WVE-6N
details: Designed for Urban combat, the 45 ton Wyvern blends heavy armor, jump jets and a versatile weapons package. Powered by a 180-rated Fusion Core, the Wyvern 6N is armed with a Large Laser and an LRM-10. For close range combat, the Mech carries a pair of Small Lasers and a SRM-6. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.01

name: Wyvern WVE-9N
details: Designed for Urban combat, the 45 ton Wyvern blends heavy armor, jump jets and a versatile weapons package. Powered by a 180-rated Fusion Core, the Wyvern 9N is armed with a Large Pulse Laser and an LRM-10. For close range combat, the Mech carries a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a SSRM-2. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

name: Xanthos XNT-2O
details: An early, primitive prototype introduced in 2564, the 2O used Age of War technology. In particular, the engine, cockpit and armor were all primitive technology. It could reach a top speed of 54 km/h and was protected by fifteen tons of primitive armor. Eighteen single heat sinks dissipated the heat produced by an Autocannon/10, SRM-4, Large Laser, and two medium and Small Lasers. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.96

name: Xanthos XNT-3O
details: An Autocannon/20 with three tons of ammunition provides substantial close hitting power. It is backed up with three Medium Lasers, a six-tube SRM Pack, and a rear-firing small laser. A single PPC rounds out this design's weaponry, giving it some range. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

name: Yeoman YMN-6Y
details:
Designed specifically as a fire support 'Mech by Curtis Militech, the Yeoman uses a combination of Endo Steel and Ferro-Fibrous armor, allowing paired LRM-15 launchers and LRM-10 launchers to be mounted in each side torso. 6 tons of ammunition are stored in CASE protected magazines. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Ymir BWP-2B
details:
The base production version, the BWP-2B was a bit of a generalized work horse. The 'Mech design mounts an Autocannon 5, four SRM-2 launchers, two LRM-5 launchers and a Large Laser. A Small Laser was also added to use up some spare space. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

name: Ymir BWP-2E
details:
An "upgunned" version of the 2B , the 2E replaced the LRMs with a single LRM-10 and the SRMs with one SRM-6. The Small Laser was replaced with an extra half-ton of armor. The Large Laser and autocannon were swapped out for two PPCs. Because they did not upgrade the heat dissipation system along with the weapons, MechWarriors had to use volley fire, leading to displeasure with the design. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ymir BWP-3A
details:
The 3A is an upgrade of the 2E Ymir using Star League technology and was developed in 2733. It downgraded the PPCs to standard Large Lasers even as double heat sinks were used. An Artemis IV Fire Control System was added to each missile launcher. The remaining tonnage went towards a Medium Laser and additional armor. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Ymir BWP-X1
details:
The original Ymir, the X1 prototype could only reach 53 km/h due to its primitive engine. The cockpit and armor were also both primitive, but the design mounted fifteen and a half tons of armor in total. Mounting sixteen heat sinks, the X1 was equipped with two LRM-5s in the right torso,a large laser in the right arm and an AC/5 in the left arm for long-range work. Four SRM-2s were mounted in the left torso for short range work - the designers believing that multiple small systems would be easier to maintain and adapt than larger systems - along with two vehicle flamers mounted in the right hand arm. The vehicle flamers were chosen for the design because of concerns about the safety of taking plasma directly from the reactor, although protecting and shielding the flamers caused problems. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.94

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Yu Huang Y-H9G
details:
The Yu Huang, named for the Jade Emperor that rules the Heavenly Court in the ancient Chinese pantheon, debuted with the promise from Sun-Tzu Liao that 'it shall sit in judgment over a battlefield, meting out justice to those who would transgress against us'. To live up to the promise of the Chancellor of the Capellan Confederation, the Yu Huang carries some of the most advanced technologies available at the time of its initial production. The Yu Huang is built on a Chariot Type II Endo Steel chassis and carries a Hermes 360 XL engine that gives the 'Mech a top speed of 64.8 km/h. The 'Mech is capable of jumping up to one hundred and twenty meters with its four Rodan 90 jump jets. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Yu Huang Y-H10G
details:
The Yu Huang, named for the Jade Emperor that rules the Heavenly Court in the ancient Chinese pantheon, debuted with the promise from Sun-Tzu Liao that 'it shall sit in judgment over a battlefield, meting out justice to those who would transgress against us'. To live up to the promise of the Chancellor of the Capellan Confederation, the Yu Huang carries some of the most advanced technologies available at the time of its initial production. The Yu Huang is built on a Chariot Type II Endo Steel chassis and carries a Hermes 360 XL engine that gives the 'Mech a top speed of 64.8 km/h. The 'Mech is capable of jumping up to one hundred and twenty meters with its four Rodan 90 jump jets. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Yu Huang Y-H11F
details:
The Yu Huang Y-H11F has a mixed weapons loadout, aimed to cover most ranges of engagement. For long rang attacks, the 'Mech carries an ER PPC and LRM-10. Two ER Medium Lasers cover medium range, and as the foes get closer an Ultra AC/20 is ready to finish them off. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

name: Zeus ZEU-5S
details:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. The Zeus 5S is an original model Zeus, carrying a similar loadout to the normal -6S but making good use of Star League technology to increase both its hitting power and its heat management, making the -5S a terrifying mech on the battlefield. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-5T
details:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. The Zeus 5T is an original model Zeus and makes use of Star League technology to make a much more deadly mech. Just as fast as the -6S, the -5T switches the autocannon for a devastating array of energy weapons which combined with the -5T's double heat sinks is a brutal combination. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-6A
details:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. Introduced in 2940, and an apparent precursor to the 6T, the 6A sports a PPC and Large Laser backed up by considerable short range firepower in the form of three SRM6 launchers and two Medium Lasers. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-6S
details:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. The Zeus 6S moves faster than many other assault 'Mechs and mounts decent long-range weaponry. Its armor is very good, but it can get stuck in a tight spot if forced into closer-range fights. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-6S-DC
details:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. A rare variant of the ZEU-6S, the 6S-DC incorporates a Command Console at the cost of a Medium Laser and two Heat Sinks. The 'Mech is all but extinct these days, but they make a large impact on any battlefield they are deployed on. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-6SR
details:
The -6SR is a battlefield refit from the standard -6S. It replaces the AC/5 with an Ultra AC/5, switches to use double heat sinks and adds C.A.S.E. protection for all ammunition. To improve its defensive strengths, the 'Mech also adds a C3 Slave computer to the center torso and an Armored Cowl to its head. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-6T
details:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. A relatively new development, the Zeus 6TS removes the Autocannon and replaces it with a PPC. To help mitigate the additional heat, two additional Heat Sinks were also added. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-6Y
details:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. An experiment in logistical support, the Zeus 6Y retains the AC/5, but downgrades the LRM15 to a LRM10. This allowed for the Large Laser to be 'upgraded' to a Binary Laser Cannon. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-9S
details:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. The 9S was an upgrade using Star League technology, debuting in 3048. It carried as its main weapon an ER PPC in its left arm, retained as back-up for long-range combat an LRM-15 launcher and an ER Large Laser. For close combat, the 9S is equipped with two Medium Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-9S2
details:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. The 9S2 was a modified version of the 9S. The armor and twelve double heat sinks of original were retained, but the engine was changed to an XL. A Gauss Rifle took the place of the ER PPC while the right arm carried a pair of LRM-15s. Though the Cyclops XII extended range laser was kept, the medium pulse lasers had to be removed to provide enough space for the modifications. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-9S-DC
details:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. The 9S-DC is a sub-variant of the 9S introduced in 3049 designed to include a Command Console. It carried as its main weapon an ER PPC in its left arm, retained as back-up for long-range combat an LRM-15 launcher and an ER Large Laser. The inclusion of a Command Console necessitated the removal of one of the two Medium pulse Lasers. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-IS
details:
The Zeus was first built by the Lyran Commonwealth in 2787, just as the First Succession War began. Built at the request of Lyran Commonwealth Armed Forces commanders for a new light-assault 'Mech, the Zeus is fast enough to keep up with most heavy 'Mechs, and is equally capable of defeating them. The Zeus IS moves faster than many other assault 'Mech, but mounts mostly low tech, cheap industrial weapons. Still, it's well armored, and a common sight among the more broke and disgraced units in the Periphery. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus ZEU-P-X
details:
The Zeus ZEU-P-X is a prototype version of the Zeus that would eventually be further developed into the Zeus X. It mounts the same LBX AC/20, MRM-30 and two ER Medium Lasers as the eventual Zeus X ZEU-X, but uses a standard chassis and has considerably less armor. However, the ZEU-X-P mounts a C3 Slave computer, something the ZEU-X is lacking. Quirk: Barrel Fist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

name: Zeus-X ZEU-X
details:
Manufactured on Kwangjong-ni by Defiance, the Zeus X was both a poster child for excellence in production engineering and an innovative high-technology platform. The first of what became commonly referred to as the Zeus X series, the ZEU-X was a variant of the venerable Zeus BattleMech developed using Experimental Technology to push the envelope of the original design. The 'Mech was armed with an LB-X Autocannon/20 as its primary weapon, backed up by an MRM-30 launcher. The ZEU-X carried three tons of ammunition for the LB-X AC/20 and two tons for the MRM-30, stored in the right torso and protected by CASE II. For close combat, the Zeus had two Medium X-Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower
